title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: To the pure all things are pure (Puris omnia pura)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Niuna corrotta mente intese mai sanamente parole.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Erubuit, posuitque meum Lucretia librum Sed coram Bruto. Brute!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reced, leget.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Miculx est de ris que de larmes escripre, Pour ce que rire est

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: le propre des hommes.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The pleasure we derive from perusing the Thousand and One

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Stories makes us regret that we possess only a comparatively

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: small part of these truly enchanting fictions.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And afterwards. Verily the works and words of those gone before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us have become instances and examples to men of our modern day,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that folk may view what admonishing chances befel other folk and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: may therefrom take warning; and that they may peruse the annals

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of antique peoples and all that hath betided them, and be thereby

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ruled and restrained:--Praise, therefore, be to Him who hath made

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the histories of the Past an admonition unto the Present! Now of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: such instances are the tales called A Thousand Nights and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Night, together with their far famed legends and wonders.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Therein it is related (but Allah is All knowing of His hidden

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: things and All ruling and All honoured and All giving and All

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gracious and All merciful [FN#1]) that, in tide of yore and in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: time long gone before, there was a King of the Kings of the Banu

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sásán in the Islands of India and China, a Lord of armies and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: guards and servants and dependents.[FN#2] He left only two sons,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one in the prime of manhood and the other yet a youth, while both

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were Knights and Braves, albeit the elder was a doughtier

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: horseman than the younger. So he succeeded to the empire; when he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ruled the land and forded it over his lieges with justice so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exemplary that he was beloved by all the peoples of his capital

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and of his kingdom. His name was King Shahryár[FN#3], and he made

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his younger brother, Shah Zamán hight, King of Samarcand in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Barbarian land. These two ceased not to abide in their several

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: realms and the law was ever carried out in their dominions; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: each ruled his own kingdom, with equity and fair dealing to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: subjects, in extreme solace and enjoyment; and this condition

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: continually endured for a score of years. But at the end of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: twentieth twelvemonth the elder King yearned for a sight of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: younger brother and felt that he must look upon him once more. So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he took counsel with his Wazír[FN#4] about visiting him, but the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Minister, finding the project unadvisable, recommended that a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: letter be written and a present be sent under his charge to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: younger brother with an invitation to visit the elder. Having

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: accepted this advice the King forthwith bade prepare handsome

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gifts, such as horses with saddles of gem encrusted gold;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mamelukes, or white slaves; beautiful handmaids, high breasted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: virgins, and splendid stuffs and costly. He then wrote a letter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to Shah Zaman expressing his warm love and great wish to see

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, ending with these words, We therefore hope of the favour

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and affection of the beloved brother that he will condescend to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bestir himself and turn his face us wards. Furthermore we have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sent our Wazir to make all ordinance for the march, and our one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and only desire is to see thee ere we die; but if thou delay or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disappoint us we shall not survive the blow. Wherewith peace be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon thee! Then King Shahryar, having sealed the missive and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: given it to the Wazir with the offerings aforementioned,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: commanded him to shorten his skirts and strain his strength and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: make all expedition in going and returning. Harkening and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: obedience! quoth the Minister, who fell to making ready without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stay and packed up his loads and prepared all his requisites

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without delay. This occupied him three days, and on the dawn of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the fourth he took leave of his King and marched right away, over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: desert and hill' way, stony waste and pleasant lea without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: halting by night or by day. But whenever he entered a realm whose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ruler was subject to his Suzerain, where he was greeted with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: magnificent gifts of gold and silver and all manner of presents

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fair and rare, he would tarry there three days,[FN#5] the term

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the guest rite; and, when he left on the fourth, he would be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: honourably escorted for a whole day's march. As soon as the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir drew near Shah Zaman's court in Samarcand he despatched to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: report his arrival one of his high officials, who presented

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself before the King; and, kissing ground between his hands,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: delivered his message. Hereupon the King commanded sundry of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Grandees and Lords of his realm to fare forth and meet his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother's Wazir at the distance of a full day's journey; which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they did, greeting him respectfully and wishing him all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prosperity and forming an escort and a procession. When he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered the city he proceeded straightway to the palace, where

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he presented himself in the royal presence; and, after kissing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ground and praying for the King's health and happiness and for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: victory over all his enemies, he informed him that his brother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was yearning to see him, and prayed for the pleasure of a visit.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He then delivered the letter which Shah Zaman took from his hand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and read: it contained sundry hints and allusions which required

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thought; but, when the King had fully comprehended its import, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, I hear and I obey the commands of the beloved brother!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: adding to the Wazir, But we will not march till after the third

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day's hospitality. He appointed for the Minister fitting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quarters of the palace; and, pitching tents for the troops,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rationed them with whatever they might require of meat and drink

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and other necessaries. On the fourth day he made ready for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wayfare and got together sumptuous presents befitting his elder

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother's majesty, and stablished his chief Wazir viceroy of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: land during his absence. Then he caused his tents and camels and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mules to be brought forth and encamped, with their bales and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loads, attend ants and guards, within sight of the city, in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: readiness to set out next morning for his brother's capital. But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when the night was half spent he bethought him that he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forgotten in his palace somewhat which he should have brought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with him, so he re turned privily and entered his apartments,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where he found the Queen, his wife, asleep on his own carpet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bed, embracing with both arms a black cook of loathsome aspect

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and foul with kitchen grease and grime. When he saw this the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: world waxed black before his sight and he said, If such case

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happen while I am yet within sight of the city what will be the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: doings of this damned whore during my long absence at my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother's court? So he drew his scymitar and, cutting the two in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: four pieces with a single blow, left them on the carpet and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned presently to his camp without letting anyone know of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what had happened. Then he gave orders for immediate departure

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and set out at once and began his travel; but he could not help

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thinking over his wife's treason and he kept ever saying to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself, How could she do this deed by me? How could she work

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her own death?, till excessive grief seized him, his colour

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: changed to yellow, his body waxed weak and he was threatened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a dangerous malady, such an one as bringeth men to die. So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir shortened his stages and tarried long at the watering

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stations and did his best to solace the King. Now when Shah Zaman

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drew near the capital of his brother he despatched vaunt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couriers and messengers of glad tidings to announce his arrival,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and Shahryar came forth to meet him with his Wazirs and Emirs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and Lords and Grandees of his realm; and saluted him and joyed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with exceeding joy and caused the city to be decorated in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: honour. When, however, the brothers met, the elder could not but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: see the change of complexion in the younger and questioned him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of his case whereto he replied, Tis caused by the travails of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wayfare and my case needs care, for I have suffered from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: change of water and air! but Allah be praised for reuniting me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a brother so dear and so rare! On this wise he dissembled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and kept his secret, adding, O King of the time and Caliph of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the tide, only toil and moil have tinged my face yellow with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bile and hath made my eyes sink deep in my head. Then the two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered the capital in all honour; and the elder brother lodged

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the younger in a palace overhanging the pleasure garden; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after a time, seeing his condition still unchanged, he attributed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it to his separation from his country and kingdom. So he let him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wend his own ways and asked no questions of him till one day when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he again said, O my brother, I see thou art grown weaker of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: body and yellower of colour. O my brother, replied Shah Zaman

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I have an internal wound:[FN#6] still he would not tell him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what he had witnessed in his wife. Thereupon Shahryar summoned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: doctors and surgeons and bade them treat his brother according

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the rules of art, which they did for a whole month; but their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sherbets and potions naught availed, for he would dwell upon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deed of his wife, and despondency, instead of diminishing,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prevailed, and leach craft treatment utterly failed. One day his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: elder brother said to him, I am going forth to hunt and course

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and to take my pleasure and pastime; maybe this would lighten thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart. Shah Zaman, however, refused, saying, O my brother, my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soul yearneth for naught of this sort and I entreat thy favour to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: suffer me tarry quietly in this place, being wholly taken up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with my malady. So King Shah Zaman passed his night in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palace and, next morning, when his brother had fared forth, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: removed from his room and sat him down at one of the lattice

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: windows overlooking the pleasure grounds; and there he abode

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thinking with saddest thought over his wife's betrayal and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: burning sighs issued from his tortured breast. And as he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: continued in this case lo! a pastern of the palace, which was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carefully kept private, swung open and out of it came twenty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave girls surrounding his bother's wife who was wondrous fair,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a model of beauty and comeliness and symmetry and perfect

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loveliness and who paced with the grace of a gazelle which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: panteth for the cooling stream. Thereupon Shah Zaman drew back

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from the window, but he kept the bevy in sight espying them from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a place whence he could not be espied. They walked under the very

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lattice and advanced a little way into the garden till they came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to a jetting fountain amiddlemost a great basin of water; then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they stripped off their clothes and behold, ten of them were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: women, concubines of the King, and the other ten were white

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slaves. Then they all paired off, each with each: but the Queen,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who was left alone, presently cried out in a loud voice, Here to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, O my lord Saeed! and then sprang with a drop leap from one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the trees a big slobbering blackamoor with rolling eyes which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: showed the whites, a truly hideous sight.[FN#7] He walked boldly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up to her and threw his arms round her neck while she embraced

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him as warmly; then he bussed her and winding his legs round

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hers, as a button loop clasps a button, he threw her and enjoyed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her. On like wise did the other slaves with the girls till all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had satisfied their passions, and they ceased not from kissing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and clipping, coupling and carousing till day began to wane; when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Mamelukes rose from the damsels' bosoms and the blackamoor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave dismounted from the Queen's breast; the men resumed their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disguises and all, except the negro who swarmed up the tree,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered the palace and closed the postern door as before. Now,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when Shah Zaman saw this conduct of his sister in law he said in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself, By Allah, my calamity is lighter than this! My brother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is a greater King among the kings than I am, yet this infamy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: goeth on in his very palace, and his wife is in love with that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: filthiest of filthy slaves. But this only showeth that they all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: do it[FN#8] and that there is no woman but who cuckoldeth her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: husband, then the curse of Allah upon one and all and upon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fools who lean against them for support or who place the reins of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: conduct in their hands. So he put away his melancholy and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: despondency, regret and repine, and allayed his sorrow by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: constantly repeating those words, adding,  'Tis my conviction

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that no man in this world is safe from their malice! When supper

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: time came they brought him the trays and he ate with voracious

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: appetite, for he had long refrained from meat, feeling unable to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: touch any dish however dainty. Then he returned grateful thanks

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to Almighty Allah, praising Him and blessing Him, and he spent a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: most restful night, it having been long since he had savoured the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sweet food of sleep. Next day he broke his fast heartily and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began to recover health and strength, and presently regained

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: excellent condition. His brother came back from the chase ten

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days after, when he rode out to meet him and they saluted each

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other; and when King Shahryar looked at King Shah Zaman he saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: how the hue of health had returned to him, how his face had waxed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ruddy and how he ate with an appetite after his late scanty diet.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He wondered much and said, O my brother, I was so anxious that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou wouldst join me in hunting and chasing, and wouldst take thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pleasure and pastime in my dominion! He thanked him and excused

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself; then the two took horse and rode into the city and, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they were seated at their ease in the palace, the food trays were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set before them and they ate their sufficiency. After the meats

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were removed and they had washed their hands, King Shahryar

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turned to his brother and said, My mind is overcome with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wonderment at thy condition. I was desirous to carry thee with me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the chase but I saw thee changed in hue, pale and wan to view,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and in sore trouble of mind too. But now Alham-dolillah--glory be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to God!--I see thy natural colour hath returned to thy face and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that thou art again in the best of case. It was my belief that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy sickness came of severance from thy family and friends, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: absence from capital and country, so I refrained from troubling

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee with further questions. But now I beseech thee to expound to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me the cause of thy complaint and thy change of colour, and to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: explain the reason of thy recovery and the return to the ruddy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hue of health which I am wont to view. So speak out and hide

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: naught! When Shah Zaman heard this he bowed groundwards awhile

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his head, then raised it and said, I will tell thee what caused

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my complaint and my loss of colour; but excuse my acquainting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee with the cause of its return to me and the reason of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: complete recovery: indeed I pray thee not to press me for a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reply. Said Shahryar, who was much surprised by these words,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Let me hear first what produced thy pallor and thy poor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: condition. Know, then, O my brother, rejoined Shah Zaman,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that when thou sentest thy Wazir with the invitation to place

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: myself between thy hands, I made ready and marched out of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city; but presently I minded me having left behind me in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palace a string of jewels intended as a gift to thee. I returned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for it alone and found my wife on my carpet bed and in the arms

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of a hideous black cook. So I slew the twain and came to thee,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yet my thoughts brooded over this business and I lost my bloom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and became weak. But excuse me if I still refuse to tell thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what was the reason of my complexion returning. Shahryar shook

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his head, marvelling with extreme marvel, and with the fire of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wrath flaming up from his heart, he cried, Indeed, the malice of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woman is mighty! Then he took refuge from them with Allah and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, In very sooth, O my brother, thou hast escaped many an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: evil by putting thy wife to death,[FN#9] and right excusable were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy wrath and grief for such mishap which never yet befel crowned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King like thee. By Allah, had the case been mine, I would not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have been satisfied without slaying a thousand women and that way

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: madness lies! But now praise be to Allah who hath tempered to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee thy tribulation, and needs must thou acquaint me with that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which so suddenly restored to thee complexion and health, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: explain to me what causeth this concealment. O King of the Age,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again I pray thee excuse my so doing! Nay, but thou must. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fear, O my brother, lest the recital cause thee more anger and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sorrow than afflicted me. That were but a better reason, quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shahryar, for telling me the whole history, and I conjure thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by Allah not to keep back aught from me. Thereupon Shah Zaman

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: told him all he had seen, from commencement to con elusion,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ending with these words, When I beheld thy calamity and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: treason of thy wife, O my brother, and I resected that thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in years my senior and in sovereignty my superior, mine own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sorrow was belittled by the comparison, and my mind recovered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tone and temper: so throwing off melancholy and despondency, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was able to eat and drink and sleep, and thus I speedily regained

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: health and strength. Such is the truth and the whole truth. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King Shahryar heard this he waxed wroth with exceeding wrath, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rage was like to strangle him; but presently he recovered himself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, O my brother, I would not give thee the lie in this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: matter, but I cannot credit it till I see it with mine own eyes.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: An thou wouldst look upon thy calamity, quoth Shah Zaman, rise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at once and make ready again for hunting and coursing.[FN#10] and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: then hide thyself with me, so shalt thou witness it and thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyes shall verify it. True, quoth the King; whereupon he let

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: make proclamation of his in tent to travel, and the troops and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tents fared forth without the city, camping within sight, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shahryar sallied out with them and took seat amidmost his host,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bidding the slaves admit no man to him. When night came on he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: summoned his Wazir and said to him, Sit thou in my stead and let

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: none wot of my absence till the term of three days. Then the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brothers disguised themselves and returned by night with all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: secrecy to the palace, where they passed the dark hours: and at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawn they seated themselves at the lattice overlooking the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pleasure grounds, when presently the Queen and her handmaids came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out as before, and passing under the windows made for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fountain. Here they stripped, ten of them being men to ten women,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the King's wife cried out, Where art thou, O Saeed? The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hideous blackamoor dropped from the tree straightway; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rushing into her arms without stay or delay, cried out, I am

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sa'ad al Din Saood![FN#11] The lady laughed heartily, and all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell to satisfying their lusts, and remained so occupied for a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couple of hours, when the white slaves rose up from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: handmaidens' breasts and the blackamoor dismounted from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Queen's bosom: then they went into the basin and, after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: performing the Ghusl, or complete ablution, donned their dresses

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and retired as they had done before. When King Shahryar saw this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: infamy of his wife and concubines he became as one distraught and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he cried out, Only in utter solitude can man be safe from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: doings of this vile world! By Allah, life is naught but one great

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wrong. Presently he added, Do not thwart me, O my brother, in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what I propose; and the other answered, I will not. So he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, Let us up as we are and depart forthright hence, for we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have no concern with Kingship, and let us overwander Allah's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: earth, worshipping the Almighty till we find some one to whom the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like calamity hath happened; and if we find none then will death

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be more welcome to us than life. So the two brothers issued from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a second private postern of the palace; and they never stinted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wayfaring by day and by night, until they reached a tree a middle

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of a meadow hard by a spring of sweet water on the shore of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: salt sea. Both drank of it and sat down to take their rest; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when an hour of the day had gone by: lo! they heard a mighty roar

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and uproar in the middle of the main as though the heavens were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: falling upon the earth; and the sea brake with waves before them,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and from it towered a black pillar, which grew and grew till it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose skywards and began making for that meadow. Seeing it, they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waxed fearful exceedingly and climbed to the top of the tree,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which was a lofty; whence they gazed to see what might be the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: matter. And behold, it was a Jinni,[FN#12] huge of height and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: burly of breast and bulk, broad of brow and black of blee,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bearing on his head a coffer of crystal. He strode to land,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wading through the deep, and coming to the tree whereupon were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the two Kings, seated himself beneath it. He then set down the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: coffer on its bottom and out it drew a casket, with seven

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: padlocks of steel, which he unlocked with seven keys of steel he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took from beside his thigh, and out of it a young lady to come

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was seen, white-skinned and of winsomest mien, of stature fine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and thin, and bright as though a moon of the fourteenth night she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had been, or the sun raining lively sheen. Even so the poet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Utayyah hath excellently said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She rose like the morn as she shone through the night * And she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gilded the grove with her gracious sight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: From her radiance the sun taketh increase when * She unveileth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and shameth the moonshine bright.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bow down all beings between her hands * As she showeth charms

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with her veil undight.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And she foodeth cities[FN#13] with torrent tears * When she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flasheth her look of levee light.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Jinni seated her under the tree by his side and looking at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her said, O choicest love of this heart of mine! O dame of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: noblest line, whom I snatched away on thy bride night that none

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: might prevent me taking thy maidenhead or tumble thee before I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: did, and whom none save myself hath loved or hath enjoyed: O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sweetheart! I would fief sleep a little while. He then laid his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: head upon the lady's thighs; and, stretching out his legs which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: extended down to the sea, slept and snored and sparked like the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: roll of thunder. Presently she raised her head towards the tree

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: top and saw the two Kings perched near the summit; then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: softly lifted off her lap the Jinni's pate which she was tired of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: supporting and placed it upon the ground; then standing upright

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: under the tree signed to the Kings, Come ye down, ye two, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fear naught from this Ifrit.[FN#14] They were in a terrible

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fright when they found that she had seen them and answered her in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the same manner, Allah upon thee[FN#15] and by thy modesty, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady, excuse us from coming down! But she rejoined by saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah upon you both, that ye come down forthright, and if ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: come not, I will rouse upon you my husband, this Ifrit, and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall do you to die by the illest of deaths; and she continued

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: making signals to them. So, being afraid, they came down to her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she rose be fore them and said, Stroke me a strong stroke,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without stay or delay, otherwise will I arouse and set upon you

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this Ifrit who shall slay you straightway. They said to her, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our lady, we conjure thee by Allah, let us off this work, for we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are fugitives from such and in extreme dread and terror of this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy husband. How then can we do it in such a way as thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: desires? Leave this talk: it needs must be so; quoth she, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she swore them by Him[FN#16] who raised the skies on high,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without prop or pillar, that, if they worked not her will, she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would cause them to be slain and cast into the sea. Whereupon out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of fear King Shahryar said to King Shah Zaman, O my brother, do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou what she biddeth thee do; but he replied, I will not do it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till thou do it before I do. And they began disputing about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: futtering her. Then quoth she to the twain, How is it I see you

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disputing and demurring; if ye do not come forward like men and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: do the deed of kind ye two, I will arouse upon you the If rit.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: At this, by reason of their sore dread of the Jinni, both did by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her what she bade them do; and, when they had dismounted from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her, she said, Well done! She then took from her pocket a purse

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and drew out a knotted string, whereon were strung five hundred

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and seventy[FN#17] seal rings, and asked, Know ye what be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these? They answered her saying, We know not! Then quoth she;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: These be the signets of five hundred and seventy men who have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all futtered me upon the horns of this foul, this foolish, this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: filthy Ifrit; so give me also your two seal rings, ye pair of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brothers. When they had drawn their two rings from their hands

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and given them to her, she said to them, Of a truth this If rit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bore me off on my bride night, and put me into a casket and set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the casket in a coffer and to the coffer he affixed seven strong

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: padlocks of steel and deposited me on the deep bottom of the sea

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that raves, dashing and clashing with waves; and guarded me so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that I might remain chaste and honest, quotha! none save himself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: might have connexion with me. But I have lain under as many of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kind as I please, and this wretched Jinni wotteth not that Des

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tiny may not be averted nor hindered by aught, and that whatso

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woman willeth the same she fulfilleth however man nilleth. Even

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so saith one of them.--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Rely not on women; * Trust not to their hearts,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whose joys and whose sorrows * Are hung to their parts!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Lying love they will swear thee * Whence guile ne'er departs:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Take Yusuf[FN#18] for sample * 'Ware sleights and 'ware smarts!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Iblis[FN#19] ousted Adam * (See ye not?) thro' their arts.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And another saith:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Stint thy blame, man! 'Twill drive to a passion without bound; *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: My fault is not so heavy as fault in it hast found.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If true lover I become, then to me there cometh not * Save what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happened unto many in the bygone stound.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For wonderful is he and right worthy of our praise * Who from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wiles of female wits kept him safe and kept him sound.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hearing these words they marvelled with exceeding marvel, and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went from them to the Ifrit and, taking up his head on her thigh

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as before, said to them softly, Now wend your ways and bear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yourselves beyond the bounds of his malice. So they fared forth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying either to other, Allah! Allah! and, There be no Majesty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and there be no Might save in Allah, the Glorious, the Great; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with Him we seek refuge from women's malice and sleight, for of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: truth it hath no mate in might. Consider, O my brother, the ways

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of this marvellous lady with an Ifrit who is so much more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: powerful than we are. Now since there hath hap pened to him a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greater mishap than that which befel us and which should bear us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abundant consolation, so return we to our countries and capitals,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and let us decide never to intermarry with womankind and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presently we will show them what will be our action. Thereupon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they rode back to the tents of King Shahryar, which they reached

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the morning of the third day; and, having mustered the Wazirs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and Emirs, the Chamberlains and high officials, he gave a robe of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: honour to his Viceroy and issued orders for an immediate return

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the city. There he sat him upon his throne and sending for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Chief Minister, the father of the two damsels who (Inshallah!)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will presently be mentioned, he said, I command thee to take my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife and smite her to death; for she hath broken her plight and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her faith. So he carried her to the place of execution and did

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her die. Then King Shahryar took brand in hand and repairing to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Serraglio slew all the concubines and their Mamelukes.[FN#20]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He also sware himself by a binding oath that whatever wife he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: married he would abate her maidenhead at night and slay her next

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: morning to make sure of his honour; For, said he, there never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was nor is there one chaste woman upon face of earth. Then Shah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Zaman prayed for permission to fare homewards; and he went forth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: equipped and escorted and travelled till he reached his own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: country. Mean while Shahryar commanded his Wazir to bring him the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bride of the night that he might go in to her; so he produced a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: most beautiful girl, the daughter of one of the Emirs and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King went in unto her at eventide and when morning dawned he bade

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his Minister strike off her head; and the Wazir did accordingly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for fear of the Sultan. On this wise he continued for the space

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of three years; marrying a maiden every night and killing her the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: next morning, till folk raised an outcry against him and cursed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, praying Allah utterly to destroy him and his rule; and women

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made an uproar and mothers wept and parents fled with their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughters till there remained not in the city a young person fit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for carnal copulation. Presently the King ordered his Chief

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir, the same who was charged with the executions, to bring him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a virgin as was his wont; and the Minister went forth and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: searched and found none; so he returned home in sorrow and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: anxiety fearing for his life from the King. Now he had two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughters, Shahrazad and Dunyazad hight,[FN#21] of whom the elder

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had perused the books, annals and legends of preceding Kings, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the stories, examples and instances of by gone men and things;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: indeed it was said that she had collected a thousand books of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: histories relating to antique races and departed rulers. She had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perused the works of the poets and knew them by heart; she had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: studied philosophy and the sciences, arts and accomplish meets;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she was pleasant and polite, wise and witty, well read and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: well bred. Now on that day she said to her father, Why do I see

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee thus changed and laden with cark and care? Concerning this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: matter quoth one of the poets.--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tell whoso hath sorrow     * Grief never shall last:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: E'en as joy hath no morrow * So woe shall go past.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the Wazir heard from his daughter these words he related to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her, from first to last, all that had happened between him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King. Thereupon said she, By Allah, O my father, how long

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall this slaughter of women endure? Shall I tell thee what is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in my mind in order to save both sides from destruction? Say

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on, O my daughter, quoth he, and quoth she, I wish thou wouldst

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: give me in marriage to this King Shahryar; either I shall live or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I shall be a ransom for the virgin daughters of Moslems and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cause of their deliverance from his hands and thine.[FN#22]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah upon thee! cried he in wrath exceeding that lacked no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: feeding, O scanty of wit, expose not thy life to such peril! How

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: durst thou address me in words so wide from wisdom and un far

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from foolishness? Know that one who lacketh experience in worldly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: matters readily falleth into misfortune; and whoso considereth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not the end keepeth not the world to friend, and the vulgar say:-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: -I was lying at mine ease: nought but my officiousness brought me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unease. Needs must thou, she broke in, make me a doer of this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: good deed, and let him kill me an he will: I shall only die a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ransom for others. O my daughter, asked he, and how shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that profit thee when thou shalt have thrown away thy life? and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she answered, O my father it must be, come of it what will! The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir was again moved to fury and blamed and reproached her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ending with, In very deed--I fear lest the same befal thee which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befel the Bull and the Ass with the Husband man. And what,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asked she, befel them, O my father? Whereupon the Wazir began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tale of the Bull[FN#23] and the Ass.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O my daughter, that there was once a merchant who owned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: much money and many men, and who was rich in cattle and camels;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he had also a wife and family and he dwelt in the country, being

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: experienced in husbandry and devoted to agriculture. Now Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Most High had endowed him with under standing the tongues of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beasts and birds of every kind, but under pain of death if he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: divulged the gift to any. So he kept it secret for very fear. He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had in his cow house a Bull and an Ass each tethered in his own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stall one hard by the other. As the merchant was sitting near

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand one day with his servants and his children were playing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about him, he heard the Bull say to the Ass, Hail and health to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee O Father of Waking![FN#24] for that thou enjoyest rest and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: good ministering; all under thee is clean swept and fresh

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sprinkled; men wait upon thee and feed thee, and thy provaunt is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sifted barley and thy drink pure spring water, while I (unhappy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: creature!) am led forth in the middle of the night, when they set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on my neck the plough and a something called Yoke; and I tire at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cleaving the earth from dawn of day till set of sun. I am forced

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to do more than I can and to bear all manner of ill treatment

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from night to night; after which they take me back with my sides

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: torn, my neck flayed, my legs aching and mine eyelids sored with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tears. Then they shut me up in the byre and throw me beans and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crushed straw,[FN#25] mixed with dirt and chaff; and I lie in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dung and filth and foul stinks through the livelong night. But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou art ever in a place swept and sprinkled and cleansed, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou art always lying at ease, save when it happens (and seldom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enough!) that the master hath some business, when he mounts thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and rides thee to town and returns with thee forthright. So it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happens that I am toiling and distress while thou takest thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ease and thy rest; thou sleepest while I am sleepless; I hunger

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: still while thou eatest thy fill, and I win contempt while thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: winnest good will. When the Bull ceased speaking, the Ass turned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to wards him and said, O Broad o' Brow,[FN#26] 0 thou lost one!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he lied not who dubbed thee Bull head, for thou, O father of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bull, hast neither forethought nor contrivance; thou art the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: simplest of simpletons,[FN#27] and thou knowest naught of good

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: advisers. Hast thou not heard the saying of the wise:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For others these hardships and labours I bear * And theirs is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pleasure and mine is the care;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: As the bleacher who blacketh his brow in the sun * To whiten the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: raiment which other men wear.[FN#28]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But thou, O fool, art full of zeal and thou toilest and moilest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before the master; and thou tearest and wearest and slayest thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: self for the comfort of another. Hast thou never heard the saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that saith, None to guide and from the way go wide? Thou wendest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth at the call to dawn prayer and thou returnest not till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sundown; and through the livelong day thou endurest all manner

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hardships; to wit, beating and belabouring and bad language. Now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hearken to me, Sir Bull! when they tie thee to thy stinking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: manger, thou pawest the ground with thy forehand and rashest out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with thy hind hoofs and pushest with thy horns and bellowest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: aloud, so they deem thee contented. And when they throw thee thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fodder thou fallest on it with greed and hastenest to line thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fair fat paunch. But if thou accept my advice it will be better

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for thee and thou wilt lead an easier life even than mine. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou goest a field and they lay the thing called Yoke on thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neck, lie down and rise not again though haply they swinge thee;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, if thou rise, lie down a second time; and when they bring

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee home and offer thee thy beans, fall backwards and only sniff

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at thy meat and withdraw thee and taste it not, and be satis fied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with thy crushed straw and chaff; and on this wise feign thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sick, and cease not doing thus for a day or two days or even

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: three days, so shalt thou have rest from toil and moil. When the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bull heard these words he knew the Ass to be his friend and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thanked him, saying, Right is thy rede; and prayed that all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blessings might requite him, and cried, O Father Wakener![FN#29]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou hast made up for my failings. (Now[FN#30] the merchant, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my daughter, understood all that passed between them.) Next day

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the driver took the Bull, and settling the plough on his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neck,[FN#31] made him work as wont; but the Bull began to shirk

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his ploughing, according to the advice of the Ass, and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ploughman drubbed him till he broke the yoke and made off; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the man caught him up and leathered him till he despaired of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: life. Not the less, however, would he do nothing but stand still

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and drop down till the evening. Then the herd led him home and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stabled him in his stall: but he drew back from his manger and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neither stamped nor ramped nor butted nor bellowed as he was wont

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to do; whereat the man wondered. He brought him the beans and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: husks, but he sniffed at them and left them and lay down as far

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from them as he could and passed the whole night fasting. The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: peasant came next morning; and, seeing the manger full of beans,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the crushed straw untasted and the ox lying on his back in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sorriest plight, with legs outstretched and swollen belly, he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: concerned for him, and said to himself, By Allah, he hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: assuredly sickened and this is the cause why he would not plough

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yesterday. Then he went to the merchant and reported, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master, the Bull is ailing; he refused his fodder last night; nay

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more, he hath not tasted a scrap of it this morning. Now the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchant farmer understood what all this meant, because he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: overheard the talk between the Bull and the Ass, so quoth he,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Take that rascal donkey, and set the yoke on his neck, and bind

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him to the plough and make him do Bull's work. Thereupon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ploughman took the Ass, and worked him through the live long day

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at the Bull's task; and, when he failed for weakness, he made him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eat stick till his ribs were sore and his sides were sunken and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his neck was hayed by the yoke; and when he came home in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: evening he could hardly drag his limbs along, either fore hand or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hind legs. But as for the Bull, he had passed the day lying at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: full length and had eaten his fodder with an excellent appetite,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he ceased not calling down blessings on the Ass for his good

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: advice, unknowing what had come to him on his ac count. So when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night set in and the Ass returned to the byte the Bull rose up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before him in honour, and said, May good tidings gladden thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart, O Father Wakener! through thee I have rested all this day

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I have eaten my meat in peace and quiet. But the Ass

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned no reply, for wrath and heart burning and fatigue and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the beating he had gotten; and he repented with the most grievous

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of repentance; and quoth he to himself: This cometh of my folly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in giving good counsel; as the saw saith, I was in joy and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gladness, nought save my officiousness brought me this sadness.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But I will bear in mind my innate worth and the nobility of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nature; for what saith the poet?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shall the beautiful hue of the Basil[FN#32] fail * Tho' the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beetle's foot o'er the Basil crawl?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And though spider and fly be its denizens * Shall disgrace attach

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the royal hall?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The cowrie,[FN#33] I ken, shall have currency * But the pearl's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clear drop, shall its value fall?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And now I must take thought and put a trick upon him and return

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him to his place, else I die. Then he went aweary to his manger,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: while the Bull thanked him and blessed him. And even so, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter, said the Wazir, thou wilt die for lack of wits;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: therefore sit thee still and say naught and expose not thy life

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to such stress; for, by Allah, I offer thee the best advice,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which cometh of my affection and kindly solicitude for thee. O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my father, she answered, needs must I go up to this King and be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: married to him. Quoth he, Do not this deed; and quoth she, Of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a truth I will: whereat he rejoined, If thou be not silent and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bide still, I will do with thee even what the merchant did with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his wife. And what did he? asked she. Know then, answered the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir, that after the return of the Ass the merchant came out on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the terrace roof with his wife and family, for it was a moonlit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night and the moon at its full. Now the ter race overlooked the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cowhouse and presently, as he sat there with his children playing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about him, the trader heard the Ass say to the Bull, Tell me, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Father Broad o' Brow, what thou purposest to do to morrow? The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bull answered, What but continue to follow thy counsel, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Aliboron? Indeed it was as good as good could be and it hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: given me rest and repose; nor will I now depart from it one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: little: so, when they bring me my meat, I will refuse it and blow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out my belly and counterfeit crank. The Ass shook his head and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, Beware of so doing, O Father of a Bull! The Bull asked,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Why, and the Ass answered, Know that I am about to give thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the best of counsel, for verily I heard our owner say to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: herd, If the Bull rise not from his place to do his work this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: morning and if he retire from his fodder this day, make him over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the butcher that he may slaughter him and give his flesh to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the poor, and fashion a bit of leather[FN#34] from his hide. Now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I fear for thee on account of this. So take my advice ere a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: calamity befal thee; and when they bring thee thy fodder eat it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and rise up and bellow and paw the ground, or our master will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: assuredly slay thee: and peace be with thee! Thereupon the Bull

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arose and lowed aloud and thanked the Ass, and said, To morrow I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will readily go forth with them; and he at once ate up all his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: meat and even licked the manger. (All this took place and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: owner was listening to their talk.) Next morning the trader and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his wife went to the Bull's crib and sat down, and the driver

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came and led forth the Bull who, seeing his owner, whisked his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tail and brake wind, and frisked about so lustily that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchant laughed a loud laugh and kept laughing till he fell on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his back. His wife asked him, Whereat laughest thou with such

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loud laughter as this?; and he answered her, I laughed at a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: secret something which I have heard and seen but cannot say lest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I die my death. She returned, Perforce thou must discover it to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, and disclose the cause of thy laughing even if thou come by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy death! But he rejoined, I cannot re veal what beasts and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: birds say in their lingo for fear I die. Then quoth she, By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, thou liest! this is a mere pretext: thou laughest at none

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: save me, and now thou wouldest hide somewhat from me. But by the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Lord of the Heavens! an thou disclose not the cause I will no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: longer cohabit with thee: I will leave thee at once. And she sat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down and cried. Whereupon quoth the merchant, Woe betide thee!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what means thy weeping? Bear Allah and leave these words and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: query me no more questions. Needs must thou tell me the cause

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of that laugh, said she, and he replied, Thou wottest that when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I prayed Allah to vouchsafe me understanding of the tongues of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beasts and birds, I made a vow never to disclose the secret to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: any under pain of dying on the spot. No matter, cried she,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tell me what secret passed between the Bull and the Ass and die

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this very hour an thou be so minded; and she ceased not to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: importune him till he was worn out and clean distraught. So at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: last he said, Summon thy father and thy mother and our kith and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kin and sundry of our neighbours, which she did; and he sent for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Kazi[FN#35] and his assessors, intending to make his will and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reveal to her his secret and die the death; for he loved her with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: love exceeding because she was his cousin, the daughter of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father's brother, and the mother of his children, and he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lived with her a life of an hundred and twenty years. Then,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: having assembled all the family and the folk of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neighbourhood, he said to them, By me there hangeth a strange

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: story, and 'tis such that if I discover the secret to any, I am a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dead man. Therefore quoth every one of those present to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woman, Allah upon thee, leave this sinful obstinacy and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recognise the right of this matter, lest haply thy husband and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the father of thy children die. But she rejoined, I will not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turn from it till he tell me, even though he come by his death.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So they ceased to urge her; and the trader rose from amongst them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and repaired to an out house to per form Wuzu ablution,[FN#36]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he purposed thereafter to return and to tell them his secret

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and to die. Now, daughter Shahrazad, that mer chant had in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out houses some fifty hens under one cock, and whilst making

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ready to farewell his folk he heard one of his many farm dogs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thus address in his own tongue the Cock, who was flapping his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wings and crowing lustily and jumping from one hen's back to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another and treading all in turn, saying O Chanti clear! how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mean is thy wit and how shameless is thy conduct! Be he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disappointed who brought thee up![FN#37] Art thou not ashamed of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy doings on such a day as this! And what, asked the Rooster,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath occurred this day? when the Dog answered, Doss thou not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: know that our master is this day making ready for his death? His

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife is resolved that he shall disclose the secret taught to him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by Allah, and the moment he so doeth he shall surely die. We dogs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are all a mourning; but thou clappest thy wings and clarionest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy loudest and treadest hen after hen. Is this an hour for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pastime and pleasuring? Art thou not ashamed of thyself?[FN#38]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then by Allah, quoth the Cock, is our master a lack wit and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man scanty of sense: if he cannot manage matters with a single

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife, his life is not worth prolonging. Now I have some fifty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Dame Partlets; and I please this and provoke that and starve one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and stuff another; and through my good governance they are all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: well under my control. This our master pretendeth to wit and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wisdom, and he hath but one wife, and yet knoweth not how to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: manage her. Asked the Dog, What then, O Cock, should the master

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: do to win clear of his strait? He should arise forthright,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered the Cock, and take some twigs from yon mulberry tree

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and give her a regular back basting and rib roasting till she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cry:--I repent, O my lord! I will never ask thee a question as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: long as I live! Then let him beat her once more and soundly, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when he shall have done this he shall sleep free from care and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enjoy life. But this master of ours owns neither sense nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: judgment. Now, daughter Shahrazad, continued the Wazir, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will do to thee as did that husband to that wife. Said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shahrazad, And what did he do? He replied, When the merchant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard the wise words spoken by his Cock to his Dog, he arose in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: haste and sought his wife's chamber, after cutting for her some

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mulberry twigs and hiding them there; and then he called to her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Come into the closet that I may tell thee the secret while no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one seeth me and then die. She entered with him and he locked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the door and came down upon her with so sound a beating of back

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and shoulders, ribs, arms and legs, saying the while, Wilt thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ever be asking questions about what concerneth thee not? that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she was well nigh senseless. Presently she cried out, I am of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the repentant! By Allah, I will ask thee no more questions, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: indeed I repent sincerely and wholesomely. Then she kissed his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand and feet and he led her out of the room submissive as a wife

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: should be. Her parents and all the company rejoiced and sadness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and mourn ing were changed into joy and gladness. Thus the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchant learnt family discipline from his Cock and he and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife lived together the happiest of lives until death. And thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: also, O my daughter! continued the Wazir, Unless thou turn from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this matter I will do by thee what that trader did to his wife.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But she answered him with much decision, I will never desist, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my father, nor shall this tale change my purpose. Leave such talk

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and tattle. I will not listen to thy words and, if thou deny me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I will marry myself to him despite the nose of thee. And first I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will go up to the King myself and alone and I will say to him:--I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prayed my father to wive me with thee, but he refused being

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: resolved to disappoint his lord, grudging the like of me to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like of thee. Her father asked, Must this needs be? and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, Even so. Hereupon the Wazir being weary of lamenting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and contending, persuading and dissuading her, all to no purpose,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went up to King Shahryar and after blessing him and kissing the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ground before him, told him all about his dispute with his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter from first to last and how he designed to bring her to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him that night. The King wondered with exceeding wonder; for he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had made an especial exception of the Wazir's daughter, and said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him, O most faithful of Counsellors, how is this? Thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wottest that I have sworn by the Raiser of the Heavens that after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I have gone in to her this night I shall say to thee on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: morrow's morning:--Take her and slay her! and, if thou slay her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not, I will slay thee in her stead without fail. Allah guide

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee to glory and lengthen thy life, O King of the age, answered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir, it is she that hath so determined: all this have I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
