text: told her and more; but she will not hearken to me and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: persisteth in passing this coming night with the King's Majesty.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So Shahryar rejoiced greatly and said, 'Tis well; go get her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ready and this night bring her to me. The Wazir returned to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter and reported to her the command saying, Allah make not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy father desolate by thy loss! But Shah razed rejoiced with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding joy and get ready all she required and said to her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: younger sister, Dunyazad, Note well what directions I entrust to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee! When I have gone in to the King I will send for thee and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when thou comest to me and seest that he hath had his carnal will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of me, do thou say to me:--O my sister, an thou be not sleepy,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: relate to me some new story, delectable and delightsome, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: better to speed our waking hours; and I will tell thee a tale

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which shall be our deliverance, if so Allah please, and which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall turn the King from his blood thirsty custom. Dunyazad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered With love and gladness. So when it was night their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father the Wazir carried Shahrazad to the King who was gladdened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at the sight and asked, Hast thou brought me my need? and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, I have. But when the King took her to his bed and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell to toying with her and wished to go in to her she wept;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which made him ask, What aileth thee? She replied, O King of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the age, I have a younger sister and fief would I take leave of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her this night before I see the dawn. So he sent at once for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Dunyazad and she came and kissed the ground between his hands,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when he permitted her to take her seat near the foot of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couch. Then the King arose and did away with his bride's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: maidenhead and the three fell asleep. But when it was midnight

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shahrazad awoke and signalled to her sister Dunyazad who sat up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, Allah upon thee, O my sister, recite to us some new

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: story, delightsome and delectable, wherewith to while away the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waking hours of our latter night.[FN#39] With joy and goodly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gree, answered Shahrazad, if this pious and auspicious King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: permit me. Tell on, quoth the King who chanced to be sleepless

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and restless and therefore was pleased with the prospect of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hearing her story. So Shahrazad rejoiced; and thus, on the first

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night of the Thousand Nights and a Night, she began with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: TALE OF THE TRADER AND THE JINNI.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: It is related, O auspicious King, that there was a merchant of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the merchants who had much wealth, and business in various

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cities. Now on a day he mounted horse and went forth to re cover

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: monies in certain towns, and the heat sore oppressed him; so he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sat beneath a tree and, putting his hand into his saddle bags,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took thence some broken bread and dry dates and began to break

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his fast. When he had ended eating the dates he threw away the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stones with force and lo! an Ifrit appeared, huge of stature and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brandishing a drawn sword, wherewith he approached the mer chant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, Stand up that I may slay thee, even as thou slewest my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son! Asked the merchant, How have I slain thy son? and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, When thou atest dates and threwest away the stones

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they struck my son full in the breast as he was walking by, so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that he died forthwith.[FN#40] Quoth the merchant, Verily from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah we proceeded and unto Allah are we re turning. There is no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Majesty, and there is no Might save in Allah, the Glorious, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Great! If I slew thy son, I slew him by chance medley. I pray

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee now pardon me. Rejoined the Jinni, There is no help but I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: must slay thee. Then he seized him and dragged him along and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: casting him to the earth, raised the sword to strike him;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon the merchant wept, and said, I commit my case to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, and began repeating these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Containeth Time a twain of days, this of blessing that of bane *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And holdeth Life a twain of halves, this of pleasure that of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pain.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: See'st not when blows the hurricane, sweeping stark and striking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strong * None save the forest giant feels the suffering of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the strain?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How many trees earth nourisheth of the dry and of the green *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yet none but those which bear the fruits for cast of stone

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: complain.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: See'st not how corpses rise and float on the surface of the tide

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: * While pearls o'price lie hidden in the deepest of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: main!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: In Heaven are unnumbered the many of the stars * Yet ne'er a star

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but Sun and Moon by eclipse is overta'en.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Well judgedst thou the days that saw thy faring sound and well *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And countedst not the pangs and pain whereof Fate is ever

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fain.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The nights have kept thee safe and the safety brought thee pride

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: * But bliss and blessings of the night are 'genderers of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bane!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the merchant ceased repeating his verses the Jinni said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, Cut thy words short, by Allah! needs must I slay thee. But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the merchant spake him thus, Know, O thou Ifrit, that I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: debts due to me and much wealth and children and a wife and many

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pledges in hand; so permit me to go home and dis charge to every

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: claimant his claim; and I will come back to thee at the head of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the new year. Allah be my testimony and surety that I will return

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to thee; and then thou mayest do with me as thou wilt and Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is witness to what I say. The Jinni took sure promise of him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: let him go; so he returned to his own city and transacted his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: business and rendered to all men their dues and after informing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his wife and children of what had betided him, he appointed a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: guardian and dwelt with them for a full year. Then he arose, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made the Wuzu ablution to purify himself before death and took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his shroud under his arm and bade farewell to his people, his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neighbours and all his kith and kin, and went forth despite his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: own nose.[FN#41] They then began weeping and wailing and beating

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their breasts over him; but he travelled until he arrived at the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: same garden, and the day of his arrival was the head of the New

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Year. As he sat weeping over what had befallen him, behold, a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shaykh,[FN#42] a very ancient man, drew near leading a chained

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gazelle; and he saluted that merchant and wishing him long life

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, What is the cause of thy sitting in this place and thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alone and this be a resort of evil spirits? The merchant related

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him what had come to pass with the Ifrit, and the old man, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: owner of the gazelle, wondered and said, By Allah, O brother,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy faith is none other than exceeding faith and thy story right

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strange; were it graven with gravers on the eye corners, it were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a warner to whoso would be warned. Then seating himself near the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchant he said, By Allah, O my brother, I will not leave thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: until I see what may come to pass with thee and this Ifrit. And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presently as he sat and the two were at talk the merchant began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to feel fear and terror and exceeding grief and sorrow beyond

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: relief and ever growing care and extreme despair. And the owner

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the gazelle was hard by his side; when behold, a second Shaykh

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: approached them, and with him were two dogs both of greyhound

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: breed and both black. The second old man after saluting them with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the salam, also asked them of their tidings and said What

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: causeth you to sit in this place, a dwelling of the Jann?[FN#43]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So they told him the tale from beginning to end, and their stay

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there had not lasted long before there came up a third Shaykh,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and with him a she mule of bright bay coat; and he saluted them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and asked them why they were seated in that place. So they told

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him the story from first to last: and of no avail, O my master,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is a twice told tale! There he sat down with them, and lo! a dust

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cloud advanced and a mighty send devil appeared amidmost of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waste. Presently the cloud opened and behold, within it was that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jinni hending in hand a drawn sword, while his eyes were shooting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fire sparks of rage. He came up to them and, haling away the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchant from among them, cried to him, Arise that I may slay

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee, as thou slewest my son, the life stuff of my liver.[FN#44]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The merchant wailed and wept, and the three old men began sighing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and crying and weeping and wailing with their companion.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Presently the first old man (the owner of the gazelle) came out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from among them and kissed the hand of the Ifrit and said, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jinni, thou Crown of the Kings of the Jann! were I to tell thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the story of me and this gazelle and thou shouldst consider it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wondrous wouldst thou give me a third part of this merchant's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blood? Then quoth the Jinni Even so, O Shaykh ! if thou tell me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this tale, and I hold it a marvellous, then will I give thee a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: third of his blood. Thereupon the old man began to tell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The First Shaykh's Story.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know O Jinni! that this gazelle is the daughter of my paternal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uncle, my own flesh and blood, and I married her when she was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young maid, and I lived with her well nigh thirty years, yet was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I not blessed with issue by her. So I took me a concubine[FN#45]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who brought to me the boon of a male child fair as the full moon,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with eyes of lovely shine and eyebrows which formed one line, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: limbs of perfect design. Little by little he grew in stature and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waxed tall; and when he was a lad fifteen years old, it became

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: needful I should journey to certain cities and I travelled with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: great store of goods. But the daughter of my uncle (this gazelle)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had learned gramarye and egromancy and clerkly craft[FN#46] from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her childhood; so she bewitched that son of mine to a calf, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my handmaid (his mother) to a heifer, and made them over to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: herdsman's care. Now when I returned after a long time from my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: journey and asked for my son and his mother, she answered me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying Thy slave girl is dead, and thy son hath fled and I know

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not whither he is sped. So I remained for a whole year with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grieving heart, and streaming eyes until the time came for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Great Festival of Allah.[FN#47] Then sent I to my herdsman bidding

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him choose for me a fat heifer; and he brought me one which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was the damsel, my handmaid, whom this gazelle had ensorcelled. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tucked up my sleeves and skirt and, taking a knife, proceeded to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cut her throat, but she lowed aloud and wept bitter tears.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereat I marvelled and pity seized me and I held my hand, saying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the herd, Bring me other than this. Then cried my cousin,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Slay her, for I have not a fatter nor a fairer! Once more I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went forward to sacrifice her, but she again lowed aloud upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which in ruth I refrained and commanded the herdsman to slay her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and flay her. He killed her and skinned her but found in her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neither fat nor flesh, only hide and bone; and I repented when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: penitence availed me naught. I gave her to the herdsman and said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him, Fetch me a fat calf; so he brought my son ensorcelled.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the calf saw me, he brake his tether and ran to me, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fawned upon me and wailed and shed tears; so that I took pity on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and said to the herdsman, Bring me a heifer and let this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: calf go! Thereupon my cousin (this gazelle) called aloud at me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, Needs must thou kill this calf; this is a holy day and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blessed, whereon naught is slain save what be perfect pure; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we have not amongst our calves any fatter or fairer than this!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth I, Look thou upon the condition of the heifer which I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slaughtered at thy bidding and how we turn from her in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disappointment and she profited us on no wise; and I repent with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an exceeding repentance of having killed her: so this time I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not obey thy bidding for the sacrifice of this calf. Quoth she,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Allah the Most Great, the Compassionating, the Compassionate!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there is no help for it; thou must kill him on this holy day, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: if thou kill him not to me thou art no man and I to thee am no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife. Now when I heard those hard words, not knowing her object

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I went up to the calf, knife in hand--And Shahrazad perceived the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawn of day and ceased to say her permitted say.[FN#48] Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth her sister to her, How fair is thy tale, and how grateful,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and how sweet and how tasteful! And Shahrazad answered her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: What is this to that I could tell thee on the coming night, were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I to live and the King would spare me? Then said the King in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself, By Allah, I will not slay her, until I shall have heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the rest of her tale. So they slept the rest of that night in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mutual em brace till day fully brake. Then the King went forth to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his audience hall[FN#49] and the Wazir went up with his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter's shroud under his arm. The King issued his orders, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: promoted this and deposed that, until the end of the day; and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: told the Wazir no whit of what had happened. But the Minister

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wondered thereat with exceeding wonder; and when the Court broke

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up King Shahryar entered his palace.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Second Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said Dunyazad to her sister Shahrazad, O my sister, finish for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us that story of the Merchant and the Jinni; and she answered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: With joy and goodly gree, if the King permit me. Then quoth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King, Tell thy tale; and Shahrazad began in these words: It

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath reached me, O auspicious King and Heaven directed Ruler!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that when the merchant purposed the sacrifice of the calf but saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it weeping, his heart relented and he said to the herdsman, Keep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the calf among my cattle. All this the old Shaykh told the Jinni

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who marvelled much at these strange words. Then the owner of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gazelle continued:--O Lord of the Kings of the Jann, this much

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took place and my uncle's daughter, this gazelle, looked on and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw it, and said, Butcher me this calf, for surely it is a fat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one; but I bade the herdsman take it away and he took it and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turned his face homewards. On the next day as I was sitting in my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: own house, lo! the herdsman came and, standing before me said, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my master, I will tell thee a thing which shall gladden thy soul,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and shall gain me the gift of good tidings.[FN#50] I answered,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Even so. Then said he, O merchant, I have a daughter, and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: learned magic in her childhood from an old woman who lived with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us. Yesterday when thou gavest me the calf, I went into the house

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to her, and she looked upon it and veiled her face; then she wept

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and laughed alternately and at last she said:--O my father, hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mine honour become so cheap to thee that thou bringest in to me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strange men? I asked her:--Where be these strange men and why

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wast thou laughing, and crying?; and she answered, Of a truth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this calf which is with thee is the son of our master, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchant; but he is ensorcelled by his stepdame who bewitched

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: both him and his mother: such is the cause of my laughing; now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the reason of his weeping is his mother, for that his father slew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her unawares. Then I marvelled at this with exceeding marvel and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hardly made sure that day had dawned before I came to tell thee.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I heard, O Jinni, my herdsman's words, I went out with him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I was drunken without wine, from the excess of joy and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gladness which came upon me, until I reached his house. There his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter welcomed me and kissed my hand, and forthwith the calf

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came and fawned upon me as before. Quoth I to the herdsman's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter, Is this true that thou sayest of this calf? Quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she, Yea, O my master, he is thy son, the very core of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart. I rejoiced and said to her, O maiden, if thou wilt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: release him thine shall be whatever cattle and property of mine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are under thy father's hand. She smiled and answered, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master, I have no greed for the goods nor will I take them save

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on two conditions; the first that thou marry me to thy son and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the second that I may bewitch her who bewitched him and imprison

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her, otherwise I cannot be safe from her malice and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: malpractices. Now when I heard, O Jinni, these, the words of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: herdsman's daughter, I replied, Beside what thou askest all the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cattle and the house hold stuff in thy father's charge are thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, as for the daughter of my uncle, her blood is lawful to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. When I had spoken, she took a cup and filled it with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: water: then she recited a spell over it and sprinkled it upon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: calf, saying, If Almighty Allah created thee a calf, remain so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shaped, and change not; but if thou be enchanted, return to thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilom form, by command of Allah Most Highest! and lo! he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trembled and became a man. Then I fell on his neck and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah upon thee, tell me all that the daughter of my uncle did

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by thee and by thy mother. And when he told me what had come to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pass between them I said,  O my son, Allah favoured thee with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one to restore thee, and thy right hath returned to thee. Then,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O Jinni, I married the herdsman's daughter to him, and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: transformed my wife into this gazelle, saying:--Her shape is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: comely and by no means loathsome. After this she abode with us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night and day, day and night, till the Almighty took her to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Himself. When she deceased, my son fared forth to the cities of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hind, even to the city of this man who hath done to thee what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath been done;[FN#51] and I also took this gazelle (my cousin)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and wandered with her from town to town seeking tidings of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son, till Destiny drove me to this place where I saw the merchant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sitting in tears. Such is my tale! Quoth the Jinni, This story

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is indeed strange, and therefore I grant thee the third part of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his blood. There upon the second old man, who owned the two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greyhounds, came up and said,  O Jinni, if I recount to thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what befel me from my brothers, these two hounds, and thou see

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that it is a tale even more wondrous and marvellous than what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou hast heard, wilt thou grant to me also the third of this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man's blood? Replied the Jinni, Thou hast my word for it, if

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thine adventures be more marvellous and wondrous. Thereupon he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thus began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Second Shaykh's Story.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O lord of the Kings of the Jann! that these two dogs are my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brothers and I am the third. Now when our father died and left us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a capital of three thousand gold pieces,[FN#52] I opened a shop

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with my share, and bought and sold therein, and in like guise did

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my two brothers, each setting up a shop. But I had been in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: business no long while before the elder sold his stock for a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thousand diners, and after buying outfit and merchandise, went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his ways to foreign parts. He was absent one whole year with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: caravan; but one day as I sat in my shop, behold, a beggar stood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before me asking alms, and I said to him, Allah open thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another door![FN#53] Whereupon he answered, weeping the while,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Am I so changed that thou knowest me not? Then I looked at him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: narrowly, and lo! it was my brother, so I rose to him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: welcomed him; then I seated him in my shop and put questions

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: concerning his case. Ask me not, answered he; my wealth is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: awaste and my state hath waxed unstated! So I took him to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hammam bath[FN#54] and clad him in a suit of my own and gave him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lodging in my house. Moreover, after looking over the accounts of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my stock in trade and the profits of my business, I found that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: industry had gained me one thousand diners, while my principal,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the head of my wealth, amounted to two thousand. So I shared the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whole with him saying, Assume that thou hast made no journey

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abroad but hast remained at home; and be not cast down by thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ill luck. He took the share in great glee and opened for himself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a shop; and matters went on quietly for a few nights and days.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But presently my second brother (yon other dog), also setting his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart upon travel, sold off what goods and stock in trade he had,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and albeit we tried to stay him he would not be stayed: he laid

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in an outfit for the journey and fared forth with certain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wayfarers. After an absence of a whole year he came back to me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: even as my elder brother had come back; and when I said to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O my brother, did I not dissuade thee from travel? he shed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tears and cried, O my brother, this be destiny's decree: here I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: am a mere beggar, penniless[FN#55] and without a shirt to my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back. So I led him to the bath, O Jinni, and clothing him in new

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes of my own wear, I went with him to my shop and served him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with meat and drink. Furthermore I said to him, O my brother, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: am wont to cast up my shop accounts at the head of every year,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and whatso I shall find of surplusage is between me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee.[FN#56] So I proceeded, O Ifrit, to strike a balance and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: finding two thousand diners of profit, I returned praises to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Creator (be He extolled and exalted!) and made over one half to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my brother, keeping the other to my self. Thereupon he busied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself with opening a shop and on this wise we abode many days.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: After a time my brothers began pressing me to travel with them;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but I refused saying, What gained ye by travel voyage that I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: should gain thereby? As I would not give ear to them we went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back each to his own shop where we bought and sold as before.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They kept urging me to travel for a whole twelvemonth, but I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: refused to do so till full six years were past and gone when I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: consented with these words, O my brothers, here am I, your

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: companion of travel: now let me see what monies you have by you.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I found, however, that they had not a doit, having squandered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their substance in high diet and drinking and carnal delights.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yet I spoke not a word of reproach; so far from it I looked over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my shop accounts once more, and sold what goods and stock in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trade were mine; and, finding myself the owner of six thousand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ducats, I gladly proceeded to divide that sum in halves, saying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to my brothers, These three thousand gold pieces are for me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for you to trade withal, adding, Let us bury the other moiety

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: underground that it may be of service in case any harm befal us,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in which case each shall take a thousand wherewith to open

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shops. Both replied, Right is thy recking; and I gave to each

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one his thousand gold pieces, keeping the same sum for myself, to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wit, a thousand diners. We then got ready suitable goods and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hired a ship and, having embarked our merchandise, proceeded on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our voyage, day following day, a full month, after which we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arrived at a city, where we sold our venture; and for every piece

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of gold we gained ten. And as we turned again to our voyage we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found on the shore of the sea a maiden clad in worn and ragged

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gear, and she kissed my hand and said, O master, is there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kindness in thee and charity? I can make thee a fitting return

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for them. I answered, Even so; truly in me are benevolence and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: good works, even though thou render me no return. Then she said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Take me to wife, O my master, and carry me to thy city, for I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have given myself to thee; so do me a kindness and I am of those

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who be meet for good works and charity: I will make thee a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fitting return for these and be thou not shamed by my condition.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I heard her words, my heart yearned towards her, in such

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sort as willed it Allah (be He extolled and exalted!); and took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her and clothed her and made ready for her a fair resting place

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the vessel, and honourably entreated her. So we voyaged on,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and my heart became attached to her with exceeding attachment,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I was separated from her neither night nor day, and I paid

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more regard to her than to my brothers. Then they were estranged

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from me, and waxed jealous of my wealth and the quantity of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchandise I had, and their eyes were opened covetously upon all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my property. So they took counsel to murder me and seize my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wealth, saying, Let us slay our brother and all his monies will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be ours; and Satan made this deed seem fair in their sight; so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when they found me in privacy (and I sleeping by my wife's side)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they took us both up and cast us into the sea. My wife awoke

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: startled from her sleep and, forthright becoming an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ifritah,[FN#57] she bore me up and carried me to an island and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disappeared for a short time; but she returned in the morning and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, Here am I, thy faithful slave, who hath made thee due

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recompense; for I bore thee up in the waters and saved thee from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: death by command of the Almighty. Know--that I am a Jinniyah, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as I saw thee my heart loved thee by will of the Lord, for I am a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: believer in Allah and in His Apostle (whom Heaven bless and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: preserve!). Thereupon I came to thee conditioned as thou sawest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and thou didst marry me, and see now I have saved thee from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sinking. But I am angered against thy brothers and assuredly I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: must slay them. When I heard her story I was surprised and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thanking her for all she had done, I said, But as to slaying my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brothers this must not be. Then I told her the tale of what had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: come to pass with them from the beginning of our lives to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: end, and on hearing it quoth she, This night will I fly as a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bird over them and will sink their ship and slay them. Quoth I,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah upon thee, do not thus, for the proverb saith, O thou who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: doest good to him that cloth evil, leave the evil doer to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: evil deeds. Moreover they are still my brothers. But she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoined, By Allah, there is no help for it but I slay them. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: humbled myself before her for their pardon, whereupon she bore me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up and flew away with me till at last she set me down on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: terrace roof of my own house. I opened the doors and took up what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I had hidden in the ground; and after I had saluted the folk I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: opened my shop and bought me merchandise. Now when night came on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I went home, and there I saw these two hounds tied up; and, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they sighted me, they arose and whined and fawned upon me; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ere I knew what happened my wife said, These two dogs be thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brothers! I answered, And who hath done this thing by them?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she rejoined, I sent a message to my sister and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entreated them on this wise, nor shall these two be released from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their present shape till ten years shall have passed. And now I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have arrived at this place on my way to my wife's sister that she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: may deliver them from this condition, after their having endured

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it for half a score of years. As I was wending onwards I saw this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young man, who acquainted me with what had befallen him, and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: determined not to fare hence until I should see what might occur

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: between thee and him. Such is my tale! Then said the Jinni,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Surely this is a strange story and therefor I give thee the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: third portion of his blood and his crime. Thereupon quoth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: third Shaykh, the master of the mare mule, to the Jinni, I can

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tell thee a tale more wondrous than these two, so thou grant me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the remainder of his blood and of his offense, and the Jinni

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, So be it! Then the old man began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Third Shaykh's Story.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O Sultan and head of the Jann, that this mule was my wife.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now it so happened that I went forth and was absent one whole

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: year; and when I returned from my journey I came to her by night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and saw a black slave lying with her on the carpet bed and they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were talking, and dallying, and laughing, and kissing and playing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the close buttock game. When she saw me, she rose and came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hurriedly at me with a gugglet[FN#58] of water; and, muttering

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spells over it, she besprinkled me and said, Come forth from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this thy shape into the shape of a dog; and I became on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: instant a dog. She drove me out of the house, and I ran through

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the doorway nor ceased running until I came to a butcher's stall,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where I stopped and began to eat what bones were there. When the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stall owner saw me, he took me and led me into his house, but as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soon as his daughter had sight of me she veiled her face from me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crying out, Doss thou bring men to me and dost thou come in with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them to me? Her father asked, Where is the man?; and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, This dog is a man whom his wife hath ensorcelled and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: am able to release him. When her father heard her words, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, Allah upon thee, O my daughter, release him. So she took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a gugglet of water and, after uttering words over it, sprinkled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon me a few drops, saying, Come forth from that form into thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: former form. And I returned to my natural shape. Then I kissed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her hand and said, I wish thou wouldest transform my wife even

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as she bans formed me. Thereupon she gave me some water, saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: As soon as thou see her asleep, sprinkle this liquid upon her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and speak what words thou heardest me utter, so shall she become

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whatsoever thou desirest. I went to my wife and found her fast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asleep; and, while sprinkling the water upon her, I said, Come

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth from that form into the form of a mare mule. So she became

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the instant a she mule, and she it is whom thou seest with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thine eyes, O Sultan and head of the Kings of the Jann! Then the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jinni turned towards her and said, Is this sooth? And she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nodded her head and replied by signs, Indeed, 'tis the truth:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for such is my tale and this is what hath be fallen me. Now when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the old man had ceased speaking the Jinni shook with pleasure and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gave him the third of the merchant's blood. And Shahrazad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perceived the dawn of day and ceased saying her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then quoth Dunyazad, O. my sister, how pleasant is thy tale, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: how tasteful; how sweet and how grateful! She replied, And what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is this compared with that I could tell thee, the night to come,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: if I live and the King spare me?[FN#59] Then thought the King,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Allah, I will not slay her until I hear the rest of her tale,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for truly it is wondrous. So they rested that night in mutual

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: embrace until the dawn. After this the King went forth to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hall of Estate, and the Wazir and the troops came in and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: court was crowded, and the King gave orders and judged and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: appointed and deposed, bidding and forbidding during the rest of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the day. Then the Divan broke up, and King Shahryar entered his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palace.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Third Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And the King had had his will of the Wazir's daughter, Dunyazad,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her sister, said to her, Finish for us that tale of thine; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she replied, With joy and goodly gree! It hath reached me, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: auspicious King, that when the third old man told a tale to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jinni more wondrous than the two preceding, the Jinni marvelled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with exceeding marvel, and, shaking with delight, cried, Lo! I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have given thee the remainder of the merchant's punishment and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for thy sake have I released him. Thereupon the merchant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: embraced the old men and thanked them, and these Shaykhs wished

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him joy on being saved and fared forth each one for his own city.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yet this tale is not more wondrous than the fisherman's story.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Asked the King, What is the fisherman's story? And she answered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by relating the tale of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: THE FISHERMAN AND THE JINNI.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that there was a Fisher

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man well stricken in years who had a wife and three children, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: withal was of poor condition. Now it was his custom to cast his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: net every day four times, and no more. On a day he went forth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about noontide to the sea shore, where he laid down his basket;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, tucking up his shirt and plunging into the water, made a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cast with his net and waited till it settled to the bottom. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he gathered the cords together and haled away at it, but found it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weighty; and however much he drew it landwards, he could not pull

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it up; so he carried the ends ashore and drove a stake into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ground and made the net fast to it. Then he stripped and dived

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: into the water all about the net, and left not off working hard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: until he had brought it up. He rejoiced thereat and, donning his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes, went to the net, when he found in it a dead jackass

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which had torn the meshes. Now when he saw it, he exclaimed in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his grief, There is no Majesty, and there is no Might save in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah the Glorious, the Great! Then quoth he, This is a strange

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: manner of daily bread; and he began re citing in extempore

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: verse:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O toiler through the glooms of night in peril and in pain * Thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: toiling stint for daily bread comes not by might and main!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Seest thou not the fisher seek afloat upon the sea * His bread,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: while glimmer stars of night as set in tangled skein.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Anon he plungeth in despite the buffet of the waves * The while

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to sight the bellying net his eager glances strain;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Till joying at the night's success, a fish he bringeth home *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whose gullet by the hook of Fate was caught and cut in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: twain.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When buys that fish of him a man who spent the hours of night *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Reckless of cold and wet and gloom in ease and comfort fain,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Laud to the Lord who gives to this, to that denies his wishes *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And dooms one toil and catch the prey and other eat the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fishes.[FN#60]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then quoth he, Up and to it; I am sure of His beneficence,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Inshallah! So he continued:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When thou art seized of Evil Fate, assume * The noble soul's long

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: suffering: 'tis thy best:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Complain not to the creature; this be plaint * From one most

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ruthful to the ruthlessest.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Fisherman, when he had looked at the dead ass, got it free of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the toils and wrung out and spread his net; then he plunged into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sea, saying, In Allah's name! and made a cast and pulled at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it, but it grew heavy and settled down more firmly than the first

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: time. Now he thought that there were fish in it, and he made it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fast, and doffing his clothes went into the water, and dived and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: haled until he drew it up upon dry land. Then found he in it a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: large earthen pitcher which was full of sand and mud; and seeing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this he was greatly troubled and began repeating these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: verses[FN#61]:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Forbear, O troubles of the world, * And pardon an ye nill

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forbear:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I went to seek my daily bread * I find that breadless I must

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fare:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For neither handcraft brings me aught * Nor Fate allots to me a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: share:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How many fools the Pleiads reach * While darkness whelms the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wise and ware.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So he prayed pardon of Allah and, throwing away the jar, wrung

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his net and cleansed it and returned to the sea the third time to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cast his net and waited till it had sunk. Then he pulled at it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and found therein potsherds and broken glass; whereupon he began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to speak these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He is to thee that daily bread thou canst nor loose nor bind *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nor pen nor writ avail thee aught thy daily bread to find:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For joy and daily bread are what Fate deigneth to allow; * This

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soil is sad and sterile ground, while that makes glad the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hind.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The shafts of Time and Life bear down full many a man of worth *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: While bearing up to high degree wights of ignoble mind.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So come thou, Death! for verily life is not worth a straw * When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: low the falcon falls withal the mallard wings the wind:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: No wonder 'tis thou seest how the great of soul and mind * Are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poor, and many a loser carle to height of luck designed.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This bird shall overfly the world from east to furthest west *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And that shall win her every wish though ne'er she leave the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nest.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then raising his eyes heavenwards he said, O my God![FN#62]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: verily Thou wottest that I cast not my net each day save four

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: times[FN#63]; the third is done and as yet Thou hast vouchsafed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me nothing. So this time, O my God, deign give me my daily

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bread. Then, having called on Allah's name,[FN#64] he again

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: threw his net and waited its sinking and settling; whereupon he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: haled at it but could not draw it in for that it was entangled at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bottom. He cried out in his vexation There is no Majesty and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there is no Might save in Allah! and he began reciting:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fie on this wretched world, an so it be * I must be whelmed by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grief and misery:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tho' gladsome be man's lot when dawns the morn * He drains the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cup of woe ere eve he see:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yet was I one of whom the world when asked * Whose lot is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happiest? oft would say 'Tis he!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon he stripped and, diving down to the net, busied him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: self with it till it came to land. Then he opened the meshes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found therein a cucumber shaped jar of yellow copper,[FN#65]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: evidently full of something, whose mouth was made fast with a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leaden cap, stamped with the seal ring of our Lord Sulayman son

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of David (Allah accept the twain!). Seeing this the Fisherman

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoiced and said, If I sell it in the brass bazar 'tis worth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ten golden diners. He shook it and finding it heavy continued,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Would to Heaven I knew what is herein. But I must and will open

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it and look to its contents and store it in my bag and sell it in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the brass market. And taking out a knife he worked at the lead

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till he had loosened it from the jar; then he laid the cup on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ground and shook the vase to pour out whatever might be inside.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He found nothing in it; whereat he marvelled with an exceeding

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marvel. But presently there came forth from the jar a smoke which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spired heavenwards into aether (whereat he again marvelled with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mighty marvel), and which trailed along earth's surface till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presently, having reached its full height, the thick vapour

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: condensed, and became an Ifrit, huge of bulk, whose crest touched

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the clouds while his feet were on the ground. His head was as a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dome, his hands like pitchforks, his legs long as masts and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mouth big as a cave; his teeth were like large stones, his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nostrils ewers, his eyes two lamps and his look was fierce and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lowering. Now when the Fisherman saw the Ifrit his side muscles

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quivered, his teeth chattered, his spittle dried up and he became

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blind about what to do. Upon this the Ifrit looked at him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried, There is no god but the God, and Sulayman is the prophet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of God; presently adding, O Apostle of Allah, slay me not;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: never again will I gainsay thee in word nor sin against thee in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deed.[FN#66] Quoth the Fisherman, O Marid,[FN#67] diddest thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: say, Sulayman the Apostle of Allah; and Sulayman is dead some

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou sand and eight hundred years ago,[FN#68] and we are now in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the last days of the world! What is thy story, and what is thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: account of thyself, and what is the cause of thy entering into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this cucur bit? Now when the Evil Spirit heard the words of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fisher man, quoth he; There is no god but the God: be of good

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cheer, O Fisherman! Quoth the Fisherman, Why biddest thou me to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be of good cheer? and he replied, Because of thy having to die

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an ill death in this very hour. Said the Fisherman, Thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deservest for thy good tidings the withdrawal of Heaven's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: protection, O thou distant one![FN#69] Wherefore shouldest thou kill

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and what thing have I done to deserve death, I who freed thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from the jar, and saved thee from the depths of the sea, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought thee up on the dry land? Replied the Ifrit, Ask of me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: only what mode of death thou wilt die, and by what manner of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slaughter shall I slay thee. Rejoined the Fisherman, What is my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crime and wherefore such retribution? Quoth the Ifrit, Hear my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: story, O Fisherman! and he answered, Say on, and be brief in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy saying, for of very sooth my life breath is in my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nostrils.[FN#70] Thereupon quoth the Jinni, Know, that I am one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: among the heretical Jann and I sinned against Sulayman, David son

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (on the twain be peace!) I together with the famous Sakhr al

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jinni;[FN#71] whereupon the Prophet sent his minister, Asaf son

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of Barkhiya, to seize me; and this Wazir brought me against my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will and led me in bonds to him (I being downcast despite my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nose) and he placed me standing before him like a suppliant. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sulayman saw me, he took refuge with Allah and bade me embrace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the True Faith and obey his behests; but I refused, so sending

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for this cucurbit[FN#72] he shut me up therein, and stopped it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over with lead whereon he impressed the Most High Name, and gave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his orders to the Jann who carried me off, and cast me into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: midmost of the ocean. There I abode an hundred years, during

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which I said in my heart, Whoso shall release me, him will I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enrich for ever and ever. But the full century went by and, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no one set me free, I entered upon the second five score saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whoso shall release me, for him I will open the hoards of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: earth. Still no one set me free and thus four hundred years

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: passed away. Then quoth I, Whoso shall release me, for him will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I fulfil three wishes. Yet no one set me free. Thereupon I waxed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wroth with exceeding wrath and said to myself, Whoso shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: release me from this time forth, him will I slay and I will give

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him choice of what death he will die; and now, as thou hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: released me, I give thee full choice of deaths. The Fisherman,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hearing the words of the Ifrit, said, O Allah! the wonder of it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that I have not come to free thee save in these days! adding,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Spare my life, so Allah spare thine; and slay me not, lest Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set one to slay thee. Replied the Contumacious One, There is no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: help for it; die thou must; so ask me by way of boon what manner

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of death thou wilt die. Albeit thus certified the Fisherman

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again addressed the Ifrit saying, Forgive me this my death as a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: generous reward for having freed thee; and the Ifrit, Surely I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would not slay thee save on account of that same release. O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Chief of the Ifrits, said the Fisherman, I do thee good and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou requitest me with evil! in very sooth the old saw lieth not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when it saith:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: We wrought them weal, they met our weal with ill; * Such, by my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: life! is every bad man's labour:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: To him who benefits unworthy wights * Shall hap what inapt to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ummi Amir's neighbor.[FN#73]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now when the Ifrit heard these words he answered, No more of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this talk, needs must I kill thee. Upon this the Fisherman said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to himself, This is a Jinni; and I am a man to whom Allah hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: given a passably cunning wit, so I will now cast about to com

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pass his destruction by my contrivance and by mine intelligence;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: even as he took counsel only of his malice and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: frowardness.[FN#74] He began by asking the Ifrit, Hast thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: indeed resolved to kill me? and, receiving for all answer, Even

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so, he cried, Now in the Most Great Name, graven on the seal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ring of Sulayman the Son of David (peace be with the holy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: twain!), an I question thee on a certain matter wilt thou give me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a true answer? The Ifrit replied Yea; but, hearing mention of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Most Great Name, his wits were troubled and he said with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trembling, Ask and be brief. Quoth the Fisherman, How didst

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou fit into this bottle which would not hold thy hand; no, nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: even thy foot, and how came it to be large enough to contain the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whole of thee? Replied the Ifrit, What! cost not believe that I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was all there? and the Fisherman rejoined, Nay! I will never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: believe it until I see thee inside with my own eyes. And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shahrazad per ceived the dawn of day and ceased to say her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Fourth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Her sister said to her, Please finish us this tale, an thou be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not sleepy! so she resumed:--It hath reached me, O auspicious

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King, that when the Fisherman said to the Ifrit, I will never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and nowise believe thee until I see thee inside it with mine own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyes; the Evil Spirit on the instant shook[FN#75] and became a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: vapour, which condensed, and entered the jar little and little,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till all was well inside when lo! the Fisherman in hot haste took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the leaden cap with the seal and stoppered therewith the mouth of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the jar and called out to the Ifrit, saying, Ask me by way of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: boon what death thou wilt die! By Allah, I will throw thee into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sea[FN#76] be fore us and here will I build me a lodge; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whoso cometh hither I will warn him against fishing and will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: say:--In these waters abideth an Ifrit who giveth as a last

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: favour a choice of deaths and fashion of slaughter to the man who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saveth him! Now when the Ifrit heard this from the Fisherman and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw him self in limbo, he was minded to escape, but this was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prevented by Solomon's seal; so he knew that the Fisherman had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cozened and outwitted him, and he waxed lowly and submissive and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began humbly to say, I did but jest with thee. But the other an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swered, Thou liest, O vilest of the Ifrits, and meanest and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: filthiest! and he set off with the bottle for the sea side; the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ifrit calling out Nay! Nay! and he calling out Aye! Aye !

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: There upon the Evil Spirit softened his voice and smoothed his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speech and abased himself, saying, What wouldest thou do with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, O Fisherman? I will throw thee back into the sea, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered; where thou hast been housed and homed for a thousand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and eight hundred years; and now I will leave thee therein till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Judgment day: did I not say to thee:--Spare me and Allah shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spare thee; and slay me not lest Allah slay thee? yet thou spurn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: east my supplication and hadst no intention save to deal un

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: graciously by me, and Allah hath now thrown thee into my hands

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I am cunninger than thou. Quoth the Ifrit, Open for me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I may bring thee weal. Quoth the Fisherman, Thou liest, thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: accursed! my case with thee is that of the Wazir of King Yunan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the sage Duban.[FN#77] And who was the Wazir of King Yunan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and who was the sage Duban; and what was the story about them?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth the Ifrit, whereupon the Fisherman began to tell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Tale of the Wazir and the Sage Duban.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O thou Ifrit, that in days of yore and in ages long gone

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before, a King called Yunan reigned over the city of Fars of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: land of the Roum.[FN#78] He was a powerful ruler and a wealthy,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who had armies and guards and allies of all nations of men; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his body was afflicted with a leprosy which leaches and men of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: science failed to heal. He drank potions and he swallowed pow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ders and he used unguents, but naught did him good and none among

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the host of physicians availed to procure him a cure. At last

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there came to his city a mighty healer of men and one well

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stricken in years, the sage Duban highs. This man was a reader of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: books, Greek, Persian, Roman, Arabian, and Syrian; and he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: skilled in astronomy and in leechcraft, the theorick as well as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the practick; he was experienced in all that healeth and that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hurteth the body; conversant with the virtues of every plant,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grass and herb, and their benefit and bane; and he understood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: philosophy and had compassed the whole range of medical science

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and other branches of the knowledge tree. Now this physician

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: passed but few days in the city, ere he heard of the King's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: malady and all his bodily sufferings through the leprosy with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which Allah had smitten him; and how all the doctors and wise men

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had failed to heal him. Upon this he sat up through the night in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deep thought and, when broke the dawn and appeared the morn and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: light was again born, and the Sun greeted the Good whose beauties

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the world adorn,[FN#79] he donned his handsomest dress and going

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in to King Yunan, he kissed the ground before him: then he prayed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the endurance of his honour and prosperity in fairest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: language and made himself known saying, O King, tidings have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reached I me of what befel thee through that which is in thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: person; and how the host of physicians have proved themselves

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unavailing to abate it; and lo! I can cure thee, O King; and yet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will I not make thee drink of draught or anoint thee with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ointment. Now when King Yunan heard his words he said in huge

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surprise, How wilt thou do this? By Allah, if thou make me whole

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I will enrich thee even to thy son's son and I will give thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sumptuous gifts; and whatso thou wishest shall be thine and thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shalt be to me a cup companion[FN#80] and a friend. The King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: then robed him with a dress of honour and entreated him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: graciously and asked him, Canst thou indeed cure me of this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: complaint without drug and unguent? and he answered, Yes! I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will heal I thee without the pains and penalties of medicine.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King marvelled with exceeding marvel and said, O physician,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when shall be this whereof thou speakest, and in how many days

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall it take place? Haste thee, O my son! He replied,I hear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I obey; the cure shall begin tomorrow. So saying he went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth from the presence, and hired himself a house in the city

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the better storage of his books and scrolls, his medicines

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and his aromatic roots. Then he set to work at choosing the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fittest drugs and simples and he fashioned a bat hollow within,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and furnished with a handle without, for which he made a ball;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the two being prepared with consummate art. On the next day when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: both were ready for use and wanted nothing more, he went up to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King; and, kissing the ground between his hands bade him ride

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth on the parade ground[FN#81] there to play at pall and mall.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He was accompanied by his suite, Emirs and Chamberlains, Wazirs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and Lords of the realm and, ere he was seated, the sage Duban
