title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came up to him, and handing him the bat said, Take this mall and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grip it as I do; so! and now push for the plain and leaning well

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over thy horse drive the ball with all thy might until thy palm

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be moist and thy body perspire: then the medicine will penetrate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: through thy palm and will permeate thy person. When thou hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: done with playing and thou feelest the effects of the medicine,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: return to thy palace, and make the Ghusl ablation[FN#82] in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hammam bath, and lay thee down to sleep; so shalt thou be come

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whole; and now peace be with thee! Thereupon King Yunan took the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bat from the Sage and grasped it firmly; then, mounting steed, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drove the ball before him and gallopped after it till he reached

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it, when he struck it with all his might, his palm gripping the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bat handle the while; and he ceased not malling the ball till his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand waxed moist and his skin, perspiring, imbibed the medicine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from the wood. Then the sage Duban knew that the drugs had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: penetrated his person and bade him return to the palace and enter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Hammam without stay or delay; so King Yunan forthright

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned and ordered them to clear for him the bath. They did so,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the carpet spreaders making all haste, and the slaves all hurry

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and got ready a change of raiment for the King. He entered the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bath and made the total ablution long and thoroughly; then donned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his clothes within the Hammam and rode therefrom to his palace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where he lay him down and slept. Such was the case with King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yunan, but as regards the sage Duban, he returned home and slept

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as usual and when morning dawned he repaired to the palace and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: craved audience. The King ordered him to be admitted; then,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: having kissed the ground between his hands, in allusion to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King he recited these couplets with solemn intonation:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Happy is Eloquence when thou art named her sire * But mourns

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she whenas other man the title claimed.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O Lord of fairest presence, whose illuming rays * Clear off the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fogs of doubt aye veiling deeds high famed,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ne'er cease thy face to shine like Dawn and rise of Morn * And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: never show Time's face with heat of ire inflamed!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thy grace hath favoured us with gifts that worked such wise * As

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rain clouds raining on the hills by words enframed:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Freely thou lavishedst thy wealth to rise on high * Till won from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Time the heights whereat thy grandeur aimed.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now when the Sage ceased reciting, the King rose quickly to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: feet and fell on his neck; then, seating him by his side he bade

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dress him in a sumptuous dress; for it had so happened that when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King left the Hammam he looked on his body and saw no trace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of leprosy: the skin was all clean as virgin silver. He joyed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thereat with exceeding joy, his breast broadened[FN#83] with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: delight and he felt thoroughly happy. Presently, when it was full

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day he entered his audience hall and sat upon the throne of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kingship whereupon his Chamberlains and Grandees flocked to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presence and with them the Sage Duban. Seeing the leach the King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose to him in honour and seated him by his side; then the food

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trays furnished with the daintiest viands were brought and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: physician ate with the King, nor did he cease companying him all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that day. Moreover, at nightfall he gave the physician Duban two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thousand gold pieces, besides the usual dress of honour and other

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gifts galore, and sent him home on his own steed. After the Sage

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had fared forth King Yunan again expressed his amazement at the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leach's art, saying, This man medicined my body from without nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: anointed me with aught of ointments: by Allah, surely this is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: none other than consummate skill! I am bound to honour such a man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with re wards and distinction, and take him to my companion and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my friend during the remainder of my days. So King Yunan passed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the night in joy and gladness for that his body had been made

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whole and had thrown off so pernicious a malady. On the morrow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King went forth from his Serraglio and sat upon his throne,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the Lords of Estate stood about him, and the Emirs and Wazirs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sat as was their wont on his right hand and on his left. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asked for the Sage Duban, who came in and kissed the ground

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before him, when the King rose to greet him and, seating him by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his side, ate with him and wished him long life. Moreover he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: robed him and gave him gifts, and ceased not con versing with him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: until night approached. Then the King ordered him, by way of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: salary, five dresses of honour and a thousand dinars.[FN#84] The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: physician returned to his own house full of gratitude to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King. Now when next morning dawned the King repaired to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: audience hall, and his Lords and Nobles surrounded him and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Chamberlains and his Ministers, as the white en closeth the black

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the eye.[FN#85] Now the King had a Wazir among his Wazirs,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unsightly to look upon, an ill omened spectacle; sor did,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ungenerous, full of envy and evil will. When this Minister saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King place the physician near him and give him all these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gifts, he jaloused him and planned to do him a harm, as in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying on such subject, Envy lurks in every body; and the say

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ing, Oppression hideth in every heart: power revealeth it and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weakness concealeth it. Then the Minister came before the King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, kissing the ground between his hands, said, O King of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: age and of all time, thou in whose benefits I have grown to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: manhood, I have weighty advice to offer thee, and if I withhold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it I were a son of adultery and no true born man; wherefore an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou order me to disclose it I will so do forthwith. Quoth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King (and he was troubled at the words of the Minister), And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what is this counsel of thine? Quoth he, O glorious monarch,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the wise of old have said:--Whoso regardeth not the end, hath not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fortune to friend; and indeed I have lately seen the King on far

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other than the right way; for he lavisheth largesse on his enemy,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on one whose object is the decline and fall of his king ship: to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this man he hath shown favour, honouring him with over honour and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: making of him an intimate. Wherefore I fear for the King's life.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King, who was much troubled and changed colour, asked, Whom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cost thou suspect and anent whom doest thou hint? and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Minister answered, O King, an thou be asleep, wake up! I point

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the physician Duban. Rejoined the King, Fie upon thee! This

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is a true friend who is favoured by me above all men, because he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cured me with some thing which I held in my hand, and he healed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my leprosy which had baffled all physicians; indeed he is one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose like may not be found in these days--no, not in the whole

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: world from furthest east to utmost west! And it is of such a man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou sayest such hard sayings. Now from this day forward I allot

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him a settled solde and allowances, every month a thousand gold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pieces; and, were I to share with him my realm 'twere but a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: little matter. Perforce I must suspect that thou speakest on this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wise from mere envy and jealousy as they relate of the King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sindibad.--And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day, and ceased

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying her permitted say. Then quoth Dunyazad, O my sister, how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pleasant is thy tale, and how tasteful, how sweet, and how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grateful! She replied, And where is this compared with what I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: could tell thee on the coming night if the King deign spare my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: life? Then said the King in himself, By Allah, I will not slay

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her until I hear the rest of her tale, for truly it is wondrous.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So they rested that night in mutual embrace until the dawn. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King went forth to his Hall of Rule, and the Wazir and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: troops came in, and the audience chamber was thronged and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King gave orders and judged and appointed and deposed and bade

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and forbade during the rest of that day till the Court broke up,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and King Shahryar returned to his palace.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When It Was The Fifth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Her sister said, Do you finish for us thy story if thou be not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sleepy, and she resumed:--It hath reached me, O auspicious King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and mighty Monarch, that King Yunan said to his Minister, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir, thou art one whom the evil spirit of envy hath possessed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: because of this physician, and thou plottest for my putting him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to death, after which I should repent me full sorely, even as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repented King Sindibad for killing his falcon. Quoth the Wazir,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Pardon me, O King of the age, how was that? So the King began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the story of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King Sindibad and his Falcon.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: It is said (but Allah is All knowing![FN#86]) that there was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King of the Kings of Fars, who was fond of pleasuring and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: diversion, especially coursing end hunting. He had reared a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: falcon which he carried all night on his fist, and whenever he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went a chasing he took with him this bird; and he bade make for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her a golden cuplet hung around her neck to give her drink

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: therefrom. One day as the King was sitting quietly in his palace,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: behold, the high falcaner of the household suddenly addressed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, O King of the age, this is indeed a day fit for birding.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King gave orders accordingly and set out taking the hawk on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fist; and they fared merrily forwards till they made a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wady[FN#87] where they planted a circle of nets for the chase;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when lo! a gazelle came within the toils and the King cried,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whoso alloweth yon gazelle to spring over his head and loseth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her, that man will I surely slay. They narrowed the nets about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the gazelle when she drew near the King's station; and, planting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: herself on her hind quarter, crossed her forehand over her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: breast, as if about to kiss the earth before the King. He bowed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his brow low in acknowledgment to the beast; when she bounded

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: high over his head and took the way of the waste. Thereupon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King turned towards his troops and seeing them winking and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pointing at him, he asked, O Wazir, what are my men saying? and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Minister answered, They say thou didst proclaim that whoso

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alloweth the gazelle to spring over his head, that man shall be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: put to death. Quoth the King, Now, by the life of my head! I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will follow her up till I bring her back. So he set off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gallopping on the gazelle's trail and gave not over tracking till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he reached the foot hills of a mountain chain where the quarry

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made for a cave. Then the King cast off at it the falcon which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presently caught it up and, swooping down, drove her talons into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: its eyes, bewildering and blinding it;[FN#88] and the King drew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his mace and struck a blow which rolled the game over. He then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dismounted; and, after cutting the antelope's throat and flaying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the body, hung it to the pommel of his saddle. Now the time was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that of the siesta[FN#89] and the wold was parched and dry, nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was any water to be found anywhere; and the King thirsted and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: horse also; so he went about searching till he saw a tree

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dropping water, as it were melted butter, from its boughs.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon the King who wore gauntlets of skin to guard him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: against poisons took the cup from the hawk's neck, and filling it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the water set it before the bird, and lo! the falcon struck

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it with her pounces and upset the liquid. The King filled it a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: second time with the dripping drops, thinking his hawk was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thirsty; but the bird again struck at the cup with her talons and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: overturned it. Then the King waxed wroth with the hawk and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: filling the cup a third time offered it to his horse: but the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hawk upset it with a flirt of wings. Quoth the King, Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: confound thee, thou unluckiest of flying things! thou keepest me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from drinking, and thou deprivest thyself also, and the horse.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So he struck the falcon with his sword and cut off her wing; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bird raised her head and said by signs, Look at that which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hangeth on the tree! The King lifted up his eyes accordingly and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: caught sight of a brood of vipers, whose poison drops he mistook

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for water; thereupon he repented him of having struck off his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: falcon's wing, and mounting horse, fared on with the dead

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gazelle, till he arrived at the camp, his starting place. He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: threw the quarry to the cook saying, Take and broil it, and sat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down on his chair, the falcon being still on his fist when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: suddenly the bird gasped and died; whereupon the King cried out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in sorrow and remorse for having slain that falcon which had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saved his life. Now this is what occurred in the case of King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sindibad; and I am assured that were I to do as thou desirest I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: should repent even as the man who killed his parrot. Quoth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir, And how was that? And the King began to tell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Tale of the Husband and the Parrot.[FN#90]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A certain man and a merchant to boot had married a fair wife, a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woman of perfect beauty and grace, symmetry and loveliness, of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom he was mad-jealous, and who contrived successfully to keep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him from travel. At last an occasion compelling him to leave her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he went to the bird market and bought him for one hundred gold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pieces a she parrot which he set in his house to act as duenna,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: expecting her to acquaint him on his return with what had passed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: during the whole time of his absence; for the bird was kenning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and cunning and never forgot what she had seen and heard. Now his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fair wife had fallen in love with a young Turk, [FN#91] who used

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to visit her, and she feasted him by day and lay with him by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night. When the man had made his journey and won his wish he came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: home; and, at once causing the Parrot be brought to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: questioned her concerning the conduct of his consort whilst he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was in foreign parts. Quoth she, Thy wife hath a man friend who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: passed every night with her during thine absence. Thereupon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: husband went to his wife in a violent rage and bashed her with a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bashing severe enough to satisfy any body. The woman, suspecting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that one of the slave girls had been tattling to the master,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: called them together and questioned them upon their oaths, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all swore that they had kept the secret, but that the Parrot had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not, adding, And we heard her with our own ears. Upon this the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woman bade one of the girls to set a hand mill under the cage and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grind therewith and a second to sprinkle water through the cage

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: roof and a third to run about, right and left, dashing a mirror

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of bright steel through the livelong night. Next morning when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: husband returned home after being entertained by one of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: friends, he bade bring the Parrot before him and asked what had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: taken place whilst he was away. Pardon me, O my master, quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bird, I could neither hear nor see aught by reason of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding murk and the thunder and lightning which lasted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: throughout the night. As it happened to be the summer tide the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master was astounded and cried, But we are now in mid

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tammuz,[FN#92] and this is not the time for rains and storms.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ay, by Allah, rejoined the bird, I saw with these eyes what my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tongue hath told thee. Upon this the man, not knowing the case

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nor smoking the plot, waxed exceeding wroth; and, holding that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his wife had been wrongously accused, put forth his hand and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pulling the Parrot from her cage dashed her upon the ground with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: such force that he killed her on the spot. Some days after wards

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one of his slave girls confessed to him the whole truth,[FN#93]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yet would he not believe it till he saw the young Turk, his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife's lover, coming out of her chamber, when he bared his blade

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#94] and slew him by a blow on the back of the neck; and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: did the same by the adulteress; and thus the twain, laden with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mortal sin, went straightways to Eternal Fire. Then the merchant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knew that the Parrot had told him the truth anent all she had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seen and he mourned grievously for her loss, when mourning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: availed him not. The Minister, hearing the words of King Yu nan,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoined, 'O Monarch, high in dignity, and what harm have I done

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, or what evil have I seen from him that I should compass his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: death? I would not do this thing, save to serve thee, and soon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shalt thou sight that it is right; and if thou accept my advice

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou shalt be saved, otherwise thou shalt be destroyed even as a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: certain Wazir who acted treacherously by the young Prince. Asked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King, How was that? and the Minister thus began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Tale of the Prince and the Ogress.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A certain King, who had a son over much given to hunting and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: coursing, ordered one of his Wazirs to be in attendance upon him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whithersoever he might wend. One day the youth set out for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chase accompanied by his father's Minister; and, as they jogged

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on together, a big wild beast came in sight. Cried the Wazir to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King's son, Up and at yon noble quarry! So the Prince

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: followed it until he was lost to every eye and the chase got away

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from him in the waste; whereby he was confused and he knew not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which way to turn, when lo! a damsel appeared ahead and she was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in tears. The King's son asked, Who art thou? and she answered,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I am daughter to a King among the Kings of Hind, and I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: travelling with a caravan in the desert when drowsiness overcame

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, and I fell from my beast unwittingly whereby I am cut off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from my people and sore bewildered. The Prince, hearing these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words, pitied her case and, mounting her on his horse's crupper,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: travelled until he passed by an old ruin [FN#95], when the damsel

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to him, O my master, I wish to obey a call of nature: he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: therefore set her down at the ruin where she delayed so long that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King's son thought that she was only wasting time; so he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: followed her without her knowledge and behold, she was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ghulah,[FN#96] a wicked Ogress, who was saying to her brood, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my children, this day I bring you a fine fat youth, [FN#97] for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinner; whereto they answered, Bring him quick to us, O our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mother, that we may browse upon him our bellies full. The Prince

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hearing their talk, made sure of death and his side muscles

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quivered in fear for his life, so he turned away and was about to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fly. The Ghulah came out and seeing him in sore affright (for he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was trembling in every limb? cried, Wherefore art thou afraid?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he replied, I have hit upon an enemy whom I greatly fear.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Asked the Ghulah, Diddest thou not say: - I am a King's son?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he answered, Even so. Then quoth she, Why cost not give

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shine enemy something of money and so satisfy him? Quoth he, He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will not be satisfied with my purse but only with my life, and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mortally fear him and am a man under oppression. She replied,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If thou be so distressed, as thou deemest, ask aid against him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from Allah, who will surely protect thee from his ill doing and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from the evil whereof thou art afraid. Then the Prince raised

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his eyes heavenwards and cried, O Thou who answerest the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: necessitous when he calleth upon Thee and dispellest his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: distress; O my God ! grant me victory over my foe and turn him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from me, for Thou over all things art Almighty. The Ghulah,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hearing his prayer, turned away from him, and the Prince returned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to his father, and told him the tale of the Wazir; whereupon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King summoned the Minister to his presence and then and there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slew him. Thou likewise, O King, if thou continue to trust this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leach, shalt be made to die the worst of deaths. He verily thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: madest much of and whom thou entreatedest as an intimate, will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: work thy destruction. Seest thou not how he healed the disease

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from outside thy body by something grasped in thy hand? Be not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: assured that he will not destroy thee by something held in like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: manner! Replied King Yunan, Thou hast spoken sooth, O Wazir, it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: may well be as thou hintest O my well advising Minister; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: belike this Sage hath come as a spy searching to put me to death;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for assuredly if he cured me by a something held in my hand, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: can kill me by a something given me to smell. Then asked King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yunan, O Minister, what must be done with him? and the Wazir

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, Send after him this very instant and summon him to thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presence; and when he shall come strike him across the neck; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thus shalt thou rid thyself of him and his wickedness, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deceive him ere he can I deceive thee. 'Thou hast again spoken

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sooth, O Wazir, said the King and sent one to call the Sage who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came in joyful mood for he knew not what had appointed for him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Compassionate; as a certain poet saith by way of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: illustration:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O Thou who fearest Fate, confiding fare * Trust all to Him who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: built the world and wait:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: What Fate saith Be perforce must be, my lord! * And safe art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou from th undecreed of Fate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: As Duban the physician entered he addressed the King in these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: An fail I of my thanks to thee nor thank thee day by day * For

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom com posed I prose and verse, for whom my say and lay?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou lavishedst thy generous gifts ere they were craved by me *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou lavishedst thy boons unsought sans pretext or delay:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How shall I stint my praise of thee, how shall I cease to laud *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The grace of thee in secresy and patentest display?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nay; I will thank thy benefits, for aye thy favours lie * Light

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on my thought and tongue, though heavy on my back they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weigh.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And he said further on the same theme:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Turn thee from grief nor care a jot! * Commit thy needs to Fate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and Lot!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Enjoy the Present passing well * And let the Past be clean forgot

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For whatso haply seemeth worse * Shall work thy weal as Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wot

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah shall do whate'er He wills * And in His will oppose Him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And further still.--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: To th' All wise Subtle One trust worldly things * Rest thee from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all whereto the worldling clings:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Learn wisely well naught cometh by thy will * But e'en as willeth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, King of Kings.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And lastly.--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Gladsome and gay forget thine every grief * Full often grief the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wisest hearts outwore:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thought is but folly in the feeble slave * Shun it and so be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saved evermore.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Said the King for sole return, Knowest thou why I have summoned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee? and the Sage replied, Allah Most Highest alone kenneth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hidden things! But the King rejoined, I summoned thee only to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: take thy life and utterly to destroy thee. Duban the Wise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wondered at this strange address with exceeding wonder and asked,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O King, and wherefore wouldest thou slay me, and what ill have I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: done thee? and the King answered, Men tell me thou art a spy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sent hither with intent to slay me; and lo! I will kill thee ere

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I be killed by thee; then he called to his Sworder, and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Strike me off the head of this traitor and deliver us from his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: evil practices. Quoth the Sage, Spare me and Allah will spare

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee; slay me not or Allah shall slay thee. And he repeated to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him these very words, even as I to thee, O Ifrit, and yet thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wouldst not let me go, being bent upon my death. King Yunan only

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoined, I shall not be safe without slaying thee; for, as thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: healedst me by something held in hand, so am I not secure against

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy killing me by something given me to smell or otherwise. Said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the physician, This then, O King, is thy requital and reward;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou returnest only evil for good. The King replied, There is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no help for it; die thou must and without delay. Now when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: physician was certified that the King would slay him without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waiting, he wept and regretted the good he had done to other than

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the good. As one hath said on this subject:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Of wit and wisdom is Maymunah[FN#98] bare * Whose sire in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wisdom all the wits outstrippeth:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Man may not tread on mud or dust or clay * Save by good sense,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: else trippeth he and slippeth.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hereupon the Sworder stepped forward and bound the Sage Duban's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyes and bared his blade, saying to the King, By thy leave;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: while the physician wept and cried, Spare me and Allah will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spare thee, and slay me not or Allah shall slay thee, and began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repeating:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I was kind and 'scaped not, they were cruel and escaped; * And my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kindness only led me to Ruination Hall,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If I live I'll ne'er be kind; if I die, then all be damned * Who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: follow me, and curses their kindliness befal.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Is this, continued Duban, the return I meet from thee? Thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: givest me, meseems, but crocodile boon. Quoth the King,What is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the tale of the crocodile?, and quoth the physician, Impossible

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for me to tell it in this my state; Allah upon thee, spare me, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou hopest Allah shall spare thee. And he wept with ex ceeding

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weeping. Then one of the King's favourites stood up and said, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King! grant me the blood of this physician; we have never seen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him sin against thee, or doing aught save healing thee from a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disease which baffled every leach and man of science. Said the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King, Ye wot not the cause of my putting to death this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: physician, and this it is. If I spare him, I doom myself to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: certain death; for one who healed me of such a malady by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: something held in my hand, surely can slay me by something held

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to my nose; and I fear lest he kill me for a price, since haply

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he is some spy whose sole purpose in coming hither was to compass

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my destruction. So there is no help for it; die he must, and then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: only shall I be sure of my own life. Again cried Duban, Spare

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and Allah shall spare thee; and slay me not or Allah shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slay thee. But it was in vain. Now when the physician, O Ifrit,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knew for certain that the King would kill him, he said, O King,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: if there be no help but I must die, grant me some little delay

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that I may go down to my house and release myself from mine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: obligations and direct my folk and my neighbours where to bury me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and distribute my books of medicine. Amongst these I have one,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the rarest of rarities, which I would present to thee as an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: offering: keep it as a treasure in thy treasury. And what is in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the book? asked the King and the Sage answered, Things beyond

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: compt; and the least of secrets is that if, directly after thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hast cut off my head, thou open three leaves and read three lines

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the page to thy left hand, my head shall speak and answer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: every question thou deignest ask of it. The King wondered with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding wonder and shaking[FN#99] with delight at the novelty,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, O physician, cost thou really tell me that when I cut off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy head it will speak to me? He replied, Yes, O King! Quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King, This is indeed a strange matter! and forthwith sent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him closely guarded to his house, and Duban then and there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: settled all his obligations. Next day he went up to the King's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: audience hall, where Emirs and Wazirs, Chamberlains and Nabobs,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Grandees and Lords of Estate were gathered together, making the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presence chamber gay as a garden of flower beds. And lo! the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: physician came up and stood before the King, bearing a worn old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: volume and a little etui of metal full of powder, like that used

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the eyes.[FN#100] Then he sat down and said, Give me a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tray. So they brought him one and he poured the powder upon it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and levelled it and lastly spake as follows: O King, take this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: book but do not open it till my head falls; then set it upon this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tray, and bid press it down upon the powder, when forthright the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blood will cease flowing. That is the time to open the book. The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King thereupon took the book and made a sign to the Sworder, who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arose and struck off the physician's head, and placing it on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: middle of the tray, pressed it down upon the powder. The blood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stopped flowing, and the Sage Duban unclosed his eyes and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now open the book, O King! The King opened the book, and found

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the leaves stuck together; so he put his finger to his mouth and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by moistening it, he easily turned over the first leaf, and in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like way the second, and the third, each leaf opening with much

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trouble; and when he had un stuck six leaves he looked over them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, finding nothing written thereon, said, O physician, there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is no writing here! Duban re plied, Turn over yet more; and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turned over three others in the same way. Now the book was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poisoned; and before long the venom penetrated his system, and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell into strong convulsions and he cried out, The poison hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: done its work! Whereupon the Sage Duban's head began to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: improvise:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: There be rulers who have ruled with a foul tyrannic sway *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But they soon became as though they had never, never been:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Just, they had won justice: they oppressed and were oppress *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Fortune, who requited them with ban and bane and teen:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So they faded like the morn, and the tongue of things repeats *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Take this far that, nor vent upon Fortune's ways thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spleen.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: No sooner had the head ceased speaking than the King rolled over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dead. Now I would have thee know, O Ifrit, that if King Yunan had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spared the Sage Duban, Allah would have spared him, but he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: refused so to do and decreed to do him dead, wherefore Allah slew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him; and thou too, O Ifrit, if thou hadst spared me, Allah would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have spared thee. And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ceased saying her permitted say: then quoth Dunyazad, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sister, how pleasant is thy tale, and how tasteful; how sweet,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and how grateful! She replied, And where is this compared with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what I could tell thee this coming night, if I live and the King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spare me? Said the King in himself, By Allah, I will not slay

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her until I hear the rest of her story, for truly it is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wondrous. They rested that night in mutual embrace until dawn:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: then the King went forth to his Darbar; the Wazirs and troops

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came in and the audience hall was crowded; so the King gave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: orders and judged and appointed and deposed and bade and forbade

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the rest of that day, when the court broke up, and King Shahryar

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered his palace,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Sixth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Her sister, Dunyazad, said to her,Pray finish for us thy story;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she answered, I will if the King give me leave. Say on,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth the King. And she continued:--It hath reached me, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: auspicious King, that when the Fisherman said to the Ifrit, If

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou hadst spared me I would have spared thee, but nothing would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: satisfy thee save my death; so now I will do thee die by jailing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee in this jar and I will hurl thee into this sea. Then the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Marid roared aloud and cried, Allah upon thee, O Fisher man,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: don't! Spare me, and pardon my past doings; and, as I have been

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tyrannous, so be thou generous, for it is said among sayings that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: go current:--O thou who doest good to him who hath done thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: evil, suffice for the ill doer his ill deeds, and do not deal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with me as did Umamah to 'Atikah.[FN#101] Asked the Fisherman,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And what was their case? and the Ifrit answered, This is not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the time for story telling and I in this prison; but set me free

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I will tell thee the tale. Quoth the Fisherman, Leave this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: language: there is no help but that thou be thrown back into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sea nor is there any way for thy getting out of it for ever and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ever. Vainly I placed myself under thy protection,[FN#102] and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: humbled my self to thee with weeping, while thou soughtest only

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to slay me, who had done thee no injury deserving this at thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hands; nay, so far from injuring thee by any evil act, I worked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee nought but weal in releasing thee from that jail of thine.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now I knew thee to be an evil doer when thou diddest to me what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou didst, and know, that when I have cast thee back into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sea, I will warn whomsoever may fish thee up of what hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befallen me with thee, and I will advise him to toss thee back

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again; so shalt thou abide here under these waters till the End

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of Time shall make an end of thee. But the Ifrit cried aloud,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Set me free; this is a noble occasion for generosity and I make

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: covenant with thee and vow never to do thee hurt and harm; nay, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will help thee to what shall put thee out of want. The Fisherman

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: accepted his promises on both conditions, not to trouble him as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before, but on the contrary to do him service; and, after making

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: firm the plight and swearing him a solemn oath by Allah Most

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Highest he opened the cucurbit. Thereupon the pillar of smoke

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose up till all of it was fully out; then it thickened and once

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more became an Ifrit of hideous presence, who forthright ad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ministered a kick to the bottle and sent it flying into the sea.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Fisherman, seeing how the cucurbit was treated and making

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sure of his own death, piddled in his clothes and said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself, This promiseth badly; but he fortified his heart, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried, O Ifrit, Allah hath said[FN#103]: - Perform your

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: covenant; for the performance of your covenant shall be inquired

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: into hereafter. Thou hast made a vow to me and hast sworn an oath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not to play me false lest Allah play thee false, for verily he is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a jealous God who respiteth the sinner, but letteth him not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: escape. I say to thee as said the Sage Duban to King Yunan,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Spare me so Allah may spare thee! The Ifrit burst into laughter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and stalked away, saying to the Fisherman, Follow me; and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man paced after him at a safe distance (for he was not assured of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: escape) till they had passed round the suburbs of the city.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thence they struck into the uncultivated grounds, and crossing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them descended into a broad wilderness, and lo! in the midst of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it stood a mountain tarn. The Ifrit waded in to the middle and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again cried, Follow me; and when this was done he took his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stand in the centre and bade the man cast his net and catch his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fish. The Fisherman looked into the water and was much astonished

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to see therein vari coloured fishes, white and red, blue and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yellow; however he cast his net and, hauling it in, saw that he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had netted four fishes, one of each colour. Thereat he rejoiced

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greatly and more when the Ifrit said to him, Carry these to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sultan and set them in his presence; then he will give thee what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall make thee a wealthy man; and now accept my excuse, for by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah at this time I wot none other way of benefiting thee,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: inasmuch I have lain in this sea eighteen hundred years and have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not seen the face of the world save within this hour. But I would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not have thee fish here save once a day. The Ifrit then gave him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: God speed, saying, Allah grant we meet again;[FN#104] and struck

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the earth with one foot, whereupon the ground clove asunder and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swallowed him up. The Fisherman, much marvelling at what had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happened to him with the Ifrit, took the fish and made for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city; and as soon as he reached home he filled an earthen bowl

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with water and therein threw the fish which began to struggle and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wriggle about. Then he bore off the bowl upon his head and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repairing to the King's palace (even as the Ifrit had bidden him)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laid the fish before the presence; and the King wondered with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding wonder at the sight, for never in his lifetime had' he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seen fishes like these in quality or in conformation. So he said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Give those fish to the stranger slave girl who now cooketh for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us, meaning the bond maiden whom the King of Roum had sent to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him only three days before, so that he had not yet made trial of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her talents in the dressing of meat. Thereupon the Wazir carried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the fish to the cook and bade her fry them[FN#105] saying, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: damsel, the King sendeth this say to thee:--I have not treasured

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee, O tear o' me! save for stress time of me; approve, then, to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us this day thy delicate handiwork and thy savoury cooking; for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this dish of fish is a present sent to the Sultan and evidently a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rarity. The Wazir, after he had carefully charged her, returned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the King, who commanded him to give the Fisherman four hundred

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: diners: he gave them accordingly, and the man took them to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bosom and ran off home stumbling and falling and rising again and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deeming the whole thing to be a dream. However, he bought for his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: family all they wanted and lastly he went to his wife in huge joy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and gladness. So far concerning him; but as regards the cookmaid,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she took the fish and cleansed them and set them in the frying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pan, basting them with oil till one side was dressed. Then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turned them over and, behold, the kitchen wall crave asunder, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: therefrom came a young lady, fair of form, oval of face, perfect

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in grace, with eyelids which Kohl lines enchase.[FN#106] Her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dress was a silken head kerchief fringed and tasseled with blue:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a large ring hung from either ear; a pair of bracelets adorned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her wrists; rings with bezels of priceless gems were on her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fingers; and she hent in hand a long rod of rattan cane which she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thrust into the frying pan, saying, O fish! O fish! be ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: constant to your covenant? When the cookmaiden saw this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: apparition she swooned away. The young lady repeated her words a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: second time and a third time, and at last the fishes raised their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heads from the pan, and saying in articulate speech Yes! Yes!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began with one voice to recite:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Come back and so will I! Keep faith and so will I! * And if ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fain forsake, I'll requite till quits we cry!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: After this the young lady upset the frying pan and went forth by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the way she came in and the kitchen wall closed upon her. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the cook maiden recovered from her fainting fit, she saw the four

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fishes charred black as charcoal, and crying out, His staff

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brake in his first bout,[FN#107] she again fell swooning to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ground. Whilst she was in this case the Wazir came for the fish

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and looking upon her as insensible she lay, not knowing Sunday

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from Thursday, shoved her with his foot and said, Bring the fish

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the Sultan! Thereupon recovering from her fainting fit she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wept and in formed him of her case and all that had befallen her.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Wazir marvelled greatly and exclaiming, This is none other

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: than a right strange matter!, he sent after the Fisherman and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to him, Thou, O Fisherman, must needs fetch us four fishes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like those thou broughtest before. Thereupon the man repaired to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the tarn and cast his net; and when he landed it, lo! four fishes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were therein exactly like the first. These he at once carried to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir, who went in with them to the cook maiden and said, Up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with thee and fry these in my presence, that I may see this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: business. The damsel arose and cleansed the fish, and set them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the frying pan over the fire; however they remained there but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a little while ere the wall crave asunder and the young lady

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: appeared, clad as before and holding in hand the wand which she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again thrust into the frying pan, saying, O fish! O fish! be ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: constant to your olden covenant? And behold, the fish lifted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their heads, and repeated Yes! Yes! and recited this couplet:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Come back and so will I! Keep faith and so will I! * But if ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fain forsake, I'll requite till quits we cry!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased saying her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Seventh Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She continued, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the fishes spoke, and the young lady upset the frying pan with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her rod, and went forth by the way she came and the wall closed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up, the Wazir cried out, This is a thing not to be hidden from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King. So he went and told him what had happened, where upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth the King, There is no help for it but that I see this with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mine own eyes. Then he sent for the Fisherman and commended him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to bring four other fish like the first and to take with him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: three men as witnesses. The Fisherman at once brought the fish:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the King, after ordering them to give him four hundred gold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pieces, turned to the Wazir and said, Up and fry me the fishes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: here before me! The Minister, replying To hear is to obey,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bade bring the frying pan, threw therein the cleansed fish and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set it over the fire; when lo! the wall crave asunder, and out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: burst a black slave like a huge rock or a remnant of the tribe

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ad[FN#108] bearing in hand a branch of a green tree; and he cried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in loud and terrible tones, O fish! O fish! be ye all constant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to your antique covenant? whereupon the fishes lifted their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heads from the frying pan and said, Yes! Yes ! we be true to our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: vow; and they again recited the couplet:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Come back and so will I! Keep faith and so will I! * But if ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fain forsake, I'll requite till quits we cry!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the huge blackamoor approached the frying pan and upset it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the branch and went forth by the way he came in. When he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: vanished from their sight the King inspected the fish; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: finding them all charred black as charcoal, was utterly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bewildered and said to the Wazir, Verily this is a matter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereanent silence cannot be kept, and as for the fishes,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: assuredly some marvellous adventure connects with them. So he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bade bring the Fisherman and asked him, saying Fie on thee,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fellow! whence came these fishes? and he answered, From a tarn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: between four heights lying behind this mountain which is in sight

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of thy city. Quoth the King, How many days' march? Quoth he,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O our lord the Sultan, a walk of half hour. The King wondered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, straight way ordering his men to march and horsemen to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mount, led off the Fisherman who went before as guide, privily

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: damning the Ifrit. They fared on till they had climbed the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mountain and descended unto a great desert which they had never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seen during all their lives; and the Sultan and his merry men

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marvelled much at the wold set in the midst of four mountains,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the tarn and its fishes of four colours, red and white,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yellow and blue. The King stood fixed to the spot in wonderment

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and asked his troops and all present, Hath any one among you

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ever seen this piece of water before now? and all made answer,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O King of the age never did we set eyes upon it during all our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days. They also questioned the oldest inhabitants they met, men

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: well stricken in years, but they replied, each and every, A

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lakelet this we never saw in this place. Thereupon quoth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King, By Allah I will neither return to my capital nor sit upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the throne of my forbears till I learn the truth about this tarn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the fish therein. He then ordered his men to dismount and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bivouac all around the mountain; which they did; and summoning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his Wazir, a Minister of much experience, sagacious, of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: penetrating wit and well versed in affairs, said to him, 'Tis in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my mind to do a certain thing whereof I will inform thee; my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart telleth me to fare forth alone this night and root out the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mystery of this tarn and its fishes. Do thou take thy seat at my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tent door, and say to the Emirs and Wazirs, the Nabobs and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Chamberlains, in fine to all who ask thee:--The Sultan is ill at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ease, and he hath ordered me to refuse all admittance;[FN#109]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and be careful thou let none know my design. And the Wazir could

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not oppose him. Then the King changed his dress and ornaments

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, slinging his sword over his shoulder, took a path which led

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up one of the mountains and marched for the rest of the night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till morning dawned; nor did he cease wayfaring till the heat was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: too much for him. After his long walk he rested for a while, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: then resumed his march and fared on through the second night till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawn, when suddenly there appeared a black point in the far

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: distance. Hereat he rejoiced and said to himself, Haply some one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: here shall acquaint me with the mystery of the tarn and its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fishes. Presently drawing near the dark object he found it a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palace built of swart stone plated with iron; and, while one leaf

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the gate stood wide open, the other was shut, The King's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spirits rose high as he stood before the gate and rapped a light

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rap; but hearing no answer he knocked a second knock and a third;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yet there came no sign. Then he knocked his loudest but still no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answer, so he said, Doubtless 'tis empty. Thereupon he mustered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up resolution and boldly walked through the main gate into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: great hall and there cried out aloud, Holla, ye people of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palace! I am a stranger and a wayfarer; have you aught here of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: victual? He repeated his cry a second time and a third but still

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there came no reply; so strengthening his heart and making up his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mind he stalked through the vestibule into the very middle of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palace and found no man in it. Yet it was furnished with silken

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stuffs gold starred; and the hangings were let down over the door

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ways. In the midst was a spacious court off which set four open

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saloons each with its raised dais, saloon facing saloon; a canopy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shaded the court and in the centre was a jetting fount with four

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: figures of lions made of red gold, spouting from their mouths

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: water clear as pearls and diaphanous gems. Round about the palace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: birds were let loose and over it stretched a net of golden wire,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hindering them from flying off; in brief there was everything but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: human beings. The King marvelled mightily thereat, yet felt he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sad at heart for that he saw no one to give him account of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waste and its tarn, the fishes, the mountains and the palace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: itself. Presently as he sat between the doors in deep thought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: behold, there came a voice of lament, as from a heart grief spent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he heard the voice chanting these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I hid what I endured of him[FN#110] and yet it came to light, *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And nightly sleep mine eyelids fled and changed to sleepless

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Oh world! Oh Fate! withhold thy hand and cease thy hurt and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: harm * Look and behold my hapless sprite in colour and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: affright:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wilt ne'er show ruth to highborn youth who lost him on the way *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Of Love, and fell from wealth and fame to lowest basest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wight.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jealous of Zephyr's breath was I as on your form he breathed *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But whenas Destiny descends she blindeth human sight[FN#111]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: What shall the hapless archer do who when he fronts his foe * And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bends his bow to shoot the shaft shall find his string

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: undight?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When cark and care so heavy bear on youth[FN#112] of generous

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soul * How shall he 'scape his lot and where from Fate his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: place of flight?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now when the Sultan heard the mournful voice he sprang to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: feet; and, following the sound, found a curtain let down over a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chamber door. He raised it and saw behind it a young man sitting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon a couch about a cubit above the ground; and he fair to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sight, a well shaped wight, with eloquence dight; his forehead

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was flower white, his cheek rosy bright, and a mole on his cheek

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: breadth like an ambergris mite; even as the poet cloth indite:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A youth slim waisted from whose locks and brow * The world in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blackness and in light is set.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Throughout Creation's round no fairer show * No rarer sight thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eye hath ever met:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A nut brown mole sits throned upon a cheek * Of rosiest red

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beneath an eye of jet.[FN#113]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King rejoiced and saluted him, but he remained sitting in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: caftan of silken stuff pureed with Egyptian gold and his crown

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: studded with gems of sorts; but his face was sad with the traces

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of sorrow. He returned the royal salute in most courteous wise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: adding, O my lord, thy dignity demandeth my rising to thee; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my sole excuse is to crave thy pardon.[FN#114] Quoth the King,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou art excused, O youth; so look upon me as thy guest come

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hither on an especial object. I would thou acquaint me with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: secrets of this tarn and its fishes and of this palace and thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loneliness therein and the cause of thy groaning and wailing.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the young man heard these words he wept with sore

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weeping;[FN#115] till his bosom was drenched with tears and began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reciting--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Say him who careless sleeps what while the shaft of Fortune flies

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: * How many cloth this shifting world lay low and raise to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rise?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Although thine eye be sealed in sleep, sleep not th' Almighty's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyes * And who hath found Time ever fair, or Fate in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: constant guise?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he sighed a long fetched sigh and recited:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Confide thy case to Him, the Lord who made mankind; * Quit cark

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and care and cultivate content of mind;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ask not the Past or how or why it came to pass: * All human

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: things by Fate and Destiny were designed!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King marvelled and asked him, What maketh thee weep, O young

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man? and he answered, How should I not weep, when this is my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: case! Thereupon he put out his hand and raised the skirt of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: garment, when lo! the lower half of him appeared stone down to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his feet while from his navel to the hair of his head he was man.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King, seeing this his plight, grieved with sore grief and of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his compassion cried, Alack and well away! in very sooth, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth, thou heapest sorrow upon my sorrow. I was minded to ask

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee the mystery of the fishes only: whereas now I am concerned
