title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to learn thy story as well as theirs. But there is no Majesty and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there is no Might save in Allah, the Glorious, the Great![FN#116]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Lose no time, O youth, but tell me forthright thy whole tale.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth he, Lend me thine ears, thy sight and thine insight; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth the King, All are at thy service! Thereupon the youth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began, Right wondrous and marvellous is my case and that of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these fishes; and were it graven with gravers upon the eye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: corners it were a warner to whoso would be warned. How is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that? asked the King, and the young man began to tell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Tale of the Ensorcelled Prince.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know then, O my lord, that whilome my sire was King of this city,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and his name was Mahmud, entitled Lord of the Black Islands, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: owner of what are now these four mountains. He ruled three score

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and ten years, after which he went to the mercy of the Lord and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reigned as Sultan in his stead. I took to wife my cousin, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter of my paternal uncle,[FN#117] and she loved me with such

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abounding love that whenever I was absent she ate not and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drank not until she saw me again. She cohabited with me for five

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: years till a certain day when she went forth to the Hammam bath;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I bade the cook hasten to get ready all requisites for our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: supper. And I entered this palace and lay down on the bed where I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was wont to sleep and bade two damsels to fan my face, one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sitting by my head and the other at my feet. But I was troubled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and made restless by my wife's absence and could not sleep; for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: although my eyes were closed my mind and thoughts were wide

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: awake. Presently I heard the slave girl at my head say to her at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my feet, O Mas'udah, how miserable is our master and how wasted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in his youth and oh! the pity of his being so be trayed by our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mistress, the accursed whore!''[FN#118] The other replied, Yes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: indeed: Allah curse all faithless women and adulterous; but the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like of our master, with his fair gifts, deserveth something

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: better than this harlot who lieth abroad every night. Then quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she who sat by my head, Is our lord dumb or fit only for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bubbling that he questioneth her not! and quoth the other, Fie

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on thee! cloth our lord know her ways or cloth she allow him his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: choice? Nay, more, cloth she not drug every night the cup she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: giveth him to drink before sleep time, and put Bhang[FN#119] into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it? So he sleepeth and wotteth not whither she goeth, nor what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she doeth; but we know that after giving him the drugged wine,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she donneth her richest raiment and perfumeth herself and then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she fareth out from him to be away till break of day; then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cometh to him, and burneth a pastile under his nose and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: awaketh from his deathlike sleep. When I heard the slave girl's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words, the light became black before my sight and I thought night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would never-fall. Presently the daughter of my uncle came from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the baths; and they set the table for us and we ate and sat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: together a fair half hour quaffing our wine as was ever our wont.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she called for the particular wine I used to drink before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sleeping and reached me the cup; but, seeming to drink it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: according to my wont, I poured the contents into my bosom; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lying down, let her hear that I was asleep. Then, behold, she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried, Sleep out the night, and never wake again: by Allah, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loathe thee and I loathe thy whole body, and my soul turneth in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disgust from cohabiting with thee; and I see not the moment when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah shall snatch away thy life! Then she rose and donned her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fairest dress and perfumed her person and slung my sword over her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shoulder; and, opening the gates of the palace, went her ill way.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I rose and followed her as she left the palace and she threaded

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the streets until she came to the city gate, where she spoke

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words I understood not, and the padlocks dropped of themselves as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: if broken and the gate leaves opened. She went forth (and I after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her without her noticing aught) till she came at last to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: outlying mounds[FN#120] and a reed fence built about a round

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: roofed hut of mud bricks. As she entered the door, I climbed upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the roof which commanded a view of the interior, and lo! my fair

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cousin had gone in to a hideous negro slave with his upper lip

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like the cover of a pot, and his lower like an open pot; lips

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which might sweep up sand from the gravel-floor of the cot. He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was to boot a leper and a paralytic, lying upon a strew of sugar

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cane trash and wrapped in an old blanket and the foulest rags and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tatters. She kissed the earth before him, and he raised his head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so as to see her and said, Woe to thee! what call hadst thou to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stay away all this time? Here have been with me sundry of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: black brethren, who drank their wine and each had his young lady,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I was not content to drink because of thine absence. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she, O my lord, my heart's love and coolth of my eyes [FN#121]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knowest thou not that I am married to my cousin whose very look I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loathe, and hate myself when in his company? And did not I fear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for thy sake, I would not let a single sun arise before making

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his city a ruined heap wherein raven should croak and howlet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hoot, and jackal and wolf harbour and loot; nay I had removed its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: very stones to the back side of Mount Kaf. [FN#122] Rejoined the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave, Thou liest, damn thee! Now I swear an oath by the velour

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and honour of blackamoor men (and deem not our manliness to be ;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the poor manliness of white men), from today forth if thou stay

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: away till this hour, I will not keep company with thee nor will I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: glue my body with thy body and strum and belly bump Dost play

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fast and loose with us, thou cracked pot, that we may satisfy thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dirty lusts? stinkard! bitch! vilest of the vile whites! When I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard his words, and saw with my own eyes what passed between

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these two wretches, the world waxed dark be fore my face and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soul knew not in what place it was. But , my wife humbly stood up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weeping before and wheedling the slave, and saying, O my beloved,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and very fruit of my heart, there is none left to cheer me but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy dear self; and, if thou cast me off who shall take me in, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my beloved, O light of my eyes? And she ceased not weeping and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abasing herself to him until he deigned be reconciled with her.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then was she right glad and stood up and doffed her clothes, even

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to her petticoat trousers, and said, 0 my master what hast thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: here for thy handmaiden to eat? Uncover the basin, he grumbled,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and thou shalt find t the bottom the broiled bones of some rats

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we dined on, pick at them, and then go to that slop pot where

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou shalt find some leavings of beer [FN#123] which thou mayest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drink. So she ate and drank and washed her hands, and went and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lay down by the side of the slave, upon the cane trash and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stripping herself stark naked, she crept in with him under his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: foul coverlet and his rags and tatters. When I saw my wife, my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cousin, the daughter of my uncle, do this deed[FN#124] I clean

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lost my wits, and climbing down from the roof, I entered and took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sword which she had with her and drew it, determined to cut

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down the twain. I first struck at the slave's neck and thought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that the death decree had fallen on him:And Shahrazad perceived

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the dawn of day and ceased to say her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Eighth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She continued, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young ensorcelled Prince said to the King, When I smote the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave with intent to strike off his head, I thought that I had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slain him; for he groaned a loud hissing groan, but I had cut

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: only the skin and flesh of the gullet and the two arteries! It

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: awoke the daughter of my uncle, so I sheathed the sword and fared

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth for the city; and, entering the palace, lay upon my bed and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slept till morning when my wife aroused me and I saw that she had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cut off her hair and had donned mourning garments. Quoth she:--O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son of my uncle, blame me not for what I do; it hath just reached

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me that my mother is dead, and my father hath been killed in holy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: war, and of my brothers one hath lost his life by a snake sting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the other by falling down some precipice; and I can and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: should do naught save weep and lament. When I heard her words I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: refrained from all reproach and said only:--Do as thou list; I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: certainly will not thwart thee. She continued sorrowing, weeping

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and wailing one whole year from the beginning of its circle to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the end, and when it was finished she said to me.--I wish to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: build me in thy palace a tomb with a cupola, which I will set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: apart for my mourning and will name the House of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Lamentations.[FN#125] Quoth I again:--Do as thou list! Then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: builded for herself a cenotaph wherein to mourn, and set on its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: centre a dome under which showed a tomb like a Santon's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sepulchre. Thither she carried the slave and lodged him; but he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was exceeding weak by reason of his wound, and unable to do her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: love service; he could only drink wine and from the day of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hurt he spake not a word, yet he lived on because his appointed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hour[FN#126] was not come. Every day, morning and evening, my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife went to him and wept and wailed over him and gave him wine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and strong soups, and left not off doing after this manner a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: second year; and I bore with her patiently and paid no heed to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her. One day, however, I went in to her unawares; and I found her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weeping and beating her face and crying:--Why art thou absent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from my sight, O my heart's delight? Speak to me, O my life; talk

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with me, O my love? Then she recited these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For your love my patience fails and albeit you forget * I may

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not, nor to other love my heart can make reply:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bear my body, bear my soul wheresoever you may fare * And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where you pitch the camp let my body buried lie:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Cry my name above my grave, and an answer shall return * The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: moaning of my bones responsive to your cry.[FN#127]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she recited, weeping bitterly the while:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The day of my delight is the day when draw you near * And the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day of mine affright is the day you turn away:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Though I tremble through the night in my bitter dread of death *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I hold you in my arms I am free from all affray

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Once more she began reciting:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Though a morn I may awake with all happiness in hand *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Though the world all be mine and like Kisra-kings[FN#128] I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reign;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: To me they had the worth of the winglet of the gnat * When I fail

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to see thy form, when I look for thee in vain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When she had ended for a time her words and her weeping I said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her--O my cousin, let this thy mourning suffice, for in pouring

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth tears there is little profit! Thwart me not, answered she,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in aught I do, or I will lay violent hands on myself! So I held

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my peace and left her to go her own way; and she ceased not to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cry and keen and indulge her affliction for yet another year. At

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the end of the third year I waxed aweary of this lonesome

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mourning, and one day I happened to enter the cenotaph when vexed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and angry with some matter which had thwarted me, and suddenly I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard her say:--O my lord, I never hear thee vouch safe a single

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: word to me! Why cost thou not answer me, O my master? and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began reciting:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O thou tomb! O, thou tomb! be his beauty set in shade? * Hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou darkened that countenance all sheeny as the noon?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O thou tomb! neither earth nor yet heaven art to me * Then how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cometh it in thee are conjoined my sun and moon?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I heard such verses as these rage was heaped upon my rage I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried out:--Well away! how long is this sorrow to last? and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began repeating:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O thou tomb! O thou tomb! be his horrors set in blight? * Hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou dark ened his countenance that sickeneth the soul?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O thou tomb! neither cess pool nor pipkin art to me * Then how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cometh it in thee are conjoined soil and coal?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When she heard my words she sprang to her feet crying.--Fie upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee, thou cur! all this is of thy doings; thou hast wounded my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart s darling and thereby worked me sore woe and thou hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wasted his youth so that these three years he hath lain abed more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dead than alive! In my wrath I cried:--O thou foulest of harlots

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and filthiest of whores ever futtered by negro slaves who are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hired to have at thee![FN#129] Yes indeed it was I who did this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: good deed; and snatching up my sword I drew it and made at her to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cut her down. But she laughed my words and mine intent to scorn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crying: To heel, hound that thou art! Alas[FN#130] for the past

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which shall no more come to pass nor shall any one avail the dead

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to raise. Allah hath indeed now given into my hand him who did to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me this thing, a deed that hath burned my heart with a fire which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: died not and a flame which might not be quenched! Then she stood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up; and, pronouncing some words to me unintelligible, she said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By virtue of my egromancy become thou half stone and half man;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon I became what thou seest, unable to rise or to sit, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neither dead nor alive. Moreover she ensorcelled the city with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all its streets and garths, and she turned by her gramarye the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: four islands into four mountains around the tarn whereof thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: questionest me; and the citizens, who were of four different

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: faiths, Moslem, Nazarene, Jew and Magian, she transformed by her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enchantments into fishes; the Moslems are the white, the Magians

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: red, the Christians blue and the Jews yellow.[FN#131] And every

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day she tortureth me and scourgeth me with an hundred stripes,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: each of which draweth floods of blood and cutteth the skin of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shoulders to strips; and lastly she clotheth my upper half with a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hair cloth and then throweth over them these robes. Hereupon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young man again shed tears and began reciting:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: In patience, O my God, I endure my lot and fate; * I will bear at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will of Thee whatsoever be my state:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They oppress me; they torture me; they make my life a woe * Yet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: haply Heaven's happiness shall compensate my strait:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yea, straitened is my life by the bane and hate o' foes * But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mustafa and Murtaza[FN#132] shall ope me Heaven's gate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: After this the Sultan turned towards the young Prince and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O youth, thou hast removed one grief only to add another grief;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but now, O my friend, where is she; and where is the mausoleum

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wherein lieth the wounded slave? The slave lieth under yon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dome, quoth the young man, and she sitteth in the chamber

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fronting yonder door. And every day at sunrise she cometh forth,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and first strippeth me, and whippeth me with an hundred strokes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the leathern scourge, and I weep and shriek; but there is no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: power of motion in my lower limbs to keep her off me. After

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ending her tormenting me she visiteth the slave, bringing him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wine and boiled meats. And to morrow at an early hour she will be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: here. Quoth the King, By Allah, O youth, I will as suredly do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee a good deed which the world shall not willingly let die, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an act of derring do which shall be chronicled long after I am

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dead and gone by. Then the King sat him by the side of the young

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Prince and talked till nightfall, when he lay down and slept;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but, as soon as the false dawn[FN#133] showed, he arose and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: doffing his outer garments[FN#134] bared his blade and hastened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the place wherein lay the slave. Then was he ware of lighted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: candles and lamps, and the perfume of incenses and unguents, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: directed by these, he made for the slave and struck him one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stroke killing him on the spot: after which he lifted him on his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back and threw him into a well that was in the palace. Presentry

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he returned and, donning the slave's gear, lay down at length

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: within the mausoleum with the drawn sword laid close to and along

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his side. After an hour or so the accursed witch came; and, first

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: going to her husband, she stripped off his clothes and, taking a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whip, flogged him cruelly while he cried out, Ah! enough for me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the case I am in! take pity on me, O my cousin!' But she replied,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Didst thou take pity on me and spare the life of my true love on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom I coated? Then she drew the cilice over his raw and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bleeding skin and threw the robe upon all and went down to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave with a goblet of wine and a bowl of meat broth in her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hands. She entered under the dome weeping and wailing,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Well-away! and crying, O my lord! speak a word to me! O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master! talk awhile with me! and began to recite these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couplets.--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How long this harshness, this unlove, shall bide? * Suffice thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not tear floods thou hast espied?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou cost prolong our parting purposely * And if wouldst please

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my foe, thou'rt satisfied!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she wept again and said, O my lord! speak to me, talk with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me! The King lowered his voice and, twisting his tongue, spoke

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after the fashion of the blackamoors and said 'lack! 'lack!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there be no Ma'esty and there be no Might save in Allauh, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Gloriose, the Great! Now when she heard these words she shouted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for joy, and fell to the ground fainting; and when her senses

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned she asked, O my lord, can it be true that thou hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: power of speech? and the King making his voice small and faint

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, O my cuss! cost thou deserve that I talk to thee and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speak with thee? Why and wherefore? rejoined she; and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied The why is that all the livelong day thou tormentest thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hubby; and he keeps calling on 'eaven for aid until sleep is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strange to me even from evenin' till mawnin', and he prays and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: damns, cussing us two, me and thee, causing me disquiet and much

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bother: were this not so, I should long ago have got my health;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and it is this which prevents my answering thee. Quoth she,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: With thy leave I will release him from what spell is on him;and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth the King, Release him and let's have some rest! She

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried, To hear is to obey; and, going from the cenotaph to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palace, she took a metal bowl and filled it with water and spake

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over it certain words which made the contents bubble and boil as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a cauldron seetheth over the fire. With this she sprinkled her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: husband saying, By virtue of the dread words I have spoken, if

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou becamest thus by my spells, come forth out of that form into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shine own former form. And lo and behold! the young man shook

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and trembled; then he rose to his feet and, rejoicing at his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deliverance, cried aloud, I testify that there is no god but the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: God, and in very truth Mohammed is His Apostle, whom Allah bless

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and keep! Then she said to him, Go forth and return not hither,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for if thou do I will surely slay thee; screaming these words in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his face. So he went from between her hands; and she returned to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the dome and, going down to the sepulchre, she said, O my lord,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: come forth to me that I may look upon thee and thy goodliness!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King replied in faint low words, What[FN#135] thing hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou done? Thou hast rid me of the branch but not of the root.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She asked, O my darling! O my negro ring! what is the root? And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he answered, Fie on thee, O my cuss! The people of this city and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the four islands every night when it's half passed lift their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heads from the tank in which thou hast turned them to fishes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cry to Heaven and call down its anger on me and thee; and this is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the reason why my body's baulked from health. Go at once and set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them free then come to me and take my hand, and raise me up, for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a little strength is already back in me. When she heard the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King's words (and she still supposed him to be the slave) she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried joyously, O my master, on my head and on my eyes be thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: commend, Bismillah[FN#136]!'' So she sprang to her feet and, full

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of joy and gladness, ran down to the tarn and took a little of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: its water n the palm of her hand--And Shahrazad perceived the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawn of day and ceased to say her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it Was the Ninth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young woman, the sorceress, took in hand some of the tarn water

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and spake over it words not to be understood, the fishes lifted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their heads and stood up on the instant like men, the spell on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the people of the city having been removed. What was the lake

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again became a crowded capital; the bazars were thronged with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: folk who bought and sold; each citizen was occupied with his own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: calling and the four hills became islands as they were whilome.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the young woman, that wicked sorceress, returned to the King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and (still thinking he was the negro) said to him, O my love!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stretch forth thy honoured hand that I may assist thee to rise.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nearer to me, quoth the King in a faint and feigned tone. She

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came close as to embrace him when he took up the sword lying hid

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by his side and smote her across the breast, so that the point

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: showed gleaming behind her back. Then he smote her a second time

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and cut her in twain and cast her to the ground in two halves.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: After which he fared forth and found the young man, now freed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from the spell, awaiting him and gave him joy of his happy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: release while the Prince kissed his hand with abundant thanks.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth the King, Wilt thou abide in this city or go with me to my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: capital? Quoth the youth, O King of the age, wottest thou not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what journey is between thee and thy city? Two days and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: half, answered he, whereupon said the other, An thou be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sleeping, O King, awake! Between thee and thy city is a year's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: march for a well girt walker, and thou haddest not come hither in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: two days and a half save that the city was under enchantment. And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I, O King, will never part from thee; no, not even for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: twinkling of an eye. The King rejoiced at his words and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thanks be to Allah who hath bestowed thee upon me! From this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hour thou art my son and my only son, for that in all my life I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have never been blessed with issue. Thereupon they embraced and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: joyed with exceeding great joy; and, reaching the palace, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Prince who had been spell bound informed his lords and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grandees that he was about to visit the Holy Places as a pilgrim,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and bade them get ready all things necessary for the occasion.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The preparations lasted ten days, after which he set out with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sultan, whose heart burned in yearning for his city whence he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: been absent a whole twelvemonth. They journeyed with an escort of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mamelukes[FN#137] carrying all manners of precious gifts and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rarities, nor stinted they wayfaring day and night for a full

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: year until they approached the Sultan's capital, and sent on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: messengers to announce their coming. Then the Wazir and the whole

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: army came out to meet him in joy and gladness, for they had given

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up all hope of ever seeing their King; and the troops kissed the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ground before him and wished him joy of his safety. He entered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and took seat upon his throne and the Minister came before him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, when acquainted with all that had be fallen the young

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Prince, he congratulated him on his narrow escape. When order was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: restored throughout the land the King gave largesse to many of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his people, and said to the Wazir, Hither the Fisherman who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought us the fishes! So he sent for the man who had been the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: first cause of the city and the citizens being delivered from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enchantment and, when he came in to the presence, the Sultan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bestowed upon him a dress of honour, and questioned him of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: condition and whether he had children. The Fisherman gave him to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: know that he had two daughters and a son, so the King sent for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them and, taking one daughter to wife, gave the other to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young Prince and made the son his head treasurer. Furthermore he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: invested his Wazir with the Sultanate of the City in the Black

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Islands whilome belonging to the young Prince, and dispatched

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with him the escort of fifty armed slaves together with dresses

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of honour for all the Emirs and Grandees. The Wazir kissed hands

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and fared forth on his way; while the Sultan and the Prince abode

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at home in all the solace and the delight of life; and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fisherman became the richest man of his age, and his daughters

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wived with Kings, until death came to them. And yet, O King!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this is not more wondrous than the story of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Porter and the Three Ladies of Baghdad.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Once upon a time there was a Porter in Baghdad, who was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bachelor and who would remain unmarried. It came to pass on a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: certain day, as he stood about the street leaning idly upon his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crate, behold, there stood before him an honourable woman in a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mantilla of Mosul[FN#138] silk, broidered with gold and bordered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with brocade; her walking shoes were also purfled with gold and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her hair floated in long plaits. She raised her face veil[FN#139]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, showing two black eyes fringed with jetty lashes, whose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: glances were soft and languishing and whose perfect beauty was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ever blandishing, she accosted the Porter and said in the suavest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tones and choicest language, Take up thy crate and follow me.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Porter was so dazzled he could hardly believe that he heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her aright, but he shouldered his basket in hot haste saying in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself, O day of good luck! O day of Allah's grace! and walked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after her till she stopped at the door of a house. There she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rapped, and presently came out to her an old man, a Nazarene, to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom she gave a gold piece, receiving from him in return what she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: required of strained wine clear as olive oil; and she set it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: safely in the hamper, saying Lift and follow. Quoth the Porter,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This, by Allah, is indeed an auspicious day, a day propitious

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the granting of all a man wisheth. He again hoisted up the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crate and followed her; till she stopped at a fruiterer's shop

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and bought from him Shami[FN#140] apples and Osmani quinces and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Omani[FN#141] peaches, and cucumbers of Nile growth, and Egyptian

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: limes and Sultani oranges and citrons; besides Aleppine jasmine,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: scented myrtle berries, Damascene nenuphars, flower of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: privet[FN#142] and camomile, blood red anemones, violets, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pomegranate bloom, eglantine and narcissus, and set the whole in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Porter's crate, saying, Up with it. So he lifted and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: followed her till she stopped at a butcher's booth and said, Cut

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me off ten pounds of mutton. She paid him his price and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wrapped it in a banana leaf, whereupon she laid it in the crate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said Hoist, O Porter. He hoisted accordingly, and followed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her as she walked on till she stopped at a grocer's, where she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bought dry fruits and pistachio kernels, Tihamah raisins, shelled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: almonds and all wanted for dessert, and said to the Porter, Lift

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and follow me. So he up with his hamper and after her till she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stayed at the confectioner's, and she bought an earthen platter,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and piled it with all kinds of sweetmeats in his shop, open

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: worked tarts and fritters scented with musk and soap cakes, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lemon loaves and melon preserves,[FN#143] and Zaynab's combs,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and ladies' fingers, and Kazi's tit-bits and goodies of every

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: description; and placed the platter in the Porter's crate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon quoth he (being a merry man), Thou shouldest have told

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, and I would have brought with me a pony or a she camel to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carry all this market stuff. She smiled and gave him a little

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cuff on the nape saying, Step out and exceed not in words for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (Allah willing!) thy wage will not be wanting. Then she stopped

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at a perfumer's and took from him ten sorts of waters, rose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: scented with musk, grange Lower, waterlily, willow flower, violet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and five others; and she also bought two loaves of sugar, a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bottle for perfume spraying, a lump of male in cense, aloe wood,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ambergris and musk, with candles of Alex' andria wax; and she put

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the whole into the basket, saying, Up with thy crate and after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me. He did so and followed until she stood before the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greengrocer's, of whom she bought pickled safflower and olives,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in brine and in oil; with tarragon and cream cheese and hard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Syrian cheese; and she stowed them away in the crate saying to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Porter, Take up thy basket and follow me. He did so and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went after her till she came to a fair mansion fronted by a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spacious court, a tall, fine place to which columns gave strength

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and grace: and the gate thereof had two leaves of ebony inlaid

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with plates of red gold. The lady stopped at the door and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turning her face veil sideways, knocked softly with her knuckles

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilst the Porter stood behind her, thinking of naught save her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beauty and loveliness. Presently the door swung back and both

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leaves were opened, whereupon he looked to see who had opened it;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and behold, it was a lady of tall figure, some five feet high; a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: model of beauty and loveliness, brilliance and symmetry and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perfect grace. Her forehead was flower white; her cheeks like the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: anemone ruddy bright; her eyes were those of the wild heifer or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the gazelle, with eyebrows like the crescent moon which ends

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sha'aban and begins Ramazan;[FN#144] her mouth was the ring of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sulayman,[FN#145] her lips coral red, and her teeth like a line

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of strung pearls or of camomile petals. Her throat recalled the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: antelope's, and her breasts, like two pomegranates of even size,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stood at bay as it were,[FN#146] her body rose and fell in waves

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: below her dress like the rolls of a piece of brocade, and her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: navel[FN#147] would hold an ounce of benzoin ointment. In fine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she was like her of whom the poet said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: On Sun and Moon of palace cast thy sight * Enjoy her flower like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: face, her fragrant light:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thine eyes shall never see in hair so black * Beauty encase a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brow so purely white:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The ruddy rosy cheek proclaims her claim * Though fail her name

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose beauties we indite:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: As sways her gait I smile at hips so big * And weep to see the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waist they bear so slight.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the Porter looked upon her his wits were waylaid, and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: senses were stormed so that his crate went nigh to fall from his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: head, and he said to himself, Never have I in my life seen a day

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more blessed than this day! Then quoth the lady portress to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady cateress, Come in from the gate and relieve this poor man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of his load. So the provisioner went in followed by the portress

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the Porter and went on till they reached a spacious ground

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: floor hall,[FN#148] built with admirable skill and beautified

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with all manner colours and carvings; with upper balconies and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: groined arches and galleries and cupboards and recesses whose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: curtains hung before them. In the midst stood a great basin full

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of water surrounding a fine fountain, and at the upper end on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: raised dais was a couch of juniper wood set with gems and pearls,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a canopy like mosquito curtains of red satin silk looped up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with pearls as big as filberts and bigger. Thereupon sat a lady

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bright of blee, with brow beaming brilliancy, the dream of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: philosophy, whose eyes were fraught with Babel's gramarye[FN#149]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and her eye brows were arched as for archery; her breath breathed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ambergris and perfumery and her lips were sugar to taste and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carnelian to see. Her stature was straight as the letter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I[FN#150] and her face shamed the noon sun's radiancy; and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was even as a galaxy, or a dome with golden marquetry or a bride

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: displayed in choicest finery or a noble maid of Araby.[FN#151]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Right well of her sang the bard when he said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Her smiles twin rows of pearls display * Chamomile-buds or rimey

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spray

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Her tresses stray as night let down * And shames her light the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawn o' day.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#152]The third lady rising from the couch stepped forward with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grace ful swaying gait till she reached the middle of the saloon,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when she said to her sisters, Why stand ye here? take it down

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from this poor man's head! Then the cateress went and stood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before him, and the portress behind him while the third helped

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them, and they lifted the load from the Porter's head; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: emptying it of all that was therein, set everything in its place.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Lastly they gave him two gold pieces, saying, Wend thy ways, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Porter. But he went not, for he stood looking at the ladies and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: admiring what uncommon beauty was theirs, and their pleasant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: manners and kindly dispositions (never had he seen goodlier); and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he gazed wistfully at that good store of wines and sweet scented

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flowers and fruits and other matters. Also he marvelled with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding marvel, especially to see no man in the place and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: delayed his going; whereupon quoth the eldest lady, What aileth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee that goest not; haply thy wage be too little? And, turning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to her sister the cateress, she said, Give him another diner!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But the Porter answered, By Allah, my lady, it is not for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wage; my hire is never more than two dirhams; but in very sooth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my heart and my soul are taken up with you and your condition. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wonder to see you single with ne'er a man about you and not a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soul to bear you company; and well you wot that the minaret

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: toppleth o'er unless it stand upon four, and you want this same

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fourth; and women's pleasure without man is short of measure,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: even as the poet said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Seest not we want for joy four things all told * The harp and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lute, the flute and flageolet;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And be they companied with scents four fold * Rose, myrtle,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: anemone and violet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nor please all eight an four thou wouldst withold * Good wine and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth and gold and pretty pet.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: You be there and want a fourth who shall be a person of good

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sense and prudence; smart witted, and one apt to keep careful

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: counsel. His words pleased and amused them much; and they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laughed at him and said, And who is to assure us of that? We are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: maidens and we fear to entrust our secret where it may not be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kept, for we have read in a certain chronicle the lines of one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ibn al-Sumam:-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hold fast thy secret and to none unfold * Lost is a secret when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that secret's told

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: An fail thy breast thy secret to conceal * How canst thou hope

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another's breast shall hold?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And Abu Nowás[FN#153] said well on the same subject:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Who trusteth secret to another's hand * Upon his brow deserveth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: burn of brand!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the Porter heard their words he rejoined, By your lives! I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: am a man of sense and a discreet, who hath read books and perused

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chronicles; I reveal the fair and conceal the foul and I act as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the poet adviseth:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: None but the good a secret keep * And good men keep it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unrevealed:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: It is to me a well shut house * With keyless locks and door

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ensealed[FN#154]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the maidens heard his verse and its poetical application

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: addressed to them they said, Thou knowest that we have laid out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all our monies on this place. Now say, hast thou aught to offer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us in return for entertainment? For surely we will not suf fer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee to sit in our company and be our cup companion, and gaze

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon our faces so fair and so rare without paying a round

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sum.[FN#155] Wottest thou not the saying:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sans hope of gain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Love's not worth a grain?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whereto the lady portress added, If thou bring anything thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a something; if no thing, be off with thee, thou art a nothing;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but the procuratrix interposed, saying, Nay, O my sisters, leave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: teasing him for by Allah he hath not failed us this day, and had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he been other he never had kept patience with me, so whatever be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his shot and scot I will take it upon myself. The Porter, over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: joyed, kissed the ground before her and thanked her saying, By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, these monies are the first fruits this day hath given me.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hearing this they said, Sit thee down and welcome to thee, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the eldest lady added, By Allah, we may not suffer thee to join

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us save on one condition, and this it is, that no questions be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asked as to what concerneth thee not, and frowardness shall be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soundly flogged. Answered the Porter, I agree to this, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady, on my head and my eyes be it! Lookye, I am dumb, I have no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tongue. Then arose the provisioneress and tightening her girdle

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set the table by the fountain and put the flowers and sweet herbs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in their jars, and strained the wine and ranged the flasks in row

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and made ready every requisite. Then sat she down, she and her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sisters, placing amidst them the Porter who kept deeming himself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in a dream; and she took up the wine flagon, and poured out the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: first cup and drank it off, and likewise a second and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: third.[FN#156] After this she filled a fourth cup which she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: handed to one of her sisters; and, lastly, she crowned a goblet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and passed it to the Porter, saying:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Drink the dear draught, drink free and fain * What healeth every

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grief and pain.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He took the cup in his hand and, louting low, returned his best

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thanks and improvised:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Drain not the bowl save with a trusty friend * A man of worth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose good old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For wine, like wind, sucks sweetness from the sweet * And stinks

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when over stench it haply blow:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Adding:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Drain not the bowl; save from dear hand like thine * The cup

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recall thy gifts; thou, gifts of wine.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: After repeating this couplet he kissed their hands and drank and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was drunk and sat swaying from side to side and pursued:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: All drinks wherein is blood the Law unclean * Doth hold save

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one, the blood shed of the vine:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fill! fill! take all my wealth bequeathed or won * Thou fawn! a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: willing ransom for those eyne.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the cateress crowned a cup and gave it to the portress, who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took it from her hand and thanked her and drank. Thereupon she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poured again and passed to the eldest lady who sat on the couch,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and filled yet another and handed it to the Porter. He kissed the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ground before them; and, after drinking and thanking them, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again began to recite :

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Here! Here! by Allah, here! * Cups of the sweet, the dear'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fill me a brimming bowl * The Fount o' Life I speer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the Porter stood up before the mistress of the house and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, O lady, I am thy slave, thy Mameluke, thy white thrall, a,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy very bondsman; and he began reciting:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A slave of slaves there standeth at thy door * Lauding thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: generous boons and gifts galore

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Beauty! may he come in awhile to 'joy * Thy charms? for Love

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I part nevermore!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said to him, Drink; and health and happiness attend thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drink. So he took the cup and kissed her hand and recited these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lines in sing song:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I gave her brave old wine that like her cheeks * Blushed red or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flame from furnace flaring up:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She bussed the brim and said with many a smile * How durst thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deal folk's cheek for folk to sup?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Drink! (said I) these are tears of mine whose tinct * Is heart

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blood sighs have boiled in the cup.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She answered him in the following couplet:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: An tears of blood for me, friend, thou hast shed * Suffer me sup

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them, by thy head and eyes!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the lady took the cup, and drank it off to her sisters'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: health, and they ceased not drinking (the Porter being in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: midst of them), and dancing and laughing and reciting verses and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: singing ballads and ritornellos. All this time the Porter was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carrying on with them, kissing, toying, biting, handling,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: groping, fingering; whilst one thrust a dainty morsel in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mouth, and another slapped him; and this cuffed his cheeks, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that threw sweet flowers at him; and he was in the very paradise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of pleasure, as though he were sitting in the seventh sphere

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: among the Houris[FN#157] of Heaven. They ceased not doing after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this fashion until the wine played tucks in their heads and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: worsted their wits; and, when the drink got the better of them,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the portress stood up and doffed her clothes till she was mother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: naked. However, she let down her hair about her body by way of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shift, and throwing herself into the basin disported herself and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dived like a duck and swam up and down, and took water in her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mouth, and spurted it all over the Porter, and washed her limbs,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and between her breasts, and inside her thighs and all around her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: navel. Then she came up out of the cistern and throwing herself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the Porter's lap said, O my lord, O my love, what callest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou this article? pointing to her slit, her solution of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: continuity. I call that thy cleft, quoth the Porter, and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoined, Wah! wah, art thou not ashamed to use such a word? and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she caught him by the collar and soundly cuffed him. Said he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again, Thy womb, thy vulva; and she struck him a second slap

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crying, O fie, O fie, this is another ugly word; is here no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shame in thee? Quoth he, Thy coynte; and she cried, O thou!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: art wholly destitute of modesty? and thumped and bashed him.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then cried the Porter, Thy clitoris,[FN#158] whereat the eldest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady came down upon him with a yet sorer beating, and said, No;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he said,  'Tis so, and the Porter went on calling the same

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: commodity by sundry other names, but whatever he said they beat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him more and more till his neck ached and swelled with the blows

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he had gotten; and on this wise they made him a butt and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laughing stock. At last he turned upon them asking, And what do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: you women call this article? Whereto the damsel made answer,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The basil of the bridges.[FN#159] Cried the Porter, Thank

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah for my safety: aid me and be thou propitious, O basil of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bridges! They passed round the cup and tossed off the bowl

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again, when the second lady stood up; and, stripping off all her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes, cast herself into the cistern and did as the first had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: done; then she came out of the water and throwing her naked form

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the Porter's lap pointed to her machine and said, O light of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mine eyes, do tell me what is the name of this concern? He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied as before, Thy slit; and she rejoined, Hath such term

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no shame for thee? and cuffed him and buffeted him till the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saloon rang with the blows. Then quoth she, O fie! O fie! how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: canst thou say this without blushing? He suggested, The basil

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the bridges; but she would not have it and she said, No!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no! and stuck him and slapped him on the back of the neck. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he began calling out all the names he knew, Thy slit, thy womb,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy coynte, thy clitoris; and the girls kept on saying, No!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no! So he said, I stick to the basil of the bridges; and all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the three laughed till they fell on their backs and laid slaps on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his neck and said, No! no! that's not its proper name.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon he cried, O my sisters, what is its name? and they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied, What sayest thou to the husked sesame seed? Then the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cateress donned her clothes and they fell again to carousing, but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Porter kept moaning, Oh! and Oh! for his neck and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shoulders, and the cup passed merrily round and round again for a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: full hour. After that time the eldest and handsomest lady stood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up and stripped off her garments, whereupon the Porter took his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neck in hand, and rubbed and shampoo'd it, saying, My neck and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shoulders are on the way of Allah![FN#160] Then she threw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: herself into the basin, and swam and dived, sported and washed;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the Porter looked at her naked figure as though she had been

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a slice of the moon[FN#161] and at her face with the sheen of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Luna when at full, or like the dawn when it brighteneth, and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: noted her noble stature and shape, and those glorious forms that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quivered as she went; for she was naked as the Lord made her.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he cried Alack! Alack!and began to address her, versifying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If I liken thy shape to the bough when green * My likeness errs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I sore mistake it;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For the bough is fairest when clad the most * And thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fairest when mother naked.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the lady heard his verses she came up out of the basin and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seating herself upon his lap and knees, pointed to her genitory

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, O my lordling, what be the name of this? Quoth he,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The basil of the bridges; but she said, Bah, bah! Quoth he,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The husked sesame; quoth she, Pooh, pooh! Then said he, Thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: womb; and she cried, Fie, Fie! art thou not ashamed of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thyself? and cuffed him on the nape of the neck. And whatever

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: name he gave declaring  'Tis so, she beat him and cried No!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no! till at last he said, O my sisters, and what is its name?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She replied, It is entitled the Khan[FN#162] of Abu Mansur;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon the Porter replied, Ha! ha! O Allah be praised for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: safe deliverance! O Khan of Abu Mansur! Then she came forth and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dressed and the cup went round a full hour. At last the Porter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose up, and stripping off all his clothes, jumped into the tank

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and swam about and washed under his bearded chin and armpits,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: even as they had done. Then he came out and threw himself into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the first lady's lap and rested his arms upon the lap of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: portress, and reposed his legs in the lap of the cateress and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pointed to his prickle[FN#163] and said, O my mistresses, what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is the name of this article? All laughed at his words till they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell on their backs, and one said, Thy pintle! But he replied,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: No! and gave each one of them a bite by way of forfeit. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said they, Thy pizzle! but he cried No, and gave each of them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a hug; And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased saying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Tenth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth her sister Dunyazad, Finish for us thy story; and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, With joy and goodly greet It hath reached me, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: auspicious King, that the damsels stinted not saying to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Porter Thy prickle, thy pintle, thy pizzle, and he ceased not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kissing and biting and hugging until his heart was satisfied, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they laughed on till they could no more. At last one said, O our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother, what, then, is it called? Quoth he, Know ye not?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth they, No! Its veritable name, said he, is mule Burst

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all, which browseth on the basil of the bridges, and muncheth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: husked sesame, and nighteth in the Khan of Abu Mansur. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laughed they till they fell on their backs, and returned to their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carousel, and ceased not to be after this fashion till night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began to fall. Thereupon said they to the Porter,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ''Bismillah,[FN#164] O our master, up and on with those sorry old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shoes of thine and turn thy face and show us the breadth of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shoulders! Said he, By Allah, to part with my soul would be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: easier for me than departing from you: come let us join night to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day, and tomorrow morning we will each wend our own way. My

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: life on you, said the procuratrix, suffer him to tarry with us,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that we may laugh at him: we may live out our lives and never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: meet with his like, for surely he is a right merry rogue and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: witty.[FN#165] So they said, Thou must not remain with us this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night save on condition that thou submit to our commands, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that whatso thou seest, thou ask no questions there anent, nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enquire of its cause. All right, rejoined he, and they said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Go read the writing over the door. So he rose and went to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entrance and there found written in letters of gold wash; WHOSO

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: SPEAKETH OF WHAT CONCERNETH HIM NOT, SHALL HEAR WHAT PLEASETH HIM

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: NOT! [FN#166] The Porter said, Be ye witnesses against me that I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will not speak on whatso concerneth me not. Then the cateress

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arose, and set food before them and they ate; after which they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: changed their drinking place for an other, and she lighted the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lamps and candles and burned amber gris and aloes wood, and set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on fresh fruit and the wine service, when they fell to carousing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and talking of their lovers. And they ceased not to eat and drink

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and chat, nibbling dry fruits and laughing and playing tricks for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the space of a full hour when lo! a knock was heard at the gate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The knocking in no wise dis turbed the seance, but one of them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose and went to see what it was and presently returned, saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Truly our pleasure for this night is to be perfect. How is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that? asked they; and she answered, At the gate be three

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Persian Kalandars[FN#167] with their beards and heads and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyebrows shaven; and all three blind of the left eye--which is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surely a strange chance. They are foreigners from Roum-land with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the mark of travel plain upon them; they have just entered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Baghdad, this being their first visit to our city; and the cause

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of their knocking at our door is simply because they cannot find

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a lodging. Indeed one of them said to me:--Haply the owner of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this mansion will let us have the key of his stable or some old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out house wherein we may pass this night; for evening had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surprised them and, being strangers in the land, they knew none

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who would give them shelter. And, O my sisters, each of them is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: figure o' fun after his own fashion; and if we let them in we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
