text: shall have matter to make sport of. She gave not over persuading

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them till they said to her, Let them in, and make thou the usual

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: condition with them that they speak not of what concerneth them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not, lest they hear what pleaseth them not. So she rejoiced and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: going to the door presently returned with the three monoculars

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose beards and mustachios were clean shaven.[FN#168] They

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: salam'd and stood afar off by way of respect; but the three

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ladies rose up to them and welcomed them and wished them joy of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their safe arrival and made them sit down. The Kalandars looked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at the room and saw that it was a pleasant place, clean swept and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: garnished with cowers; and the lamps were burning and the smoke

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of perfumes was spireing in air; and beside the dessert and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fruits and wine, there were three fair girls who might be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: maidens; so they exclaimed with one voice, By Allah, 'tis good!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then they turned to the Porter and saw that he was a merry faced

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wight, albeit he was by no means sober and was sore after his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slappings. So they thought that he was one of themselves and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, A mendicant like us! whether Arab or foreigner.[FN#169]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But when the Porter heard these words, he rose up, and fixing his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyes fiercely upon them, said, Sit ye here without exceeding in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: talk! Have you not read what is writ over the door? surely it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befitteth not fellows who come to us like paupers to wag your

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tongues at us. We crave thy pardon, O Fakír,[FN#170] rejoined

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they, and our heads are between thy hands. The ladies laughed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: consumedly at the squabble; and, making peace between the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kalandars and the Porter, seated the new guests before meat and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they ate. Then they sat together, and the portress served them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with drink; and, as the cup went round merrily, quoth the Porter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the askers, And you, O brothers mine, have ye no story or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rare adventure to amuse us withal? Now the warmth of wine having

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mounted to their heads they called for musical instruments; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the portress brought them a tambourine of Mosul, and a lute of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Irák, and a Persian harp; and each mendicant took one and tuned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it; this the tambourine and those the lute and the harp, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: struck up a merry tune while the ladies sang so lustily that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there was a great noise.[FN#171] And whilst they were carrying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on, behold, some one knocked at the gate, and the portress went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to see what was the matter there. Now the cause of that knocking,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O King (quoth Shahrazad) was this, the Caliph, Harun al-Rashid,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had gone forth from the palace, as was his wont now and then, to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: solace himself in the city that night, and to see and hear what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: new thing was stirring; he was in merchant's gear, and he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: attended by Ja'afar, his Wazir, and by Masrur his Sworder of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Vengeance.[FN#172] As they walked about the city, their way led

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them towards the house of the three ladies; where they heard the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loud noise of musical instruments and singing and merriment; so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth the Caliph to Ja'afar, I long to enter this house and hear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: those songs and see who sing them. Quoth Ja'afar, O Prince of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Faithful; these folk are surely drunken with wine, and I fear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: some mischief betide us if we get amongst them. There is no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: help but that I go in there, replied the Caliph, and I desire

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee to contrive some pretext for our appearing among them.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ja'afar replied, I hear and I obey;[FN#173] and knocked at the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: door, whereupon the portress came out and opened. Then Ja'afar

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came forward and kissing the ground before her said, O my lady,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we be merchants from Tiberias town: we arrived at Baghdad ten

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days ago; and, alighting at the merchants' caravanserai, we sold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all our merchandise. Now a certain trader invited us to an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entertainment this night; so we went to his house and he set food

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before us and we ate: then we sat at wine and wassail with him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for an hour or so when he gave us leave to depart; and we went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out from him in the shadow of the night and, being strangers, we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: could not find our way back to our Khan. So haply of your

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kindness and courtesy you will suffer us to tarry with you this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night, and Heaven will reward you![FN#174] The portress looked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon them and seeing them dressed like merchants and men of grave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looks and solid, she returned to her sisters and repeated to them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ja'afar's story; and they took compassion upon the strangers and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to her, Let them enter. She opened the door to them, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said they to her, Have we thy leave to come in? Come in,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth she; and the Caliph entered followed by Ja'afar and Masrur;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and when the girls saw them they stood up to them in respect and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made them sit down and looked to their wants, saying, Welcome,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and well come and good cheer to the guests, but with one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: condition! What is that? asked they, and one of the ladies

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, Speak not of what concerneth you not, lest ye hear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what pleaseth you not. Even so, said they; and sat down to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their wine and drank deep. Presently the Caliph looked on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: three Kalandars and, seeing them each and every blind of the left

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eye, wondered at the sight; then he gazed upon the girls and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was startled and he marvelled with exceeding marvel at their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beauty and loveliness. They continued to carouse and to converse

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said to the Caliph, Drink! but he replied, I am vowed to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Pilgrimage;[FN#175] and drew back from the wine. Thereupon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: portress rose and spreading before him a table cloth worked with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gold, set thereon a porcelain bowl into which she poured willow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flower water with a lump of snow and a spoonful of sugar candy.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Caliph thanked her and said in himself,By Allah, I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recompense her to morrow for the kind deed she hath done. The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: others again addressed themselves to conversing and carousing;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, when the wine gat the better of them, the eldest lady who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ruled the house rose and making obeisance to them took the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cateress by the hand, and said, Rise, O my sister and let us do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what is our devoir. Both answered Even so! Then the portress

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stood up and proceeded to remove the table service and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: remnants of the banquet; and renewed the pastiles and cleared the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: middle of the saloon. Then she made the Kalandars sit upon a sofa

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at the side of the estrade, and seated the Caliph and Ja'afar and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Masrur on the other side of the saloon; after which she called

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Porter, and said, How scanty is thy courtesy! now thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no stranger; nay, thou art one of the household. So he stood up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, tightening his waist cloth, asked, What would ye I do? and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she answered, Stand in thy place. Then the procuratrix rose and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set in the midst of the saloon a low chair and, opening a closet,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried to the Porter, Come help me. So he went to help her and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw two black bitches with chains round their necks; and she said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him, Take hold of them; and he took them and led them into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the middle of the saloon. Then the lady of the house arose and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tucked up her sleeves above her wrists and, seizing a scourge,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to the Porter, Bring forward one of the bitches. He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought her forward, dragging her by the chain, while the bitch

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wept, and shook her head at the lady who, however, came down upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her with blows on the sconce; and the bitch howled and the lady

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ceased not beating her till her forearm failed her. Then, casting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the scourge from her hand, she pressed the bitch to her bosom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, wiping away her tears with her hands, kissed her head. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she said to the Porter, Take her away and bring the second;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, when he brought her, she did with her as she had done with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the first. Now the heart of the Caliph, was touched at these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cruel doings; his chest straitened and he lost all patience in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his desire to know why the two bitches were so beaten. He threw a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wink at Ja'afar wishing him to ask, but; the Minister turning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: towards him said by signs, Be silent! Then quoth the portress

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the mistress of the house, O my lady, arise and go to thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: place that I in turn may do my devoir.[FN#176] She answered,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Even so; and, taking her seat upon the couch of juniper wood,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pargetted with gold and silver, said to the portress and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cateress, Now do ye what ye have to do. Thereupon the portress

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sat upon a low seat by the couch side; but the procuretrix,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entering a closet, brought out of it a bag of satin with green

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fringes and two tassels of gold. She stood up before the lady of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the house and shaking the bag drew out from it a lute which she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tuned by tightening its pegs; and when it was in perfect order,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she began to sing these quatrains:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ye are the wish, the aim of me *And when, O Love, thy sight I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: see[FN#177]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The heavenly mansion openeth;[FN#178] * But Hell I see when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lost thy sight.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: From thee comes madness; nor the less * Comes highest joy,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: comes ecstasy:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nor in my love for thee I fear * Or shame and blame, or hate and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spite.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When Love was throned within my heart * I rent the veil of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: modesty;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And stints not Love to rend that veil * Garring disgrace on grace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to alight;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The robe of sickness then I donned * But rent to rags was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: secrecy:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wherefore my love and longing heart * Proclaim your high

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: supremest might;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The tear drop railing adown my cheek * Telleth my tale of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ignomy:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And all the hid was seen by all * And all my riddle ree'd aright.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Heal then my malady, for thou * Art malady and remedy!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But she whose cure is in thy hand * Shall ne'er be free of bane

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and blight;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Burn me those eyne that radiance rain * Slay me the swords of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: phantasy;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How many hath the sword of Love * Laid low, their high degree

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: despite?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yet will I never cease to pine * Nor to oblivion will I flee.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Love is my health, my faith, my joy * Public and private, wrong

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: or right.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O happy eyes that sight thy charms * That gaze upon thee at their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gree!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yea, of my purest wish and will * The slave of Love I'll aye be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hight.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the damsel heard this elegy in quatrains she cried out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Alas! Alas! and rent her raiment, and fell to the ground

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fainting; and the Caliph saw scars of the palm rod[FN#179] on her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back and welts of the whip; and marvelled with exceeding wonder.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the portress arose and sprinkled water on her and brought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her a fresh and very fine dress and put it on her. But when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: company beheld these doings their minds were troubled, for they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had no inkling of the case nor knew the story thereof; so the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Caliph said to Ja'afar, Didst thou not see the scars upon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: damsel's body? I cannot keep silence or be at rest till I learn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the truth of her condition and the story of this other maiden and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the secret of the two black bitches. But Ja'afar answered, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our lord, they made it a condition with us that we speak not of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what concerneth us not, lest we come to hear what pleaseth us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not. Then said the portress By Allah, O my sister, come to me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and complete this service for me. Replied the procuratrix, With

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: joy and goodly gree; so she took the lute; and leaned it against

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her breasts and swept the strings with her finger tips, and began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: singing:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Give back mine eyes their sleep long ravished * And say me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whither be my reason fled:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I learnt that lending to thy love a place * Sleep to mine eyelids

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mortal foe was made.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They said, We held thee righteous, who waylaid * Thy soul? Go

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ask his glorious eyes, I said.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I pardon all my blood he pleased to spill * Owning his troubles

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drove him blood to shed.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: On my mind's mirror sun like sheen he cast * Whose keen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reflection fire in vitals bred

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Waters of Life let Allah waste at will * Suffice my wage those

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lips of dewy red:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: An thou address my love thou'lt find a cause * For plaint and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tears or ruth or lustihed.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: In water pure his form shall greet your eyne * When fails the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bowl nor need ye drink of wine.[FN#180]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she quoted from the same ode:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I drank, but the draught of his glance, not wine, * And his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swaying gait swayed to sleep these eyne:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'Twas not grape juice grips me but grasp of Past * 'Twas not bowl

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: o'erbowled me but gifts divine:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: His coiling curl-lets my soul ennetted * And his cruel will all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my wits outwitted.[FN#181]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: After a pause she resumed:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If we 'plain of absence what shall we say? * Or if pain afflict

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us where wend our way?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: An I hire a truchman[FN#182] to tell my tale * The lover's plaint

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is not told for pay:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If I put on patience, a lover's life * After loss of love will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not last a day:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Naught is left me now but regret, repine * And tears flooding

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cheeks for ever and aye:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O thou who the babes of these eyes[FN#183] hast fled * Thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: homed in heart that shall never stray

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Would heaven I wot hast thou kept our pact * Long as stream shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flow, to have firmest fey?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Or hast forgotten the weeping slave * Whom groans afflict and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom griefs waylay?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ah, when severance ends and we side by side * Couch, I'll blame

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy rigours and chide thy pride!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now when the portress heard her second ode she shrieked aloud and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, By Allah! 'tis right good!; and laying hands on her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: garments tore them, as she did the first time, and fell to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ground fainting. Thereupon the procuratrix rose end brought her a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: second change of clothes after she had sprinkled water on her.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She recovered and sat upright and said to her sister the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cateress, Onwards, and help me in my duty, for there remains but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this one song. So the provisioneress again brought out the lute

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and began to sing these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How long shall last, how long this rigour rife of woe * May not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: suffice thee all these tears thou seest flow?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Our parting thus with purpose fell thou dost prolong * Is't not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enough to glad the heart of envious foe?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Were but this lying world once true to lover heart * He had not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: watched the weary night in tears of woe:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Oh pity me whom overwhelmed thy cruel will * My lord, my king,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'tis time some ruth to me thou show:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: To whom reveal my wrongs, O thou who murdered me? * Sad,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who of broken troth the pangs must undergo!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Increase wild love for thee and phrenzy hour by hour * And days

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of exile minute by so long, so slow;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O Moslems, claim vendetta[FN#184] for this slave of Love *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whose sleep Love ever wastes, whose patience Love lays low:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Doth law of Love allow thee, O my wish! to lie * Lapt in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another's arms and unto me cry Go!?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yet in thy presence, say, what joys shall I enjoy * When he I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: love but works my love to overthrow?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the portress heard the third song she cried aloud; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laying hands on her garments, rent them down to the very skirt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and fell to the ground fainting a third time, again showing the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: scars of the scourge. Then said the three Kalandars, Would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Heaven we had never entered this house, but had rather righted on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the mounds and heaps outside the city! for verily our visit hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: been troubled by sights which cut to the heart. The Caliph

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turned to them and asked, Why so? and they made answer, Our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: minds are sore troubled by this matter. Quoth the Caliph, Are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ye not of the household? and quoth they, No; nor indeed did we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ever set eyes on the place till within this hour. Hereat the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Caliph marvelled and rejoined, This man who sitteth by you,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would he not know the secret of the matter? and so saying he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: winked and made signs at the Porter. So they questioned the man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but he replied, By the All might of Allah, in love all are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alike![FN#185] I am the growth of Baghdad, yet never in my born

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days did I darken these doors till to day and my companying with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them was a curious matter. By Allah, they rejoined, we took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee for one of them and now we see thou art one like ourselves.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then said the Caliph, We be seven men, and they only three women

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without even a fourth to help them; so let us question them of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their case; and, if they answer us not, fain we will be answered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by force. All of them agreed to this except Ja'afar who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said,[FN#186] This is not my recking; let them be; for we are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their guests and, as ye know, they made a compact and condition

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with us which we accepted and promised to keep: wherefore it is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: better that we be silent concerning this matter; and, as but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: little of the night remaineth, let each and every of us gang his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: own gait. Then he winked at the Caliph and whispered to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: There is but one hour of darkness left and I can bring them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before thee to morrow, when thou canst freely question them all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: concerning their story. But the Caliph raised his head haughtily

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and cried out at him in wrath, saying, I have no patience left

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for my longing to hear of them: let the Kalandars question them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forthright. Quoth Ja'afar, This is not my rede. Then words ran

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: high and talk answered talk, and they disputed as to who should

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: first put the question, but at last all fixed upon the Porter.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And as the jingle increased the house mistress could not but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: notice it and asked them, O ye folk! on what matter are ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: talking so loudly? Then the Porter stood up respectfully before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her and said, O my lady, this company earnestly desire that thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: acquaint them with the story of the two bitches and what maketh

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee punish them so cruelly; and then thou fallest to weeping

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over them and kissing them; and lastly they want to hear the tale

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of thy sister and why she hath been bastinado'd with palm sticks

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like a man. These are the questions they charge me to put, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: peace be with thee.[FN#187] Thereupon quoth she who was the lady

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the house to the guests, Is this true that he saith on your

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: part? and all replied, Yes! save Ja'afar who kept silence.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When she heard these words she cried, By Allah, ye have wronged

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us, O our guests. with grievous wronging; for when you came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before us we made compact and condition with you, that whoso

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: should speak of what concerneth him not should hear what pleaseth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him not. Sufficeth ye not that we took you into our house and fed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: you with our best food? But the fault is not so much yours as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hers who let you in. Then she tucked up her sleeves from her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wrists and struck the floor thrice with her hand crying, Come ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quickly; and lo! a closet door opened and out of it came seven

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: negro slaves with drawn swords in hand to whom she said, Pinion

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me those praters' elbows and bind them each to each. They did

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her bidding and asked her, O veiled and virtuous! is it thy high

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: command that we strike off their heads?; but she answered,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Leave them awhile that I question them of their condition,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before their necks feel the sword. By Allah, O my lady! cried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Porter, slay me not for other's sin; all these men offended

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and deserve the penalty of crime save myself. Now by Allah, our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night had been charming had we escaped the mortification of those

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: monocular Kalandars whose entrance into a populous city would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: convert it into a howling wilderness. Then he repeated these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: verses :

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How fair is ruth the strong man deigns not smother! * And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fairest fair when shown to weakest brother:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Love's own holy tie between us twain, * Let one not suffer for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sin of other.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the Porter ended his verse the lady laughed. And Shahrazad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perceived the dawn of day and ceased to say her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When It was the Eleventh Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the lady,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after laughing at the Porter despite her wrath, came up to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: party and spake thus, Tell me who ye be, for ye have but an hour

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of life; and were ye not men of rank and, perhaps, notables of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: your tribes, you had not been so froward and I had hastened your

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: doom. Then said the Caliph, Woe to thee, O Ja'afar, tell her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who we are lest we be slain by mistake; and speak her fair be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fore some horror befal us. 'Tis part of thy deserts,replied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he; whereupon the Caliph cried out at him saying, There is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: time for witty words and there is a time for serious work. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the lady accosted the three Kalandars and asked them, Are ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brothers?; when they answered, No, by Allah, we be naught but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fakirs and foreigners. Then quoth she to one among them, Wast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou born blind of one eye?; and quoth he, No, by Allah, 'twas

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a marvellous matter and a wondrous mischance which caused my eye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to be torn out, and mine is a tale which, if it were written upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the eye corners with needle gravers, were a warner to whoso would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be warned.[FN#188] She questioned the second and third Kalandar;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but all replied like the first, By Allah, O our mistress, each

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one of us cometh from a different country, and we are all three

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sons of Kings, sovereign Princes ruling over suzerains and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: capital cities. Thereupon she turned towards them and said, Let

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: each and every of you tell me his tale in due order and explain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the cause of his coming to our place; and if his story please us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: let him stroke his head[FN#189] and wend his way. The first to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: come forward was the Hammal, the Porter, who said, O my lady, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: am a man and a porter. This dame, the cateress, hired me to carry

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a load and took me first to the shop of a vintner, then to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: booth of a butcher; thence to the stall of a fruiterer; thence to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a grocer who also sold dry fruits; thence to a confectioner and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perfumer cum druggist and from him to this place where there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happened to me with you what happened. Such is my story and peace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be on us all! At this the lady laughed and said, Rub thy head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and wend thy ways!; but he cried, By Allah, I will not stump it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till I hear the stories of my companions. Then came forward one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Monoculars and began to tell her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The First Kalandar's Tale.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O my lady, that the cause of my beard being shorn and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eye being out torn was as follows. My father was a King and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had a brother who was a King over another city; and it came to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pass that I and my cousin, the son of my paternal uncle, were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: both born on one and the same day. And years and days rolled on;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, as we grew up, I used to visit my uncle every now and then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and to spend a certain number of months with him. Now my cousin

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I were sworn friends; for he ever entreated me with exceeding

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kindness; he killed for me the fattest sheep and strained the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: best of his wines, and we enjoyed long conversing and carousing.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: One day when the wine had gotten the better of us, the son of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uncle said to me, O my cousin, I have a great service to ask of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee; and I desire that thou stay me not in whatso I desire to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: do! And I replied, With joy and goodly will. Then he made me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swear the most binding oaths and left me; but after a little

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: while he returned leading a lady veiled and richly apparelled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with ornaments worth a large sum of money. Presently he turned to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me (the woman being still behind him) and said, Take this lady

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with thee and go before me to such a burial ground (describing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it, so that I knew the place), and enter with her into such a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sepulchre[FN#190] and there await my coming. The oaths I swore

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him made me keep silence and suffered me not to oppose him; so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I led the woman to the cemetery and both I and she took our seats

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the sepulchre; and hardly had we sat down when in came my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uncle's son, with a bowl of water, a bag of mortar and an adze

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: somewhat like a hoe. He went straight to the tomb in the midst of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sepulchre and, breaking it open with the adze set the stones

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on one side; then he fell to digging into the earth of the tomb

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till he came upon a large iron plate, the size of a wicket door;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and on raising it there appeared below it a staircase vaulted and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: winding. Then he turned to the lady and said to her, Come now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and take thy final choice! She at once went down by the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: staircase and disappeared; then quoth he to me, O son of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uncle, by way of completing thy kindness, when I shall have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: descended into this place, restore the trap door to where it was,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and heap back the earth upon it as it lay before; and then of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: goodness mix this unslaked lime which is in the bag with this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: water which is in the bowl and, after building up the stones,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: plaster the outside so that none looking upon it shall say:--This

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is a new opening in an old tomb. For a whole year have I worked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at this place whereof none knoweth but Allah, and this is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: need I have of thee; presently adding, May Allah never bereave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy friends of thee nor make them desolate by thine absence, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son of my uncle, O my dear cousin! And he went down the stairs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and disappeared for ever. When he was lost to sight I replaced

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the iron plate and did all his bidding till the tomb became as it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was before and I worked almost unconsciously for my head was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heated with wine. Returning to the palace of my uncle, I was told

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that he had gone forth a-sporting and hunting; so I slept that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night without seeing him; and, when the morning dawned, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: remembered the scenes of the past evening and what happened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: between me and my cousin; I repented of having obeyed him when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: penitence was of no avail, I still thought, however, that it was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a dream. So I fell to asking for the son of my uncle; but there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was none to answer me concerning him; and I went out to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grave-yard and the sepulchres, and sought for the tomb under

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which he was, but could not find it; and I ceased not wandering

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about from sepulchre to sepulchre, and tomb to tomb, all without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: success, till night set in. So I returned to the city, yet I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: could neither eat nor drink; my thoughts being engrossed with my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cousin, for that I knew not what was become of him; and I grieved

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with exceeding grief and passed another sorrowful night, watching

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: until the morning. Then went I a second time to the cemetery,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pondering over what the son of mine uncle had done; and, sorely

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repenting my hearkening to him, went round among all the tombs,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but could not find the tomb I sought. I mourned over the past,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and remained in my mourning seven days, seeking the place and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ever missing the path. Then my torture of scruples[FN#191] grew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon me till I well nigh went mad, and I found no way to dispel

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my grief save travel and return to my father. So I set out and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: journeyed homeward; but as I was entering my father's capital a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crowd of rioters sprang upon me and pinioned me.[FN#192] I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wondered thereat with all wonderment, seeing that I was the son

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Sultan, and these men were my father's subjects and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: amongst them were some of my own slaves. A great fear fell upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, and I said to my soul,[FN#193] Would heaven I knew what hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happened to my father! I questioned those that bound me of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cause of their doing, but they returned me no answer. However,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after a while one of them said to me (and he had been a hired

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: servant of our house), Fortune hath been false to thy father;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his troops betrayed him and the Wazir who slew him now reigneth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in his stead and we lay in wait to seize thee by the bidding of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him. I was well nigh distraught and felt ready to faint on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hearing of my father's death; when they carried me off and placed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me in presence of the usurper. Now between me and him there was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an olden grudge, the cause of which was this. I was fond of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shooting with the stone bow,[FN#194] and it befel one day as I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was standing on the terrace roof of the palace, that a bird

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lighted on the top of the Wazir's house when he happened to be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there. I shot at the bird and missed the mark; but I hit the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir's eye and knocked it out as fate and fortune decreed. Even

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so saith the poet:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: We tread the path where Fate hath led * The path Fate writ we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fain must tread:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And man in one land doomed to die * Death no where else shall do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him dead.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And on like wise saith another:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Let Fortune have her wanton way * Take heart and all her words

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: obey:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nor joy nor mourn at anything * For all things pass and no things

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stay.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now when I knocked out the Wazir's eye he could not say a single

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: word, for that my father was King of the city; but he hated me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: everafter and dire was the grudge thus caused between us twain.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So when I was set before him hand bound and pinioned, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: straightway gave orders for me to be beheaded. I asked, For what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crime wilt thou put me to death?; whereupon he answered, What

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crime is greater than this? pointing the while to the place

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where his eye had been Quoth I, This I did by accident not of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: malice prepense; and quoth he, If thou didst it by accident, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will do the like by thee with intention.''[FN#195] Then cried he,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bring him forward, and they brought me up to him, when he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thrust his finger into my left eye and gouged it out; whereupon I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: became one eyed as ye see me. Then he bade bind me hand and foot,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and put me into a chest and said to the sworder, Take charge of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this fellow, and go off with him to the waste lands about the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city; then draw thy scymitar and slay him, and leave him to feed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the beasts and birds. So the headsman fared forth with me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when he was in the midst of the desert, he took me out of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chest (and I with both hands pinioned and both feet fettered) and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was about to bandage my eyes before striking off my head. But I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wept with exceeding weeping until I made him weep with me and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looking at him I began to recite these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I deemed you coat o' mail that should withstand * The foeman's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shafts, and you proved foeman's brand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I hoped your aidance in mine every chance * Though fail my left

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to aid my dexter hand:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Aloof you stand and hear the railer's gibe * While rain their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shafts on me the giber-band:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But an ye will not guard me from my foes * Stand clear, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: succour neither these nor those!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And I also quoted:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I deemed my brethren mail of strongest steel * And so they were--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from foes I to fend my dart!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I deemed their arrows surest of their aim; * And so they were--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when aiming at my heart!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the headsman heard my lines (he had been sworder to my sire

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he owed me a debt of gratitude) he cried, O my lord, what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: can I do, being but a slave under orders? presently adding, Fly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for thy life and nevermore return to this land, or they will slay

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee and slay me with thee, even as the poet said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Take thy life and fly whenas evils threat; * Let the ruined house

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tell its owner's fate:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: New land for the old thou shalt seek and find * But to find new

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: life thou must not await.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Strange that men should sit in the stead of shame, * When Allah's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: world is so wide and great!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And trust not other, in matters grave * Life itself must act for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a life beset:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ne'er would prowl the lion with maned neck, * Did he reckon on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: aid or of others reck.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hardly believing in my escape, I kissed his hand and thought the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loss of my eye a light matter in consideration of my escaping

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from being slain. I arrived at my uncle's capital; and, going in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him, told him of what had befallen my father and myself;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereat he wept with sore weeping and said, Verily thou addest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grief to my grief, and woe to my woe; for thy cousin hath been

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: missing these many days; I wot not what hath happened to him, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: none can give me news of him. And he wept till he fainted. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sorrowed and condoled with him; and he would have applied certain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: medicaments to my eye, but he saw that it was become as a walnut

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the shell empty. Then said he, O my son, better to lose eye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and keep life! After that I could no longer remain silent about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my cousin, who was his only son and one dearly loved, so I told

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him all that had happened. He rejoiced with extreme joyance to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hear news of his son and said, Come now and show me the tomb;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but I replied, By Allah, O my uncle, I know not its place,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: though I sought it carefully full many times, yet could not find

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the site. However, I and my uncle went to the grave yard and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looked right and left, till at last I recognised the tomb and we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: both rejoiced with exceeding joy. We entered the sepulchre and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loosened the earth about the grave; then, up raising the trap

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: door, descended some fifty steps till we came to the foot of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: staircase when lo! we were stopped by a blinding smoke. Thereupon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said my uncle that saying whose sayer shall never come to shame,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: There is no Majesty and there is no Might, save in Allah, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Glorious, the Great! and we advanced till we suddenly came upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a saloon, whose floor was strewed with flour and grain and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: provisions and all manner necessaries; and in the midst of it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stood a canopy sheltering a couch. Thereupon my uncle went up to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the couch and inspecting it found his son and the lady who had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gone down with him into the tomb, lying in each other's embrace;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but the twain had become black as charred wood; it was as if they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had been cast into a pit of fire. When my uncle saw this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spectacle, he spat in his son's face and said, Thou hast thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deserts, O thou hog![FN#196] this is thy judgment in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: transitory world, and yet remaineth the judgment in the world to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: come, a durer and a more enduring -- And Shahrazad perceived the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawn of day and ceased saying her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twelfth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She continued, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kalandar thus went on with his story before the lady and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Caliph and Ja'afar:--My uncle struck his son with his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slipper[FN#197] as he lay there a black heap of coal. I marvelled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at his hardness of heart, and grieving for my cousin and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady, said, By Allah, O my uncle, calm thy wrath: dost thou not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: see that all my thoughts are occupied with this misfortune, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: how sorrowful I am for what hath befallen thy son, and how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: horrible it is that naught of him remaineth but a black heap of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: charcoal? And is not that enough, but thou must smite him with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy slipper? Answered he,O son of my brother, this youth from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his boyhood was madly in love with his own sister;[FN#198] and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: often and often I forbade him from her, saying to myself:--They

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are but little ones. However, when they grew up sin befel between

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them; and, although I could hardly believe it, I confined him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chided him and threatened him with the severest threats; and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eunuchs and servants said to him:--Beware of so foul a thing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which none before thee ever did, and which none after thee will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ever do; and have a care lest thou be dishonoured and disgraced

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: among the Kings of the day, even to the end of time. And I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: added:--Such a report as this will be spread abroad by caravans,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and take heed not to give them cause to talk or I will assuredly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: curse thee and do thee to death. After that I lodged them apart

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and shut her up; but the accursed girl loved him with passionate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: love, for Satan had got the mastery of her as well as of him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made their foul sin seem fair in their sight. Now when my son saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that I separated them, he secretly built this souterrain and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: furnished it and transported to it victuals, even as thou seest;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, when I had gone out a-sporting, came here with his sister

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and hid from me. Then His righteous judgment fell upon the twain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and consumed them with fire from Heaven; and verily the last

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: judgment will deal them durer pains and more enduring! Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wept and I wept with him; and he looked at me and said, Thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my son in his stead. And I bethought me awhile of the world and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of its chances, how the Wazir had slain my father and had taken

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his place and had put out my eye; and how my cousin had come to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his death by the strangest chance: and I wept again and my uncle

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wept with me. Then we mounted the steps and let down the iron

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: plate and heaped up the earth over it; and, after restoring the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tomb to its former condition, we returned to the palace. But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hardly had we sat down ere we heard the tomtoming of the kettle

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drum and tantara of trumpets and clash of cymbals; and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rattling of war men's lances; and the clamours of assailants and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the clanking of bits and the neighing of steeds; while the world

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was canopied with dense dust and sand clouds raised by the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: horses' hoofs.[FN#199] We were amazed at sight and sound, knowing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not what could be the matter; so we asked and were told us that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir who usurped my father's kingdom had marched his men;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and that after levying his soldiery and taking a host of wild

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Arabs[FN#200] into service, he had come down upon us with armies

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like the sands of the sea; their number none could tell and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: against them none could prevail. They attacked the city unawares;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the citizens, being powerless to oppose them, surrendered the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: place: my uncle was slain and I made for the suburbs saying to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: myself, If thou fall into this villain's hands he will assuredly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kill thee. On this wise all my troubles were renewed; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pondered all that had betided my father and my uncle and I knew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not what to do; for if the city people or my father's troops had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recognised me they would have done their best to win favour by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: destroying me; and I could think of no way to escape save by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shaving off my beard and my eyebrows. So I shore them off and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: changing my fine clothes for a Kalandar's rags, I fared forth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from my uncle's capital and made for this city; hoping that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: peradventure some one would assist me to the presence of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Prince of the Faithful,[FN#201] and the Caliph who is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Viceregent of Allah upon earth. Thus have I come hither that I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: might tell him my tale and lay my case before him. I arrived here

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this very night, and was standing in doubt whither I should go,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when suddenly I saw this second Kalandar; so I salam'd to him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying--I am a stranger! and he answered:--I too am a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stranger! And as we were conversing behold, up came our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: companion, this third Kalandar, and saluted us saying:--I am a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stranger! And we answered:--We too be strangers! Then we three

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: walked on and together till darkness overtook us and Destiny

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crave us to your house. Such, then, is the cause of the shaving

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of my beard and mustachios and eyebrows; and the manner of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: losing my right eye. They marvelled much at this tale and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Caliph said to Ja'afar, By Allah, I have not seen nor have I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard the like of what hath happened to this Kalandar! Quoth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady of the house, Rub thy head and wend thy ways; but he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied, I will not go, till I hear the history of the two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: others. Thereupon the second Kalandar came forward; and, kissing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the ground, began to tell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Second Kalandar's Tale.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O my lady, that I was not born one eyed and mine is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strange story; an it were graven with needle graver on the eye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: corners, it were a warner to whoso would be warned. I am a King,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son of a King, and was brought up like a Prince. I learned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: intoning the Koran according the seven schools;[FN#202] and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: read all manner books, and held disputations on their contents

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the doctors and men of science; moreover I studied star lore

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the fair sayings of poets and I exercised myself in all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: branches of learning until I surpassed the people of my time; my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: skill in calligraphy exceeded that of all the scribes; and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fame was bruited abroad over all climes and cities, and all the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kings learned to know my name. Amongst others the King of Hind

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard of me and sent to my father to invite me to his court, with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: offerings and presents and rarities such as befit royalties. So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my father fitted out six ships for me and my people; and we put

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to sea and sailed for the space of a full month till we made the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: land. Then we brought out the horses that were with us in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ships; and, after loading the camels with our presents for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Prince, we set forth inland. But we had marched only a little

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: way, when behold, a dust cloud up flew, and grew until it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: walled[FN#203] the horizon from view. After an hour or so the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: veil lifted and discovered beneath it fifty horsemen, ravening

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lions to the sight, in steel armour dight. We observed them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: straightly and lo! they were cutters off of the highway, wild as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wild Arabs. When they saw that we were only four and had with us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but the ten camels carrying the presents, they dashed down upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us with lances at rest. We signed to them, with our fingers, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it were saying, We be messengers of the great King of Hind, so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: harm us not! but they answered on like wise, We are not in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dominions to obey nor are we subject to his sway. Then they set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon us and slew some of my slaves and put the lave to flight;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I also fled after I had gotten a wound, a grievous hurt,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilst the Arabs were taken up with the money and the presents

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which were with us. I went forth unknowing whither I went, having

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: become mean as I was mighty; and I fared on until I came to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crest of a mountain where I took shelter for the night in a cave.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When day arose I set out again, nor ceased after this fashion

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till I arrived at a fair city and a well filled. Now it was the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: season when Winter was turning away with his rime and to greet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the world with his flowers came Prime, and the young blooms were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: springing and the streams flowed ringing, and the birds were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sweetly singing, as saith the poet concerning a certain city when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: describing it:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A place secure from every thought of fear * Safety and peace for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ever lord it here:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Its beauties seem to beautify its sons * And as in Heaven its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happy folk appear.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I was glad of my arrival for I was wearied with the way, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yellow of face for weakness and want; but my plight was pitiable

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I knew not whither to betake me. So I accosted a Tailor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sitting in his little shop and saluted him; he returned my salam,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and bade me kindly welcome and wished me well and entreated me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gently and asked me of the cause of my strangerhood. I told him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all my past from first to last; and he was concerned on my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: account and said, O youth, disclose not thy secret to any: the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King of this city is the greatest enemy thy father hath, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there is blood wit[FN#204] between them and thou hast cause to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fear for thy life. Then he set meat and drink before me; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ate and drank and he with me; and we conversed freely till night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fall, when he cleared me a place in a corner of his shop and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought me a carpet and a coverlet. I tarried with him three

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days; at the end of which time he said to me, Knowest thou no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: calling whereby to win thy living, O my son? I am learned in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the law, I replied, and a doctor of doctrine; an adept in art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and science, a mathematician and a notable penman. He rejoined,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thy calling is of no account in our city, where not a soul under

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: standeth science or even writing or aught save money making.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then said I, By Allah, I know nothing but what I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mentioned; and he answered, Gird thy middle and take thee a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hatchet and a cord, and go and hew wood in the wold for thy daily

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bread, till Allah send thee relief; and tell none who thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lest they slay thee. Then he bought me an axe and a rope and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gave me in charge to certain wood cutters; and with these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: guardians I went forth into the forest, where I cut fuel wood the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whole of my day and came back in the evening bearing my bundle on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my head. I sold it for half a diner, with part of which I bought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: provision and laid by the rest. In such work I spent a whole year

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and when this was ended I went out one day, as was my wont, into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the wilderness; and, wandering away from my companions, I chanced

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on a thickly grown lowland[FN#205] in which there was an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abundance of wood. So I entered and I found the gnarled stump of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a great tree and loosened the ground about it and shovelled away

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the earth. Presently my hatchet rang upon a copper ring; so I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cleared away the soil and behold, the ring was attached to a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wooden trap door. This I raised and there appeared beneath it a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: staircase. I descended the steps to the bottom and came to a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: door, which I opened and found myself in a noble hall strong of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: structure and beautifully built, where was a damsel like a pearl

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of great price, whose favour banished from my heart all grief and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cark and care; and whose soft speech healed the soul in despair

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and captivated the wise and ware. Her figure measured five feet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in height; her breasts were firm and upright; her cheek a very

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: garden of delight; her colour lively bright; her face gleamed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like dawn through curly tresses which gloomed like night, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: above the snows of her bosom glittered teeth of a pearly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: white.[FN#206] As the poet said of one like her:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Slim waisted loveling jetty hair encrowned * A wand of willow on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a sandy mound:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And as saith another.--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Four things that meet not, save they here unite * To shed my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart blood and to rape my sprite:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Brilliantest forehead; tresses jetty bright; * Cheeks rosy red

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and stature beauty dight.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I looked upon her I prostrated myself before Him who had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: created her, for the beauty and loveliness He had shaped in her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she looked at me and said, Art thou man or Jinni? I am a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man, answered I, and she, Now who brought thee to this place

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where I have abided five and twenty years without even yet seeing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man in it? Quoth I (and indeed I found her words wonder sweet,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and my heart was melted to the core by them), O my lady, my good

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fortune led me hither for the dispelling of my cark and care.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I related to her all my mishap from first to last, and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: case appeared to her exceeding grievous; so she wept and said, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will tell thee my story in my turn. I am the daughter of the King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ifitamus, lord of the Islands of Abnus,[FN#207] who married me to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my cousin, the son of my paternal uncle; but on my wedding night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an Ifrit named Jirjís[FN#208] bin Rajmús, first cousin that is,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mother's sister's son, of Iblís, the Foul Fiend, snatched me up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, flying away with me like a bird, set me down in this place,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whither he conveyed all I needed of fine stuffs, raiment and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: jewels and furniture, and meat and drink and other else. Once in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: every ten days he comes here and lies a single night with me, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: then wends his way, for he took me without the consent of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: family; and he hath agreed with me that if ever I need him by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night or by day, I have only to pass my hand over yonder two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lines engraved upon the alcove, and he will appear to me before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my fingers cease touching. Four days have now passed since he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: here; and, as there remain six days before he come again, say me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wilt thou abide with me five days, and go hence the day before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his coming? I replied Yes, and yes again! O rare, if all this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be not a dream! Hereat she was glad and, springing to her feet,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seized my hand and carried me through an arched doorway to a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hammam bath, a fair hall and richly decorate. I doffed my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes, and she doffed hers; then we bathed and she washed me;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and when this was done we left the bath, and she seated me by her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: side upon a high divan, and brought me sherbet scented with musk.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When we felt cool after the bath, she set food before me and we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ate and fell to talking; but presently she said to me, Lay thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down and take thy rest, for surely thou must be weary. So I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thanked her, my lady, and lay down and slept soundly, forgetting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all that had happened to me. When I awoke I found her rubbing and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shampooing my feet;[FN#209] so I again thanked her and blessed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her and we sat for awhile talking. Said she, By Allah, I was sad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at heart, for that I have dwelt alone underground for these five

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and twenty years; and praise be to Allah, who hath sent me some

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one with whom I can converse! Then she asked, O youth, what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sayest thou to wine? and I answered, Do as thou wilt. Where-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon she went to a cupboard and took out a sealed flask of right

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: old wine and set off the table with flowers and scented herbs and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began to sing these lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Had we known of thy coming we fain had dispread * The cores of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our hearts or the balls of our eyes;
