title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Our cheeks as a carpet to greet thee had thrown * And our eyelids

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had strown for thy feet to betread.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now when she finished her verse I thanked her, for indeed love

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of her had gotten hold of my heart and my grief and anguish were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gone. We sat at converse and carousel till nightfall, and with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her I spent the night--such night never spent I in all my life!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: On the morrow delight followed delight till midday, by which time

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I had drunken wine so freely that I had lost my wits, and stood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up, staggering to the right and to the left, and said Come, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: charmer, and I will carry thee up from this underground vault and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deliver thee from the spell of thy Jinni. She laughed and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied Content thee and hold thy peace: of every ten days one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is for the Ifrit and the other nine are thine. Quoth I (and in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: good sooth drink had got the better of me), This very instant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will I break down the alcove whereon is graven the talisman and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: summon the Ifrit that I may slay him, for it is a practice of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mine to slay Ifrits! When she heard my words her colour waxed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wan and she said, By Allah, do not! and she began repeating:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This is a thing wherein destruction lies * I rede thee shun it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an thy wits be wise.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And these also:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O thou who seekest severance, draw the rein * Of thy swift steed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nor seek o'ermuch t' advance;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ah stay! for treachery is the rule of life, * And sweets of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: meeting end in severance.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I heard her verse but paid no heed to her words, nay, I raised my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: foot and administered to the alcove a mighty kick. And Shahrazad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perceived the dawn of day and ceased to say her permisted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Thirteenth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the second

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kalandar thus continued his tale to the lady:--But when, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mistress, I kicked that alcove with a mighty kick, behold, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: air starkened and darkened and thundered and lightened; the earth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trembled and quaked and the world became invisible. At once the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fumes of wine left my head: I cried to her, What is the matter?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she replied, The Ifrit is upon us! did I not warn thee of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this? By Allah, thou hast brought ruin upon me; but fly for thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: life and go up by the way thou camest down! So I fled up the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: staircase; but, in the excess of my fear, I forgot sandals and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hatchet. And when I had mounted two steps I turned to look for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them, and lo! I saw the earth cleave asunder, and there arose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from it an Ifrit, a monster of hideousness, who said to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: damsel What trouble and posher be this wherewith thou disturbest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me? What mishap hath betided thee? No mishap hath befallen me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she answered, save that my breast was straitened[FN#210] and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart heavy with sadness! so I drank a little wine to broaden it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and to hearten myself; then I rose to obey a call of Nature, but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the wine had gotten into my head and I fell against the alcove.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou liest, like the whore thou art! shrieked the Ifrit; and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looked around the hall right and left till he caught sight of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: axe and sandals and said to her, What be these but the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: belongings of some mortal who hath been in thy society? She

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, I never set eyes upon them till this moment: they must

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have been brought by thee hither cleaving to thy garments. Quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Ifrit, These words are absurd; thou harlot! thou strumpet!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he stripped her stark naked and, stretching her upon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: floor, bound her hands and feet to four stakes, like one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crucified;[FN#211] and set about torturing and trying to make her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: confess. I could not bear to stand listening to her cries and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: groans; so I climbed the stair on the quake with fear; and when I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reached the top I replaced the trap door and covered it with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: earth. Then repented I of what I had done with penitence

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding; and thought of the lady and her beauty and loveliness,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the tortures she was suffering at the hands of the accursed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ifrit, after her quiet life of five and twenty years; and how all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that had happened to her was for the cause of me. I bethought me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of my father and his kingly estate and how I had become a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woodcutter; and how, after my time had been awhile serene, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: world had again waxed turbid and troubled to me. So I wept

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bitterly and repeated this couplet:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: What time Fate's tyranny shall most oppress thee * Perpend! one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day shall joy thee, one distress thee!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I walked till I reached the home of my friend, the Tailor,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom I found most anxiously expecting me; indeed he was, as the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying goes, on coals of fire for my account. And when he saw me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he said, All night long my heart hath been heavy, fearing for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee from wild beasts or other mischances. Now praise be to Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for thy safety! I thanked him for his friendly solicitude and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: retiring to my corner, sat pondering and musing on what had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befallen me; and I blamed and chided myself for my meddlesome

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: folly and my frowardness in kicking the alcove. I was calling

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: myself to account when behold, my friend, the Tailor, came to me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, O youth, in the shop there is an old man, a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Persian,[FN#212] who seeketh thee: he hath thy hatchet and thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sandals which he had taken to the woodcutters,[FN#213] saying, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was going out at what time the Mu'azzin began the call to dawn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prayer, when I chanced upon these things and know not whose they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are; so direct me to their owner. The woodcutters recognised thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hatchet and directed him to thee: he is sitting in my shop, so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fare forth to him and thank him and take thine axe and sandals.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I heard these words I turned yellow with fear and felt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stunned as by a blow; and, before I could recover myself, lo! the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: floor of my private room clove asunder, and out of it rose the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Persian who was the Ifrit. He had tortured the lady with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding tortures, natheless she would not confess to him aught;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so he took the hatchet and sandals and said to her, As surely as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I am Jirjis of the seed of Iblis, I will bring thee back the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: owner of this and these![FN#214] Then he went to the woodcutters

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the presence aforesaid and, being directed to me, after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waiting a while in the shop till the fact was confirmed, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: suddenly snatched me up as a hawk snatcheth a mouse and dew high

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in air; but presently descended and plunged with me under the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: earth (I being aswoon the while), and lastly set me down in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: subterranean palace wherein I had passed that blissful night. And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there I saw the lady stripped to the skin, her limbs bound to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: four stakes and blood welling from her sides. At the sight my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyes ran over with tears; but the Ifrit covered her person and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, O wanton, is not this man thy lover? She looked upon me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and replied, I wot him not nor have I ever seen him before this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hour! Quoth the Ifrit, What! this torture and yet no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: confessing; and quoth she,I never saw this man in my born days,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and it is not lawful in Allah's sight to tell lies on him. If

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou know him not, said the Ifrit to her, take this sword and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strike off his head.''[FN#215] She hent the sword in hand and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came close up to me; and I signalled to her with my eyebrows, my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tears the while flowing adown my cheeks. She understood me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made answer, also by signs, How couldest thou bring all this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: evil upon me? and I rejoined after the same fashion, This is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the time for mercy and forgiveness. And the mute tongue of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: case[FN#216] spake aloud saying:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mine eyes were dragomans for my tongue betted * And told full

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clear the love I fain would hide:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When last we met and tears in torrents railed * For tongue struck

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dumb my glances testified:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She signed with eye glance while her lips were mute * I signed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with fingers and she kenned th' implied:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Our eyebrows did all duty 'twixt us twain; * And we being

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speechless Love spake loud and plain.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then, O my mistress, the lady threw away the sword and said, How

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall I strike the neck of one I wot not, and who hath done me no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: evil? Such deed were not lawful in my law! and she held her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand. Said the Ifrit, 'Tis grievous to thee to slay thy lover;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, because he hath lain with thee, thou endurest these torments

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and obstinately refusest to confess. After this it is clear to me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that only like loveth and pitieth like. Then he turned to me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asked me, O man, haply thou also dost not know this woman;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereto I answered, And pray who may she be? assuredly I never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw her till this instant. Then take the sword, said he and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strike off her head and I will believe that thou wottest her not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and will leave thee free to go, and will not deaf 'hardly with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. I replied, That will I do; and, taking the sword went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forward sharply and raised my hand to smite. But she signed to me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with her eyebrows, Have I failed thee in aught of love; and is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it thus that thou requirest me? I understood what her looks

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: implied and answered her with an eye-glance, I will sacrifice my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soul for thee. And the tongue of the case wrote in our hearts

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How many a lover with his eyebrows speaketh * To his beloved, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his passion pleadeth:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: With flashing eyne his passion he inspireth * And well she seeth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what kits pleading needeth.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How sweet the look when each on other gazeth; * And with what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swiftness and how sure it speedeth:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And this with eyebrows all his passion writeth; * And that with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyeballs all his passion readeth.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then my eyes filled with tears to overflowing and I cast the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sword from my hand saying, O mighty Ifrit and hero, if a woman

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lacking wits and faith deem it unlawful to strike off my head,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: how can it be lawful for me, a man, to smite her neck whom I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: never saw in my whole life. I cannot do such misdeed though thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cause me drink the cup of death and perdition. Then said the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ifrit, Ye twain show the good understanding between you; but I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will let you see how such doings end. He took the sword, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: struck off the lady's hands first, with four strokes, and then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her feet; whilst I looked on and made sure of death and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: farewelled me with her dying eyes. So the Ifrit cried at her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou whorest and makest me a wittol with thine eyes; and struck

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her so that her head went flying. Then he turned to me and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O mortal, we have it in our law that, when the wife committeth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: advowtry it is lawful for us to slay her. As for this damsel I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: snatched her away on her bride-night when she was a girl of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: twelve and she knew no one but myself. I used to come to her once

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: every ten days and lie with her the night, under the semblance of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a man, a Persian; and when I was well assured that she had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cuckolded me, I slew her. But as for thee I am not well satisfied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that thou hast wronged me in her; nevertheless I must not let

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee go unharmed; so ask a boon of me and I will grant it. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I rejoiced, O my lady, with ex ceeding joy and said, What boon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall I crave of thee? He replied, Ask me this boon; into what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shape I shall bewitch thee; wilt thou be a dog, or an ass or an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ape? I rejoined (and indeed I had hoped that mercy might be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shown me), By Allah, spare me, that Allah spare thee for sparing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a Moslem and a man who never wronged thee. And I humbled myself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before him with exceeding humility, and remained standing in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presence, saying, I am sore oppressed by circumstance. He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied Talk me no long talk, it is in my power to slay thee;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but I give thee instead thy choice. Quoth I, O thou Ifrit, it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would besit thee to pardon me even as the Envied pardoned the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Envier. Quoth he, And how was that? and I began to tell him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Tale of the Envier and the Envied.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They relate, O Ifrit, that in a certain city were two men who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dwelt in adjoining houses, having a common party wall; and one of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them envied the other and looked on him with an evil eye,[FN#217]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and did his utmost endeavour to injure him; and, albeit at all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: times he was jealous of his neighbour, his malice at last grew on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him till he could hardly eat or enjoy the sweet pleasures of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sleep. But the Envied did nothing save prosper; and the more the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other strove to injure him, the more he got and gained and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: throve. At last the malice of his neighbour and the man's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: constant endeavour to work him a harm came to his knowledge; so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he said, By Allah! God's earth is wide enough for its people;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, leaving the neighbourhood, he repaired to another city where

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he bought himself a piece of land in which was a dried up draw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: well,[FN#218] old and in ruinous condition. Here he built him an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: oratory and, furnishing it with a few necessaries, took up his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abode therein, and devoted himself to prayer and worshipping

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah Almighty; and Fakirs and holy mendicants docked to him from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all quarters; and his fame went abroad through the city and that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: country side. Presently the news reached his envious neighbour,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of what good fortune had befallen him and how the city notables

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had become his disciples; so he travelled to the place and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presented himself at the holy man's hermitage, and was met by the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Envied with welcome and greeting and all honour. Then quoth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Envier, I have a word to say to thee; and this is the cause of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my faring hither, and I wish to give thee a piece of good news;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so come with me to thy cell. Thereupon the Envied arose and took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Envier by the hand, and they went in to the inmost part of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the hermitage; but the Envier said, Bid thy Fakirs retire to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their cells, for I will not tell thee what I have to say, save in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: secret where none may hear us. Accordingly the Envied said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his Fakirs, Retire to your private cells; and, when all had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: done as he bade them, he set out with his visitor and walked a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: little way until the twain reached the ruinous old well. And as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they stood upon the brink the Envier gave the Envied a push which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tumbled him headlong into it, unseen of any; whereupon he fared

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth, and went his ways, thinking to have had slain him. Now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this well happened to be haunted by the Jann who, seeing the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: case, bore him up and let him down little by little, till he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reached the bottom, when they seated him upon a large stone. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one of them asked his fellows, Wot ye who be this man? and they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, Nay. This man, continued the speaker, is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Envied hight who, flying from the Envier, came to dwell in our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city, and here founded this holy house, and he hath edified us by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his litanies[FN#219] and his lections of the Koran; but the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Envier set out and journeyed till he rejoined him, and cunningly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: contrived to deceive him and cast him into the well where we now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are. But the fame of this good man hath this very night come to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Sultan of our city who designeth to visit him on the morrow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on account of his daughter. What aileth his daughter? asked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one, and another answered She is possessed of a spirit; for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Maymun, son of Damdam, is madly in love with her; but, if this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pious man knew the remedy, her cure would be as easy as could

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be. Hereupon one of them inquired, And what is the medicine?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he replied, The black tom cat which is with him in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: oratory hath, on the end of his tail, a white spot, the size of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dirham; let him pluck seven white hairs from the spot, then let

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him fumigate her therewith and the Marid will flee from her and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not return; so she shall be sane for the rest of her life. All

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this took place, O Ifrit, within earshot of the Envied who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: listened readily. When dawn broke and morn arose in sheen and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shone, the Fakirs went to seek the Shaykh and found him climbing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up the wall of the well; whereby he was magnified in their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyes.[FN#220] Then, knowing that naught save the black tomcat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: could supply him with the remedy required, he plucked the seven

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tail hairs from the white spot and laid them by him; and hardly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had the sun risen ere the Sultan entered the hermitage, with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: great lords of his estate, bidding the rest of his retinue to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: remain standing outside. The Envied gave him a hearty welcome,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and seating him by his side asked him, Shall I tell thee the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cause of thy coming? The King answered, Yes. He continued,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou hast come upon pretext of a visitation;[FN#221] but it is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in thy heart to question me of thy daughter. Replied the King,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tis even so, O thou holy Shaykh; and the Envied continued,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Send and fetch her, and I trust to heal her forthright (an such

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it be the will of Allah!) The King in great joy sent for his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter, and they brought her pinioned and fettered. The Envied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made her sit down behind a curtain and taking out the hairs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fumigated her therewith; whereupon that which was in her head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried out and departed from her. The girl was at once restored to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her right mind and veiling her face, said, What hath happened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and who brought me hither? The Sultan rejoiced with a joy that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nothing could exceed, and kissed his daughter's eyes,[FN#222] and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the holy man's hand; then, turning to his great lords, he asked,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How say ye! What fee deserveth he who hath made my daughter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whole? and all answered, He deserveth her to wife; and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King said, Ye speak sooth! So he married him to her and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Envied thus became son in law to the King. And after a little the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir died and the King said, Whom can I make Minister in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stead? Thy son in law, replied the courtiers. So the Envied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: became a Wazir; and after a while the Sultan also died and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lieges said, Whom shall we make King? and all cried, The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir. So the Wazir was forthright made Sultan, and he became

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King regnant, a true ruler of men. One day as he had mounted his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: horse; and, in the eminence of his kinglihood, was riding amidst

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his Emirs and Wazirs and the Grandees of his realm his eye fell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon his old neighbour, the Envier, who stood afoot on his path;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so he turned to one of his Ministers, and said, Bring hither

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that man and cause him no affright. The Wazir brought him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King said, Give him a thousand miskals[FN#223] of gold from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the treasury, and load him ten camels with goods for trade, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: send him under escort to his own town. Then he bade his enemy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: farewell and sent him away and forbore to punish him for the many

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and great evils he had done. See, O Ifrit, the mercy of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Envied to the Envier, who had hated him from the beginning and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had borne him such bitter malice and never met him without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: causing him trouble; and had driven him from house and home, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: then had journeyed for the sole purpose of taking his life by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: throwing him into the well. Yet he did not requite his injurious

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dealing, but forgave him and was bountiful to him.[FN#224] Then I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wept before him, O my lady, with sore weeping, never was there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sorer, and I recited:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Pardon my fault, for 'tis the wise man's wont * All faults to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pardon and revenge forgo:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: In sooth all manner faults in me contain * Then deign of goodness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mercy grace to show:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whoso imploreth pardon from on High * Should hold his hand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from sinners here below.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Said the Ifrit, Lengthen not thy words! As to my slaying thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fear it not, and as to my pardoning thee hope it not; but from my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bewitching thee there is no escape. Then he tore me from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ground which closed under my feet and hew with me into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: firmament till I saw the earth as a large white cloud or a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saucer[FN#225] in the midst of the waters. Presently he set me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down on a mountain, and taking a little dust, over which he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: muttered some magical words, sprinkled me therewith, saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quit that shape and take thou the shape of an ape! And on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: instant I became an ape, a tailless baboon, the son of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: century[FN#226]. Now when he had left me and I saw myself in this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ugly and hateful shape, I wept for myself, but resigned my soul

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the tyranny of Time and Circumstance, well weeting that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fortune is fair and constant to no man. I descended the mountain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and found at the foot a desert plain, long and broad, over which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I travelled for the space of a month till my course brought me to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the brink of the briny sea.[FN#227] After standing there awhile,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I was ware of a ship in the offing which ran before a fair wind

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: making for the shore. I hid myself behind a rock on the beach and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waited till the ship drew near, when I leaped on board. I found

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her full of merchants and passengers and one of them cried, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Captain, this ill omened brute will bring us ill luck! and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another said, Turn this ill omened beast out from among us; the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Captain said, Let us kill it! another said, Slay it with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sword; a third, Drown it; and a fourth, Shoot it with an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arrow. But I sprang up and laid hold of the Rais's[FN#228]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: skirt, and shed tears which poured down my chops. The Captain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took pity on me, and said, O merchants! this ape hath appealed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to me for protection and I will protect him; henceforth he is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: under my charge: so let none do him aught hurt or harm, otherwise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there will be bad blood between us. Then he entreated me kindly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and whatsoever he said I understood and ministered to his every

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: want and served him as a servant, albeit my tongue would not obey

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my wishes; so that he came to love me. The vessel sailed on, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wind being fair, for the space of fifty days; at the end of which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we cast anchor under the walls of a great city wherein was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: world of people, especially learned men, none could tell their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: number save Allah. No sooner had we arrived than we were visited

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by certain Mameluke officials from the King of that city; who,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after boarding us, greeted the merchants and giving them joy of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: safe arrival said, Our King welcometh you, and sendeth you this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: roll of paper, whereupon each and every of you must write a line.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For ye shall know that the King's Minister, a calligrapher of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: renown, is dead, and the King hath sworn a solemn oath that he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will make none Wazir in his stead who cannot write as well as he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: could. He then gave us the scroll which measured ten cubits long

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by a breadth of one, and each of the merchants who knew how to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: write wrote a line thereon, even to the last of them; after which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I stood up (still in the shape of an ape) and snatched the roll

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out of their hands. They feared lest I should tear it or throw it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: overboard; so they tried to stay me and scare me, but I signed to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them that i could write, whereat all marvelled, saying, We never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yet saw an, ape write. And the Captain cried, Let him write;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and if he scribble and scrabble we will kick him out and kill

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him; but if he; write fair and scholarly I will adopt him as my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son; for surely I never yet saw a more intelligent and well

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mannered monkey than he. Would Heaven my real son were his match

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in morals and manners. I took the reed, and stretching out my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: paw, dipped it in ink and wrote, in the hand used for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: letters,[FN#229] these two couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Time hath recorded gifts she gave the great; * But none recorded

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thine which be far higher

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah ne'er orphan men by loss of thee * Who be of Goodness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mother. Bounty's sire.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And I wrote in Rayháni or larger letters elegantly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: curved[FN#230]:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou hast a reed[FN#231] of rede to every land, * Whose driving

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: causeth all the world to thrive;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nil is the Nile of Misraim by thy boons * Who makest misery

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: smile with fingers five

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I wrote in the Suls[FN#232] character:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: There be no writer who from Death shall fleet, * But what his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand hath writ men shall repeat:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Write, therefore, naught save what shall serve thee when * Thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: see's on Judgment-Day an so thou see's!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I wrote in the character Naskh[FN#233]:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When to sore parting Fate our love shall doom, * To distant life

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by Destiny decreed,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: We cause the inkhorn's lips to 'plain our pains, * And tongue our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: utterance with the talking reed.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And I wrote in the Túmár character[FN#234]:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kingdom with none endures; if thou deny * This truth, where be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Kings of earlier earth?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Set trees of goodliness while rule endures, * And when thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fallen they shall tell thy worth.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And I wrote in the character Muhakkak[FN#235]:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When oped the inkhorn of thy wealth and fame * Take ink of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: generous heart and gracious hand;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Write brave and noble deeds while write thou can * And win thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: praise from point of pen and brand.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I gave the scroll to the officials and, after we all had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: written our line, they carried it before the King. When he saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the paper no writing pleased him save my writing; and he said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the assembled courtiers, Go seek the writer of these lines and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dress him in a splendid robe of honour; then mount him on a she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mule,[FN#236] let a band of music precede him and bring him to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the presence. At these words they smiled and the King was wroth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with them and cried, O accursed! I give you an order and you

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laugh at me? O King, replied they, if we laugh 'tis not at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee and not without a cause. And what is it? asked he; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they answered, O King, thou orderest us to bring to thy presence

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the man who wrote these lines; now the truth is that he who wrote

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them is not of the sons of Adam,[FN#237] but an ape, a tail-less

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: baboon, belonging to the ship captain. Quoth he, Is this true

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that you say? Quoth they, Yea! by the rights of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: munificence! The King marvelled at their words and shook with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mirth and said, I am minded to buy this ape of the Captain.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he sent messengers to the ship with the mule, the dress, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: guard and the state drums, saying, Not the less do you clothe

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him in the robe of honour and mount him on the mule and let him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be surrounded by the guards and preceded by the band of music.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They came to the ship and took me from the Captain and robed me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the robe of honour and, mounting me on the she mule, carried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me in state procession through the streets', whilst the people

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were amazed and amused. And folk said to one another, Halloo! is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our Sultan about to make an ape his Minister?; and came all agog

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crowding to gaze at me, and the town was astir and turned topsy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turvy on my account. When they brought me up to the King and set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me in his presence, I kissed the ground before him three times,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and once before the High Chamberlain and great officers, and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bade me be seated, and I sat respectfully on shins and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knees,[FN#238] and all who were present marvelled at my fine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: manners, and the King most of all. Thereupon he ordered the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lieges to retire; and, when none remained save the King's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: majesty, the Eunuch on duty and a little white slave, he bade

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them set before me the table of food, containing all manner of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: birds, whatever hoppeth and flieth and treadeth in nest, such as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quail and sand grouse. Then he signed me to eat with him; so I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose and kissed ground before him, then sat me down and ate with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him. And when the table was removed I washed my hands in seven

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waters and took the reed-case and reed; and wrote instead of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speaking these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wail for the little partridges on porringer and plate; * Cry for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the ruin of the fries and stews well marinate:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Keen as I keen for loved, lost daughters of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Katá-grouse,[FN#239] * And omelette round the fair

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enbrowned fowls agglomerate:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O fire in heart of me for fish, those deux poissons I saw, *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bedded on new made scones[FN#240] and cakes in piles to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laniate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For thee, O vermicelli! aches my very maw! I hold * Without thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: every taste and joy are clean annihilate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Those eggs have rolled their yellow eyes in torturing pains of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fire * Ere served with hash and fritters hot, that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: delicatest cate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Praised be Allah for His baked and roast and ah! how good * This

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pulse, these pot-herbs steeped in oil with eysill combinate!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When hunger sated was, I elbow-propt fell back upon * Meat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pudding[FN#241] wherein gleamed the bangles that my wits

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: amate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then woke I sleeping appetite to eat as though in sport * Sweets

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from broceded trays and kickshaws most elaborate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Be patient, soul of me! Time is a haughty, jealous wight; * Today

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he seems dark-lowering and tomorrow fair to sight.[FN#242]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I rose and seated myself at a respectful distance while the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King read what I had written, and marvelled, exclaiming, O the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: miracle, that an ape should be gifted with this graceful style

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and this power of penmanship! By Allah, 'tis a wonder of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wonders! Presently they set before the King choice wines in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flagons of glass and he drank: then he passed on the cup to me;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I kissed the ground and drank and wrote on it:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: With fire they boiled me to loose my tongue,[FN#243] * And pain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and patience gave for fellowship:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hence comes it hands of men upbear me high * And honey dew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from lips of maid I sip!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And these also:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Morn saith to Night, withdraw and let me shine; * So drain we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: draughts that dull all pain and pine:[FN#244]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I doubt, so fine the glass, the wine so clear, * If 'tis the wine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in glass or glass in twine.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King read my verse and said with a sigh, Were these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gifts[FN#245] in a man, he would excel all the folk of his time

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and age! Then he called for the chess board, and said, Say,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wilt thou play with me?; and I signed with my head, Yes. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I came forward and ordered the pieces and played with him two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: games, both of which I won. He was speechless with surprise; so I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took the pen case and, drawing forth a reed, wrote on the board

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these two couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Two hosts fare fighting thro' the livelong day * Nor is their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: battling ever finished,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Until, when darkness girdeth them about, * The twain go sleeping

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in a single bed.[FN#246]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King read these lines with wonder and delight and said to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Eunuch,[FN#247] O Mukbil, go to thy mistress, Sitt al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Husn,[FN#248] and say her, 'Come, speak the King who biddeth thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hither to take thy solace in seeing this right wondrous ape!' So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Eunuch went out and presently returned with the lady who,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when she saw me veiled her face and said, O my father! hast thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lost all sense of honour? How cometh it thou art pleased to send

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for me and show me to strange men? O Sitt al-Husn, said he,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no man is here save this little foot page and the Eunuch who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reared thee and I, thy father. From whom, then, cost thou veil

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy face? She answered, This whom thou deemest an ape is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young man, a clever and polite, a wise and learned and the son of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a King; but he is ensorcelled and the Ifrit Jirjaris, who is of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the seed of Iblis, cast a spell upon him, after putting to death

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his own wife the daughter of King Ifitamus lord of the Islands of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Abnus. The King marvelled at his daughter's words and, turning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to me, said, Is this true that she saith of thee?; and I signed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by a nod of my head the answer, Yea, verily; and wept sore.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he asked his daughter, Whence knewest thou that he is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ensorcelled?; and she answered, O my dear papa, there was with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me in my childhood an old woman, a wily one and a wise and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: witch to boot, and she taught me the theory of magic and its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: practice; and I took notes in writing and therein waxed perfect,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and have committed to memory an hundred and seventy chapters of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: egromantic formulas, by the least of which I could transport the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stones of thy city behind the Mountain Kaf and the Circumambient

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Main,[FN#249] or make its site an abyss of the sea and its people

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fishes swimming in the midst of it. O my daughter, said her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father, I conjure thee, by my life, disenchant this young man,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that I may make him my Wazir and marry thee to him, for indeed he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is an ingenious youth and a deeply learned. With joy and goodly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gree, she replied and, hending in hand an iron knife whereon was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: inscribed the name of Allah in Hebrew characters, she described a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wide circle--And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Fourteenth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kalandar continued his tale thus:--O my lady, the King's daughter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hent in hand a knife whereon were inscribed Hebrew characters and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: described a wide circle in the midst of the palace hall, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: therein wrote in Cufic letters mysterious names and talismans;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she uttered words and muttered charms, some of which we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: understood and others we understood not. Presently the world waxed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dark before our sight till we thought that the sky was falling

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon our heads, and lo! the Ifrit presented himself in his own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shape and aspect. His hands were like many pronged pitch forks,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his legs like the masts of great ships, and his eyes like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cressets of gleaming fire. We were in terrible fear of him but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King's daughter cried at him, No welcome to thee and no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greeting, O dog! whereupon he changed to the form of a lion and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, O traitress, how is it thou hast broken the oath we sware

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that neither should contraire other! O accursed one, answered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she, how could there be a compact between me and the like of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee? Then said he, Take what thou has brought on thy self;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the lion opened his jaws and rushed upon her; but she was too

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quick for him; and, plucking a hair from her head, waved it in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the air muttering over it the while; and the hair straightway

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: became a trenchant sword blade, wherewith she smote the lion and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cut him in twain. Then the two halves flew away in air and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: head changed to a scorpion and the Princess became a huge serpent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and set upon the accursed scorpion, and the two fought, coiling

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and uncoiling, a stiff fight for an hour at least. Then the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: scorpion changed to a vulture and the serpent became an eagle

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which set upon the vulture, and hunted him for an hour's time,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till he became a black tom cat, which miauled and grinned and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spat. Thereupon the eagle changed into a piebald wolf and these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: two battled in the palace for a long time, when the cat, seeing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself overcome, changed into a worm and crept into a huge red

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pomegranate,[FN#250] which lay beside the jetting fountain in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: midst of the palace hall. Whereupon the pomegranate swelled to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the size of a water melon in air; and, falling upon the marble

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pavement of the palace, broke to pieces, and all the grains fell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out and were scattered about till they covered the whole floor.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the wolf shook himself and became a snow white cock, which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell to picking up the grains purposing not to leave one; but by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: doom of destiny one seed rolled to the fountain edge and there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lay hid. The cock fell to crowing and clapping his wings and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: signing to us with his beak as if to ask, ' Are any grains left?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But we understood not what he meant, and he cried to us with so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loud a cry that we thought the palace would fall upon us. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ran over all the floor till he saw the grain which had rolled to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the fountain edge, and rushed eagerly to pick it up when behold,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it sprang into the midst of the water and became a fish and dived

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the bottom of the basin. Thereupon the cock changed to a big

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fish, and plunged in after the other, and the two disappeared for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a while and lo! we heard loud shrieks and cries of pain which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made us tremble. After this the Ifrit rose out of the water, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he was as a burning flame; casting fire and smoke from his mouth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and eyes and nostrils. And immediately the Princess likewise came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth from the basin and she was one live coal of flaming lowe;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and these two, she and he, battled for the space of an hour,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: until their fires entirely compassed them about and their thick

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: smoke filled the palace. As for us we panted for breath, being

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: well nigh suffocated, and we longed to plunge into the water

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fearing lest we be burnt up and utterly destroyed; and the King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, There is no Majesty and there is no Might save in Allah the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Glorious, the Great! Verily we are Allah's and unto Him are we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returning! Would Heaven I had not urged my daughter to attempt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the disenchantment of this ape fellow, whereby I have imposed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon her the terrible task of fighting yon accursed Ifrit against

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom all the Ifrits in the world could not prevail. And would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Heaven we had never seen this ape, Allah never assain nor bless

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the day of his coming! We thought to do a good deed by him before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the face of Allah,[FN#251] and to release him from enchantment,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and now we have brought this trouble and travail upon our heart.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But I, O my lady, was tongue tied and powerless to say a word to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him. Suddenly, ere we were ware of aught, the Ifrit yelled out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from under the flames and, coming up to us as we stood on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: estrade, blew fire in our faces. The damsel overtook him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: breathed blasts of fire at his face and the sparks from her and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from him rained down upon us, and her sparks did us no harm, but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one of his sparks alighted upon my eye and destroyed it making me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a monocular ape; and another fell on the King's face scorching

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the lower half, burning off his beard and mustachios and causing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his under teeth to fall out; while a third alighted on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Castrato's breast, killing him on the spot. So we despaired of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: life and made sure of death when lo! a voice repeated the saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah is most Highest! Allah is most Highest! Aidance and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: victory to all who the Truth believe; and disappointment and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disgrace to all who the religion of Mohammed, the Moon of Faith,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unbelieve. The speaker was the Princess who had burnt the Ifrit,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he was become a heap of ashes. Then she came up to us and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, Reach me a cup of water. They brought it to her and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spoke over it words we understood not, and sprinkling me with it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried, By virtue of the Truth, and by the Most Great name of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, I charge thee return to thy former shape. And behold, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shook, and became a man as before, save that I had utterly lost

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an eye. Then she cried out, The fire! The fire! O my dear papa

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an arrow from the accursed hath wounded me to the death, for I am

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not used to fight with the Jann; had he been a man I had slain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him in the beginning. I had no trouble till the time when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pomegranate burst and the grains scattered, but I overlooked the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seed wherein was the very life of the Jinni. Had I picked it up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he had died on the spot, but as Fate and Fortune decreed, I saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it not; so he came upon me all unawares and there befel between

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and me a sore struggle under the earth and high in air and in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the water; and, as often as I opened on him a gate,[FN#252] he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: opened on me another gate and a stronger, till at last he opened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on me the gate of fire, and few are saved upon whom the door of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fire openeth. But Destiny willed that my cunning prevail over his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cunning; and I burned him to death after I vainly exhorted him to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: embrace the religion of al-Islam. As for me I am a dead woman;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah supply my place to you! Then she called upon Heaven for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: help and ceased not to implore relief from the fire; when lo! a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: black spark shot up from her robed feet to her thighs; then it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flew to her bosom and thence to her face. When it reached her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: face she wept and said, I testify that there is no god but the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: God and that Mahommed is the Apostle of God! And we looked at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her and saw naught but a heap of ashes by the side of the heap

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that had been the Ifrit. We mourned for her and I wished I had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: been in her place, so had I not seen her lovely face who had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: worked me such weal become ashes; but there is no gainsaying the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will of Allah. When the King saw his daughter's terrible death,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he plucked out what was left of his beard and beat his face and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rent his raiment; and I did as he did and we both wept over her.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then came in the Chamberlains and Grandees and were amazed to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: find two heaps of ashes and the Sultan in a fainting fit; so they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stood round him till he revived and told them what had befallen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his daughter from the Ifrit; whereat their grief was right

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grievous and the women and the slave girls shrieked and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: keened,[FN#253] and they continued their lamentations for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: space of seven days. Moreover the King bade build over his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter's ashes a vast vaulted tomb, and burn therein wax tapers

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and sepulchral lamps: but as for the Ifrit's ashes they scattered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them on the winds, speeding them to the curse of Allah. Then the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sultan fell sick of a sickness that well nigh brought him to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: death for a month's space; and, when health returned to him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his beard grew again and he had been converted by the mercy of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah to al-Islam, he sent for me and said, O youth, Fate had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: decreed for us the happiest of lives, safe from all the chances

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and changes of Time, till thou camest to us, when troubles fell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon us. Would to Heaven we had never seen thee and the foul face

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of thee! For we took pity on thee and thereby we have lost our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all. I have on thy account first lost my daughter who to me was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: well worth an hundred men, secondly I have suffered that which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befel me by reason of the fire and the loss of my teeth, and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Eunuch also was slain. I blame thee not, for it was out of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: power to prevent this: the doom of Allah was on thee as well as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on us and thanks be to the Almighty for that my daughter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: delivered thee, albeit thereby she lost her own life! Go forth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: now, O my son, from this my city, and suffice thee what hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befallen us through thee, even although 'twas decreed for us. Go

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth in peace; and if I ever see thee again I will surely slay

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. And he cried out at me. So I went forth from his presence,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O my lady, weeping bitterly and hardly believing in my escape and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knowing not whither I should wend. And I recalled all that had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befallen me, my meeting the tailor, my love for the damsel in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palace beneath the earth, and my narrow escape from the Ifrit,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: even after he had determined to do me die; and how I had entered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the city as an ape and was now leaving it a man once more. Then I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gave thanks to Allah and said, My eye and not my life! and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before leaving the place I entered the bath and shaved my poll

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and beard and mustachios and eye brows; and cast ashes on my head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and donned the coarse black woollen robe of a Kalandar. Then I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fared forth, O my lady, and every day I pondered all the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: calamities which had betided me, and I wept and repeated these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I am distraught, yet verily His ruth abides with me, * Tho'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: round me gather hosts of ills, whence come I cannot see:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Patient I'll be till Patience self with me impatient wax; *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Patient for ever till the Lord fulfil my destiny:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Patient I'll bide without complaint, a wronged and vanquish man;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: * Patient as sunparcht wight that spans the desert's sandy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sea:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Patient I'll be till Aloe's[FN#254] self unwittingly allow * I'm

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: patient under bitterer things than bitterest aloë:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: No bitterer things than aloes or than patience for mankind, * Yet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bitterer than the twain to me were Patience' treachery:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: My sere and seamed and seared brow would dragoman my sore *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If soul could search my sprite and there unsecret secrecy:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Were hills to bear the load I bear they'd crumble 'neath the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weight, * 'Twould still the roaring wind, 'twould quench the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flame-tongue's flagrancy,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And whoso saith the world is sweet certès a day he'll see * With

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more than aloes' bitterness and aloes' pungency.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I journeyed through many regions and saw many a city

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: intending for Baghdad, that I might seek audience, in the House

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of Peace,[FN#255] with the Commander of the Faithful and tell him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all that had befallen me. I arrived here this very night and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found my brother in Allah, this first Kalandar, standing about as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one perplexed; so I saluted him with Peace be upon thee, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered into discourse with him. Presently up came our brother,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this third Kalandar, and said to us, Peace be with you! I am a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stranger; whereto we replied, And we too be strangers, who have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: come hither this blessed night. So we all three walked on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: together, none of us knowing the other's history, till Destiny

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crave us to this door and we came in to you. Such then is my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: story and my reason for shaving my beard and mustachios, and this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is what caused the loss of my eye. Said the house mistress, Thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tale is indeed a rare; so rub thy head and wend thy ways; but he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied, I will not budge till I hear my companions' stories.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then came forward the third Kalandar, and said, O illustrious

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady! my history is not like that of these my comrades, but more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wondrous and far more marvellous. In their case Fate and Fortune

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came down on them unawares; but I drew down destiny upon my own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: head and brought sorrow on mine own soul, and shaved my own beard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and lost my own eye. Hear then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Third Kalandar's Tale.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O my lady, that I also am a King and the son of a King and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my name is Ajíb son of Kazíb. When my father died I succeeded

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him; and I ruled and did justice and dealt fairly by all my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lieges. I delighted in sea trips, for my capital stood on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shore, before which the ocean stretched far and wide; and near

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand were many great islands with sconces and garrisons in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: midst of the main. My fleet numbered fifty merchantmen, and as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: many yachts for pleasance, and an hundred and fifty sail ready

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fitted for holy war with the Unbelievers. It fortuned that I had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a mind to enjoy myself on the islands aforesaid, so I took ship

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with my people in ten keel; and, carrying with me a month's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: victual, I set out on a twenty days' voyage. But one night a head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wind struck us, and the sea rose against us with huge waves; the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: billows sorely buffetted us and a dense darkness settled round

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us. We gave ourselves up for lost and I said, Whoso endangereth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his days, e'en an he 'scape deserveth no praise. Then we prayed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to Allah and besought Him; but the storm blasts ceased not to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blow against us nor the surges to strike us till morning broke

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when the gale fell, the seas sank to mirrory stillness and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sun shone upon us kindly clear. Presently we made an island where

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we landed and cooked somewhat of food, and ate heartily and took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our rest for a couple of days. Then we set out again and sailed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other twenty days, the seas broadening and the land shrinking.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Presently the current ran counter to us, and we found ourselves

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in strange waters, where the Captain had lost his reckoning, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was wholly bewildered in this sea; so said we to the look out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man,[FN#256] Get thee to the mast head and keep thine eyes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: open. He swarmed up the mast and looked out and cried aloud, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Rais, I espy to starboard something dark, very like a fish

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: floating on the face of the sea, and to larboard there is a loom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the midst of the main, now black and now bright. When the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Captain heard the look out's words he dashed his turband on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deck and plucked out his beard and beat his face saying, Good

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: news indeed! we be all dead men; not one of us can be saved. And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he fell to weeping and all of us wept for his weeping and also

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for our lives; and I said, O Captain, tell us what it is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: look out saw. O my Prince, answered he, know that we lost our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: course on the night of the storm, which was followed on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: morrow by a two days' calm during which we made no way; and we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have gone astray eleven days reckoning from that night, with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ne'er a wind to bring us back to our true course. Tomorrow by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the end of the day we shall come to a mountain of black stone,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: highs the Magnet Mountain;[FN#257] for thither the currents carry

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us willy-nilly. As soon as we are under its lea, the ship's sides

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will open and every nail in plank will fly out and cleave fast to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the mountain; for that Almighty Allah hath gifted the loadstone

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a mysterious virtue and a love for iron, by reason whereof

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all which is iron travelleth towards it; and on this mountain is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: much iron, how much none knoweth save the Most High, from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: many vessels which have been lost there since the days of yore.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The bright spot upon its summit is a dome of yellow laton from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Andalusia, vaulted upon ten columns; and on its crown is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: horseman who rideth a horse of brass and holdeth in hand a lance

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of laton; and there hangeth on his bosom a tablet of lead graven

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with names and talismans. And he presently added, And, O King,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: none destroyeth folk save the rider on that steed, nor will the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
