text: egromancy be dispelled till he fall from his horse.''[FN#258]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then, O my lady, the Captain wept with exceeding weeping and we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all made sure of death doom and each and every one of us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: farewelled his friend and charged him with his last will and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: testament in case he might be saved. We slept not that night and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the morning we found ourselves much nearer the Loadstone

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mountain, whither the waters crave us with a violent send. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the ships were close under its lea they opened and the nails flew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out and all the iron in them sought the Magnet Mountain and clove

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to it like a network; so that by the end of the day we were all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: struggling in the waves round about the mountain. Some of us were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saved, but more were drowned and even those who had escaped knew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not one another, so stupefied were they by the beating of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: billows and the raving of the winds. As for me, O my lady, Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (be His name exalted!) preserved my life that I might suffer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whatso He willed to me of hardship, misfortune and calamity; for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I scrambled upon a plank from one of the ships, and the wind and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waters threw it at the feet of the Mountain. There I found a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: practicable path leading by steps carven out of the rock to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: summit, and I called on the name of Allah Almighty[FN#259]--And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased to say her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Fifteenth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She continued, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: third Kalandar said to the lady (the rest of the party sitting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fast bound and the slaves standing with swords drawn over their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heads):--And after calling on the name of Almighty Allah and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: passionately beseeching Him, I breasted the ascent, clinging to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the steps and notches hewn in the stone, and mounted little by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: little. And the Lord stilled the wind and aided me in the ascent,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so that I succeeded in reaching the summit. There I found no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: resting place save the dome, which I entered, joying with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding joy at my escape; and made the Wuzu-ablution[FN#260]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and prayed a two bow prayer,[FN#261] a thanksgiving to God for my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: preservation. Then I fell asleep under the dome, and heard in my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dream a mysterious Voice[FN#262] saying, O son of Khazib! when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou wakest from thy sleep dig under thy feet and thou shalt find

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a bow of brass and three leaden arrows, inscribed with talismans

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and characts. Take the bow and shoot the arrows at the horseman

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the dome top and free mankind from this sore calamity. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou hast shot him he shall fall into the sea, and the horse will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: also drop at thy feet: then bury it in the place of the bow. This

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: done, the main will swell and rise till it is level with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mountain head, and there will appear on it a skiff carrying a man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of laton (other than he thou shalt have shot) holding in his hand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a pair of paddles. He will come to thee and do thou embark with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him but beware of saying Bismillah or of otherwise naming Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Almighty. He will row thee for a space of ten days, till he bring

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee to certain Islands called the Islands of Safety, and thence

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou shalt easily reach a port and find those who will convey

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee to thy native land; and all this shall be fulfilled to thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so thou call not on the name of Allah. Then I started up from my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sleep in joy and gladness and, hastening to do the bidding of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mysterious Voice, found the bow and arrows and shot at the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: horseman and tumbled him into the main, whilst the horse dropped

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at my feet; so I took it and buried it. Presently the sea surged

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up and rose till it reached the top of the mountain; nor had I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: long to wait ere I saw a skiff in the offing coming towards me. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gave thanks to Allah; and, when the skiff came up to me, I saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: therein a man of brass with a tablet of lead on his breast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: inscribed with talismans and characts; and I embarked without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uttering a word. The boatman rowed on with me through the first

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day and the second and the third, in all ten whole days, till I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: caught sight of the Islands of Safety; whereat I joyed with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding joy and for stress of gladness exclaimed, Allah!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah! In the name of Allah! There is no god but the God and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah is Almighty.''[FN#263] Thereupon the skiff forthwith upset

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and cast me upon the sea; then it righted and sank deep into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: depths. Now I am a fair swimmer, so I swam the whole day till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nightfall, when my forearms and shoulders were numbed with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fatigue and I felt like to die; so I testified to my faith,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: expecting naught but death. The sea was still surging under the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: violence of the winds, and presently there came a billow like a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hillock; and, bearing me up high in air, threw me with a long

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cast on dry land, that His will might be fulfilled. I crawled up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the beach and doffing my raiment wrung it out to dry and spread

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it in the sunshine: then I lay me down and slept the whole night.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: As soon as it was day, I donned my clothes and rose to look

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whither I should walk. Presently I came to a thicket of low

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trees; and, making a cast round it, found that the spot whereon I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stood was an islet, a mere holm, girt on all sides by the ocean;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon I said to myself, Whatso freeth me from one great

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: calamity casteth me into a greater! But while I was pondering my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: case and longing for death behold, I saw afar off a ship making

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the island; so I clomb a tree and hid myself among the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: branches. Presently the ship anchored and landed ten slaves,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blackamoors, bearing iron hoes and baskets, who walked on till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they reached the middle of the island. Here they dug deep into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the ground, until they uncovered a plate of metal which they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lifted, thereby opening a trap door. After this they returned to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the ship and thence brought bread and flour, honey and fruits,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clarified butter,[FN#264] leather bottles containing liquors and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: many household stuffs; also furniture, table service and mirrors

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rugs, carpets and in fact all needed to furnish a dwelling; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they kept going to and fro, and descending by the trap door, till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they had transported into the dwelling all that was in the ship.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: After this the slaves again went on board and brought back with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them garments as rich as may be, and in the midst of them came an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: old, old man, of whom very little was left, for Time had dealt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hardly and harshly with him, and all that remained of him was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bone wrapped in a rag of blue stuff through which the winds

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whistled west and east. As saith the poet of him:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Time gars me tremble Ah, how sore the baulk! * While Time in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pride of strength cloth ever stalk:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Time was I walked nor ever felt I tired, * Now am I tired albe I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: never walk!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And the Shaykh held by the hand a youth cast in beauty's mould,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all elegance and perfect grace; so fair that his comeliness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deserved to be proverbial; for he was as a green bough or the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tender young of the roe, ravishing every heart with his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loveliness and subduing every soul with his coquetry and amorous

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ways.[FN#265] It was of him the poet spake when he said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Beauty they brought with him to make compare, * But Beauty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hung her head in shame and care:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth' they, O Beauty, hast thou seen his like? * And Beauty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried, His like? not anywhere!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They stinted not their going, O my lady, till all went down by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the trap door and did not reappear for an hour, or rather more;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at the end of which time the slaves and the old man came up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without the youth and, replacing the iron plate and carefully

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: closing the door slab as it was before, they returned to the ship

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and made sail and were lost to my sight. When they turned away to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: depart, I came down from the tree and, going to the place I had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seen them fill up, scraped off and removed the earth; and in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: patience possessed my soul till I had cleared the whole of it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: away. Then appeared the trap door which was of wood, in shape and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: size like a millstone; and when I lifted it up it disclosed a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: winding staircase of stone. At this I marvelled and, descending

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the steps till I reached the last, found a fair hall, spread with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: various kinds of carpets and silk stuffs, wherein was a youth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sitting upon a raised couch and leaning back on a round cushion

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a fan in his hand and nosegays and posies of sweet scented

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: herbs and flowers before him;[FN#266] but he was alone and not a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soul near him in the great vault. When he saw me he turned pale;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but I saluted him courteously and said, Set thy mind at ease and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: calm thy fears; no harm shall come near thee; I am a man like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thyself and the son of a King to boot; whom the decrees of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Destiny have sent to bear thee company and cheer thee in thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loneliness. But now tell me, what is thy story and what causeth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee to dwell thus in solitude under the ground? When he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: assured that I was of his kind and no Jinni, he rejoiced and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fine colour returned; and, making me draw near to him he said, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my brother, my story is a strange story and 'tis this. My father

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is a merchant-jeweller possessed of great wealth, who hath white

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and black slaves travelling and trading on his account in ships

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and on camels, and trafficking with the most distant cities; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he was not blessed with a child, not even one. Now on a certain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night he dreamed a dream that he should be favoured with a son,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who would be short lived; so the morning dawned on my father

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bringing him woe and weeping. On the following night my mother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: conceived and my father noted down the date of her becoming

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pregnant.[FN#267] Her time being fulfilled she bare me; whereat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my father rejoiced and made banquets and called together the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neighbors and fed the Fakirs and the poor, for that he had been

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blessed with issue near the end of his days. Then he assembled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the astrologers and astronomers who knew the places of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: planets, and the wizards and wise ones of the time, and men

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: learned in horoscopes and nativities,[FN#268] and they drew out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my birth scheme and said to my father, Thy son shall live to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fifteen years, but in his fifteenth there is a sinister aspect;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an he safely tide it over he shall attain a great age. And the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cause that threateneth him with death is this. In the Sea of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Peril standeth the Mountain Magnet hight; on whose summit is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: horseman of yellow laton seated on a horse also of brass and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bearing on his breast a tablet of lead. Fifty days after this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rider shall fall from his steed thy son will die and his slayer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will be he who shoots down the horseman, a Prince named Ajib son

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of King Khazib. My father grieved with exceeding grief to hear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these words; but reared me in tenderest fashion and educated me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: excellently well until my fifteenth year was told. Ten days ago

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: news came to him that the horseman had fallen into the sea and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who shot him down was named Ajib son of King Khazib. My father

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thereupon wept bitter tears at the need of parting with me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: became like one possessed of a Jinni. However, being in mortal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fear for me, he built me this place under the earth; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stocking it with all required for the few days still remaining,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he brought me hither in a ship and left me here. Ten are already

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: past and, when the forty shall have gone by without danger to me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he will come and take me away; for he hath done all this only in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fear of Prince Ajib. Such, then, is my story and the cause of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loneliness. When I heard his history I marvelled and said in my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mind, I am the Prince Ajib who hath done all this; but as Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is with me I will surely not slay him! So said I to him, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lord, far from thee be this hurt and harm and then, please Allah,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou shalt not suffer cark nor care nor aught disquietude, for I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will tarry with thee and serve thee as a servant, and then wend

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my ways; and after having borne thee company during the forty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days, I will go with thee to thy home where thou shalt give me an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: escort of some of thy Mamelukes with whom I may journey back to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my own city; and the Almighty shall requite thee for me. He was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: glad to hear these words, when I rose and lighted a large wax

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: candle and trimmed the ramps end the three lanterns; and I set on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: meat and drink and sweetmeats. We ate and drank and sat talking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over various matters till the greater part of the night was gone;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when he lay down to rest and I covered him up and went to sleep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: myself. Next morning I arose and warmed a little water, then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lifted him gently so as to awake him and brought him the warm

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: water wherewith he washed his face[FN#269] and said to me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Heaven requite thee for me with every blessing, O youth! By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, if I get quit of this danger and am saved from him whose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: name is Ajib bin Khazib, I will make my father reward thee and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: send thee home healthy and wealthy; and, if I die, then my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blessing be upon thee. I answered, May the day never dawn on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which evil shall betide thee; and may Allah make my last day

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before thy last day! Then I set before him somewhat of food and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we ate; and I got ready perfumes for fumigating the hall,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wherewith he was pleased. Moreover I made him a Mankalah-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cloth;[FN#270] and we played and ate sweetmeats and we played

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again and took our pleasure till nightfall, when I rose and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lighted the lamps, and set before him somewhat to eat, and sat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: telling him stories till the hours of darkness were far spent.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he lay down to rest and I covered him up and rested also.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And thus I continued to do, O my lady, for days and nights and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: affection for him took root in my heart and my sorrow was eased,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I said to myself, The astrologers lied[FN#271] when they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: predicted that he should be slain by Ajib bin Khazib: by Allah, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will not slay him. I ceased not ministering to him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: conversing and carousing with him and telling him all manner

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tales for thirty nine days. On the fortieth night[FN#272] the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth rejoiced and said, O my brother, Alhamdo, lillah!--praise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be to Allah--who hath preserved me from death and this is by thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blessing and the blessing of thy coming to me and I pray God that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He restore thee to thy native land. But now, O my brother, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would thou warm me some water for the Ghusl ablution and do thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kindly bathe me and change my clothes. I replied, With love and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gladness; and I heated water in plenty and carrying it in to him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: washed his body all over the washing of health,[FN#273] with meal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of lupins[FN#274] and rubbed him well and changed his clothes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spread him a high bed whereon he lay down to rest, being drowsy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after bathing. Then said he, O my brother, cut me up a water

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: melon, and sweeten it with a little sugar candy.[FN#275] So I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went to the store room and bringing out a fine water melon I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found there, set it on a platter and laid it before him saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O my master hast thou not a knife? Here it is, answered he,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over my head upon the high shelf. So I got up in haste and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: taking the knife drew it from its sheath; but my foot slipped in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stepping down and I fell heavily upon the youth holding in my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand the knife which hastened to fulfil what had been written on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Day that decided the destinies of man, and buried itself, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: if planted, in the youth's heart. He died on the instant. When I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw that he was slain and knew that I had slain him, maugre

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: myself, I cried out with an exceeding loud and bitter cry and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beat my face and rent my raiment and said, Verily we be Allah's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and unto Him we be returning, O Moslems! O folk fain of Allah!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there remained for this youth but one day of the forty dangerous

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days which the astrologers and the learned had foretold for him;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the predestined death of this beautiful one was to be at my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand. Would Heaven I had not tried to cut the watermelon. What

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dire misfortune is this I must bear fief or loath? What a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disaster! What an affliction! O Allah mine, I implore thy pardon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and declare to Thee my innocence of his death. But what God

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: willeth let that come to pass.''[FN#276]--And Shahrazad perceived

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the dawn of day and ceased to say her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Sixteenth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that Ajib thus

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: continued his tale to the lady:--When I was certified that I had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slain him, I arose and ascending the stairs replaced the trap-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: door and covered it with earth as before. Then I looked out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seawards and saw the ship cleaving the waters and making for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: island, wherefore I was afeard and said, The moment they come

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and see the youth done to death, they will know 'twas I who slew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and will slay me without respite. So I climbed up into a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: high tree and concealed myself among its leaves; and hardly had I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: done so when the ship anchored and the slaves landed with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ancient man, the youth's father, and made direct for the place

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and when they removed the earth they were surprised to see it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soft.[FN#277] Then they raised the trap door and went down and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found the youth lying at full length, clothed in fair new

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: garments, with a face beaming after the bath, and the knife deep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in his heart. At the sight they shrieked and wept and beat their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: faces, loudly cursing the murderer; whilst a swoon came over the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shaykh so that the slaves deemed him dead, unable to survive his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son. At last they wrapped the slain youth in his clothes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carried him up and laid him on the ground covering him with a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shroud of silk. Whilst they were making for the ship the old man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: revived; and, gazing on his son who was stretched out, fell on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the ground and strewed dust over his head and smote his face and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: plucked out his beard; and his weeping redoubled as he thought of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his murdered son and he swooned away once more. After awhile a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave went and fetched a strip of silk whereupon they lay the old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man and sat down at his head. All this took place and I was on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the tree above them watching everything that came to pass; and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart became hoary before my head waxed grey, for the hard lot

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which was mine, and for the distress and anguish I had undergone,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I fell to reciting:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How many a joy by Allah's will hath fled * With flight escaping

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sight of wisest head!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How many a sadness shall begin the day, * Yet grow right

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gladsome ere the day is sped!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How many a weal trips on the heels of ill, * Causing the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mourner's heart with joy to thrill![FN#278]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But the old man, O my lady, ceased not from his swoon till near

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sunset, when he came to himself and, looking upon his dead son,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he recalled what had happened, and how what he had dreaded had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: come to pass; and he beat his face and head and recited these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Racked is my heart by parting fro' my friends * And two rills

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ever fro' my eyelids flow:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: With them[FN#279] went forth my hopes, Ah, well away! * What

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shift remaineth me to say or do?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Would I had never looked upon their sight, * What shift, fair

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sirs, when paths e'er strainer grow?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: What charm shall calm my pangs when this wise burn * Longings

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of love which in my vitals glow?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Would I had trod with them the road of Death! * Ne'er had befel

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us twain this parting blow:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah: I pray the Truthful show me Roth * And mix our lives nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: part them evermo'e!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How blest were we as 'death one roof we dwelt * Conjoined in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: joys nor recking aught of woe;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Till Fortune shot us pith the severance shaft; * Ah who shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: patient bear such parting throe?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And dart of Death struck down amid the tribe * The age's pearl

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that Morn saw brightest show:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I cried the while his case took speech and said:--* Would Heaven,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my son, Death mote his doom foreslow!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Which be the readiest road wi' thee to meet * My Son! for whom I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would my soul bestow?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If sun I call him no! the sun cloth set; * If moon I call him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wane the moons; Ah no!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O sad mischance o' thee, O doom of days, * Thy place none other

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: love shall ever know:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thy sire distracted sees thee, but despairs * By wit or wisdom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fate to overthrow:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Some evil eye this day hath cast its spell * And foul befal him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as it foul befel!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he sobbed a single sob and his soul fled his flesh. The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slaves shrieked aloud, Alas, our lord! and showered dust on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their heads and redoubled their weeping and wailing. Presently

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they carried their dead master to the ship side by side with his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dead son and, having transported all the stuff from the dwelling

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the vessel, set sail and disappeared from mine eyes. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: descended from the tree and, raising the trap-door, went down

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: into the underground dwelling where everything reminded me of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth; and I looked upon the poor remains of him and began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repeating these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Their tracks I see, and pine with pain and pang * And on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deserted hearths I weep and yearn:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And Him I pray who doomed them depart * Some day vouchsafe

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the boon of safe return.''[FN#280]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then, O my lady, I went up again by the trap-door, and every day

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I used to wander round about the island and every night I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned to the underground hall. Thus I lived for a month, till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at last, looking at the western side of the island, I observed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that every day the tides ebbed, leaving shallow water for which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the flow did not compensate; and by the end of the month the sea

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: showed dry land in that direction. At this I rejoiced making

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: certain of my safety; so I arose and fording what little was left

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the water got me to the mainland, where I fell in with great

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heaps of loose sand in which even a camel's hoof would sink up to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the knee.[FN#281] However I emboldened my soul and wading through

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sand behold, a fire shone from afar burning with a brazing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: light.[FN#282] So I made for it hoping haply to find succour, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: broke out into these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Belike Fortune may her bridle turn * And Time bring weal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: although he's jealous hight;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Forward my hopes, and further all my needs, * And passed ills

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with present weals requite.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And when I drew near the fire aforesaid lo! it was a palace with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gates of copper burnished red which, when the rising sun shone

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thereon, gleamed and glistened from afar showing what had seemed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to me a fire. I rejoiced in the sight, and sat down over against

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the gate, but I was hardly settled in my seat before there met me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ten young men clothed in sumptuous gear and all were blind of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: left eye which appeared as plucked out. They were accompanied by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a Shaykh, an old, old man, and much I marvelled at their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: appearance, and their all being blind of the same eye. When they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw me, they saluted me with the Salam and asked me of my case

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and my history; whereupon I related to them all what had befallen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, and what full measure of misfortune was mine. Marvelling at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my tale they took me to the mansion, where I saw ranged round the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hall ten couches each with its blue bedding and coverlet of blue

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stuff[FN#283] and amiddlemost stood a smaller couch furnished

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like them with blue and nothing else. As we entered each of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youths took his seat on his own couch and the old man seated

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself upon the smaller one in the middle saying to me, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth, sit thee down on the floor and ask not of our case nor of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the loss of our eyes. Presently he rose up and set before each

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young man some meat in a charger and drink in a large mazer,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: treating me in like manner; and after that they sat questioning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me concerning my adventures and what had betided me: and I kept

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: telling them my tale till the night was far spent. Then said the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young men, O our Shaykh, wilt not thou set before us our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ordinary? The time is come. He replied, With love and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gladness, and rose and entering a closet disappeared, but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presently returned bearing on his head ten trays each covered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a strip of blue stuff. He set a tray before each youth and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lighting ten wax candles, he stuck one upon each tray, and drew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: off the covers and lo! under them was naught but ashes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: powdered charcoal and kettle soot. Then all the young men tucked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up their sleeves to the elbows and fell a weeping and wailing and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they blackened their faces and smeared their clothes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: buffetted their brows and beat their breasts, continually

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exclaiming, We were sitting at our ease but our frowardness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought us unease!  They ceased not to do this till dawn drew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nigh, when the old man rose and heated water for them; and they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: washed their faces, and donned other and clean clothes. Now when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I saw this, O my lady, for very wonderment my senses left me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my wits went wild and heart and head were full of thought, till I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forgot what had betided me and I could not keep silence feeling I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fain must speak out and question them of these strangenesses; so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I said to them, How come ye to do this after we have been so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: open hearted and frolicksome? Thanks be to Allah ye be all sound

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and sane, yet actions such as these befit none but mad men or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: those possessed of an evil spirit. I conjure you by all that is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dearest to you, why stint ye to tell me your history, and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cause of your losing your eyes and your blackening your faces

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with ashes and soot? Hereupon they turned to me and said, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young man, hearken not to thy youthtide's suggestions and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: question us no questions. Then they slept and I with them and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when they awoke the old man brought us somewhat of food; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after we had eaten and the plates and goblets had been removed,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they sat conversing till night fall when the old man rose and lit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the wax candles and lamps and set meat and drink before us. After

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we had eaten and drunken we sat conversing and carousing in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: companionage till the noon of night, when they said to the old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man, Bring us our ordinary, for the hour of sleep is at hand!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So he rose and brought them the trays of soot and ashes; and they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: did as they had done on the preceding night, nor more, nor less.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I abode with them after this fashion for the space of a month

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: during which time they used to blacken their faces with ashes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: every night, and to wash and change their raiment when the morn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was young; and I but marvelled the more and my scruples and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: curiosity increased to such a point that I had to forego even

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: food and drink. At last, I lost command of myself, for my heart

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was aflame with fire unquenchable and lowe unconcealable and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, O young men, will ye not relieve my trouble and acquaint

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me with the reason of thus blackening your faces and the meaning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of your words:--We were sitting at our ease but our frowardness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought us unease? Quoth they 'Twere better to keep these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: things secret. Still I was bewildered by their doings to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: point of abstaining from eating and drinking and, at last wholly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: losing patience, quoth I to them, There is no help for it: ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: must acquaint me with what is the reason of these doings. They

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied, We kept our secret only for thy good: to gratify thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will bring down evil upon thee and thou wilt become a monocular

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: even as we are. I repeated There is no help for it and, if ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will not, let me leave you and return to mine own people and be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at rest from seeing these things, for the proverb saith:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Better ye 'bide and I take my leave: * For what eye sees not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart shall never grieve.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon they said to me, Remember, O youth, that should ill

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befal thee we will not again harbour thee nor suffer thee to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abide amongst us; and bringing a ram they slaughtered it and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: skinned it. Lastly they gave me a knife saying, Take this skin

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and stretch thyself upon it and we will sew it around thee,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presently there shall come to thee a certain bird, hight

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Rukh,[FN#284] that will catch thee up in his pounces and tower

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: high in air and then set thee down on a mountain. When thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: feelest he is no longer flying, rip open the pelt with this blade

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and come out of it; the bird will be scared and will fly away and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leave thee free. After this fare for half a day, and the march

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will place thee at a palace wondrous fair to behold, towering

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: high in air and builded of Khalanj[FN#285], lign-aloes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sandal-wood, plated with red gold, and studded with all manner

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: emeralds and costly gems fit for seal rings. Enter it and thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shalt win to thy wish for we have all entered that palace; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: such is the cause of our losing our eyes and of our blackening

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our faces. Were we now to tell thee our stories it would take too

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: long a time; for each and every of us lost his left eye by an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: adventure of his own. I rejoiced at their words and they did

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with me as they said; and the bird Rukh bore me off end set me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down on the mountain. Then I came out of the skin and walked on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till I reached the palace. The door stood open as I entered and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found myself in a spacious and goodly hall, wide exceedingly,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: even as a horse-course; and around it were an hundred chambers

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with doors of sandal and aloes woods plated with red gold and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: furnished with silver rings by way of knockers.[FN#286] At the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: head or upper end[FN#287] of the hall I saw forty damsels,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sumptuously dressed and ornamented and one and all bright as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: moons; none could ever tire of gazing upon them and all so lovely

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that the most ascetic devotee on seeing them would become their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave and obey their will. When they saw me the whole bevy came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up to me and said Welcome and well come and good cheer[FN#288]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to thee, O our lord! This whole month have we been expecting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. Praised be Allah who hath sent us one who is worthy of us,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: even as we are worthy of him! Then they made me sit down upon a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: high divan and said to me, This day thou art our lord and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master, and we are thy servants and thy hand-maids, so order us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as thou wilt. And I marvelled at their case. Presently one of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them arose and set meat before me and I ate and they ate with me;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilst others warmed water and washed my hands and feet and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: changed my clothes and others made ready sherbets and gave us to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drink; and all gathered around me being full of joy and gladness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at my coming. Then they sat down and conversed with me till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nightfall, when five of them arose and laid the trays and spread

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them with flowers and fragrant herbs and fruits, fresh and dried,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and confections in profusion. At last they brought out a fine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wine service with rich old wine; and we sat down to drink and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: some sang songs and others played the lute and psaltery and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recorders and other instruments, and the bowl went merrily round.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hereupon such gladness possessed me that I forgot the sorrows of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the world one and all and said, This is indeed life; O sad that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tis fleeting! I enjoyed their company till the time came for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rest; and our heads were all warm with wine, when they said, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our lord, choose from amongst us her who shall be thy bed-fellow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this night and not lie with thee again till forty days be past.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So I chose a girl fair of face and perfect in shape, with eyes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kohl-edged by nature's hand;[FN#289] hair long and jet black with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slightly parted teeth[FN#290] and joining brows: 'twas as if she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were some limber graceful branchlet or the slender stalk of sweet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: basil to amaze and to bewilder man's fancy, even as the poet said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of such an one--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: To even her with greeny bough were vain * Fool he who finds her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beauties in the roe:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When hath the roe those lively lovely limbs * Or honey dews those

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lips alone bestow?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Those eyne, soul piercing eyne, which slay with love, * Which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bind the victim by their shafts laid low?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: My heart to second childhood they beguiled * No wonder: love

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sick-man again is child!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And I repeated to her the maker's words who said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: None other charms but thine shall greet mine eyes, * Nor other

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: image can my heart surprise:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thy love, my lady, captives all my thoughts * And on that love

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I'll die and I'll arise.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So I lay with her that night; none fairer I ever knew; and, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it was morning, the damsels carried me to the Hammam bath and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bathed me and robed me in fairest apparel. Then they served up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: food, and we ate and drank and the cup went round till nightfall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when I chose from among them one fair of form and face, soft-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sided and a model of grace, such an one as the poet described

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when he said.--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: On her fair bosom caskets twain I scanned, * Sealed fast with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: musk seals lovers to withstand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: With arrowy glances stand on guard her eyes, * Whose shafts

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would shoot who dares put forth a hand.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: With her I spent a most goodly night; and, to be brief, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mistress, I remained with them in all solace and delight of life,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eating and drinking, conversing and carousing and every night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lying with one or other of them. But at the head of the new year

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they came to me in tears and bade me farewell, weeping and crying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out and clinging about me: whereat I wondered and said, What may

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be the matter? verily you break my heart! They exclaimed, Would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Heaven we had never known thee; for, though we have companies

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with many, yet never saw we a pleasanter than thou or a more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: courteous. And they wept again. But tell me more clearly,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asked I, what causeth this weeping which maketh my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gall-bladder[FN#291] like to burst; and they answered, O our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lord and master, it is severance which maketh us weep; and thou,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and thou only, art the cause of our tears. If thou hearken to us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we need never be parted and if thou hearken not we part for ever;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but our hearts tell us that thou wilt not listen to our words and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this is the cause of our tears and cries. Tell me how the case

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: standeth? Know, O our lord, that we are the daughters of Kings

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who have met here and have lived together for years; and once in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: every year we are perforce absent for forty days; and afterwards

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we return and abide here for the rest of the twelve month eating

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and drinking and taking our pleasure and enjoying delights: we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are about to depart according to our custom; and we fear lest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after we be gone thou contraire our charge and disobey our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: injunctions. Here now we commit to thee the keys of the palace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which containeth forty chambers and thou mayest open of these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thirty and nine, but beware (and we conjure thee by Allah and by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the lives of us!) lest thou open the fortieth door, for therein

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is that which shall separate us for ever.[FN#292] Quoth I,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Assuredly I will not open it, if it contain the cause of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: severance from you. Then one among them came up to me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: falling on my neck wept and recited these verses.--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If Time unite us after absent while, * The world harsh frowning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on our lot shall smile

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And if thy semblance deign adorn mine eyes,[FN#293] * I'll

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pardon Time past wrongs and by gone guile.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And I recited the following:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When drew she near to bid adieu with heart unstrung, * While

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: care and longing on that day her bosom wrung

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wet pearls she wept and mine like red carnelians rolled * And,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: joined in sad rivière, around her neck they hung.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I saw her weeping I said, By Allah I will never open that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fortieth door, never and no wise! and I bade her farewell.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon all departed flying away like birds; signalling with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their hands farewells as they went and leaving me alone in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palace. When evening drew near I opened the door of the first

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chamber and entering it found myself in a place like one of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pleasaunces of Paradise. It was a garden with trees of freshest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: green and ripe fruits of yellow sheen; and its birds were singing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clear and keen and rills ran wimpling through the fair terrene.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The sight and sounds brought solace to my sprite; and I walked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: among the trees, and I smelt the breath of the flowers on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: breeze; and heard the birdies sing their melodies hymning the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: One, the Almighty in sweetest litanies; and I looked upon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: apple whose hue is parcel red and parcel yellow; as said the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poet:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Apple whose hue combines in union mellow * My fair's red cheek,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her hapless lover's yellow.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I looked upon the quince, and inhaled its fragrance which to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shame musk and ambergris, even as the poet hath said :

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quince every taste conjoins; in her are found * Gifts which for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: queen of fruits the Quince have crowned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Her taste is wine, her scent the waft of musk; * Pure gold her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hue, her shape the Moon's fair round.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I looked upon the pear whose taste surpasseth sherbet and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sugar; and the apricot[FN#294] whose beauty striketh the eye with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: admiration, as if she were a polished ruby. Then I went out of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the place and locked the door as it was before. When it was the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: morrow I opened the second door; and entering found myself in a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spacious plain set with tall date palms and watered by a running

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stream whose banks were shrubbed with bushes of rose and jasmine,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: while privet and eglantine, oxe-eye, violet and lily, narcissus,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: origane and the winter gilliflower carpeted the borders; and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: breath of the breeze swept over these sweet smelling growths

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: diffusing their delicious odours right and left, perfuming the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: world and filling my soul with delight. After taking my pleasure

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there awhile I went from it and, having closed the door as it was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before, opened the third door wherein I saw a high open hall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pargetted with parti-coloured marbles and pietra dura of price

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and other precious stones, and hung with cages of sandal-wood and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eagle-wood; full of birds which made sweet music, such as the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thousand voiced,[FN#295] and the cushat, the merle, the turtle-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dove and the Nubian ring dove. My heart was filled with pleasure

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thereby; my grief was dispelled and I slept in that aviary till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawn. Then I undocked the door of the fourth chamber and therein

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found a grand saloon with forty smaller chambers giving upon it.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: All their doors stood open: so I entered and found them full of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pearls and jacinths and beryls and emeralds and corals and car

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: buncles, and all manner precious gems and jewels, such as tongue

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of man may not describe. My thought was stunned at the sight and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I said to myself, These be things methinks united which could

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not be found save in the treasuries of a King of Kings, nor could

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the monarchs of the world have collected the like of these! And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my heart dilated and my sorrows ceased, For, quoth I, now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: verily am I the monarch of the age, since by Allah's grace this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enormous wealth is mine; and I have forty damsels under my hand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nor is there any to claim them save myself. Then I gave not over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: opening place after place until nine and thirty days were passed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and in that time I had entered every chamber except that one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose door the Princesses had charged me not to open. But my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thoughts, O my mistress, ever ran on that forbidden

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fortieth[FN#296] and Satan urged me to open it for my own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: undoing; nor had I patience to forbear, albeit there wanted of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the trysting time but a single day. So I stood before the chamber

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: aforesaid and, after a moment's hesitation, opened the door which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was plated with red gold, and entered. I was met by a perfume

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose like I had never before smelt; and so sharp and subtle was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the odour that it made my senses drunken as with strong wine, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I fell to the ground in a fainting fit which lasted a full hour.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I came to myself I strengthened my heart and, entering,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found myself in a chamber whose floor was bespread with saffron

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and blazing with light from branched candelabra of gold and lamps

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fed with costly oils, which diffused the scent of musk and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ambergris. I saw there also two great censers each big as a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mazer-bowl,[FN#297] flaming with lign-aloes, nadd-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perfume,[FN#298] ambergris and honied scents; and the place was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: full of their fragrance. Presently, O my lady, I espied a noble

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: steed, black as the murks of night when murkiest, standing, ready

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saddled and bridled (and his saddle was of red gold) before two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mangers, one of clear crystal wherein was husked sesame, and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other also of crystal containing water of the rose scented with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: musk. When I saw this I marvelled and said to myself, Doubtless

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in this animal must be some wondrous mystery; and Satan cozened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, so I led him without the palace end mounted him, but he would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not stir from his place. So I hammered his sides with my heels,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but he moved not, and then I took the rein whip,[FN#299] and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: struck him withal. When he felt the blow, he neighed a neigh with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a sound like deafening thunder and, opening a pair of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wings[FN#300] flew up with me in the firmament of heaven far

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beyond the eyesight of man. After a full hour of flight he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: descended and alighted on a terrace roof and shaking me off his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back lashed me on the face with his tail and gouged out my left

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eye causing it roll along my cheek. Then he flew away. I went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down from the terrace and found myself again amongst the ten one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyed youths sitting upon their ten couches with blue covers; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they cried out when they saw me, No welcome to thee, nor aught

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of good cheer! We all lived of lives the happiest and we ate and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drank of the best; upon brocades and cloths of gold we took rest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and we slept with our heads on beauty's breast, but we could not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: await one day to gain the delights of a year! Quoth I, Behold I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have become one like unto you and now I would have you bring me a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tray full of blackness, wherewith to blacken my face, and receive

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me into your society. No, by Allah, quoth they, thou shalt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not sojourn with us and now get thee hence! So they drove me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: away. Finding them reject me thus I foresaw that matters would go

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hard with me, and I remembered the many miseries which Destiny

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had written upon my forehead; and I fared forth from among them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heavy hearted and tearful eyed, repeating to myself these words,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I was sitting at mine ease but my frowardness brought me to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unease. Then I shaved beard and mustachios and eye brows,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: renouncing the world, and wandered in Kalandar garb about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah's earth; and the Almighty decreed safety for me till I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arrived at Baghdad, which was on the evening of this very night.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Here I met these two other Kalandars standing bewildered; so I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saluted them saying, I am a stranger! and they answered, And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we likewise be strangers! By the freak of Fortune we were like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to like, three Kalandars and three monoculars all blind of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: left eye. Such, O my lady, is the cause of the shearing of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beard and the manner of my losing an eye. Said the lady to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Rub thy head and wend thy ways; but he answered, By Allah, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will not go until I hear the stories of these others. Then the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady, turning towards the Caliph and Ja'afar and Masrur, said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them, Do ye also give an account of yourselves, you men!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whereupon Ja'afar stood forth and told her what he had told the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: portress as they were entering the house; and when she heard his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: story of their being merchants and Mosul men who had outrun the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: watch, she said, I grant you your lives each for each sake, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: now away with you all. So they all went out and when they were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the street, quoth the Caliph to the Kalandars, O company,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whither go ye now, seeing that the morning hath not yet dawned?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth they, By Allah, O our lord, we know not where to go.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Come and pass the rest of the night with us, said the Caliph

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, turning to Ja'afar, Take them home with thee and tomorrow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bring them to my presence that we may chronicle their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: adventures. Ja'afar did as the Caliph bade him and the Commander

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Faithful returned to his palace; but sleep gave no sign of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: visiting him that night and he lay awake pondering the mishaps of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the three Kalandar princes and impatient to know the history of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the ladies and the two black bitches. No sooner had morning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawned than he went forth and sat upon the throne of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sovereignty; and, turning to Ja'afar, after all his Grandees and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Officers of state were gathered together, he said, Bring me the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: three ladies and the two bitches and the three Kalandars. So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ja'afar fared forth and brought them all before him (and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ladies were veiled); then the Minister turned to them and said in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Caliph's name, We pardon you your maltreatment of us and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: your want of courtesy, in consideration of the kindness which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forewent it, and for that ye knew us not: now however I would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have you to know that ye stand in presence of the fifth[FN#301]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the sons of Abbas, Harun al-Rashid, brother of Caliph Músá al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hádi, son of Al-Mansúr; son of Mohammed the brother of Al-Saffáh

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bin Mohammed who was first of the royal house. Speak ye therefore

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before him the truth and the whole truth! When the ladies heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ja afar's words touching the Commander of the Faithful, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eldest came forward and said, O Prince of True Believers, my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: story is one which, were it graven with needle-gravers upon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eye corners were a warner for whoso would be warned and an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: example for whoso can take profit from example.--And Shahrazad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perceived the dawn of day and ceased to say her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Seventeenth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that she stood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth before the Commander of the Faithful and began to tell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Eldest Lady's Tale.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Verily a strange tale is mine and 'tis this:--Yon two black

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bitches are my eldest sisters by one mother and father; and these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: two others, she who beareth upon her the signs of stripes and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: third our procuratrix are my sisters by another mother. When my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father died, each took her share of the heritage and, after a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: while my mother also deceased, leaving me and my sisters german

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: three thousand diners; so each daughter received her portion of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thousand diners and I the same, albe the youngest. In due course

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of time my sisters married with the usual festivities and lived

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with their husbands, who bought merchandise with their wives

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: monies and set out on their travels together. Thus they threw me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: off. My brothers in law were absent with their wives five years,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: during which period they spent all the money they had and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: becoming bankrupt, deserted my sisters in foreign parts amid

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stranger folk. After five years my eldest sister returned to me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in beggar's gear with her clothes in rags and tatters[FN#302] and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a dirty old mantilla;[FN#303] and truly she was in the foulest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and sorriest plight. At first sight I did not know my own sister;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but presently I recognised her and said What state is this? O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our sister, she replied, Words cannot undo the done; and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reed of Destiny hath run through what Allah decreed. Then I sent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her to the bath and dressed her in a suit of mine own, and boiled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for her a bouillon and brought her some good wine and said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her, O my sister, thou art the eldest, who still standest to us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the stead of father and mother; and, as for the inheritance

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which came to me as to you twain, Allah hath blessed it and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prospered it to me with increase; and my circumstances are easy,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for I have made much money by spinning and cleaning silk; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and you will share my wealth alike. I entreated her with all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kindliness and she abode with me a whole year, during which our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thoughts and fancies were always full of our other sister. Shortly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after she too came home in yet fouler and sorrier plight than

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that of my eldest sister; and I dealt by her still more honorably

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: than I had done by the first, and each of them had a share of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: substance. After a time they said to me, 'O our sister, we desire

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to marry again, for indeed we have not patience to drag on our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days without husbands and to lead the lives of widows bewitched;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I replied, O eyes of me![FN#304] ye have hitherto seen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: scanty weal in wedlock, for now-a-days good men and true are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: become rarities and curiosities; nor do I deem your projects

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: advisable, as ye have already made trial of matrimony and have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: failed. But they would not accept my advice and married without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my consent: nevertheless I gave them outfit and dowries out of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: money; and they fared forth with their mates. In a mighty little

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: time their husbands played them false and, taking whatever they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: could lay hands upon, levanted and left them in the lurch.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon they came to me ashamed and in abject case and made

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their excuses to me, saying, Pardon our fault and be not wroth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with us;[FN#305] for although thou art younger in years yet art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou older in wit; henceforth we will never make mention of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
