text: with its governance; and those of whom they complain we will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: depose from office and those whom they commend we will promote.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth Ja'afar, Hearkening and obedience! So the Caliph went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down with Ja'afar and Eunuch Masrur to the town and walked about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the streets and markets and, as they were threading a narrow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alley, they came upon a very old man with a fishing-net and crate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to carry small fish on his head, and in his hand a staff; and, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he walked at a leisurely pace, he repeated these lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They say me: --Thou shinest a light to mankind * With thy lore

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as the night which the Moon doth uplight!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I answer, A truce to your jests and your gibes; * Without luck

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what is learning?--a poor-devil wight!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If they take me to pawn with my lore in my pouch, * With my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: volumes to read and my ink-case to write,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For one day's provision they never could pledge me; * As likely

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on Doomsday to draw bill at sight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How poorly, indeed, doth it fare wi' the poor, * With his pauper

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: existence and beggarly plight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: In summer he faileth provision to find; * In winter the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fire-pot's his only delight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The street-dogs with bite and with bark to him rise, * And each

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: losel receives him with bark and with bite:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If he lift up his voice and complain of his wrong, * None pities

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: or heeds him, however he's right;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And when sorrows and evils like these he must brave * His

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happiest homestead were down in the grave.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the Caliph heard his verses he said to Ja'afar, See this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poor man and note his verses, for surely they point to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: necessities. Then he accosted him and asked, O Shaykh, what be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thine occupation? and the poor man answered, O my lord, I am a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fisherman with a family to keep and I have been out between

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mid-day and this time; and not a thing hath Allah made my portion

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wherewithal to feed my family. I cannot even pawn myself to buy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them a supper and I hate and disgust my life and I hanker after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: death. Quoth the Caliph, Say me, wilt thou return with us to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tigris' bank and cast thy net on my luck, and whatsoever turneth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up I will buy of thee for an hundred gold pieces? The man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoiced when he heard these words and said, On my head be it! I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will go back with you; and, returning with them river-wards,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made a cast and waited a while; then he hauled in the rope and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dragged the net ashore and there appeared in it a chest padlocked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and heavy. The Caliph examined it and lifted it finding it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weighty; so he gave the fisherman two hundred dinars and sent him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about his business; whilst Masrur, aided by the Caliph, carried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the chest to the palace and set it down and lighted the candles.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ja'afar and Masrur then broke it open and found therein a basket

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of palm-leaves corded with red worsted. This they cut open and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw within it a piece of carpet which they lifted out, and under

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it was a woman's mantilla folded in four, which they pulled out;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and at the bottom of the chest they came upon a young lady, fair

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as a silver ingot, slain and cut into nineteen pieces. When the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Caliph looked upon her he cried, Alas! and tears ran down his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cheeks and turning to Ja'afar he said, O dog of Wazirs, [FN#354]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall folk be murdered in our reign and be cast into the river to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be a burden and a responsibility for us on the Day of Doom? By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, we must avenge this woman on her murderer and he shall be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made die the worst of deaths! And presently he added,  Now, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surely as we are descended from the Sons of Abbas, [FN#355] if

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou bring us not him who slew her, that we do her justice on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, I will hang thee at the gate of my palace, thee and forty of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy kith and kin by thy side. And the: Caliph was wroth with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding rage. Quoth Ja'afar, Grant me three days' delay; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth the Caliph, We grant thee this. So Ja'afar went out from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before him and returned to his own house, full of sorrow and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying to himself, How shall I find him who murdered this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: damsel, that I may bring him before the Caliph? If I bring other

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: than the murderer, it will be laid to my charge by the Lord: in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: very sooth I wot not what to do. He kept his house three days

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and on the fourth day the Caliph sent one of the Chamberlains for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and, as he came into the presence, asked him, Where is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: murderer of the damsel? to which answered Ja'afar, O Commander

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Faithful, am I inspector of  murdered folk that I should

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ken who killed her? The Caliph was furious at his answer and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bade hang him before the palace-gate and commanded that a crier

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cry through the streets of Baghdad, Whoso would see the hanging

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of Ja'afar, the Barmaki, Wazir of the Caliph, with forty of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Barmecides, [FN#356] his cousins and kinsmen, before the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palace-gate, let him come and let him look! The people flocked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out from all the quarters of the city to witness the execution of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ja'afar and his kinsmen, not knowing the cause. Then they set up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the gallows and made Ja'afar and the others stand underneath in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: readiness for execution, but whilst every eye was looking for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Caliph's signal, and the crowd wept for Ja'afar and his cousins

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Barmecides, lo and behold! a young man fair of face and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neat of dress and of favour like the moon raining light, with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyes black and bright, and brow flower-white, and cheeks red as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose and young down where the beard grows, and a mole like a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grain of ambergris, pushed his way through the people till he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stood immediately before the Wazir and said to him, Safety to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee from this strait, O Prince of the Emirs and Asylum of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poor! I am the man who slew the woman ye found in the chest, so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hang me for her and do her justice on me! When Ja'afar heard the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth's confession he rejoiced at his own deliverance. but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grieved and sorrowed for the fair youth; and whilst they were yet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: talking behold, another man well stricken in years pressed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forwards through the people and thrust his way amid the populace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till he came to Ja'afar and the youth, whom he saluted saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ho thou the Wazir and Prince sans-peer! believe not the words of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this youth. Of a surety none murdered the damsel but I; take her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wreak on me this moment; for, an thou do not thus, I will require

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it of thee before Almighty Allah. Then quoth the young man, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir, this is an old man in his dotage who wotteth not whatso he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saith ever, and I am he who murdered her, so do thou avenge her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on me! Quoth the old man, O my son, thou art young and desirest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the joys of the world and I am old and weary and surfeited with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the world: I will offer my life as a ransom for thee and for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir and his cousins. No one murdered the damsel but I, so Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon thee, make haste to hang me, for no life is left in me now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that hers is gone. The Wazir marvelled much at all this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strangeness and, taking the young man and the old man, carried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them before the Caliph, where, after kissing the ground seven

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: times between his hands, he said, O Commander of the Faithful, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bring thee the murderer of the damsel! Where is he? asked the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Caliph and Ja'afar answered, This young man saith, I am the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: murderer, and this old man giving him the lie saith, I am the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: murderer, and behold, here are the twain standing before thee.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Caliph looked at the old man and the young man and asked,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Which of you killed the girl? The young man replied, No one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slew her save I; and the old man answered, Indeed none killed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her but myself. Then said the Caliph to Ja'afar, Take the twain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and hang them both; but Ja'afar rejoined, Since one of them was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the murderer, to hang the other were mere injustice.[FN#357] By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Him who raised the firmament and dispread the earth like a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carpet, cried the youth, I am he who slew the damsel; and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went on to describe the manner of her murder and the basket, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mantilla and the bit of carpet, in fact all that the Caliph had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found upon her. So the Caliph was certified that the young man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was the murderer; whereat he wondered and asked him, 'What was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the cause of thy wrongfully doing this damsel to die and what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made thee confess the murder without the bastinado, and what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought thee here to yield up thy life, and what made thee say Do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her wreak upon me? The youth answered, Know, O Commander of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Faithful, that this woman was my wife and the mother of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: children; also my first cousin and the daughter of my paternal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uncle, this old man who is my father's own brother. When I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: married her she was a maid [FN#358] and Allah blessed me with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: three male children by her; she loved me and served me and I saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no evil in her, for I also loved her with fondest love. Now on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the first day of this month she fell ill with grievous sickness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I fetched in physicians to her; but recovery came to her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: little by little. and, when I wished her to go to the Hammam-bath,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she said, There is a something I long for before I go to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bath and I long for it with an exceeding longing. To hear is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to comply, said I. And what is it? Quoth she, I have a queasy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: craving for an apple, to smell it and bite a bit of it. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied, Hadst thou a thousand longings I would try to satisfy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them! So I went on the instant into the city and sought for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: apples but could find none; yet, had they cost a gold piece each,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would I have bought them. I was vexed at this and went home and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, O daughter of my uncle. by Allah I can find none! She was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: distressed, being yet very weakly, and her weakness in. creased

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greatly on her that night and I felt anxious and alarmed on her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: account. As soon as morning dawned I went out again and made the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: round of the gardens, one by one, but found no apples anywhere.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: At last there met me an old gardener. of whom I asked about them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he answered, O my son, this fruit is a rarity with us and is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not now to be found save in the garden of the Commander of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Faithful at Bassorah, where the gardener keepeth it for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Caliph's eating. I returned to my house troubled by my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ill-success; and my love for my wife and my affection moved me to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: undertake the journey. So I gat me ready and set out and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: travelled fifteen days and nights, going and coming, and brought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her three apples which I bought from the gardener for three

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinars. But when I went in to my wife and set them before her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she took no pleasure in them and let them lie by her side; for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her weakness and fever had increased on her and her malady lasted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without abating ten days, after which time she began to recover

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: health. So I left my house and betaking me to my shop sat there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: buying and selling; and about midday behold, a great ugly black

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave, long as a lance and broad as a bench, passed by my shop

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: holding in hand one of the three apples wherewith he was playing.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth I, O my good slave, tell me whence thou tookest that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: apple, that I may get the like of it? He laughed and answered,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I got it from my mistress, for I had been absent and on my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: return I found her lying ill with three apples by her side, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she said to me, 'My horned wittol of a husband made a journey for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them to Bassorah and bought them for three dinars.' So I ate and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drank with her and took this one from her. [FN#359] When I heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: such words from the slave, O Commander of the Faithful, the world

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grew black before my face, and I arose and locked up my shop and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went home beside myself for excess of rage. I looked for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: apples and finding only two of the three asked my wife, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cousin, where is the third apple?; and raising her head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: languidly she answered, I wet not, O son of my uncle, where 'tis

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gone! This convinced me that the slave had spoken the truth, so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I took a knife and coming behind her got upon her breast without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a word said and cut her throat. Then I hewed off her head and her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: limbs in pieces and, wrapping her in her mantilla and a rag of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carpet, hurriedly sewed up the whole which I set in a chest and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: locking it tight, loaded it on my he-mule and threw it into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tigris with my own hands. So Allah upon thee, O Commander of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Faithful, make haste to hang me, as I fear lest she appeal for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: vengeance on Resurrection Day. For, when I had thrown her into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the river and none knew aught of it, as I went back home I found

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my eldest son crying and yet he knew naught of what I had done

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with his mother. I asked him, What hath made thee weep, my boy?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he answered, I took one of the three apples which were by my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mammy and went down into the lane to play with my brethren when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: behold, a big long black slave snatched it from my hand and said.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'Whence hadst thou this?' Quoth I, 'My father travelled far for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it, and brought it from Bassorah for my mother who was ill and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: two other apples for which he paid three ducats.' He took no heed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of my words and I asked for the apple a second and a third time,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but he cuffed me and kicked me and went off with it. I was afraid

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lest my mother should swinge me on account of the apple, so for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fear of her I went with my brother outside the city and stayed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there till evening closed in upon us; and indeed I am in fear of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her; and now by Allah, O my father, say nothing to her of this or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it may add to her ailment! When I heard what-my child said I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knew that the slave was he who had foully slandered my wife, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter of my uncle, and was certified that I had slain her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wrong. fully. So I wept with exceeding weeping and presently this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: old man, my paternal uncle and her father, came in; and I told

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him what had happened and he sat down by my side and wept and we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ceased not weeping till midnight. We have kept up mourning for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her these last five days and we lamented her in the deepest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sorrow for that she was unjustly done to die. This came from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gratuitous lying of the slave, the blackamoor, and this was the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: manner of my killing her; so I conjure thee, by the honour of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thine ancestors, make haste to kill me and do her justice upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, as there is no living for me after her! The Caliph marvelled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at his words and said, By Allah, the young man is excusable: I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will hang none but the accursed slave and I will do a deed which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall comfort the ill-at-ease and suffering, and which shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: please the All-glorious King.--And Shahrazad perceived the dawn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of day and ceased saying her permitted say,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twentieth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the Caliph

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swore he would hang none but the slave, for the youth was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: excusable. Then he turned to Ja'afar and said to him, Bring

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before me this accursed slave who was the sole cause of this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: calamity; and, if thou bring him not before me within three days,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou shalt be slain in his stead. So Ja'afar fared forth weeping

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and saying. Two deaths have already beset me, nor shall the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crock come of safe from every shock.' [FN#360] In this matter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: craft and cunning are of no avail; but He who preserved my life

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the first time can preserve it a second time. By Allah, I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not leave my house during the three days of life which remain to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and let the Truth (whose perfection be praised!) do e'en as He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will. So he kept his house three days, and on the fourth day he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: summoned the Kazis and legal witnesses and made his last will and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: testament, and took leave of his children weeping. Presently in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came a messenger from the Caliph and said to him, The Commander

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Faithful is in the most violent rage that can be, and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sendeth to seek thee and he sweareth that the day shall certainly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not pass without thy being hanged unless the slave be forth-coming.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When Ja'afar heard this he wept, and his children and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slaves and all who were in the house wept with him. After he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bidden adieu to everybody except his youngest daughter, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: proceeded to farewell her; for he loved this wee one, who was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beautiful child, more than all his other children; and he pressed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her to his breast and kissed her and wept bitterly at parting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from her; when he felt something round inside the bosom of her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dress and asked her, O my little maid, what is in thy bosom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pocket?; O my father, she replied, it is an apple with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: name of our Lord the Caliph written upon it. Rayhán our slave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought it to me four days ago and would not let me have it till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I gave him two dinars for it. When Ja'afar heard speak of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave and the apple, he was glad and put his hand into his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: child's pocket [FN#361] and drew out the apple and knew it and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoiced saying, O ready Dispeller of trouble  [FN#362] Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bade them bring the slave and said to him, Fie upon thee,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Rayhan! whence haddest thou this apple? By Allah, O my master,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he replied, though a lie may get a man once off, yet may truth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: get him off, and well off, again and again. I did not steal this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: apple from thy palace nor from the gardens of the Commander of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Faithful. The fact is that five days ago, as I was walking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: along one of the alleys of this city, I saw some little ones at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: play and this apple in hand of one of them. So I snatched it from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and beat him and he cried and said, 'O youth this apple is my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mother's and she is ill. She told my father how she longed for an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: apple, so he travelled to Bassorah and bought her three apples

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for three gold pieces, and I took one of them to play withal.' He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wept again, but I paid no heed to what he said and carried it off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and brought it here, and my little lady bought it of me for two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinars of gold. And this is the whole story. When Ja'afar heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his words he marvelled that the murder of the damsel and all this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: misery should have been caused by his slave; he grieved for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: relation of the slave to himself, while rejoicing over his own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deliverance, and he repeated these lines: --

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If ill betide thee through thy slave, * Make him forthright thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sacrifice:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A many serviles thou shalt find, * But life comes once and never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: twice.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he took the slave's hand and, leading him to the Caliph,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: related the story from first to last and the Caliph marvelled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with extreme astonishment, and laughed till he fell on his back

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and ordered that the story be recorded and be made public amongst

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the people. But Ja'afar said, Marvel not, O Commander of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Faithful, at this adventure, for it is not more wondrous than the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: History of the Wazir Núr al-Dín Ali of Egypt and his brother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shams al-Dín Mohammed. -- Quoth the Caliph, Out with it; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what can be stranger than this story? And Ja'afar answered, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Commander of the Faithful, I will not tell it thee, save on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: condition that thou pardon my slave; and the Caliph rejoined,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If it be indeed more wondrous than that of the three apples, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grant thee his blood, and if not I will surely slay thy slave.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So Ja'afar began in these words the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: TALE OF NUR AL-DIN AND HIS SON.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O Commander of the Faithful, that in times of yore the land

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of Egypt was ruled by a Sultan endowed with justice and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: generosity, one who loved the pious poor and companied with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Olema and learned men; and he had a Wazir, a wise and an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: experienced, well versed in affairs and in the art of government.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This Minister, who was a very old man, had two sons, as they were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: two moons; never man saw the like of them for beauty and grace,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the elder called Shams al-Din Mohammed and the younger Nur al-Din

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ali; but the younger excelled the elder in seemliness and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pleasing semblance, so that folk heard his fame in far countries

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and men flocked to Egypt for the purpose of seeing him. In

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: course of time their father, the Wazir, died and was deeply

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: regretted and mourned by the Sultan, who sent for his two sons

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, investing them with dresses of honour, [FN#363] said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them, Let not your hearts be troubled, for ye shall stand in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: your father's stead and be joint Ministers of Egypt. At this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they rejoiced and kissed the ground before him and performed the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ceremonial mourning [FN#364] for their father during a full

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: month; after which time they entered upon the Wazirate, and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: power passed into their hands as it had been in the hands of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their father, each doing duty for a week at a time. They lived

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: under the same roof and their word was one; and whenever the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sultan desired to travel they took it by turns to be in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: attendance on him. It fortuned one night that the Sultan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: purposed setting out on a journey next morning, and the elder,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose turn it was to accompany him, was sitting conversing with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his brother and said to him, O my brother, it is my wish that we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: both marry, I and thou, two sisters; and go in to our wives on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one and the same night. Do, O my brother, as thou desirest,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the younger replied, for right is thy recking and surely I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: comply with thee in whatso thou sayest. So they agreed upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this and quoth Shams al-Din, If Allah decree that we marry two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: damsels and go in to them on the same night, and they shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: conceive on their bridenights and bear children to us on the same

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day, and by Allah's will they wife bear thee a son and my wife

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bear me a daughter, let us wed them either to other, for they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will be cousins. Quoth Nur al-Din, O my brother, Shams al-Din,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what dower [FN#365] wilt thou require from my son for thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter? Quoth Shams al-Din, I will take three thousand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinars and three pleasure gardens and three farms; and it would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not be seemly that the youth make contract for less than this.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When Nur al-Din heard such demand he said, What manner of dower

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is this thou wouldst impose upon my son? Wottest thou not that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we are brothers and both by Allah's grace Wazirs and equal in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: office? It behoveth thee to offer thy daughter to my son without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marriage settlement; or if one need be, it should represent a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mere nominal value by way of show to the world: for thou knowest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that the masculine is worthier than the feminine, and my son is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: male and our memory will be preserved by him, not by thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter. But what, said Shams al-Din, is she to have?; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nur al-Din continued, Through her we shall not be remembered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: among the Emirs of the earth; but I see thou wouldest do with me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: according to the saying:--An thou wouldst bluff off a buyer, ask

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him high price and higher; or as did a man who, they say, went to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a friend and asked something of him being in necessity and was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, 'Bismallah, [FN#366] in the name of Allah, I will do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all what thou requirest but come to-morrow!' Whereupon the other

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied in this verse:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When he who is asked a favour saith To-morrow, * The wise man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wots 'tis vain to beg or borrow.'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth Shams al-Din, Basta! [FN#367] I see thee fail in respect

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to me by making thy son of more account than my daughter; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'tis plain that thine understanding is of the meanest and that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou lackest manners. Thou remindest me of thy partnership in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazirate, when I admitted thee to share with me only in pity

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for thee, and not wishing to mortify thee; and that thou mightest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: help me as a manner of assistant. But since thou talkest on this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wise, by Allah, I will never marry my daughter to thy son; no,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not for her weight in gold! When Nur al-Din heard his brother's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words he waxed wroth and said, And I too, I will never, never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marry my son to thy daughter; no, not to keep from my lips the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cup of death. Shams al-Din replied, I would not accept him as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a husband for her, and he is not worth a paring of her nail.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Were I not about to travel I would make an example of thee;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: however when I return thou shalt see, and I will show thee, how I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: can assert my dignity and vindicate my honour. But Allah doeth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whatso He willeth.[FN#368] When Nur al-Din heard this speech

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from his brother, he was filled with fury and lost his wits for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rage; but he hid what he felt and held his peace; and each of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brothers passed the night in a place far apart, wild with wrath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: against the other. As soon as morning dawned the Sultan fared

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth in state and crossed over from Cairo [FN#369] to Jizah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#370] and made for the pyramids, accompanied by the Wazir

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shams al-Din, whose turn of duty it was, whilst his brother Nur

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-din, who passed the night in sore rage, rose with the light

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and prayed the dawn-prayer. Then he betook himself to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: treasury and, taking a small pair of saddle-bags, filled them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with gold; and he called to mind his brother's threats and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: contempt wherewith he had treated him, and he repeated these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Travel! and thou shalt find new friends for old ones left

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: behind; * Toil! for the sweets of human life by toil and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: moil are found:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The stay-at-home no honour wins nor aught attains but want; * So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leave thy place of birth [FN#371] and wander all the world

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: around!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I've seen, and very oft I've seen, how standing water stinks, *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And only flowing sweetens it and trotting makes it sound:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And were the moon forever full and ne'er to wax or wane, * Man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would not strain his watchful eyes to see its gladsome

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: round:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Except the lion leave his lair he ne'er would fell his game, *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Except the arrow leave the bow ne'er had it reached its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bound:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Gold-dust is dust the while it lies untravelled in the mine, *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And aloes-wood mere fuel is upon its native ground:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And gold shall win his highest worth when from his goal ungoal'd;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: * And aloes sent to foreign parts grows costlier than gold.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When he ended his verse he bade one of his pages saddle him his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nubian mare-mule with her padded selle. Now she was a dapple-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grey, [FN#372] with ears like reed-pens and legs like columns and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a back high and strong as a dome builded on pillars; her saddle

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was of gold-cloth and her stirrups of Indian steel, and her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: housing of Ispahan velvet; she had trappings which would serve

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Chosroes, and she was like a bride adorned for her wedding

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night. Moreover he bade lay on her back a piece of silk for a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seat, and a prayer-carpet under which were his saddle-bags. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this was done he said to his pages and slaves, I purpose going

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth a-pleasuring outside the city on the road to Kalyub-town,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#373] and I shall lie three nights abroad; so let none of you

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: follow me, for there is something straiteneth my breast. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he mounted the mule in haste; and, taking with him some provaunt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the way, set out from Cairo and faced the open and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uncultivated country lying around it. [FN#374] About noontide he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered Bilbays-city, [FN#375] where he dismounted and stayed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: awhile to rest himself and his mule and ate some of his victual.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He bought at Bilbays all he wanted for himself and forage for his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mule and then fared on the way of the waste. Towards night-fall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he entered a town called Sa'adiyah [FN#376] where he alighted and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took out somewhat of his viaticum and ate; then he spread his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strip of silk on the sand and set the saddle-bags under his head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and slept in the open air; for he was still overcome with anger.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When morning dawned he mounted and rode onward till he reached

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Holy City, [FN#377] Jerusalem, and thence he made Aleppo,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where he dismounted at one of the caravanserais and abode three

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days to rest himself and the mule and to smell the air. [FN#378]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then, being determined to travel afar and Allah having written

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: safety in his fate, he set out again, wending without wotting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whither he was going; and, having fallen in with certain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couriers, he stinted not travelling till he had reached Bassorah-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city albeit he knew not what the place was. It was dark night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when he alighted at the Khan, so he spread out his prayer-carpet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and took down the saddle-bags from the back of his mule and gave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her with her furniture in charge of the door-keeper that he might

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: walk her about. The man took her and did as he was bid. Now it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so happened that the Wazir of Bassorah, a man shot in years, was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sitting at the lattice-window of his palace opposite the Khan and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he saw the porter walking the mule up and down. He was struck by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her trappings of price and thought her a nice beast fit for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: riding of Wazirs or even of royalties; and the more he looked the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more was he perplexed till at last he said to one of his pages,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bring hither yon door-keeper, The page went and returned to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir with the porter who kissed the ground between his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hands, and the Minister asked him, Who is the owner of yonder

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mule and what manner of man is he?; and he answered, O my lord,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the owner of this mule is a comely young man of pleasant manners,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: withal grave and dignified, and doubtless one of the sons of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchants. When the Wazir heard the door-keeper's words he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arose forthright; and, mounting his horse, rode to the Khan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#379] and went in to Nur al-Din who, seeing the minister

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: making towards him, rose to his feet and advanced to meet him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saluted him. The Wazir welcomed him to Bassorah and dis-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mounting, embraced him and made him sit down by his side and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, O my son, whence comest thou and what dost thou seek? O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my lord, Nur al-Din replied, I have come from Cairo-city of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which my father was whilome Wazir; but he hath been removed to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the grace of Allah; and he informed him of all that had befallen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him from beginning to end, adding, I am resolved never to return

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: home before I have seen all the cities and countries of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: world. When the Wazir heard this, he said to him, O my son,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hearken not to the voice of passion lest it cast thee into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pit; for indeed many regions be waste places and I fear for thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the turns of Time. Then he let load the saddle-bags and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: silk and prayer-carpets on the mule and carried Nur al-Din to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: own house, where he lodged him in a pleasant place and entreated

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him honourably and made much of him, for he inclined to love him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with exceeding love. After a while he said to him, O my son,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: here am I left a man in years and have no male children, but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah hath blessed me with a daughter who eventh thee in beauty;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I have rejected all her many suitors, men of rank and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: substance. But affection for thee hath entered into my heart;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: say me, then, wilt thou be to her a husband? If thou accept

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this, I will go up with thee to the Sultan of Bassorah [FN#380]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and will tell him that thou art my nephew, the son of my brother,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and bring thee to be appointed Wazir in my place that I may keep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the house for, by Allah, O my son, I am stricken in years and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: aweary. When Nur al-Din heard the Wazir's words, he bowed his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: head in modesty and said, To hear is to obey! At this the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir rejoiced and bade his servants prepare a feast and decorate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the great assembly-hall, wherein they were wont to celebrate the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marriages of Emirs and Grandees. Then he assembled his friends

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the notables of the reign and the merchants of Bassorah and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when all stood before him he said to them, I had a brother who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was Wazir in the land of Egypt, and Allah Almighty blessed him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with two sons, whilst to me, as well ye wot, He hath given a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter. My brother charged me to marry my daughter to one of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his sons, whereto I assented; and, when my daughter was of age to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marry, he sent me one of his sons, the young man now present, to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom I purpose marrying her, drawing up the contract and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: celebrating the night of unveiling with due ceremony; for he is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nearer and dearer to me than a stranger and, after the wedding,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: if he please he shall abide with me, or if he desire to travel I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will forward him and his wife to his father's home. Hereat one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and all replied, Right is thy recking; and they all looked at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bridegroom and were pleased with him. So the Wazir sent for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Kazi and legal witnesses and they wrote out the marriage-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: contract, after which the slaves perfumed the guests with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: incense, [FN#381] and served them with sherbet of sugar and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sprinkled rose-water on them and all went their ways. Then the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir bade his servants take Nur al-Din to the Hammam-baths and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sent him a suit of the best of his own especial raiment, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: napkins and towelry and bowls and perfume-burners and all else

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that was required. After the bath, when he came out and donned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the dress, he was even as the full moon on the fourteenth night;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he mounted his mule and stayed not till he reached the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir's palace. There he dismounted and went in to the Minister

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and kissed his hands, and the Wazir bade him welcome.--And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased to say her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twenty-first Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the Wazir

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stood up to him and welcoming him said, Arise and go in to thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife this night, and on the morrow I will carry thee to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sultan, and pray Allah bless thee with all manner of weal. So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nur al-Din left him and went into his wife the Wazir's daughter.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thus far concerning him, but as regards his eldest brother, Shams

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din, he was absent with the Sultan a long time and when he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned from his journey he found not his brother; and he asked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of his servants and slaves who answered, On the day of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: departure with the Sultan, thy brother mounted his mule fully

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: caparisoned as for state procession saying, 'I am going towards

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kalyub-town and I shall be absent one day or at most two days;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for my breast is straitened, and let none of you follow me.'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he fared forth and from that time to this we have heard no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tidings of him. Shams al-Din was greatly troubled at the sudden

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disappearance of his brother and grieved with exceeding grief at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the loss and said to himself, This is only because I chided and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upbraided him the night before my departure with the Sultan;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: haply his feelings were hurt and he fared forth a-travelling; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I must send after him. Then he went in to the Sultan and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: acquainted him with what had happened and wrote letters and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dispatches, which he sent by running footmen to his deputies in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: every province. But during the twenty days of his brother's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: absence Nur al-Din had travelled far and had reached Bassorah; so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after diligent search the messengers failed to come at any news

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of him and returned. Thereupon Shams al-Din despaired of finding

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his brother and said, Indeed I went beyond all bounds in what I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to him with reference to the marriage of our children.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Would that I had not done so! This all cometh of my lack of wit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and want of caution. Soon after this he sought in marriage the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter of a Cairene merchant, [FN#382] and drew up the marriage

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: contract and went in to her. And it so chanced that, on the very

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: same night when Shams al-Din went in to his wife, Nur al-Din also

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went in to his wife the daughter of the Wazir of Bassorah; this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: being in accordance with the will of Almighty Allah, that He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: might deal the decrees of Destiny to His creatures. Furthermore,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it was as the two brothers had said; for their two wives became

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pregnant by them on the same night and both were brought to bed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the same day; the wife of Shams al-Din, Wazir of Egypt, of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter, never in Cairo was seen a fairer; and the wife of Nur

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din of a son, none more beautiful was ever seen in his time,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as one of the poets said concerning the like of him:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: That jetty hair, that glossy brow,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: My slender-waisted youth, of thine,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Can darkness round creation throw,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Or make it brightly shine.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The dusky mole that faintly shows

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Upon his cheek, ah! blame it not:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The tulip-flower never blows

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Undarkened by its spot [FN#383]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And as another also said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: His scent was musk and his cheek was rose; * His teeth are pearls

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and his lips drop wine;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: His form is a brand and his hips a hill; * His hair is night and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his face moon-shine.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They named the boy Badr al-Din Hasan and his grandfather, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir of Bassorah, rejoiced in him and, on the seventh day after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his birth, made entertainments and spread banquets which would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befit the birth of Kings' sons and heirs. Then he took Nur al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Din and went up with him to the Sultan, and his son-in-law, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he came before the presence of the King, kissed the ground

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: between his hands and repeated these verses, for he was ready of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speech, firm of sprite and good in heart as he was goodly in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: form:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The world's best joys long be thy lot, my lord! * And last while

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: darkness and the dawn o'erlap:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O thou who makest, when we greet thy gifts, * The world to dance

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and Time his palms to clap. [FN#384]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the Sultan rose up to honour them, and thanking Nur al-Din

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for his fine compliment, asked the Wazir, Who may be this young

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man?; and the Minister answered, This is my brother's son, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: related his tale from first to last. Quoth the Sultan, And how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: comes he to be thy nephew and we have never heard speak of him?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth the Minister, O our lord the Sultan, I had a brother who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was Wazir in the land of Egypt and he died, leaving two sons,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereof the elder hath taken his father's place and the younger,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom thou seest, came to me. I had sworn I would not marry my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter to any but to him; so when he came I married him to her.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#385] Now he is young and I am old; my hearing is dulled and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my judgement is easily fooled; wherefore I would solicit our lord

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Sultan [FN#386] to set him in my stead, for he is my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother's son and my daughter's husband; and he is fit for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazirate, being a man of good counsel and ready contrivance.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Sultan looked at Nur al-Din and liked him, so he stablished

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him in office as the Wazir had requested and formally appointed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, presenting him with a splendid dress of honour and a she-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mule from his private stud; and assigning to him solde, stipends

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and supplies. Nur al-Din kissed the Sultan's hand and went home,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he and his father-in-law, joying with exceeding joy and saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: All this followeth on the heels of the boy Hasan's birth! Next

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day he presented himself before the King and, kissing the ground,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began repeating:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Grow thy weal and thy welfare day by day: * And thy luck

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prevail o'er the envier's spite;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And ne'er cease thy days to be white as day, * And thy foeman's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day to be black as night!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Sultan bade him be seated on the Wazir's seat, so he sat down

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and applied himself to the business of his office and went into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the cases of the lieges and their suits, as is the wont of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ministers; while the Sultan watched him and wondered at his wit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and good sense, judgement and insight. Wherefor he loved him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took him into intimacy. When the Divan was dismissed Nur al-Din

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned to his house and related what had passed to his father-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in-law who rejoiced. And thenceforward Nur al-Din ceased not so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to administer the Wazirate that the Sultan would not be parted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from him night or day; and increased his stipend and supplies

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: until his means were ample and he became the owner of ships that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made trading voyages at his command, as well as of Mamelukes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blackamoor slaves; and he laid out many estates and set up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Persian wheels and planted gardens. When his son Hasan was four

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: years of age, the old Wazir deceased and he made for his father-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in-law a sumptuous funeral ceremony ere he was laid in the dust.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he occupied himself with the education of this son and, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the boy waxed strong and came to the age of seven, he brought him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a Fakih, a doctor of law and religion, to teach him in his own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house and charged him to give him a good education and instruct

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him in politeness and manners. So the tutor made the boy read

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and retain all varieties of useful knowledge, after he had spent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: some years in learning the Koran by heart; [FN#387] and he ceased

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not to grow in beauty and stature and symmetry, even as saith the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poet:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: In his face-sky shines the fullest moon; * In his cheeks' anemone

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: glows the sun:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He so conquered Beauty that he hath won * All charms of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: humanity one by one.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The professor brought him up in his father's palace teaching him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reading, writing and cyphering, theology and belles lettres. His

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grandfather the old Wazir had bequeathed to him the whole of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: property when he was but four years of age. Now during all the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: time of his earliest youth he had never left the house, till on a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: certain day his father, the Wazir Nur al-Din, clad him in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: best clothes and, mounting him on a she-mule of the finest, went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up with him to the Sultan. The King gazed at Badr al-Din Hasan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and marvelled at his comeliness and loved him. As for the city-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: folk, when he first passed before them with his father, they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marvelled at his exceeding beauty and sat down on the road

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: expecting his return, that they might look their fill on his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beauty and loveliness and symmetry and perfect grace; even as the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poet said in these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: As the sage watched the stars, the semblance clear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Of a fair youth on 's scroll he saw appear.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Those jetty locks Canopus o'er him threw,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And tinged his temple curls a musky hue;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mars dyed his ruddy cheek; and from his eyes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Archer-star his glittering arrow flies;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: His wit from Hermes came; and Soha's care,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (The half-seen star that dimly haunts the Bear)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kept off all evil eyes that threaten and ensnare,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The sage stood mazed to see such fortunes meet,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And Luna kissed the earth beneath his feet. [FN#388]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And they blessed him aloud as he passed and called upon Almighty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah to bless him. [FN#389] The Sultan entreated the lad with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: especial favour and said to his father, O Wazir, thou must needs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bring him daily to my presence; whereupon he replied, I hear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I obey. Then the Wazir returned home with his son and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ceased not to carry him to court till he reached the age of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: twenty. At that time the Minister sickened and, sending for Badr

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din Hasan, said to him, Know, O my son, that the world of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Present is but a house of mortality, while that of the Future is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a house of eternity. I wish, before I die, to bequeath thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: certain charges and do thou take heed of what I say and incline

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy heart to my words. Then he gave him last instructions as to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the properest way of dealing with his neighbours and the due

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: management of his affairs; after which he called to mind his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother and his home and his native land and wept over his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: separation from those he had first loved. Then he wiped away his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tears and, turning to his son, said to him, Before I proceed, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my son, to my last charges and injunctions, know that I have a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother, and thou hast an uncle, Shams al-Din hight, the Wazir of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Cairo, which whom I parted, leaving him against his will. Now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: take thee a sheet of paper and write upon it whatso I say to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. Badr al-Din took a fair leaf and set about doing his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father's bidding and he wrote thereon a full account of what had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happened to his sire first and last; the dates of his arrival at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bassorah and of his foregathering with the Wazir; of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marriage, of his going in to the Minister's daughter and of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: birth of his son; brief, his life of forty years from the date of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his dispute with his brother, adding the words, And this is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: written at my dictation and may Almighty Allah be with him when I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: am gone! Then he folded the paper and sealed it and said, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan, O my son, keep this paper with all care; for it will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enable thee to stablish thine origin and rank and lineage and, if

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: anything contrary befal thee, set out for Cairo and ask for thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uncle and show him this paper and say to him that I died a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stranger far from mine own people and full of yearning to see him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and them. So Badr al-Din Hasan took the document and folded it;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, wrapping it up in a piece of waxed cloth of his skull-cap

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and wound his light turband [FN#390] round it. And he fell to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weeping over his father and at parting with him, and he but a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: boy. Then Nur al-Din lapsed into a swoon, the forerunner of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: death; but presently recovering himself he said, O Hasan, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son, I will now bequeath to thee five last behests. The FIRST

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: BEHEST is, Be over-intimate with none, nor frequent any, nor be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: familiar with any; so shalt thou be safe from his mischief;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#391] for security lieth in seclusion of thought and a certain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: retirement from the society of thy fellows; and I have heard it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said by a poet:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: In this world there is none thou mayst count upon * To befriend

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy case in the nick of need:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So live for thyself nursing hope of none * Such counsel I give

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee: enow, take heed!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The SECOND BEHEST is, O my son: Deal harshly with none lest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fortune with thee deal hardly; for the fortune of this world is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one day with thee and another day against thee and all worldly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: goods are but a loan to be repaid. And I have heard a poet say:-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Take thought nor hast to win the thing thou wilt; * Have ruth on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man for ruth thou may'st require:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: No hand is there but Allah's hand is higher; * No tyrant but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall rue worse tyrant's ire!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The THIRD BEHEST is, Learn to be silent in society and let thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: own faults distract thine attention from the faults of other men:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for it is said:--In silence dwelleth safety, and thereon I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard the lines that tell us:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Reserve's a jewel, Silence safety is; * Whenas thou speakest many

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a word withhold;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: For an of Silence thou repent thee once, * Of speech thou shalt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repent times manifold.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The FOURTH BEHEST, O my son, is Beware of wine-bibbing, for wine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is the head of all frowardness and a fine solvent of human wits.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So shun, and again I say, shun mixing strong liquor; for I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard a poet say [FN#392]:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: From wine [FN#393] I turn and whoso wine-cups swill; *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Becoming one of those who deem it ill:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wine driveth man to miss salvation-way, [FN#394] * And opes the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gateway wide to sins that kill.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The FIFTH BEHEST, O my son, is Keep thy wealth and it will keep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee; guard thy money and it will guard thee; and waste not thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: substance lest haply thou come to want and must fare a-begging

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from the meanest of mankind. Save thy dirhams and deem them the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sovereignest salve for the wounds of the world. And here again I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have heard that one of the poets said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When fails my wealth no friend will deign befriend: * When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wealth abounds all friends their friendship tender:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How many friends lent aid my wealth to spend; * But friends to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lack of wealth no friendship render.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: On this wise Nur al-Din ceased not to counsel his son Badr al-Din

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan till his hour came and, sighing one sobbing sigh, his life

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went forth. Then the voice of mourning and keening rose high in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his house and the Sultan and all the grandees grieved for him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: buried him; but his son ceased not lamenting his loss for two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: months, during which he never mounted horse, nor attended the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Divan nor presented himself before the Sultan. At last the King,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: being wroth with him, stablished in his stead one of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Chamberlains and made him Wazir, giving orders to seize and set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seals on all Nur al-Din's houses and goods and domains. So the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: new Wazir went forth with a mighty posse of Chamberlains and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: people of the Divan, and watchmen and a host of idlers to do this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and to seize Badr al-Din Hasan and carry him before the King, who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would deal with him as he deemed fit. Now there was among the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crowd of followers a Mameluke of the deceased Wazir who, when he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard this order, urged his horse and rode at full speed to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house of Badr al-Din Hasan; for he cold not endure to see the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ruin of his old master's son. He found him sitting at the gate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with head hung down and sorrowing, as was his wont, for the loss

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of his father; so he dismounted and kissing his hand said to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O my lord and son of my lord, haste ere ruin come and lay

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waste! When Hasan heard this he trembled and asked, What may

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be the matter?; and the man answered, The Sultan is angered with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee and hath issued a warrant against thee, and evil cometh hard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon my track; so flee with thy life! At these words Hasan's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart flamed with the fire of bale, and his rose-red cheek turned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pale, and he said to the Mameluke, O my brother, is there time

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for me to go in and get me some worldly gear which may stand me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in stead during my strangerhood? But the slave replied, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
