text: lord, up at once and save thyself and leave this house, while it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is yet time. And he quoted these lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Escape with thy life, if oppression betide thee, * And let the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house of its builder's fate!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Country for country thou'lt find, if thou seek it; * Life for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: life never, early or late.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: It is strange men should dwell in the house of abjection, * When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the plain of God's earth is so wide and so great! [FN#395]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: At these words of the Mameluke, Badr al-Din covered his head with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the skirt of his garment and went forth on foot till he stood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: outside of the city, where he heard folk saying, The Sultan hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sent his new Wazir to the house of the old Wazir, now no more, to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seal his property and seize his son Badr al-Din Hasan and take

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him before the presence, that he may put him to death;  and all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried, Alas for his beauty and his loveliness! When he heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this he fled forth at hazard, knowing not whither he was going,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and gave not over hurrying onwards till Destiny drove him to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father's tomb. So he entered the cemetery and, threading his way

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: through the graves, at last he reached the sepulchre where he sat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down and let fall from his head the skirt of his long robe

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#396] which was made of brocade with a gold-embroidered hem

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereon were worked these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O thou whose forehead, like the radiant East, * Tells of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stars of Heaven and bounteous dews:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Endure thine honour to the latest day, * And Time thy growth of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: glory ne'er refuse!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: While he was sitting by his father's tomb behold, there came to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him a Jew as he were a Shroff, [FN#397] a money-changer, with a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pair of saddle-bags containing much gold, who accosted him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kissed his hand, saying, Whither bound, O my lord; 'tis late in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the day and thou art clad but lightly, and I read signs of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trouble in thy face? I was sleeping within this very hour,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered Hasan, when my father appeared to me and chid me for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not having visited his tomb; so I awoke trembling and came hither

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forthright lest the day should go by without my visiting him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which would have been grievous to me. O my lord, rejoined the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jew, [FN#398] thy father had many merchantmen at sea and, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: some of them are now due, it is my wish to buy of thee the cargo

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the first ship that cometh into port with this thousand dinars

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of gold. I consent, quoth Hasan, whereupon the Jew took out a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bag of gold and counted out a thousand sequins which he gave to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan, the son of the Wazir, saying, Write me a letter of sale

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and seal it. So Hasan took a pen and paper and wrote these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words in duplicate, The writer, Hasan Badr al-Din, son of Wazir

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nur al-Din, hath to Isaac the Jew all the cargo of the first of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his father's ships which cometh into port, for a thousand dinars,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he hath received the price in advance. And after he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: taken one copy the Jew put it into his pouch and went away; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan fell a-weeping as he thought of the dignity and prosperity

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which had erst been his and he began reciting:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This house, my lady, since you left is now a home no more * For

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, not neighbours, since you left, prove kind and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neighbourly:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The friend, whilere I took to heart, alas! no more to me * Is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: friend; and even Luna's self displayeth lunacy:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: You left and by your going left the world a waste, a wolf, * And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lies a gloomy murk upon the face of hill and lea:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O may the raven-bird whose cry our hapless parting croaked *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Find ne'er a nesty home and eke shed all his plumery!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: At length my patience fails me; and this absence wastes my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flesh; * How many a veil by severance rent our eyes are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: doomed see:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ah! shall I ever sight again our fair past nights of your; * And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall a single house become a home for me once more?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he wept with exceeding weeping and night came upon him; so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he leant his head against his father's grave and sleep overcame

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him: Glory to him who sleepeth not! He ceased not slumbering

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till the moon rose, when his head slipped from off the tomb and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he lay on his back, with limbs outstretched, his face shining

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bright in the moonlight. Now the cemetery was haunted day and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night by Jinns who were of the True Believers, and presently came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out a Jinniyah who, seeing Hasan asleep, marvelled at his beauty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and loveliness and cried, Glory to God! This youth can be none

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other than one of the Wuldan of Paradise.[FN#399] Then she flew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: firmament-wards to circle it, as was her custom, and met an Ifrit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the wing who saluted her and she said to him, Whence comest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou? From Cairo, he replied. Wilt thou come with me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: look upon the beauty of a youth who sleepeth in yonder burial

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: place? she asked and he answered, I will. So they flew till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they lighted at the tomb and she showed him the youth and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now diddest thou ever in thy born days see aught like this?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Ifrit looked upon him and exclaimed, Praise be to Him that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath no equal! But, O my sister, shall I tell thee what I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seen this day? Asked she, What is that? and he answered, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have seen the counterpart of this youth in the land of Egypt.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She is the daughter of the Wazir Shams al-Din and she is a model

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of beauty and loveliness, of fairest favour and formous form, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dight with symmetry and perfect grace. When she had reached the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: age of nineteen, [FN#400] the Sultan of Egypt heard of her and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sending for the Wazir her father, said to him, 'Hear me, O Wazir:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it hath reached mine ear that thou hast a daughter and I wish to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: demand her of thee in marriage. The Wazir replied, O our lord

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Sultan, deign accept my excuses and take compassion on my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sorrows, for thou knowest that my brother, who was partner with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me in the Wazirate, disappeared from amongst us many years ago

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and we wot not where he is. Now the cause of his departure was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that one night, as we were sitting together and talking of wives

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and children to come, we had words on the matter and he went off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in high dudgeon. But I swore that I would marry my daughter to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: none save to the son of my brother on the day her mother gave her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: birth, which was nigh upon nineteen years ago. I have lately

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard that my brother died at Bassorah, where he married the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter of the Wazir and that she bare him a son; and I will not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marry my daughter but to him in honour of my brother's memory. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recorded the date of my marriage and the conception of my wife

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the birth of my daughter; and from her horoscope I find that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her name is conjoined with that of her cousin; [FN#401] and there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are damsels in foison for our lord the Sultan.' The King,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hearing his Minister's answer and refusal, waxed wroth with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding wrath and cried, 'When the like of me asketh a girl in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marriage of the like of thee, he conferreth an honour, and thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejectest me and puttest me off with cold [FN#402] excuses! Now,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by the life of my head I will marry her to the meanest of my men

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in spite of the nose of thee! [FN#403] There was in the palace a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: horse-groom which was a Gobbo with a bunch to his breast and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hunch to his back; and the Sultan sent for him and married him to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the daughter of the Wazir, lief or loath, and hath ordered a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pompous marriage procession for him and that he go in to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bride this very night. I have now just flown hither from Cairo,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where I left the Hunchback at the door of the Hammam-bath amidst

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Sultan's white slaves who were waving lighted flambeaux about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him. As for the Minister's daughter she sitteth among her nurses

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and tirewomen, weeping and wailing; for they have forbidden her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father to come near her. Never have I seen, O my sister, more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hideous being than this Hunchback [FN#404] whilest the young lady

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is the likest of all folk to this young man, albeit even fairer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: than he,--And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twenty-second Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jinni narrated to the Jinniyah how the King had caused the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wedding contract to be drawn up between the hunchbacked groom and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the lovely young lady who was heart-broken for sorrow; and how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she was the fairest of created things and even more beautiful

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: than this youth, the Jinniyah cried at him Thou liest! this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth is handsomer than any one of his day. The Ifrit gave her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the lie again, adding, By Allah, O my sister, the damsel I speak

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of is fairer than this; yet none but he deserveth her, for they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: resemble each other like brother and sister or at least cousins.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And, well-away! how she is wasted upon that Hunchback! Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said she, O my brother, let us get under him and lift him up and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carry him to Cairo, that we may compare him with the damsel of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom thou speakest and so determine whether of the twain is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fairer. To hear is to obey! replied he, thou speakest to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: point; nor is there a righter recking than this of thine, and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: myself will carry him. So he raised him from the ground and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flew with him like a bird soaring in upper air, the Ifritah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: keeping close by his side at equal speed, till he alighted with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him in the city of Cairo and set him down on a stone bench and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woke him up. He roused himself and finding that he was no longer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at his father's tomb in Bassorah-city he looked right and left

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and saw that he was in a strange place; and he would have cried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out; but the Ifrit gave him a cuff which persuaded him to keep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: silence. Then he brought him rich raiment and clothed him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: therein and, giving him a lighted flambeau, said, Know that I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have brought thee hither, meaning to do thee a good turn for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: love of Allah: so take this torch and mingle with the people at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Hammam-door and walk on with them without stopping till thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reach the house of the wedding-festival; then go boldly forward

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and enter the great saloon; and fear none, but take thy stand at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the right hand of the Hunchback bridegroom; and, as often as any

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the nurses and tirewomen and singing-girls come up to thee,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#405] put thy hand into thy pocket which thou wilt find filled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with gold. Take it out and throw it to them and spare not; for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as often as thou thrustest fingers in pouch thou shalt find it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: full of coin. Give largesse by handsful and fear nothing, but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set thy trust upon Him who created thee, for this is not by thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: own strength but by that of Allah Almighty, that His decrees may

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: take effect upon his creatures. When Badr al-Din Hasan heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these words from the Ifrit he said to himself, Would Heaven I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knew what all this means and what is the cause of such kindness!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: However, he mingled with the people and, lighting his flambeau,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: moved on with the bridal procession till he came to the bath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where he found the Hunchback already on horseback. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pushed his way in among the crowd, a veritable beauty of a man in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the finest apparel, wearing tarbush [FN#406] and turband and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: long-sleeved robe purfled with gold; and, as often as the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: singing-women stopped for the people to give them largesse, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thrust his hand into his pocket and, finding it full of gold,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took out a handful and threw it on the tambourine [FN#407] till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he had filled it with gold pieces for the music-girls and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tirewomen. The singers were amazed by his bounty and the people

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marvelled at his beauty and loveliness and the splendour of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dress. He ceased not to do thus till he reached the mansion of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir (who was his uncle), where the Chamberlains drove back

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the people and forbade them to go forward; but the singing-girls

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the tirewomen said, By Allah we will not enter unless this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young man enter with us, for he hath given us length o' life with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his largesse and we will not display the bride unless he be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: present. Therewith they carried him into the bridal hall and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made him sit down defying the evil glances of the hunchbacked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bridegroom. The wives of the Emirs and Wazirs and Chamberlains

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and Courtiers all stood in double line, each holding a massy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cierge ready lighted; all wore thin face-veils and the two rows

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: right and left extended from the bride's throne [FN#408] to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: head of the hall adjoining the chamber whence she was to come

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth. When the ladies saw Badr al-Din Hasan and noted his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beauty and loveliness and his face that shone like the new moon,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their hearts inclined to him and the singing-girls said to all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that were present, Know that this beauty crossed our hands with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: naught but red gold; so be not chary to do him womanly service

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and comply with all he says, no matter what he ask. [FN#409] So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all the women crowded around Hasan with their torches and gazed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon his loveliness and envied him his beauty; and one and all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would gladly have lain on his bosom an hour or rather a year.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Their hearts were so troubled that they let fall their veils from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before their faces and said, Happy she who belongeth to this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth or to whom he belongeth!; and they called down curses on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the crooked groom and on him who was the cause of his marriage to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the girl-beauty; and as often as they blessed Badr al-Din Hasan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they damned the Hunchback, saying, Verily this youth and none

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: else deserveth our Bride: Ah, well-away for such a lovely one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with this hideous Quasimodo; Allah's curse light on his head and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the Sultan who commanded the marriage! Then the singing-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: girls beat their tabrets and lulliloo'd with joy, announcing the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: appearing of the bride; and the Wazir's daughter came in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surrounded by her tirewomen who had made her goodly to look upon;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for they had perfumed her and incensed her and adorned her hair;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and they had robed her in raiment and ornaments befitting the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mighty Chosroes Kings. The most notable part of her dress was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loose robe worn over her other garments; it was diapered in red

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gold with figures of wild beasts, and birds whose eyes and beaks

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were of gems, and claws of red rubies and green beryl; and her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neck was graced with a necklace of Yamani work, worth thousands

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of gold pieces, whose bezels were great round jewels of sorts,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the like of which was never owned by Kaysar or by Tobba King.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#410] And the bride was as the full moon when at fullest on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fourteenth night; and as she paced into the hall she was like one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Houris of Heaven--praise be to Him who created her in such

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: splendour of beauty! The ladies encompassed her as the white

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: contains the black of the eye, they clustering like stars whilst

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she shone amongst them like the moon when it eats up the clouds.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now Badr al-Din Hasan of Bassorah was sitting in full gaze of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: folk, when the bride came forward with her graceful swaying and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swimming gait, and her hunchbacked groom stood up to meet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#411] and receive her: she, however, turned away from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wight and walked forward till she stood before her cousin Hasan,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the son of her uncle. Whereat the people laughed. But when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wedding-guests saw her thus attracted towards Badr al-Din they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made a mighty clamour and the singing-women shouted their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loudest; whereupon he put his hand into his pocket and, pulling

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out a handful of gold, cast it into their tambourines and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: girls rejoiced and said, Could we win our wish this bride were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thine! At this he smiled and the folk came round him, flambeaux

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in hand like the eyeball round the pupil, while the Gobbo

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bridegroom was left sitting alone much like a tail-less baboon;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for every time they lighted a candle for him it went out willy-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nilly, so he was left in darkness and silence and looking at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: naught but himself. [FN#412] When Badr al-Din Hasan saw the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bridegroom sitting lonesome in the dark, and all the wedding-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: guests with their flambeaux and wax candles crowding around

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself, he was bewildered and marvelled much; but when he looked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at his cousin, the daughter of his uncle, he rejoiced and felt an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: inward delight: he longed to greet her and gazed intently on her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: face which was radiant with light and brilliancy. Then the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tirewomen took off her veil and displayed her in the first bridal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dress which was of scarlet satin; and Hasan had a view of her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which dazzled his sight and dazed his wits, as she moved to and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fro, swaying with graceful gait; [FN#413] and she turned the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heads of all the guests, women as well as men, for she was even

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as saith the surpassing poet:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A sun on wand in knoll of sand she showed * Clad in her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cramoisy-hued chemisette:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Of her lips honey-dew she gave me drink, * And with her rosy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cheeks quencht fire she set.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then they changed that dress and displayed her in a robe of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: azure; and she reappeared like the full moon when it riseth over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the horizon, with her coal-black hair and cheeks delicately fair;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and teeth shown in sweet smiling and breasts firm rising and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crowning sides of the softest and waist of the roundest. And in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this second suit she was as a certain master of high conceits

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saith of the like of her:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She came apparrelled in an azure vest, * Ultramarine, as skies

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are deckt and dight;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I view'd th' unparrellel'd sight, which show'd my eyes * A moon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of Summer on a Winter-night.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then they changed that suit for another and, veiling her face in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the luxuriance of her hair, loosed her lovelocks, so dark, so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: long that their darkness and length outvied the darkest nights,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she shot through all hearts with the magical shaft of her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eye-babes. They displayed her in the third dress and she was as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said of her the sayer:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Veiling her cheeks with hair a-morn she comes, * And I her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mischiefs with the cloud compare:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Saying, Thou veilest morn with night! Ah, no! * Quoth she,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I shroud full moon with darkling air!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then they displayed her in the fourth bridal dress and she came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forward shining like the rising sun and swaying to and fro with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lovesome grace and supple ease like a gazelle-fawn. And she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clave all hearts with the arrows of her eyelashes, even as saith

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one who described a charmer like her:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The sun of beauty she to sight appears * And, lovely-coy, she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mocks all loveliness;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And when he fronts her favour and her smile * A-morn, the Sun of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day in clouds must dress.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she came forth in the fifth dress, a very light of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loveliness like a wand of waving willow or a gazelle of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thirsty wold. Those locks which stung like scorpions along her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cheeks were bent, and her neck was bowed in blandishment, and her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hips quivered as she went. As saith one of the poets describing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her in verse:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She comes like fullest moon on happy night; * Taper of waist,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with shape of magic might:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She hath an eye whose glances quell mankind, * And Ruby on her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cheeks reflects his light:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Enveils her hips the blackness of her hair; *Beware of curls that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bite with viper-bite!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Her sides are silken-soft, the while the heart * Mere rock behind

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that surface lurks from sight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: From the fringed curtains of her eyne she shoots * Shafts which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at farthest range on mark alight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When round her neck or waist I throw my arms * Her breasts repel

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me with their hardened height.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ah, how her beauty all excels! ah how * That shape transcends the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: graceful waving bough!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then they adorned her with the sixth toilette, a dress which was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: green. And now she shamed her slender straightness the nut-brown

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spear; her radiant face dimmed the brightest beams of full moon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she outdid the bending branches in gentle movement and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flexible grace. Her loveliness exalted the beauties of earth's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: four quarters and she broke men's hearts by the significance of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her semblance; for she was even as saith one of the poets in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A damsel 'twas the tirer's art had decked with snares and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sleight.[FN#414] * And robed in rays as though the sun from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her had borrowed light:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She came before us wondrous clad in chemisette of green, * As

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: veiled by its leafy screen pomegranate hides from sight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And when he said How callest thou the manner of thy dress? *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She answered us in pleasant way with double meaning dight;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: We call this garment creve-coeur; and rightly is it hight, * For

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: many a heart wi' this we broke [FN#415] and conquered many

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a sprite!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then they displayed her in the seventh dress, coloured between

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: safflower [FN#416] and saffron, even as one of the poets saith:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: In vest of saffron pale and safflower red * Musk'd, sandal'd

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ambergris'd, she came to front:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Rise! cried her youth, go forth and show thyself! * Sit!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said her hips, we cannot bear the brunt!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And when I craved a bout, her Beauty said * Do, do! and said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her pretty shame, Don't, don't!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thus they displayed the bride in all her seven toilettes before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan al-Basri, wholly neglecting the Gobbo who sat moping alone;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, when she opened her eyes [FN#417] she said, O Allah make

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this man my goodman and deliver me from the evil of this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hunchbacked groom. As soon as they had made an end of this part

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the ceremony they dismissed the wedding guests who went forth,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: women, children and all, and none remained save Hasan and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback, whilst the tirewomen led the bride into an inner room

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to change her garb and gear and get her ready for the bridegroom.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon Quasimodo came up to Badr al-Din Hasan and said, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lord, thou hast cheered us this night with thy good company and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: overwhelmed us with thy kindness and courtesy; but now why not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: get thee up and go? Bismallah, he answered, In Allah's name

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so be it! and rising, he went forth by the door, where the Ifrit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: met him and said, Stay in thy stead, O Badr al-Din, and when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback goes out to the closet of ease go in without losing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: time and seat thyself in the alcove; and when the bride comes say

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to her, 'Tis I am thy husband, for the King devised this trick

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: only fearing for thee the evil eye, and he whom thou sawest is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but a Syce, a groom, one of our stablemen.' Then walk boldly up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to her and unveil her face; for jealousy hath taken us of this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: matter. While Hasan was still talking with the Ifrit behold,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the groom fared forth from the hall and entering the closet of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ease sat down on the stool. Hardly had he done this when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ifrit came out of the tank, [FN#418] wherein the water was, in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: semblance of a mouse and squeaked out Zeek! Quoth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback, What ails thee?; and the mouse grew and grew till it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: became a coal-black cat and caterwauled Meeao! Meeao![FN#419]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then it grew still more and more till it became a dog and barked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out Owh! Owh! When the bridegroom saw this he was frightened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and exclaimed Out with thee, O unlucky one! [FN#420] But the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dog grew and swelled till it became an ass-colt that brayed and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: snorted in his face Hauk! Hauk! [FN#421] Whereupon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback quaked and cried, Come to my aid, O people of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house! But behold, the ass-colt grew and became big as a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: buffalo and walled the way before him and spake with the voice of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sons of Adam, saying, Woe to thee, O thou Bunch-back, thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stinkard, O thou filthiest of grooms! Hearing this the groom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was seized with a colic and he sat down on the jakes in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes with teeth chattering and knocking together. Quoth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ifrit, Is the world so strait to thee thou findest none to marry

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: save my lady-love? But as he was silent the Ifrit continued,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Answer me or I will do thee dwell in the dust! By Allah,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied the Gobbo, O King of the Buffaloes, this is no fault of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mine, for they forced me to wed her; and verily I wot not that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she had a lover among the buffaloes; but now I repent, first

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before Allah and then before thee. Said the Ifrit to him, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swear to thee that if thou fare forth from this place, or thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: utter a word before sunrise, I assuredly will wring thy neck.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the sun rises wend thy went and never more return to this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house. So saying, the Ifrit took up the Gobbo bridegroom and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set him head downwards and feet upwards in the slit of the privy,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#422] and said to him, I will leave thee here but I shall be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the look-out for thee till sunrise; and, if thou stir before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: then, I will seize thee by the feet and dash out thy brains

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: against the wall: so look out for thy life! Thus far concerning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Hunchback, but as regards Badr al-Din Hasan of Bassorah he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: left the Gobbo and the Ifrit jangling and wrangling and, going

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: into the house, sat him down in the very middle of the alcove;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and behold, in came the bride attended by an old woman who stood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at the door and said, O Father of Uprightness, [FN#423] arise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and take what God giveth thee. Then the old woman went away and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bride, Sitt al-Husn or the Lady of Beauty hight, entered the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: inner part of the alcove broken-hearted and saying in herself,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Allah I will never yield my person to him; no, not even were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he to take my life! But as she came to the further end she saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Badr al-Din Hasan and she said, Dearling! Art thou still sitting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: here? By Allah I was wishing that thou wert my bridegroom or, at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: least, that thou and the hunchbacked horse-groom were partners in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me. He replied, O beautiful lady, how should the Syce have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: access to thee, and how should he share in thee with me?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then, quoth she, who is my husband, thou or he? Sitt al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Husn, rejoined Hasan, we have not done this for mere fun,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#424] but only as a device to ward off the evil eye from thee;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for when the tirewomen and singers and wedding guests saw they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beauty being displayed to me, they feared fascination and thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father hired the horse-groom for ten dinars and a porringer of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: meat to take the evil eye off us; and now he hath received his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hire and gone his gait. When the Lady of Beauty heard these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words she smiled and rejoiced and laughed a pleasant laugh. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she whispered him, By the Lord thou hast quenched a fire which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tortured me and now, by Allah, O my little dark-haired darling,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: take me to thee and press me to thy bosom! Then she began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: singing:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Allah, set thy foot upon my soul; * Since long, long years

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for this alone I long:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And whisper tale of love in ear of me; * To me 'tis sweeter than

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sweetest song!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: No other youth upon my heart shall lie; * So do it often, dear,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and do it long.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she stripped off her outer gear and she threw open her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chemise from the neck downwards and showed her parts genital and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all the rondure of her hips. When Badr al-Din saw the glorious

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sight his desires were roused, and he arose and doffed her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes, and wrapping up in his bag-trousers [FN#425] the purse

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of gold which he had taken from the Jew and which contained the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thousand dinars, he laid it under the edge of the bedding. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he took off his turband and set it upon the settle [FN#426] atop

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of his other clothes, remaining in his skull-cap and fine shirt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of blue silk laced with gold. Whereupon the Lady of Beauty drew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him to her and he did likewise. Then he took her to his embrace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and set her legs round his waist and point-blanked that cannon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#427] placed where it battereth down the bulwark of maidenhead

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and layeth it waste. And he found her a pearl unpierced and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unthridden and a filly by all men save himself unridden; and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abated her virginity and had joyance of her youth in his virility

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and presently he withdrew sword from sheath; and then returned to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the fray right eath; and when the battle and the siege had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: finished, some fifteen assaults he had furnished and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: conceived by him that very night. Then he laid his hand under

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her head and she did the same and they embraced and fell asleep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in each other's arms, as a certain poet said of such lovers in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Visit thy lover, spurn what envy told; * No envious churl shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: smile on love ensoul'd.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Merciful Allah made no fairer sight * Than coupled lovers single

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couch doth hold;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Breast pressing breast and robed in joys their own, * With

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pillowed forearms cast in finest mould:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And when heart speaks to heart with tongue of love, * Folk who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would part them hammer steel ice-cold:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If a fair friend[FN#428] thou find who cleaves to thee, * Live

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for that friend, that friend in heart enfold.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O ye who blame for love us lover kind * Say, can ye minister to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: diseasèd mind?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This much concerning Badr al-Hasan and Sitt al-Husn his cousin;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but as regards the Ifrit, as soon as he saw the twain asleep, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to the Ifritah, Arise, slip thee under the youth and let us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carry him back to his place ere dawn overtake us; for the day is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nearhand. Thereupon she came forward and, getting under him as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he lay asleep, took him up clad only in his fine blue shirt,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leaving the rest of his garments; and ceased not flying (and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ifrit vying with her in flight) till the dawn advised them that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it had come upon them mid-way, and the Muezzin began his call

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from the Minaret, Haste ye to salvation! Haste ye to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: salvation! [FN#429] Then Allah suffered his angelic host to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shoot down the Ifrit with a shooting star, [FN#430] so he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: consumed, but the Ifritah escaped and she descended with Badr al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Din at the place where the Ifrit was burnt, and did not carry him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back to Bassorah, fearing lest he come to harm. Now by the order

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of Him who predestineth all things, they alighted at Damascus of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Syria, and the Ifritah set down her burden at one of the city-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gates and flew away. When day arose and the doors were opened,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the folks who came forth saw a handsome youth, with no other

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: raiment but his blue shirt of gold-embroidered silk and skull-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cap,[FN#431] lying upon the ground drowned in sleep after the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hard labour of the night which had not suffered him to take his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rest. So the folk looking at him said, O her luck with whom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this one spent the night! but would he had waited to don his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: garments. Quoth another, A sorry lot are the sons of great

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: families! Haply he but now came forth of the tavern on some

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: occasion of his own and his wine flew to his head,[FN#432]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereby he hath missed the place he was making for and strayed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till he came to the gate of the city; and finding it shut lay him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down and to by-by! As the people were bandying guesses about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him suddenly the morning breeze blew upon Badr al-Din and raising

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his shirt to his middle showed a stomach and navel with something

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: below it, [FN#433] and legs and thighs clear as crystal and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: smooth as cream. Cried the people, By Allah he is a pretty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fellow!; and at the cry Badr al-din awoke and found himself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lying at a city-gate with a crowd gathered around him. At this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he greatly marvelled and asked, Where am I, O good folk; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what causeth you thus to gather round me, and what have I had to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: do with you?; and they answered, We found thee lying here

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asleep during the call to dawn-prayer and this is all we know of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the matter, but where diddest thou lie last night? [FN#434] By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, O good people, replied he, I lay last night in Cairo.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Said somebody, Thou hast surely been eating Hashish, [FN#435]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and another, He is a fool; and a third, He is a citrouille;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and a fourth asked him, Art thou out of thy mind? thou sleepest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in Cairo and thou wakest in the morning at the gate of Damascus-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city! [FN#436] Cried he, By Allah, my good people, one and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all, I lie not to you: indeed I lay yesternight in the land of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Egypt and yesternoon I was at Bassorah. Quoth one, Well!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: well!; and quoth another, Ho! ho!; and a third, So! so!; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a fourth cried, This youth is mad, is possessed of the Jinni!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So they clapped hands at him and said to one another, Alas, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pity of it for his youth: by Allah a madman! and madness is no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: respecter of persons. Then they said to him, Collect thy wits

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and return to thy reason! How couldest thou be in Bassorah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yesterday and Cairo yesternight and withal awake in Damascus this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: morning? But he persisted, Indeed I was a bridegroom in Cairo

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: last night. Belike thou hast been dreaming, rejoined they,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and sawest all this in thy sleep. So Hasan took thought for a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: while and said to them, By Allah, this is no dream; nor vision-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like doth it seem! I certainly was in Cairo where they displayed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bride before me, in presence of a third person, the Hunchback

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: groom who was sitting hard by. By Allah, O my brother, this be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no dream, and if it were a dream, where is the bag of gold I bore

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with me and where are my turband and my robe, and my trousers?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he rose and entered the city, threading its highways and by-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ways and bazar-streets; and the people pressed upon him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: jeered at him, crying out Madman! madman! till he, beside

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself with rage, took refuge in a cook's shop. Now that Cook

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had been a trifle too clever, that is, a rogue and thief; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah had made him repent and turn from his evil ways and open a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cook-shop; and all the people of Damascus stood in fear of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: boldness and his mischief. So when the crowd saw the youth enter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his shop, they dispersed being afraid of him, and went their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ways. The Cook looked at Badr al-Din and, noting his beauty and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loveliness, fell in love with him forthright and said, Whence

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: comest thou, O youth? Tell me at once thy tale, for thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: become dearer to me than my soul. So Hasan recounted to him all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that had befallen him from beginning to end (but in repetition

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there is no fruition) and the Cook said, O my lord Badr al-Din,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: doubtless thou knowest that this case is wondrous and this story

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marvellous; therefore, O my son, hide what hath betided thee,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till Allah dispel what ills be thine; and tarry with me here the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: meanwhile, for I have no child and I will adopt thee. Badr al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Din replied, Be it as thou wilt, O my uncle! Whereupon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Cook went to the bazar and bought him a fine suit of clothes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made him don it; then fared with him to the Kazi, and formally

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: declared that he was his son. So Badr al-Din Hasan became known

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in Damascus-city as the Cook's son and he sat with him in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shop to take the silver, and on this wise he sojourned there for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a time. Thus far concerning him; but as regards his cousin, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Lady of Beauty, when morning dawned she awoke and missed Badr al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Din Hasan from her side; but she thought that he had gone to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: privy and she sat expecting him for an hour or so; when behold,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered her father Shams al-Din Mohammed, Wazir of Egypt. Now he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was disconsolate by reason of what had befallen him through the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sultan, who had entreated him harshly and had married his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter by force to the lowest of his menials and he too a lump

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of a groom bunch-backed withal, and he said to himself, I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slay this daughter of mine if of her own free will she have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yielded her person to this acursed carle. So he came to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: door of the bride's private chamber and said, Ho! Sitt al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Husn. She answered him, Here am I! here am I! [FN#437] O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lord, and came out unsteady of gait after the pains and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pleasures of the night; and she kissed his hand, her face showing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: redoubled brightness and beauty for having lain in the arms of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that gazelle, her cousin. When her father, the Wazir, saw her in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: such case, he asked her, O thou accursed, art thou rejoicing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: because of this horse-groom?, and Sitt al-Husn smiled sweetly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and answered, By Allah, don't ridicule me: enough of what passed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yesterday when folk laughed at me, and evened me with that groom-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fellow who is not worthy to bring my husband's shoes or slippers;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nay who is not worth the paring of my husband's nails! By the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Lord, never in my life have I nighted a night so sweet as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yesternight!, so don't mock by reminding me of the Gobbo. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her parent heard her words he was filled with fury, and his eyes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: glared and stared, so that little of them showed save the whites

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he cried, Fie upon thee! What words are these? 'Twas the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hunchbacked horse-groom who passed the night with thee! Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon thee, replied the Lady of Beauty, do not worry me about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Gobbo, Allah damn his father; [FN#438] and leave jesting with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me; for this groom was only hired for ten dinars and a porringer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of meat and he took his wage and went his way. As for me I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered the bridal-chamber, where I found my true bridegroom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sitting, after the singer-women had displayed me to him; the same

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who had crossed their hands with red gold, till every pauper that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was present waxed wealthy; and I passed the night on the breast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of my bonny man, a most lively darling, with his black eyes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: joined eyebrows. [FN#439] When her parent heard these words the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: light before his face became night, and he cried out at her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, O thou whore! What is this thou tellest me? Where be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy wits? O my father, she rejoined, thou breakest my heart;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enough for thee that thou hast been so hard upon me! Indeed my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: husband who took my virginity is but just now gone to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: draught-house and I feel that I have conceived by him. [FN#440]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Wazir rose in much marvel and entered the privy where he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found the hunchbacked groom with his head in the hole, and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heels in the air. At this sight he was confounded and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This is none other than he, the rascal Hunchback! So he called

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him, Ho Hunchback! The Gobbo grunted out, Taghum! Taghum!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#441] thinking it was the Ifrit spoke to him; so the Wazir

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shouted at him and said, Speak out, or I'll strike off thy pate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with this sword. Then quoth the Hunchback, By Allah, O Shaykh

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Ifrits, ever since thou settest me in this place, I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not lifted my head; so Allah upon thee, take pity and entreat me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kindly! When the Wazir heard this he asked, What is this thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sayest? I'm bride's father and no Ifrit. Enough for thee that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou hast well nigh done me die,  answered Quasimodo; now go

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy ways before he come upon thee who hath served me thus. Could

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ye not marry me to any save the lady-love of buffaloes and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beloved of Ifrits? Allah curse her and curse him who married me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to her and was the cause of this my case,--And Shahrazad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perceived the dawn of day, and ceased to say her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twenty-third Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Said she, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hunchbacked groom spake to the bride's father saying, Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: curse him who was the cause of this my case! Then said the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir to him, Up and out of this place! Am I mad, cried the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: groom, that I should go with thee without leave of the Ifrit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose last words to me were:--When the sun rises, arise and go

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they gait. So hath the sun risen or no?; for I dare not budge

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from this place till then. Asked the Wazir, Who brought thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hither?; and he answered I came here yesternight for a call of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nature and to do what none can do for me, when lo! a mouse came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out of the water, and squeaked at me and swelled and waxed gross

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till it was big as a buffalo, and spoke to me words that entered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my ears. Then he left me here and went away, Allah curse the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bride and him who married me to her! The Wazir walked up to him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and lifted his head out of the cesspool hole; and he fared forth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: running for dear life and hardly crediting that the sun had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: risen; and repaired to the Sultan to whom he told all that had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befallen him with the Ifrit. But the Wazir returned to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bride's private chamber, sore troubled in spirit about her, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to her, O my daughter, explain this strange matter to me!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth she, Tis simply this. The bridegroom to whom they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: displayed me yestereve lay with me all night, and took my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: virginity and I am with child by him. He is my husband and if

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou believe me not, there are his turband, twisted as it was,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lying on the settle and his dagger and his trousers beneath the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bed with a something, I wot not what, wrapped up in them. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her father heard this he entered the private chamber and found

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the turband which had been left there by Badr al-Din Hasan, his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother's son, and he took it in hand and turned it over, saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This is the turband worn by Wazirs, save that it is of Mosul

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stuff. [FN#442] So he opened it and, finding what seemed to be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an amulet sewn up in the Fez, he unsewed the lining and took it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out; then he lifted up the trousers wherein was the purse of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thousand gold pieces and, opening that also, found in it a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: written paper. This he read and it was the sale-receipt of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jew in the name of Badr al-Din Hasan, son of Nur al-Din Ali, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Egyptian; and the thousand dinars were also there. No sooner had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shams al-Din read this than he cried out with a loud cry and fell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the ground fainting; and as soon as he revived and understood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the gist of the matter he marvelled and said, There is no God,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but the God, who All-might is over all things! Knowest thou, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my daughter, who it was that became the husband of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: virginity? No, answered she, and he said, Verily he is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son of my brother, thy cousin, and this thousand dinars is thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dowry. Praise be to Allah! and would I wot how this matter came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about! then opened he the amulet which was sewn up and found

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: therein a paper in the handwriting of his deceased brother, Nur

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din the Egyptian, father of Badr al-Din Hasan; and, when he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw the hand-writing, he kissed it again and again; and he wept

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and wailed over his dead brother and improvised this lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I see their traces and with pain I melt, * And on their whilome

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: homes I weep and yearn:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And Him I pray who dealt this parting-blow * Some day he deign

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: vouchsafe a safe return. [FN#443]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When he ceased versifying, he read the scroll and found in it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recorded the dates of his brother's marriage with the daughter of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir of Bassorah, and of his going in to her, and her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: conception, and the birth of Badr al-Din Hasan and all his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother's history and doings up to his dying day. So he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marvelled much and shook with joy and, comparing the dates with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his own marriage and going in to his wife and the birth of their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter, Sitt al-Husn, he found that they perfectly agreed. So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he took the document and, repairing with it to the Sultan,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: acquainted him with what had passed, from first to last; whereat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King marvelled and commanded the case to be at once recorded.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#444] The Wazir abode that day expecting to see his brother's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son but he came not; and he waited a second day, a third day and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so on to the seventh day, without any tidings of him. So he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, By Allah, I will do a deed such as none hath ever done

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before me!; and he took reed-pen and ink and drew upon a sheet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of paper the plan of the whole house, showing whereabouts was the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: private chamber with the curtain in such a place and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: furniture in such another and so on with all that was in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: room. Then he folded up the sketch and, causing all the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: furniture to be collected, he took Badr al-Din's garments and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turband and Fez and robe and purse, and carried the whole to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house and locked them up, against the coming of his nephew, Badr

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din Hasan, the son of his lost brother, with an iron padlock

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on which he set his seal. As for the Wazir's daughter, when her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tale of months was fulfilled, she bare a son like the full moon,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the image of his father in beauty and loveliness and fair

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: proportions and perfect grace. They cut his navel-string

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#445] and Kohl'd his eyelids to strengthen his eyes, and gave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him over to the nurses and nursery governesses, [FN#446] naming

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him Ajib, the Wonderful. His day was as a month and his month

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was as a year; [FN#447] and, when seven years had passed over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, his grandfather sent him to school, enjoining the master to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: teach him Koran-reading, and to educate him well. he remained at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the school four years, till he began to bully his schoolfellows

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and abuse them and bash them and thrash them and say, Who among

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: you is like me? I am the son of Wazir of Egypt! At last the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: boys came in a body to the Monitor [FN#448] of what hard usage

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they were wont to have from Ajib, and he said to them, I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tell you somewhat you may do to him so that he shall leave off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: coming to the school, and it is this. When he enters to-morrow,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sit ye down about him and say some one of you to some other, 'By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah none shall play with us at this game except he tell us the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: names of his mamma and his papa; for he who knows not the names

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of his mother and his father is a bastard, a son of adultery,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#449] and he shall not play with us.' When morning dawned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the boys came to school, Ajib being one of them, and all flocked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: around him saying, We will play a game wherein none can join

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: save he can tell the name of his mamma and his papa. And they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all cried, By Allah, good! Then quoth one of them, My name is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Majid and my mammy's name is Alawiyah and my daddy's Izz al-Din.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Another spoke in like guise and yet a third, till Ajid's turn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came, and he said, MY name is Ajib, and my mother's is Sitt al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Husn, and my father's Shams al-Din, the Wazir of Cairo. By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, cried they, the Wazir is not thy true father. Ajib

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, The Wazir is my father in very deed. Then the boys

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all laughed and clapped their hands at him, saying He does not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: know who is his papa: get out from among us, for none shall play

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with us except he know his father's name. Thereupon they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dispersed from around him and laughed him to scorn; so his breast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was straitened and he well nigh choked with tears and hurt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: feelings. Then said the Monitor to him, We know that the Wazir

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is thy grandfather, the father of thy mother, Sitt al-Husn, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not thy father. As for thy father, neither dost thou know him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nor yet do we; for the Sultan married thy mother to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hunchbacked horse-groom; but the Jinni came and slept with her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and thou hast no known father. Leave, then, comparing thyself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: too advantageously with the little ones of the school, till thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: know that thou hast a lawful father; for until then thou wilt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pass for a child of adultery amongst them. Seest thou that not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: even a huckster's son knoweth his own sire? Thy grandfather is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir of Egypt; but as for thy father we wot him not and we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: say indeed that thou hast none. So return to thy sound senses!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When Ajib heard these insulting words from the Monitor and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: school boys and understood the reproach they put upon him, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went out at once and ran to his mother, Sitt al-Husn, to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: complain; but he was crying so bitterly that his tears prevented

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his speech for a while. When she heard his sobs and saw his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tears her heart burned as though with fire for him, and she said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O my son, why dost thou weep? Allah keep the tears from thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyes! Tell me what hath betided thee? So he told her all that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he heard from the boys and from the Monitor and ended with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asking, And who, O my mother, is my father? She answered, Thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father is the Wazir of Egypt; but he said, Do not lie to me.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Wazir is thy father, not mine! who then is my father? Except

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou tell me the very truth I will kill myself with this hanger.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#450] When his mother heard him speak of his father she wept,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: remembering her cousin and her bridal night with him and all that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: occurred thereon and then, and she repeated these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Love in my heart they lit and went their ways, * And all I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: love to furthest lands withdrew;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And when they left me sufferance also left, * And when we parted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Patience bade adieu:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They fled and flying with my joys they fled, * In very

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: consistency my spirit flew:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They made my eyelids flow with severance tears * And to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: parting-pang these drops are due:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And when I long to see reunion-day, * My groans prolonging sore

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for ruth I sue:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then in my heart of hearts their shapes I trace, * And love and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: longing care and cark renew:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O ye, whose names cling round me like a cloak, * Whose love yet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: closer than a shirt I drew,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Beloved ones! how long this hard despite? * How long this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: severance and this coy shy flight?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she wailed and shrieked aloud and her son did the like; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: behold, in came the Wazir whose heart burnt within him at the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sight of their lamentations, and he said, What makes you weep?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So the Lady of Beauty acquainted him with what had happened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: between her son and the school boys; and he also wept, calling to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
