text: mind his brother and what had past between them and what had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: betided his daughter and how he had failed to find out what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mystery there was in the matter. Then he rose at once and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repairing to the audience-hall, went straight to the King and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: told his tale and craved his permission [FN#451] to travel

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eastward to the city of Bassorah and ask after his brother's son.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Furthermore, he besought the Sultan to write for him letters

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: patent, authorising him to seize upon Badr al-Din, his nephew and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son-in-law, wheresoever he might find him. And he wept before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King, who had pity on him and wrote royal autographs to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deputies in all climes [FN#452] and countries and cities; whereat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir rejoiced and prayed for blessings on him. Then, taking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leave of his Sovereign, he returned to his house, where he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: equipped himself and his daughter and his adopted child Ajib,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with all things meet for a long march; and set out and travelled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the first day and the second and the third and so forth till he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arrived at Damascus-city. He found it a fair place abounding in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trees and streams, even as the poet said of it:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I nighted and dayed in Damascus town, * Time sware such

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another he ne'er should view:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And careless we slept under wing of night, * Till dappled Morn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'gan her smiles renew:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And dew-drops on branch in their beauty hung, * Like pearls to be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dropt when the Zephyr blew:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And the Lake [FN#453] was the page where birds read and note, *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And the clouds set points to what breezes wrote.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Wazir encamped on the open space called Al-Hasa; [FN#454]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, after pitching tents, said to his servants, A halt here for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: two days! So they went into the city upon their several

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: occasions, this to sell and this to buy; this to go to the Hammam

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and that to visit the Cathedral-mosque of the Banu Umayyah, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ommiades, whose like is not in this world. [FN#455] Ajib also

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went, with his attendant eunuch, for solace and diversion to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city and the servant followed with a quarter-staff [FN#456] of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: almond-wood so heavy that if he struck a camel therewith the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beast would never rise again. [FN#457] When the people of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Damascus saw Ajib's beauty and brilliancy and perfect grace and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: symmetry (for he was a marvel of comeliness and winning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loveliness, softer than the cool breeze of the North, sweeter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: than limpid waters to a man in drowth, and pleasanter than the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: health for which sick man sueth), a mighty many followed him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilest others ran on before, and sat down on the road until he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: should come up, that they might gaze on him, till, as Destiny had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: decreed, the Eunuch stopped opposite the shop of Ajib's father,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Badr al-Din Hasan. Now his beard had grown long and thick and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his wits had ripened during the twelve years which had passed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over him, and the Cook and ex-rogue having died, the so-called

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan of Bassorah had succeeded to his goods and shop, for that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he had been formally adopted before the Kazi and witnesses. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his son and the Eunuch stepped before him he gazed on Ajib and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seeing how very beautiful he was, his heart fluttered and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: throbbed, and blood drew to blood and natural affection spake out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and his bowels yearned over him. He had just dressed a conserve

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of pomegranate-grains with sugar, and Heaven-implanted love

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wrought within him; so he called to his son Ajib and said, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lord, O thou who hast gotten the mastery of my heart and my very

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: vitals and to whom my bowels yearn; say me, wilt thou enter my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house and solace my soul by eating of my meat? Then his eyes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: streamed with tears which he could not stay, for he bethought him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of what he had been and what he had become. When Ajib heard his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father's words his heart also yearned himwards and he looked at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Eunuch and said to him, Of a truth, O my good guard, my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart yearns to this cook; he is as one that hath a son far away

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from him: so let us enter and gladden his heart by tasting of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hospitality. Perchance for our so doing Allah may reunite me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with my father. When the Eunuch heard these words he cried, A

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fine thing this, by Allah! Shall the sons of Wazirs be seen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eating in a common cook-shop? Indeed I keep off the folk from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee with this quarter-staff lest they even look upon thee; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dare not suffer thee to enter this shop at all. When Hasan of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bassorah heard his speech he marvelled and turned to the Eunuch

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the tears pouring down his cheeks; and Ajib said, Verily my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart loves him! But he answered, Leave this talk, thou shalt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not go in. Thereupon the father turned to the Eunuch and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O worthy sir, why wilt thou not gladden my soul by entering my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shop? O thou who art like a chestnut, dark without but white of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart within! O thou of the like of whom a certain poet said * *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: * The Eunuch burst out a-laughing and asked--Said what? Speak

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out by Allah and be quick about it. So Hasan the Bassorite

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began reciting these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If not master of manners or aught but discreet * In the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: household of Kings no trust could he take:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And then for the Harem! what Eunuch [FN#458] is he * Whom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: angels would serve for his service sake.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Eunuch marvelled and was pleased at these words, so he took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ajib by the hand and went into the cook's shop: whereupon Hasan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Bassorite ladled into a saucer some conserve of pomegranate-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grains wonderfully good, dressed with almonds and sugar, saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: You have honoured me with your company: eat then and health and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happiness to you! Thereupon Ajib said to his father, Sit thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down and eat with us; so perchance Allah may unite us with him we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: long for. Quoth Hasan, O my son, hast thou then been afflicted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in thy tender years with parting from those thou lovest? Quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ajib, Even so, O nuncle mine; my heart burns for the loss of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beloved one who is non other than my father; and indeed I come

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth, I and my grandfather, [FN#459] to circle and search the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: world for him. Oh, the pity of it, and how I long to meet him!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he wept with exceeding for his own bereavement, which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recalled to him his long separation from dear friends and from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his mother; and the Eunuch was moved to pity for him. Then they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ate together till they were satisfied; and Ajib and the slave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose and left the shop. Hereat Hasan the Bassorite felt as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: though his soul had departed his body and had gone with them; for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he could not lose sight of the boy during the twinkling of an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eye, albeit he knew not that Ajib was his son. So he locked up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his shop and hastened after them; and he walked so fast that he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came up with them before they had gone out of the western gate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Eunuch turned and asked him, What ails the?; and Badr al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Din answered, When ye went from me, meseemed my soul had gone

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with you; and, as I had business without the city-gate, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: purposed to bear you company till my matter was ordered and so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: return. The Eunuch was angered and said to Ajib, This is just

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what I feared! we ate that unlucky mouthful (which we are bound

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to respect), and here is the fellow following us from place to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: place; for the vulgar are ever the vulgar. Ajib, turning and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seeing the Cook just behind him, was wroth and his face reddened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with rage and he said to the servant; Let him walk the highway

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Moslems; but, when we turn off it to our tents, and find

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that he still follows us, we will send him about his business

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a flea in his ear. Then he bowed his head and walked on,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Eunuch walking behind him. But Hasan of Bassorah followed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them to the plain Al-Hasa; and, as they drew near to the tents,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they turned round and saw him close on their heels; so Ajib was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: very angry, fearing that the Eunuch might tell his grandfather

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what had happened. His indignation was the hotter for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: apprehension lest any say that after he had entered a cook-shop

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the cook had followed him. So he turned and looked at Hasan of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bassorah and found his eyes fixed on his own, for the father had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: become a body without a soul; and it seemed to Ajib that his eye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was a treacherous eye or that he was some lewd fellow. So his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rage redoubled and, stooping down, he took up a stone weighing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: half a pound and threw it at his father. It struck him on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forehead, cutting it open from eye-brow to eye-brow and causing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the blood to stream down: and Hasan fell to the ground in a swoon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilst Ajib and the Eunuch made for the tents. When the father

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came to himself he wiped away the blood and tore off a strip from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his turband and bound up his head, blaming himself the while, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, I wronged the lad by shutting up my shop and following,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so that he thought I was some evil-minded fellow. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned to his place where he busied himself with the sale of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his sweetmeats; and he yearned after his mother at Bassorah, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wept over her and broke out repeating:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Unjust it were to bid the World [FN#460] be just * And blame

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her not: She ne'er was made for justice:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Take what she gives thee, leave all grief aside, * For now to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fair and then to foul her lust is.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So Hasan of Bassorah set himself steadily to sell his sweetmeats;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but the Wazir, his uncle, halted in Damascus three days and then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marched upon Emesa, and passing through that town he made enquiry

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there and at every place where he rested. Thence he fared on by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: way of Hamah and Aleppo and thence to Diyar Bakr and Maridin and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mosul, still enquiring, till he arrived at Bassorah-city. Here,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as soon as he had secured a lodging, he presented himself before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Sultan, who entreated him with high honour and the respect

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: due to his rank, and asked the cause of his coming. The Wazir

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: acquainted him with his history and told him that the Minister

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nur al-Din was his brother; whereupon the Sultan exclaimed,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah have mercy upon him! and added, My good Sahib!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#461]; he was my Wazir for fifteen years and I loved him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceedingly. Then he died leaving a son who abode only a single

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: month after his father's death; since which time he has

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disappeared and we could gain no tidings of him. But his mother,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who is the daughter of my former Minister, is still among us.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the Wazir Shams al-Din heard that his nephew's mother was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alive and well, he rejoiced and said, O King I much desire to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: meet her. The King on the instant gave him leave to visit her;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so he betook himself to the mansion of his brother, Nur al-Din,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and cast sorrowful glances on all things in and around it and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kissed the threshold. Then he bethought him of his brother, Nur

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din Ali, and how he had died in a strange land far from kith

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and kin and friends; and he wept and repeated these lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I wander 'mid these walls, my Layla's walls, * And kissing this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and other wall I roam:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'Tis not the walls or roof my heart so loves, * But those who in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this house had made their home.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he passed through the gate into a courtyard and found a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: vaulted doorway builded of hardest syenite [FN#462] inlaid with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sundry kinds of multi-coloured marble. Into this he walked and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wandered about the house and, throwing many a glance around, saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the name of his brother, Nur al-Din, written in gold wash upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the walls. So he went up to the inscription and kissed it and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wept and thought of how he had been separated from his brother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and had now lost him for ever, and he recited these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I ask of you from every rising sun, * And eke I ask when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flasheth levenlight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I pass my nights in passion-pain, * Yet ne'er I 'plain me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of my painful plight;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: My love! if longer last this parting throe * Little by little

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall it waste my sprite.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: An thou wouldst bless these eyne with sight of thee * One day on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: earth, I crave none other sight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Think not another could possess my mind * Nor length nor breadth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for other love I find.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he walked on till he came to the apartment of his brother's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: widow, the mother of Badr al-Din Hasan, the Egyptian. Now from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the time of her son's disappearance she had never ceased weeping

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and wailing through the light hours and the dark; and, when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: years grew longsome with her, she built for him a tomb of marble

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the midst of the saloon and there used to weep for him day and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night, never sleeping save thereby. When the Wazir drew near her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: apartment, he heard her voice and stood behind the door while she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: addressed the sepulchre in verse and said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Answer, by Allah! Sepulchre, are all his beauties gone? * Hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: change the power to blight his charms, that Beauty's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: paragon?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou art not earth, O Sepulchre! nor art thou sky to me; * How

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: comes it, then, in thee I see conjoint the branch and moon?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: While she was bemoaning herself after this fashion, behold, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir went in to her and saluted her and informed her that he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her husband's brother; and, telling her all that had passed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: between them, laid open before her the whole story, how her son

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Badr al-Din Hasan had spent a whole night with his daughter full

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ten years ago but had disappeared in the morning. And he ended

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with saying, My daughter conceived by thy son and bare a male

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: child who is now with me, and he is thy son and thy son's son by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my daughter. When she heard the tidings that her boy, Badr al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Din, was still alive and saw her brother-in-law, she rose up to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and threw herself at his feet and kissed them, reciting these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah be good to him that gives glad tidings of thy steps; * In

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: very sooth for better news mine ears would never sue:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Were he content with worn-out robe, upon his back I'd throw * A

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart to pieces rent and torn when heard the word Adieu.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the Wazir sent for Ajib and his grandmother stood up and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell on his neck and wept; but Shams al-Din said to her, This is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no time for weeping; this is the time to get thee ready for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: travelling with us to the land of Egypt; haply Allah will reunite

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and thee with thy son and my nephew. Replied she,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hearkening and obedience; and, rising at once, collected her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: baggage and treasures and her jewels, and equipped herself and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her slave-girls for the march, whilst the Wazir went to take his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leave of the Sultan of Bassorah, who sent by him presents and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rarities for the Soldan of Egypt. Then he set out at once upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his homeward march and journeyed till he came to Damascus-city

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where he alighted in the usual place and pitched tents, and said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to his suite, We will halt a se'nnight here to buy presents and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rare things for the Soldan. Now Ajib bethought him of the past

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so he said to the Eunuch, O Laik, I want a little diversion;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: come, let us go down to the great bazar of Damascus, [FN#463] and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: see what hath become of the cook whose sweetmeats we ate and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose head we broke, for indeed he was kind to us and we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entreated him scurvily. The Eunuch answered, Hearing is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: obeying! So they went forth from the tents; and the tie of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blood drew Ajib towards his father, and forthwith they passed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: through the gateway, Bab al-Faradis [FN#464] hight, and entered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the city and ceased not walking through the streets till they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reached the cookshop, where they found Hasan of Bassorah standing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at the door. It was near the time of mid-afternoon prayer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#465] and it so fortuned that he had just dressed a confection

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of pomegranate-grains. When the twain drew near to him and Ajib

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw him, his heart yearned towards him, and noticing the scar of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the blow, which time had darkened on his brow, he said to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Peace be on thee, O man! [FN#466] know that my heart is with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. But when Badr al-Din looked upon his son his vitals

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yearned and his heart fluttered, and he hung his head earthwards

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and sought to make his tongue give utterance to his words, but he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: could not. Then he raised his head humbly and suppliant-wise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: towards his boy and repeated these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I longed for my beloved but when I saw his face, * Abashed I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: held my tongue and stood with downcast eye;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And hung my head in dread and would have hid my love, * But do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whatso I would hidden it would not lie;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Volumes of plaints I had prepared, reproach and blame, * But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when we met, no single word remembered I.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And then said he to them, Heal my broken heart and eat of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sweetmeats; for, by Allah, I cannot look at thee but my heart

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flutters. Indeed I should not have followed thee the other day,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but that I was beside myself. By Allah, answered Ajib, thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dost indeed love us! We ate in thy house a mouthful when we were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: here before and thou madest us repent of it, for that thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: followedst us and wouldst have disgraced us; so now we will not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eat aught with thee save on condition that thou make oath not to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: go out after us nor dog us. Otherwise we will not visit thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again during our present stay; for we shall halt a week here,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilst my grandfather buys certain presents for the King. Quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan of Bassorah, I promise you this. So Ajib and the Eunuch

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered the shop, and his father set before them a saucer-full of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: conserve of pomegranate-grains. Said Ajib, Sit thee down and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eat with us, so haply shall Allah dispel our sorrows. Hasan the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bassorite was joyful and sat down and ate with them; but his eyes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kept gazing fixedly on Ajib's face, for his very heart and vitals

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clove to him; and at last the boy said to him, Did I not tell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee thou art a most noyous dotard?; so do stint thy staring in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my face! But when Hasan of Bassorah heard his son's words he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repeated these lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou hast some art the hearts of men to clip; * Close-veiled,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: far-hidden mystery dark and deep:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O thou whose beauties sham the lustrous moon, * Wherewith the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saffron Morn fears rivalship!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thy beauty is a shrine shall ne'er decay; * Whose signs shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grow until they all outstrip; [FN#467]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Must I be thirst-burnt by that Eden-brow * And die of pine to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: taste that Kausar-lip? [FN#468]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan kept putting morsels into Ajib's mouth at one time and at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another time did the same by the Eunuch and they ate till they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were satisfied and could no more. Then all rose up and the cook

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poured water on their hands; [FN#469] and, loosing a silken

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waist-shawl, dried them and sprinkled them with rose-water from a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: casting-bottle he had by him. Then he went out and presently

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned with a gugglet of sherbet flavoured with rose-water,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: scented with musk and cooled with snow; and he set this before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them saying, Complete your kindness to me! So Ajib took the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gugglet and drank and passed it to the Eunuch; and it went round

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till their stomachs were full and they were surfeited with a meal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: larger than their wont. Then they went away and made haste in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: walking till they reached the tents, and Ajib went in to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grandmother, who kissed him and, thinking of her son, Badr al-Din

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan, groaned aloud and wept and recited these lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I still had hoped to see thee and enjoy thy sight, * For in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thine absence life has lost its kindly light:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I swear my vitals wot none other love but thine * By Allah, who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: can read the secrets of the sprite!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she asked Ajib, O my son! where hast thou been?; and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, In Damascus-city; Whereupon she rose and set before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him a bit of scone and a saucer of conserve of pomegranate-grains

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (which was too little sweetened), and she said to the Eunuch,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sit down with thy master! Said the servant to himself, By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, we have no mind to eat: I cannot bear the smell of bread;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but he sat down and so did Ajib, though his stomach was full of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what he had eaten already and drunken. Nevertheless he took a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bit of the bread and dipped it in the pomegranate-conserve and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made shift to eat it, but he found it too little sweetened, for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he was cloyed and surfeited, so he said, Faugh; what be this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wild-beast [FN#470] stuff? O my son, cried his grandmother,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dost thou find fault with my cookery? I cooked this myself and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: none can cook it as nicely as I can save thy father, Badr al-Din

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan. By Allah, O my lady, Ajib answered, this dish is nasty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stuff; for we saw but now in the city of Bassorah a cook who so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dresseth pomegranate-grains that the very smell openeth a way to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the heart and the taste would make a full man long to eat; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as for this mess compared with his, 'tis not worth either much or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: little. When his grandmother heard his words she waxed wroth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with exceeding wrath and looked at the servant--And Shahrazad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perceived the dawn of day and ceased to say her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twenty-fourth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that when Ajib's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grandmother heard his words, she waxed wroth and looked at the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: servant and said, Woe to thee! dost thou spoil my son, [FN#471]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and dost take him into common cookshops? The Eunuch was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: frightened and denied, saying, We did not go into the shop; we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: only passed by it. By Allah, cried Ajib, but we did go in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and we ate till it came out of our nostrils, and the dish was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: better than thy dish! Then his grandmother rose and went and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: told her brother-in-law, who was incensed against the Eunuch, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sending for him asked him, Why didst thou take my son into a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cookshop?; and the Eunuch being frightened answered, We did not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: go in. But Ajib said, We did go inside and ate conserve of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pomegranate-grains till we were full; and the cook gave us to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drink of iced and sugared sherbet. At this the Wazir's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: indignation redoubled and he questioned the Castrato but, as he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: still denied, the Wazir said to him, If thou speak sooth, sit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down and eat before us. So he came forward and tried to eat,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but could not eat and threw away the mouthful crying O my lord!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I am surfeited since yesterday. By this the Wazir was certified

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that he had eaten at the cook's and bade the slaves throw him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#472] which they did. Then they came down on him with a rib-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: basting which burned him till he cried for mercy and help from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, saying, O my master, beat me no more and I will tell thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the truth; whereupon the Wazir stopped the bastinado and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now speak thou sooth. Quoth the Eunuch, Know then that we did

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enter the shop of a cook while he was dressing conserve of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pomegranate-grains and he set some of it before us: by Allah! I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: never ate in my life its like, nor tasted aught nastier than this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stuff which is now before us.[FN#473] Badr al-Din Hasan's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mother was angry at this and said, Needs thou must go back to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the cook and bring me a saucer of conserved pomegranate-grains

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from that which is in his shop and show it to thy master, that he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: may say which be the better and the nicer, mine or his. Said the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unsexed, I will. So on the instant she gave him a saucer and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: half dinar and he returned to the shop and said to the cook, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shaykh of all Cooks, [FN#474] we have laid a wager concerning thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cookery in my lord's house, for they have conserve of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pomegranate-grains there also; so give me this half-dinar's worth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and look to it; for I have eaten a full meal of stick on account

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of thy cookery, and so do not let me eat aught more thereof.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan of Bassorah laughed and answered, By Allah, none can dress

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this dish as it should be dressed save myself and my mother, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she at this time is in a far country. Then he ladled out a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saucer-full; and, finishing it off with musk and rose-water, put

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it in a cloth which he sealed [FN#475] and gave it to the Eunuch,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who hastened back with it. No sooner had Badr al-Din Hasan's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mother tasted it and perceived its fine flavour and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: excellence of the cookery, than she knew who had dressed it, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she screamed and fell down fainting. The Wazir, sorely started,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sprinkled rose-water upon her and after a time she recovered and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, If my son be yet of this world, none dressed this conserve

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of pomegranate-grains but he; and this Cook is my very son Badr

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din Hasan; there is no doubt of it nor can there be any

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mistake, for only I and he knew how to prepare it and I taught

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him. When the Wazir heard her words he joyed with exceeding joy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, O the longing of me for a sight of my brother's son!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I wonder if the days will ever unite us with him! Yet it is to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Almighty Allah alone that we look for bringing about this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: meeting. Then he rose without stay or delay and, going to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: suite said to them, Be off, some fifty of you with sticks and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: staves to the Cook's shop and demolish it; then pinion his arms

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: behind him with his own turband, saying, 'It was thou madest that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: foul mess of pomegranate-grains!' and drag him here perforce but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without doing him a harm. And they replied, It is well. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir rode off without losing an instant to the Palace and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: foregathering with the Viceroy of Damascus, showed him the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sultan's orders. After careful perusal he kissed the letter, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: placing it upon his head said to his visitor, Who is this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: offender of thine? Quoth the Wazir, A man who is a cook. So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Viceroy at once sent his apparitors to the shop; which they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found demolished and everything in it broken to pieces; for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilst the Wazir was riding to the palace his men had done his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bidding. Then they awaited his return from the audience, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hasan of Bassorah who was their prisoner kept saying, I wonder

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what they have found in the conserve of pomegranate-grains to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bring things to this pass! [FN#476] When the Wazir returned to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them, after his visit to the Viceroy who had given him formal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: permission to take up his debtor and depart with him, on entering

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the tents he called for the Cook. They brought him forward

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pinioned with his turband; and, when Badr al-Din Hasan saw his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uncle, he wept with excessive weeping and said, O my lord, what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is my offence against thee? Art thou the man who dressed that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: conserve of pomegranate-grains?; asked the Wazir, and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered Yes! didst thou find in it aught to call for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cutting off of my head? Quoth the Wazir, That were the least

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of thy deserts! Quoth the cook, O my lord, wilt thou not tell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me my crime and what aileth the conserve of pomegranate-grains?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Presently, replied the Wazir and called aloud to his men,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bring hither the camels. So they struck the tents and by the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir's orders the servants took Badr al-Din Hasan, and set him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in a chest which they padlocked and put on a camel. Then they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: departed and stinted not journeying till nightfall, when they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: halted and ate some victual, and took Badr al-Din Hasan out of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his chest and gave him a meal and locked him up again. They set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out once more and travelled till they reached Kimrah, where they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took him out of the box and brought him before the Wazir who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asked him, Art thou he who dressed that conserve of pomegranate-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grains? He answered Yes, O my lord!; and the Wazir said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fetter him! So they fettered him and returned him to the chest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and fared on again till they reached Cairo and lighted at the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quarter called Al-Raydaniyah.[FN#477] Then the Wazir gave order

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to take Badr al-Din Hasan out of the chest and sent for a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carpenter and said to him, Make me a cross of wood [FN#478] for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this fellow! Cried Badr al-Din Hasan And what wilt thou do with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it?; and the Wazir replied, I mean to crucify thee thereon, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nail thee thereto and parade thee all about the city. And why

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wilt thou use me after this fashion? Because of thy villanous

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cookery of conserved pomegranate-grains; how durst thou dress it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and sell it lacking pepper? And for that it lacked pepper wilt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou do all this to me? Is it not enough that thou hast broken

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my shop and smashed my gear and boxed me up in a chest and fed me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: only once a day? Too little pepper! too little pepper! this is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a crime which can be expiated only upon the cross! Then Badr

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din Hasan marvelled and fell a-mourning for his life;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon the Wazir asked him, Of what thinkest thou?; and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered him, Of maggoty heads like thine; [FN#479] for an thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had one ounce of sense thou hadst not treated me thus. Quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Wazir, It is our duty to punish thee lest thou do the like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again. Quoth Badr al-Din Hasan, Of a truth my offense were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over-punished by the least of what thou hast already done to me;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and Allah damn all conserve of pomegranate-grains and curse the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hour when I cooked it and would I had died ere this! But the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir rejoined, There is no help for it; I must crucify a man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who sells conserve of pomegranate-grains lacking pepper. All

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this time the carpenter was shaping the wood and Badr al-Din

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looked on; and thus they did till night, when his uncle took him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and clapped him into the chest, saying, The thing shall be done

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to-morrow! Then he waited until he knew Badr al-Din Hasan to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be asleep, when he mounted; and taking the chest up before him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered the city and rode on to his own house, where he alighted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said to his daughter, Sitt al-Husn, Praised be Allah who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath reunited thee with thy husband, the son of thine uncle! Up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: now, and order the house as it was on thy bridal night. So the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: servants arose and lit the candles; and the Wazir took out his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: plan of the nuptial chamber, and directed them what to do till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they had set everything in its stead, so that whoever saw it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would have no doubt but it was the very night of the marriage.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he bade them put down Badr al-Din Hasan's turband on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: settle, as he had deposited it with his own hand, and in like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: manner his bag-trousers and the purse which were under the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mattress: and told daughter to undress herself and go to bed in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the private chamber as on her wedding-night, adding, When the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son of thine uncle comes in to thee, say to him:--Thou hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loitered while going to the privy; and call him to lie by thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: side and keep him in converse till daybreak, when we will explain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the whole matter to him. Then he bade take Badr al-Din Hasan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out of the chest, after loosing the fetters from his feet and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stripping off all that was on him save the fine shirt of blue

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: silk in which he had slept on his wedding-night; so that he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: well-nigh naked and trouserless. All this was done whilst he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sleeping on utterly unconscious. Then, by doom of Destiny, Badr

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din Hasan turned over and awoke; and, finding himself in a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lighted vestibule, said to himself, Surely I am in the mazes of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: some dream. So he rose and went on to a little to an inner door

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and looked in and lo! he was in the very chamber wherein the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bride had been displayed to him; and there he saw the bridal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alcove and the settle and his turband and all his clothes. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he saw this he was confounded and kept advancing with one foot,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and retiring with the other, saying, Am I sleeping or waking?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And he began rubbing his forehead and saying (for indeed he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thoroughly astounded), By Allah, verily this is the chamber of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bride who was displayed before me! Where am I then? I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surely but now in a box! Whilst he was talking with himself,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sitt al-Husn suddenly lifted the corner of the chamber-curtain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, O my lord, wilt thou not come in? Indeed thou hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loitered long in the water-closet. When he heard her words and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw her face he burst out laughing and said, Of a truth this is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a very nightmare among dreams! Then he went in sighing, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pondered what had come to pass with him and was perplexed about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his case, and his affair became yet more obscure to him when he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw his turband and bag-trousers and when, feeling the pocket, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found the purse containing the thousand gold pieces. So he stood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: still and muttered, Allah is all knowing! Assuredly I am

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dreaming a wild waking dream! Then said the Lady of Beauty to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, What ails thee to look puzzled and perplexed?; adding,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou wast a very different man during the first of the night!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He laughed and asked her, How long have I been away from thee?;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she answered him, Allah preserve thee and His Holy Name be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about thee! Thou didst but go out an hour ago for an occasion

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and return. Are thy wits clean gone? When Badr al-Din Hasan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard this, he laughed, [FN#480] and said, Thou hast spoken

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: truth; but, when I went out from thee, I forgot myself awhile in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the draught-house and dreamed that I was a cook at Damascus and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abode there ten years; and there came to me a boy who was of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sons of the great, and with him an Eunuch. Here he passed his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand over his forehead and, feeling the scar, cried, By Allah, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my lady, it must have been true, for he struck my forehead with a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stone and cut it open from eye-brow to eye-brow; and here is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mark: so it must have been on wake. Then he added, But perhaps

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I dreamt it when we fell asleep, I and thou, in each other's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arms, for meseems it was as though I travelled to Damascus

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without tarbush and trousers and set up as a cook there. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he was perplexed and considered for awhile, and said, By Allah,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I also fancied that I dressed a conserve of pomegranate-grains

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and put too little pepper in it. By Allah, I must have slept in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the numerocent and have seen the whole thing in a dream; but how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: long was that dream! Allah upon thee, said Sitt al-Husn, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what more sawest thou? So he related all to her; and presently

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, By Allah had I not woke up they would have nailed me to a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cross of wood! Wherefore? asked she; and he answered, For

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: putting too little pepper in the conserve of pomegranate-grains,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and meseemed they demolished my shop and dashed to pieces my pots

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and pans, destroyed all my stuff and put me in a box; they then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sent for the carpenter to fashion a cross for me and would have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crucified me thereon. Now Alham-dolillah! thanks be to Allah, for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that all this happened to me in sleep, and not on wake. Sitt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Husn laughed and clasped him to her bosom and he her to his:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: then he thought again and said, By Allah, it could not be save

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: while I was awake: truly I know not what to think of it. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he lay him down and all the night he was bewildered about his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: case, now saying, I was dreaming! and then saying, I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: awake!, till morning, when his uncle Shams al-Din, the Wazir,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came to him and saluted him. When Badr al-Din Hasan saw him he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, By Allah, art thou not he who bade bind my hands behind me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and smash my shop and nail me to a cross on a matter of conserved

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pomegranate-grains because the dish lacked a sufficiency of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pepper? Whereupon the Wazir said to him, Know, O my son, that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: truth hath shown it soothfast and the concealed hath been

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: revealed! [FN#481] Thou art the son of my brother, and I did all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this with thee to certify myself that thou wast indeed he who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went in unto my daughter that night. I could not be sure of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this, till I saw that thou knewest the chamber and thy turband

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and thy trousers and thy gold and the papers in thy writing and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in that of thy father, my brother; for I had never seen thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: afore that and knew thee not; and as to thy mother I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prevailed upon her to come with me from Bassorah. So saying, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: threw himself on his nephew's breast and wept for joy; and Badr

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din Hasan, hearing these words from his uncle, marvelled with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding marvel and fell on his neck and also shed tears for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: excess of delight. Then said the Wazir to him, O my son, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sole cause of all this is what passed between me and thy sire;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and all that had occurred to part them. Lastly the Wazir sent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for Ajib; and when his father saw him he cried, And this is he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who struck me with the stone! Quoth the Wazir, This is thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son! And Badr al-Din Hasan threw himself upon his boy and began

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repeating:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Long have I wept o'er severance ban and bane, * Long from mine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyelids tear-rills rail and rain:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And vowed I if Time re-union bring * My tongue from name of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Severance I'll restrain:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Joy hath o'ercome me to this stress that I * From joy's revulsion

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to shed tears am fain:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ye are so trained to tears, O eyne of me! * You weep with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pleasure as you weep with pain. [FN#482]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When he had ended his verse his mother came in and threw herself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon him and began reciting:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When we met we complained, * Our hearts were sore wrung:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But plaint is not pleasant * Fro' messenger's tongue.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she wept and related to him what had befallen her since his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: departure, and he told her what he had suffered, and they thanked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah Almighty for their reunion. Two days after his arrival the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wazir Shams al-din went in to the Sultan and, kissing the ground

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: between his hands, greeted him with the greeting due to Kings.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Sultan rejoiced at his return and his face brightened and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: placing him hard by his side, [FN#483] asked him to relate all he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had seen in his wayfaring and whatso had betided him in his going

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and coming. So the Wazir told him all that had passed from first

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to last and the Sultan said, Thanks be to Allah for thy victory

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#484] and the winning of thy wish and thy safe return to thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: children and thy people! And now I needs must see the son of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother, Hasan of Bassorah, so bring him to the audience-hall to-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: morrow. Shams al-Din replied, Thy slave shall stand in thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presence to-morrow, Inshallah, if it be God's will. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saluted him and, returning to his own house, informed his nephew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Sultan's desire to see him, whereto replied Hasan, whilome

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Bassorite, The slave is obedient to the orders of his lord.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And the result was that next day he accompanied his uncle, Shams

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Din, to the Divan; and, after saluting the Sultan and doing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him reverence in most ceremonious obeisance and with most courtly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: obsequiousness, he began improvising these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The first in rank to kiss the ground shall deign * Before you,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and all ends and aims attain:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: You are Honour's fount; and all that hope of you, * Shall gain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more honour than Hope hoped to gain.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Sultan smiled and signed to him to sit down. So he took a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seat close to his uncle, Shams al-Din, and the King asked him his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: name. Quoth Badr al-Din Hasan, The meanest of thy slaves is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: known as Hasan the Bassorite, who is instant in prayer for thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day and night. The Sultan was pleased at his words and, being

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: minded to test his learning and prove his good breeding, asked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, Dost thou remember any verses in praise of the mole on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cheek? He answered, I do, and began reciting:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I think of my love and our parting-smart, * My groans go

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth and my tears upstart:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He's a mole that reminds me in colour and charms * O' the black

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: o' the eye and the grain [FN#485] of the heart.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King admired and praised the two couplets and said to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quote something else; Allah bless thy sire and may thy tongue

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: never tire! So he began:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: That cheek-mole's spot they evened with a grain * Of musk, nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: did they here the simile strain:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nay, marvel at the face comprising all * Beauty, nor falling

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: short by single grain.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The King shook with pleasure [FN#486] and said to him, Say more:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah bless thy days! So he began:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O you whose mole on cheek enthroned recalls * A dot of musk

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon a stone of ruby,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Grant me your favours! Be not stone at heart! * Core of my heart

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose only sustenance you be!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth the King, Fair comparison, O Hasan! [FN#487] thou hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spoken excellently well and hast proved thyself accomplished in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: every accomplishment! Now explain to me how many meanings be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there in the Arabic language [FN#488] for the word Khal or mole.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He replied, Allah keep the King! Seven and fifty and some by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tradition say fifty. Said the Sultan, Thou sayest sooth,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presently adding, Hast thou knowledge as to the points of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: excellence in beauty? Yes, answered Badr al-Din Hasan,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Beauty consisteth in brightness of face, clearness of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: complexion, shapeliness of nose, gentleness of eyes, sweetness of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mouth, cleverness of speech, slenderness of shape and seemliness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of all attributes. But the acme of beauty is in the hair and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: indeed, al-Shihab the Hijazi hath brought together all these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: items in his doggrel verse of the metre Rajaz, [FN#489] and it is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Say thou to skin Be soft, to face Be fair, * And gaze, nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall they blame howso thou stare:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fine nose in Beauty's list is high esteemed; * Nor less an eye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: full, bright and debonnair:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Eke did they well to laud the lovely lips * (Which e'en the sleep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of me will never spare);

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A winning tongue, a stature tall and straight; [FN#490] * A

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seemly union of gifts rarest rare:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But Beauty's acme in the hair one views it; * So hear my strain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and with some few excuse it!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Sultan was captivated by his converse and, regarding him as a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: friend, asked, What meaning is there in the saw 'Shurayh is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: foxier than the fox'? And he answered, Know, O King (whom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Almighty Allah keep!) that the legist Shurayh [FN#491] was wont,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: during the days of the plague, to make a visitation to Al-Najaf;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, whenever he stood up to pray, there came a fox which would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: plant himself facing him and which, by mimicking his movements,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: distracted him from his devotions. Now when this became longsome

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him, one day he doffed his shirt and set it upon a cane and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shook out the sleeves; then placing his turband on the top and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: girding its middle with a shawl, he stuck it up in the place

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where he used to pray. Presently up trotted the fox according to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his custom and stood over against the figure, whereupon Shurayh

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came behind him, and took him. Hence the sayer saith, 'Shurayh

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: foxier than the fox.' When the Sultan heard Badr al-Din Hasan's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: explanation he said to his uncle, Shams al-Din, Truly this the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son of thy brother is perfect in courtly breeding and I do not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: think that his like can be found in Cairo. At this Hasan arose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and kissed the ground before him and sat down again as a Mameluke

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: should sit before his master. When the Sultan had thus assured

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself of his courtly breeding and bearing and his knowledge of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the liberal arts and belles-lettres, he joyed with exceeding joy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and invested him with a splendid robe of honour and promoted him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to an office whereby he might better his condition. [FN#492]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then Badr al-Din Hasan arose and, kissing the ground before the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King, wished him continuance of glory and asked leave to retire

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with his uncle, the Wazir Shams al-Din. The Sultan gave him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leave and he issued forth and the two returned home, where food

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was set before them and they ate what Allah had given them.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: After finishing his meal Hasan repaired to the sitting-chamber of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his wife, the Lady of Beauty, and told her what had past between

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and the Sultan; whereupon quoth she, He cannot fail to make

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee a cup-companion and give thee largess in excess and load

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee with favours and bounties; so shalt thou, by Allah's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blessing, dispread, like the greater light, the rays of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perfection wherever thou be, on shore or on sea. Said he to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her, I purpose to recite a Kasidah, an ode, in his praise, that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he may redouble in affection for me. Thou art right in thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: intent, she answered, so gather thy wits together and weigh thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words, and I shall surely see my husband favoured with his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: highest favour. Thereupon Hasan shut himself up and composed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these couplets on a solid base and abounding in inner grace and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: copies them out in a hand-writing of the nicest taste. They are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as follows:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mine is a Chief who reached most haught estate, * Treading the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pathways of the good and great:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: His justice makes all regions safe and sure, * And against

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: froward foes bars every gate:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bold lion, hero, saint, e'en if you call * Seraph or Sovran

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#493] he with all may rate!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The poorest supplicant rich from him returns, * All words to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: praise him were inadequate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He to the day of peace is saffron Morn, * And murky Night in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: furious warfare's bate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bow 'neath his gifts our necks, and by his deeds * As King of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: freeborn [FN#494] souls he 'joys his state:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah increase for us his term of years, * And from his lot avert

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all risks and fears!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When he had finished transcribing the lines, he despatched them,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in charge of one of his uncle's slaves, to the Sultan, who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perused them and his fancy was pleased; so he read them to those

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: present and all praised them with the highest praise. Thereupon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he sent for the writer to his sitting-chamber and said to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou art from this day forth my boon-companion and I appoint to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee a monthly solde of a thousand dirhams, over and above that I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bestowed on thee aforetime. So Hasan rose and, kissing the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ground before the King several times, prayed for the continuance

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of his greatness and glory and length of life and strength. Thus

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Badr al-Din Hasan the Bassorite waxed high in honour and his fame

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flew forth to many regions and he abode in all comfort and solace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and delight of life with his uncle and his own folk till Death

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: overtook him. When the Caliph Harun al-Rashid heard this story

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from the mouth of his Wazir, Ja'afar the Barmecide, he marvelled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: much and said, It behoves that these stories be written in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: letters of liquid gold. Then he set the slave at liberty and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: assigned to the youth who had slain his wife such a monthly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stipend as sufficed to make his life easy; he also gave him a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: concubine from amongst his own slave-girls and the young man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: became one of his cup-companions. Yet this story, (continued

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shahrazad) is in no wise stranger than the tale of the Tailor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the Hunchback and the Jew and the Reeve and the Nazarene, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what betided them. Quoth the King, And what may that be? So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shahrazad began, in these words,[FN#495]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: THE HUNCHBACK'S TALE.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that there dwelt during

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: times of yore, and years and ages long gone before, in a certain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city of China,[FN#496] a Tailor who was an open handed man that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loved pleasuring and merry making; and who was wont, he and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife, to solace themselves from time to time with public

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: diversions and amusements. One day they went out with the first

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the light and were returning in the evening when they fell in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a Hunchback, whose semblance would draw a laugh from care

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and dispel the horrors of despair. So they went up to enjoy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looking at him and invited him to go home with them and converse

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and carouse with them that night. He consented and accompanied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them afoot to their home; whereupon the Tailor fared forth to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bazaar (night having just set in) and bought a fried fish and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bread and lemons and dry sweetmeats for dessert; and set the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: victuals before the Hunchback and they ate. Presently the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tailor's wife took a great fid of fish and gave it in a gobbet to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Gobbo, stopping his mouth with her hand and saying, By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, thou must down with it at a single gulp; and I will not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: give thee time to chew it. So he bolted it; but therein was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stiff bone which stuck in his gullet and, his hour being come, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: died.--And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased saying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twenty-fifth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tailor's wife gave the Hunchback that mouthful of fish which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ended his term of days he died on the instant. Seeing this the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tailor cried aloud, There is no Majesty and there is no Might

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: save in Allah! Alas, that this poor wretch should have died in so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: foolish fashion at our hands! and the woman rejoined, Why this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: idle talk? Hast thou not heard his saying who said:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Why then waste I my time in grief, until I * find no friend to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bear my weight of woe

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How sleep upon a fire that flames unquenched? * Upon the flames

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to rest were hard enow!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Asked her husband, And what shall I do with him?; and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, Rise and take him in thine arms and spread a silken

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kerchief over him; then I will fare forth, with thee following me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this very night and if thou meet any one say, 'This is my son,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and his mother and I are carrying him to the doctor that he may

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: look at him.' So he rose and taking the Hunchback in his arms

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bore him along the streets, preceded by his wife who kept crying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O my son, Allah keep thee! what part paineth thee and where hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
