text: this small-pox[FN#497] attacked thee? So all who saw them said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tis a child sick of small-pox. [FN#498] They went along asking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the physician's house till folk directed them to that of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leach which was a Jew. They knocked at the door, and there came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down to them a black slave girl who opened and, seeing a man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bearing a babe, and a woman with him, said to them, What is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: matter? We have a little one with us, answered the Tailor's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife, and we wish to show him to the physician: so take this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quarter dinar and give it to thy master and let him come down and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: see my son who is sore sick. The girl went up to tell her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master, whereupon the Tailor's wife walked into the vestibule and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to her husband, Leave the Hunchback here and let us fly for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our lives. So the Tailor carried the dead man to the top of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stairs and propped him upright against the wall and ran away, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and his wife. Meanwhile the girl went in to the Jew and said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, At the door are a man and a woman with a sick child and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they have given me a quarter dinar for thee, that thou mayest go

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down and look at the little one and prescribe for it. As soon as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Jew saw the quarter dinar he rejoiced and rose quickly in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greed of gain and went forth hurriedly in the dark; but hardly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had he made a step when he stumbled on the corpse and threw it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over, when it rolled to the bottom of the staircase. So he cried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out to the girl to hurry up with the light, and she brought it,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon he went down and examining the Hunchback found that he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was stone dead. So he cried out, O for Esdras![FN#499] O for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Moses! O for Aaron! O for Joshua, son of Nun! O the Ten

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Commandments! I have stumbled against the sick one and he hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fallen downstairs and he is dead! How shall I get this man I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: killed out of my house? O by the hoofs of the ass of Esdras!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he took up the body and, carrying it into the house, told

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his wife what had happened and she said to him, Why dost thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sit still? If thou keep him here till day break we shall both

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lose our lives. Let us two carry him to the terrace roof and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: throw him over into the house of our neighbour, the Moslem, for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: if he abide there a night the dogs will come down on him from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: adjoining terraces and eat him up. Now his neighbour was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Reeve, the controller of the Sultan's kitchen, and was wont to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bring back great store of oil and fat and broken meats; but the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cats and rats used to eat it, or, if the dogs scented a fat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sheep's tail they would come down from the nearest roofs and tear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at it; and on this wise the beasts had already damaged much of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what he brought home. So the Jew and his wife carried the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback up to the roof; and, letting him down by his hands and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: feet through the wind-shaft[FN#500] into the Reeve's house,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: propped him up against the wall and went their ways. Hardly had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they done this when the Reeve, who had been passing an evening

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with his friends hearing a recitation of the Koran, came home and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: opened the door and, going up with a lighted candle, found a son

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of Adam standing in the corner under the ventilator. When he saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this, he said, Wah! by Allah, very good forsooth! He who robbeth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my stuff is none other than a man. Then he turned to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback and said, So 'tis thou that stealest the meat and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fat! I thought it was the cats and dogs, and I kill the dogs and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cats of the quarter and sin against them by killing them. And all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the while 'tis thou comest down from the house terrace through

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the wind shaft. But I will avenge myself upon thee with my own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand! So he snatched up a heavy hammer and set upon him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: smote him full on the breast and he fell down. Then he examined

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and, finding that he was dead, cried out in horror, thinking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that he had killed him, and said, There is no Majesty and there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is no Might save in Allah, the Glorious, the Great! And he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: feared for his life, and added Allah curse the oil and the meat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the grease and the sheep's tails to boot! How hath fate given

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this man his quietus at my hand! Then he looked at the body and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seeing it was that of a Gobbo, said, Was it not enough for thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to be a hunchback,[FN#501] but thou must likewise be a thief and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prig flesh and fat! O thou Veiler,[FN#502] deign to veil me with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thy curtain of concealment! So he took him up on his shoulders

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, going forth with him from his house about the latter end of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the night, carried him to the nearest end of the bazaar, where he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set him up on his feet against the wall of a shop at the head of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a dark lane, and left him and went away. After a while up came a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nazarene,[FN#503] the Sultan's broker who, much bemused with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: liquor, was purposing for the Hammam bath as his drunkenness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whispered in his ear, Verily the call to matins[FN#504] is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nigh. He came plodding along and staggering about till he drew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: near the Hunchback and squatted down to make water[FN#505] over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: against him; when he happened to glance around and saw a man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: standing against the wall. Now some person had snatched off the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Christian's turband[FN#506] in the first of the night; so when he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw the Hunchback hard by he fancied that he also meant to steal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his headdress. Thereupon he clenched his fist and struck him on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the neck, felling him to the ground, and called aloud to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: watchman of the bazaar, and came down on the body in his drunken

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fury and kept on belabouring and throttling the corpse. Presently

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Charley came up and, finding a Nazarene kneeling on a Moslem

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and frapping him, asked, What harm hath this one done?; and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Broker answered, The fellow meant to snatch off my turband.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Get up from him, quoth the watch man. So he arose and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Charley went up to the Hunchback and finding him dead, exclaimed,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Allah, good indeed! A Christian killing a Mahometan! Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seized the Broker and, tying his hands behind his back, carried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him to the Governor's house,[FN#507] and all the while the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nazarene kept saying to himself, O Messiah! O Virgin! how came I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to kill this fellow? And in what a hurry he must have been to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: depart this life when he died of a single blow! Presently, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his drunkenness fled, came dolour in its stead. So the Broker and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the body were kept in the Governor's place till morning morrowed,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when the Wali came out and gave order to hang the supposed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: murderer and commanded the executioner[FN#508] make proclamation

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the sentence. Forthwith they set up a gallows under which they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made the Nazarene stand and the torch bearer, who was hangman,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: threw the rope round his neck and passed one end through the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pulley, and was about to hoist him up[FN#509] when lo! the Reeve,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who was passing by, saw the Broker about to be hanged; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: making his way through the people, cried out to the executioner,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hold! Hold! I am he who killed the Hunchback! Asked the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Governor, What made thee kill him?; and he answered, I went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: home last night and there found this man who had come down the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ventilator to steal my property; so I smote him with a hammer on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the breast and he died forthright. Then I took him up and carried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him to the bazaar and set him up against the wall in such a place

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: near such a lane; adding, Is it not enough for me to have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: killed a Moslem without also killing a Christian? So hang none

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other but me. When the Governor heard these words he released

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Broker and said to the torch bearer, Hang up this man on his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: own confession. So he loosed the cord from the Nazarene's neck

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and threw it round that of the Reeve and, making him stand under

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the gallows tree, was about to string him up when behold, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jewish physician pushed through the people and shouted to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: executioner, Hold! Hold! It was I and none else killed the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback! Last night I was sitting at home when a man and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woman knocked at the door carrying this Gobbo who was sick, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gave my handmaid a quarter dinar, bidding her hand me the fee and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tell me to come down and see him. Whilst she was gone the man and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the woman brought him into the house and, setting him on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stairs, went away; and presently I came down and not seeing him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for I was in the dark, stumbled over him and he fell to the foot

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the staircase and died on the moment. Then we took him up, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and my wife, and carried him on to the top terrace; and, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house of this Reeve being next door to mine, we let the body down

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: through the ventilator. When he came home and found the Hunchback

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in his house, he fancied he was a thief and struck him with a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hammer, so that he fell to the ground, and our neighbour made

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: certain that he had slain him. Now is it not enough for me to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have killed one Moslem unwittingly, without burdening myself with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: taking the life of another Moslem wittingly? When the Governor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard this he said to the hangman, Set free the Reeve and hang

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Jew. Thereupon the torch bearer took him and slung the cord

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: round his neck when behold, the Tailor pushed through the people,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and shouted to the executioner, Hold! Hold! It was I and none

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: else killed the Hunchback; and this was the fashion thereof. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had been out a pleasuring yesterday and, coming back to supper,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell in with this Gobbo, who was drunk and drumming away and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: singing lustily to his tambourine. So I accosted him and carried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him to my house and bought a fish, and we sat down to eat.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Presently my wife took a fid of fish and, making a gobbet of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it,[FN#510] crammed it into his mouth; but some of it went down

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the wrong way or stuck in his gullet and he died on the instant.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So we lifted him up, I and my wife, and carried him to the Jew's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house where the slave girl came down and opened the door to us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I said to her, 'Tell thy master that there are a man and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woman and a sick person for thee to see!' I gave her a quarter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinar and she went up to tell her master; and, whilst she was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gone, I carried the Hunchback to the head of the staircase and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: propped him up against the wall, and went off with my wife. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Jew came down he stumbled over him and thought that he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: killed him. Then he asked the Jew, Is this the truth?; and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jew answered, Yes. Thereupon the Tailor turned to the Governor,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, Leave go the Jew and hang me. When the Governor heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Tailor's tale he marvelled at the matter of this Hunchback

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and exclaimed. Verily this is an adventure which should be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recorded in books! Then he said to the hangman, Let the Jew go

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and hang the Tailor on his own confession. The executioner took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Tailor and put the rope around his neck and said, I am tired

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of such slow work: we bring out this one and change him for that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other, and no one is hanged after all! Now the Hunchback in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: question was, they relate, jester to the Sultan of China who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: could not bear him out of his sight; so when the fellow got drunk

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and did not make his appearance that night or the next day till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: noon, the Sultan asked some of his courtiers about him and they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, O our lord, the Governor hath come upon him dead and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath ordered his murderer to be hanged; but, as the hangman was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about to hoist him up there came a second and a third and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fourth and each one said, 'It is I, and none else killed the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback!' and each gave a full and circumstantial account of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the manner of the jester being killed. When the King heard this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he cried aloud to the Chamberlain in waiting, Go down to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Governor and bring me all four of them. So the Chamberlain went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down at once to the place of execution, where he found the torch

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bearer on the point of hanging the Tailor and shouted to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hold! Hold! Then he gave the King's command to the Governor who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took the Tailor, the Jew, the Nazarene and the Reeve (the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback's body being borne on men's shoulders) and went up with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one and all of them to the King. When he came into the presence,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he kissed the ground and acquainted the ruler with the whole

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: story which it is needless to relate for, as they say, There is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no avail in a thrice told tale. The Sultan hearing it marvelled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and was moved to mirth and commanded the story to be written in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: letters of liquid gold, saying to those present, Did ye ever

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hear a more wondrous tale than that of my Hunchback? Thereupon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Nazarene broker came forward and said, O King of the age,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with thy leave I will tell thee a thing which happened to myself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and which is still more wondrous and marvellous and pleasurable

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and delectable than the tale of the Hunchback. Quoth the King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tell us what thou hast to say! So he began in these words

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Nazarene Broker's Story.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O King of the age, I came to this thy country with merchandise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and Destiny stayed me here with you: but my place of birth was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Cairo, in Egypt, where I also was brought up, for I am one of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Copts and my father was a broker before me. When I came to man's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: estate he departed this life and I succeeded to his business. One

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day, as I was sitting in my shop, behold, there came up to me a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth as handsome as could be, wearing sumptuous raiment and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: riding a fine ass.[FN#511] When he saw me he saluted me, and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stood up to do him honour: then he took out a kerchief containing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a sample of sesame and asked, How much is this worth per

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ardabb?;[FN#512] whereto I answered, An hundred dirhams. Quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he, Take porters and gaugers and metesmen and come tomorrow to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Khan al-Jawáli,[FN#513] by the Gate of Victory quarter where

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou wilt find me. Then he fared forth leaving with me the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sample of sesame in his kerchief; and I went the round of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: customers and ascertained that every Ardabb would fetch an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hundred and twenty dirhams. Next day I took four metesmen and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: walked with them to the Khan, where I found him awaiting me. As

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soon as he saw me he rose and opened his magazine, when we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: measured the grain till the store was empty; and we found the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: contents fifty Ardabbs, making five thousand pieces of silver.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then said he, Let ten dirhams on every Ardabb be thy brokerage;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so take the price and keep in deposit four thousand and five

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hundred dirhams for me; and, when I have made an end of selling

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the other wares in my warehouses, I will come to thee and receive

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the amount. I will well, replied I and kissing his hand went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: away, having made that day a profit of a thousand dirhams. He was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: absent a month, at the end of which he came to me and asked,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Where be the dirhams? I rose and saluted him and answered to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, Wilt thou not eat somewhat in my house? But he refused

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the remark, Get the monies ready and I will presently

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: return and take them. Then he rode away. So I brought out the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dirhams and sat down to await him, but he stayed away for another

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: month, when he came back and said to me, Where be the dirhams?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I rose and saluting him asked, Wilt thou not eat some thing in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my house? But he again refused adding, Get me the monies ready

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I will presently return and take them. Then he rode off. So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I brought out the dirhams and sat down to await his return; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he stayed away from me a third month, and I said, Verily this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young man is liberality in incarnate form. At the end of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: month he came up, riding a mare mule and wearing a suit of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sumptuous raiment; he was as the moon on the night of fullness,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he seemed as if fresh from the baths, with his cheeks rosy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bright, and his brow flower white, and a mole spot like a grain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of ambergris delighting the sight; even as was said of such an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one by the poet:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Full moon with sun in single mansion * In brightest sheen and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fortune rose and shone,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: With happy splendour changing every sprite: * Hail to what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: guerdons prayer with blissful! boon!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Their charms and grace have gained perfection's height, * All

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hearts have conquered and all wits have won.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Laud to the Lord for works so wonder strange, * And what th'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Almighty wills His hand hath done!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I saw him I rose to him and invoking blessings on him asked,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O my lord, wilt thou not take thy monies? Whence the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hurry?[FN#514] quoth he, Wait till I have made an end of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: business and then I will come and take them. Again he rode away

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I said to myself, By Allah, when he comes next time needs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: must I make him my guest; for I have traded with his dirhams and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have gotten large gains thereby. At the end of the year he came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again, habited in a suit of clothes more sumptuous than the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: former; and, when I conjured him by the Evangel to alight at my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house and eat of my guest food, he said, I consent, on condition

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that what thou expendest on me shall be of my monies still in thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hands. I answered, So be it, and made him sit down whilst I got

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ready what was needful of meat and drink and else besides; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set the tray before him, with the invitation Bismillah![FN#515]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he drew near the tray and put out his left hand[FN#516] and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ate with me; and I marvelled at his not using the right hand.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When we had done eating, I poured water on his hand and gave him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wherewith to wipe it. Upon this we sat down to converse after I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had set before him some sweetmeats; and I said to him, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master, prithee relieve me by telling me why thou eatest with thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: left hand? Perchance something aileth thy other hand? When he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard my words, he repeated these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Dear friend, ask not what burneth in my breast, * Lest thou see

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fiery pangs eye never saw:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wills not my heart to harbour Salma in stead * Of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Layla's[FN#517] love, but need hath ne'er a law!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And he put out his right arm from his sleeve and behold, the hand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was cut off, a wrist without a fist. I was astounded at this but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he said, Marvel not, and think not that I ate with my left hand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for conceit and insolence, but from necessity; and the cutting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: off my right hand was caused by an adventure of the strangest.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Asked I, And what caused it?; and he answered:--Know that I am

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the sons of Baghdad and my father was of notables of that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city. When I came to man's estate I heard the pilgrims and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wayfarers, travellers and merchants talk of the land of Egypt and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their words sank deep into my mind till my parent died, when I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took a large sum of money and furnished myself for trade with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stuffs of Baghdad and Mosul and, packing them up in bales, set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out on my wanderings; and Allah decreed me safety till I entered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this your city. Then he wept and began repeating:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The blear eyed 'scapes the pits    * Wherein the lynx eyed fall:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A word the wise man slays          * And saves the natural:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Moslem fails of food           * The Kafir feasts in hall:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: What art or act is man's?          * God's will obligeth all!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now when he had ended his verse he said, So I entered Cairo and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took off my loads and stored my stuffs in the Khan Al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Masrúr.[FN#518] Then I gave the servant a few silvers wherewith

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to buy me some food and lay down to sleep awhile. When I awoke I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went to the street called Bayn al-Kasrayn--Between the two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Palaces--and presently returned and rested my night in the Khan.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was morning I opened a bale and took out some stuff

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying to myself, I will be off and go through some of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bazaars and see the state of the market. So I loaded the stuff

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on some of my slaves and fared forth till I reached the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kaysariyah or Exchange of Jaharkas;[FN#519] where the brokers who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knew of my coming came to meet me. They took the stuffs and cried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them for sale, but could not get the prime cost of them. I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: vexed at this, however the Shaykh of the brokers said to me, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my lord, I will tell thee how thou mayest make a profit of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: goods. Thou shouldest do as the merchants do and sell thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchandise at credit for a fixed period, on a contract drawn up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by a notary and duly witnessed; and employ a Shroff to take thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dues every Monday and Thursday. So shalt thou gain two dirhams

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and more, for every one; and thou shalt solace and divert thyself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by seeing Cairo and the Nile. Quoth I, This is sound advice,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and carried the brokers to the Khan. They took my stuffs and went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with them on 'Change where I sold them well taking bonds for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: value. These bonds I deposited with a Shroff, a banker, who gave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me a receipt with which I returned to the Khan. Here I stayed a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whole month, every morning breaking my fast with a cup of wine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and making my meals on pigeon's meat, mutton and sweetmeats, till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the time came when my receipts began to fall due. So, every

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Monday and Thursday I used to go on 'Change and sit in the shop

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of one or other of the merchants, whilst the notary and money

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: changer went round to recover the monies from the traders, till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after the time of mid afternoon prayer, when they brought me the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: amount, and I counted it and, sealing the bags, returned with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them to the Khan. On a certain day which happened to be a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Monday,[FN#520] I went to the Hammam and thence back to my Khan,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and sitting in my own room[FN#521] broke my fast with a cup of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wine, after which I slept a little. When I awoke I ate a chicken

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, perfuming my person, repaired to the shop of a merchant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hight Badr al-Din al-Bostáni, or the Gardener,[FN#522] who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: welcomed me; and we sat talking awhile till the bazaar should

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: open. Presently, behold, up came a lady of stately figure wearing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a head-dress of the most magnificent, perfumed with the sweetest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of scents and walking with graceful swaying gait; and seeing me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she raised her mantilla allowing me a glimpse of her beautiful

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: black eyes. She saluted Badr al-Din who returned her salutation

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and stood up, and talked with her; and the moment I heard her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speak, the love of her got hold of my heart. Presently she said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to Badr al-Din, Hast thou by thee a cut piece of stuff woven

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with thread of pure gold? So he brought out to her a piece from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: those he had bought of me and sold it to her for one thousand two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hundred dirhams; when she said, I will take the piece home with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and send thee its price. That is impossible, O my lady, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchant replied, for here is the owner of the stuff and I owe

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him a share of profit. Fie upon thee! she cried, Do I not use

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to take from thee entire rolls of costly stuff, and give thee a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greater profit than thou expectest, and send thee the money?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yes, rejoined he; but I stand in pressing need of the price

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this very day. Hereupon she took up the piece and threw it back

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon his lap, saying Out on thee! Allah confound the tribe of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: you which estimates none at the right value; and she turned to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: go. I felt my very soul going with her; so I stood up and stayed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her, saying, I conjure thee by the Lord, O my lady, favour me by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: retracing thy gracious steps. She turned back with a smile and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, For thy sake I return, and took a seat opposite me in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shop. Then quoth I to Badr al-Din, What is the price they asked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee for this piece?; and quoth he, Eleven hundred dirhams. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoined, The odd hundred shall be thy profit: bring me a sheet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of paper and I will write thee a discharge for it. Then I wrote

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him a receipt in my own handwriting and gave the piece to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady, saying, Take it away with thee and, if thou wilt, bring me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: its price next bazaar day; or better still, accept it as my guest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gift to thee. Allah requite thee with good, answered she, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: make thee my husband and lord and master of all I have![FN#523]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And Allah favoured her prayer. I saw the Gates of Paradise swing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: open before me and said, O my lady, let this piece of stuff be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: now thine and another like it is ready for thee, only let me have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one look at thy face. So she raised her veil and I saw a face

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sight of which bequeathed to me a thousand sighs, and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart was so captivated by her love that I was no longer ruler of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my reason. Then she let fall her face veil and taking up the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: piece of stuff said, O my lord make me not desolate by thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: absence! and turned away and disappeared from my sight. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: remained sitting on 'Change till past the hour of after noon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prayer, lost to the world by the love which had mastered me, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the violence of my passion compelled me to make enquiries

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: concerning her of the merchant, who answered me, This is a lady

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and a rich: she is the daughter of a certain Emir who lately died

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and left her a large fortune. Then I took leave of him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned home to the Khan where they set supper before me; but I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: could not eat for thinking of her and when I lay down to sleep,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sleep came not near me. So I watched till morning, when I arose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and donned a change of raiment and drank a cup of wine and, after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: breaking my fast on some slight matter, I went to the merchant's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shop where I saluted him and sat down by him. Presently up came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the lady as usual, followed by a slave girl and wearing a dress

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more sumptuous than before; and she saluted me without noticing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Badr al-Din and said in fluent graceful speech (never heard I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: voice softer or sweeter), Send one with me to take the thousand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and two hundred dirhams, the price of the piece. Why this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hurry? asked I and she answered, May we never lose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee![FN#524] and handed me the money. Then I sat talking with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her and presently I signed to her in dumb show, whereby she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: understood that I longed to enjoy her person,[FN#525] and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose up in haste with a show of displeasure. My heart clung to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her and I went forth from the bazaar and followed on her track.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: As I was walking suddenly a black slave girl stopped me and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O my master, come speak with my mistress.[FN#526] At this I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surprised and replied, There is none who knows me here; but she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoined, 0 my lord, how soon hast thou forgotten her! My lady

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is the same who was this day at the shop of such a merchant.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I went with her to the Shroff's, where I found the lady who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drew me to her side and said, O my beloved, thine image is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: firmly stamped upon my fancy, and love of thee hath gotten hold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of my heart: from the hour I first saw thee nor sleep nor food

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nor drink hath given me aught of pleasure. I replied, The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: double of that suffering is mine and my state dispenseth me from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: complaint. Then said she, O my beloved, at thy house, or at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mine? I am a stranger here and have no place of reception save

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Khan, so by thy favour it shall be at thy house. So be it;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but this is Friday[FN#527] night and nothing can be done till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tomorrow after public prayers; go to the Mosque and pray; then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mount thine ass, and ask for the Habbániyah[FN#528] quarter; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when there, look out for the mansion of Al-Nakib[FN#529] Barakát,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: popularly known as Abu Shámah the Syndic; for I live there: so do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not delay as I shall be expecting thee. I rejoiced with still

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greater joy at this; and took leave of her and returned to my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Khan, where I passed a sleepless night. Hardly was I assured that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: morning had dawned when I rose, changed my dress, perfumed myself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with essences and sweet scents and, taking fifty dinars in a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kerchief, went from the Khan Masrúr to the Zuwaylah[FN#530] gate,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where I mounted an ass and said to its owner, Take me to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Habbaniyah. So he set off with me and brought up in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: twinkling of an eye at a street known as Darb al-Munkari, where I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to him, Go in and ask for the Syndic's mansion. He was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: absent a while and then returned and said, Alight. Go thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before me to the house, quoth I, adding, Come back with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: earliest light and bring me home; and he answered, In Allah's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: name; whereupon I gave him a quarter dinar of gold, and he took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it and went his ways. Then I knocked at the door and out came two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: white slave girls, both young; high-bosomed virgins, as they were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: moons, and said to me, Enter, for our mistress is expecting thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she hath not slept the night long for her delight in thee. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: passed through the vestibule into a saloon with seven doors,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: floored with parti-coloured marbles and furnished with curtains

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and hangings of coloured silks: the ceiling was cloisonné with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gold and corniced with inscriptions[FN#531] emblazoned in lapis

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lazuli; and the walls were stuccoed with Sultání gypsum[FN#532]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which mirrored the beholder's face. Around the saloon were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: latticed windows overlooking a garden full of all manner of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fruits; whose streams were railing and riffling and whose birds

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were trilling and shrilling; and in the heart of the hall was a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: jetting fountain at whose corners stood birds fashioned in red

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gold crusted with pearls and gems and spouting water crystal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clear. When I entered and took a seat.--And Shahrazad perceived

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the dawn of day and ceased saying her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twenty-sixth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the young

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchant continued, When I entered and took a seat, the lady at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: once came in crowned with a diadem[FN#533] of pearls and jewels;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her face dotted with artificial moles in indigo,[FN#534] her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyebrows pencilled with Kohl and her hands and feet reddened with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Henna. When she saw me she smiled in my face and took me to her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: embrace and clasped me to her breast; then she put her mouth to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my mouth and sucked my tongue[FN#535] (and I did likewise) and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, Can it be true, O my little darkling, thou art come to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me? adding, Welcome and good cheer to thee! By Allah, from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day I saw thee sleep hath not been sweet to me nor hath food been

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pleasant. Quoth I, Such hath also been my case: and I am thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave, thy negro slave. Then we sat down to converse and I hung

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my head earthwards in bashfulness, but she delayed not long ere

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she set before me a tray of the most exquisite viands, marinated

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: meats, fritters soaked in bee's[FN#536] honeys and chickens

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stuffed with sugar and pistachio nuts, whereof we ate till we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were satisfied. Then they brought basin and ewer and I washed my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hands and we scented ourselves with rose water musk'd and sat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: down again to converse. So she began repeating these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couplets[FN#537]:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Had we wist of thy coming, thy way had been strewn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: With the blood of our heart and the balls of our sight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Our cheek as a foot cloth to greet thee been thrown,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: That thy step on our eyelids should softly alight.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And she kept plaining of what had befallen her and I of what had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: betided me; and love of her got so firm hold of my heart that all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my wealth seemed a thing of naught in comparison with her. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we fell to toying and groping and kissing till night fall, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the handmaidens set before us meats and a complete wine service,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and we sat carousing till the noon of night, when we lay down and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I lay with her; never in my life saw I a night like that night.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When morning morrowed I arose and took leave of her, throwing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: under the carpet bed the kerchief wherein were the dinars[FN#538]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and as I went out she wept and said, O my lord, when shall I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: look upon that lovely face again? I will be with thee at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sunset, answered I, and going out found the donkey boy, who had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought me the day before, awaiting at the door. So I mounted ass

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and rode to the Khan of Masrur where I alighted and gave the man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a half dinar, saying, Return at sunset; and he said I will.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I breakfasted and went out to seek the price of my stuffs;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after which I returned, and taking a roast lamb and some

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sweetmeats, called a porter and put the provision in his crate,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and sent it to the lady paying the man his hire.[FN#539] I went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back to my business till sunset, when the ass driver came to me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I took fifty dinars in a kerchief and rode to her house where

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I found the marble floor swept, the brasses burnisht, the branch

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lights burning, the wax candles ready lighted, the meat served up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the wine strained.[FN#540] When my lady saw me she threw her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arms about my neck, and cried, Thou hast desolated me by thine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: absence. Then she set the tables before me and we ate till we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were satisfied, when the slave girls carried off the trays and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: served up wine. We gave not over drinking till half the night was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: past; and, being well warmed with drink, we went to the sleeping

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chamber and lay there till morning. I then arose and fared forth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from her leaving the fifty dinars with her as before; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: finding the donkey boy at the door, rode to the Khan and slept

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: awhile. After that I went out to make ready the evening meal and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took a brace of geese with gravy on two platters of dressed and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: peppered rice, and got ready colocasia[FN#541]-roots fried and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soaked in honey, and wax candles and fruits and conserves and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nuts and almonds and sweet scented cowers; and I sent them all to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her. As soon as it was night I again tied up fifty dinars in a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kerchief and, mounting the ass as usual, rode to the mansion

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where we ate and drank and lay together till morning when I threw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the kerchief and dinars to her[FN#542] and rode back to the Khan.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I ceased not doing after that fashion till, after a sweet night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I woke one fine morning and found myself beggared, dinar-less and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dirhamless. So said I to myself All this be Satan's work; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began to recite these couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Poverty dims the sheen of man whate'er his wealth has been, *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: E'en as the sun about to set shines with a yellowing light

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Absent he falls from memory, forgotten by his friends; * Present

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he shareth not their joys for none in him delight

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He walks the market shunned of all, too glad to hide his head, *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: In desert places tears he sheds and moans his bitter plight

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Allah, 'mid his kith and kin a man, however good, * Waylaid

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by want and penury is but a stranger wight!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I fared forth from the Khan and walked down Between the Palaces

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: street till I came to the Zuwaylah Porte, where I found the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: people crowding and the gateway blocked for the much folk. And by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the decree of Destiny I saw there a trooper against whom I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pressed unintentionally, so that my hand came upon his bosom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pocket and I felt a purse inside it. I looked and seeing a string

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of green silk hanging from the pocket knew it for a purse; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the crush grew greater every minute and just then, a camel laden

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a load of fuel happened to jostle the trooper on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: opposite side, and he turned round to fend it off from him, lest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it tear his clothes; and Satan tempted me, so I pulled the string

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and drew out a little bag of blue silk, containing something

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which chinked like coin. But the soldier, feeling his pocket

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: suddenly lightened, put his hand to it and found it empty;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon he turned to me and, snatching up his mace from his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saddle bow, struck me with it on the head. I fell to the ground,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilst the people came round us and seizing the trooper's mare by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bridle said to him, Strikest thou this youth such a blow as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this for a mere push! But the trooper cried out at them, This

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fellow is an accursed thief! Whereupon I came to myself and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stood up, and the people looked at me and said, Nay, he is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: comely youth: he would not steal anything; and some of them took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my part and others were against me and question and answer waxed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loud and warm. The people pulled at me and would have rescued me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from his clutches; but as fate decreed behold, the Governor, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Chief of Police, and the watch[FN#543] entered the Zuwaylah Gate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at this moment and, seeing the people gathered together around me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the soldier, the Governor asked, What is the matter? By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah! O Emir, answered the trooper, this is a thief! I had in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my pocket a purse of blue silk lined with twenty good gold pieces

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he took it, whilst I was in the crush. Quoth the Governor,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Was any one by thee at the time?; and quoth the soldier, No.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon the Governor cried out to the Chief of Police who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seized me, and on this wise the curtain of the Lord's. protection

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was withdrawn from me. Then he said Strip him; and, when they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stripped me, they found the purse in my clothes. The Wali took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it, opened it and counted it; and, finding in it twenty dinars as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the soldier had said, waxed exceeding wroth and bade his guard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bring me before him. Then said he to me, Now, O youth, speak

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: truly: didst thou steal this purse?[FN#544] At this I hung my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: head to the ground and said to myself, If I deny having stolen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it, I shall get myself into terrible trouble. So I raised my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: head and said, Yes, I took it. When the Governor heard these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words he wondered and summoned witnesses who came forward and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: attested my confession. All this happened at the Zuwaylah Gate.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the Governor ordered the link bearer to cut off my right

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand, and he did so; after which he would have struck off my left

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: foot also; but the heart of the soldier softened and he took pity

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on me and interceded for me with the Governor that I should not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be slain.[FN#545] Thereupon the Wali left me, and went away and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the folk remained round me and gave me a cup of wine to drink. As

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the trooper he pressed the purse upon me, and said, Thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a comely youth and it befitteth not thou be a thief. So I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repeated these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I swear by Allah's name, fair sir! no thief was I, * Nor, O thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: best of men! was I a bandit bred:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But Fortune's change and chance o'erthrew me suddenly, * And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cark and care and penury my course misled:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I shot it not, indeed, 'twas Allah shot the shaft * That rolled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in dust the Kingly diadem from my head.[FN#546]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The soldier turned away after giving me the purse; and I also

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went my ways having wrapped my hand in a piece of rag and thrust

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it into my bosom. My whole semblance had changed, and my colour

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had waxed yellow from the shame and pain which had befallen me.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yet I went on to my mistress's house where, in extreme

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perturbation of spirit I threw myself down on the carpet bed. She

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw me in this state and asked me, What aileth thee and why do I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: see thee so changed in looks?; and I answered, My head paineth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and I am far from well. Whereupon she was vexed and was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: concerned on my account and said, Burn not my heart, O my lord,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but sit up and raise thy head and recount to me what hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happened to thee today, for thy face tells me a tale. Leave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this talk, replied I. But she wept and said, Me seems thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tired of me, for I see thee contrary to thy wont. But I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: silent; and she kept on talking to me albeit I gave her no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answer, till night came on. Then she set food before me, but I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: refused it fearing lest she see me eating with my left hand and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to her, I have no stomach to eat at present. Quoth she,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tell me what hath befallen thee to day, and why art thou so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sorrowful and broken in spirit and heart? Quoth I, Wait awhile;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I will tell thee all at my leisure. Then she brought me wine,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, Down with it, this will dispel thy grief: thou must

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: indeed drink and tell me of thy tidings. I asked her, Perforce

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: must I tell thee?; and she answered, Yes. Then said I, If it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: needs must be so, then give me to drink with thine own hand. She

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: filled and drank,[FN#547] and filled again and gave me the cup

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which I took from her with my left hand and wiped the tears from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my eyelids and began repeating:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When Allah willeth aught befall a man * Who hath of ears and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eyes and wits full share:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: His ears He deafens and his eyes He blinds * And draws his wits

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: e'en as we draw a hair[FN#548]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Till, having wrought His purpose, He restores * Man's wits, that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: warned more circumspect he fare.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When I ended my verses I wept, and she cried out with an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding loud cry, What is the cause of thy tears? Thou burnest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my heart! What makes thee take the cup with thy left hand? Quoth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I, Truly I have on my right hand a boil; and quoth she, Put it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out and I will open it for thee.[FN#549] It is not yet time to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: open it, I replied, so worry me not with thy words, for I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not take it out of the bandage at this hour. Then I drank off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the cup, and she gave not over plying me with drink until

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drunkenness overcame me and I fell asleep in the place where I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was sitting; whereupon she looked at my right hand and saw a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wrist without a fist. So she searched me closely and found with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me the purse of gold and my severed hand wrapped up in the bit of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rag.[FN#550] With this such sorrow came upon her as never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: overcame any and she ceased not lamenting on my account till the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: morning. When I awoke I found that she had dressed me a dish of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: broth of four boiled chickens, which she brought to me together

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a cup of wine. I ate and drank and laying down the purse,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would have gone out; but she said to me, Whither away?; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, Where my business calleth me; and said she, Thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shalt not go: sit thee down. So I sat down and she resumed,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hath thy love for me so overpowered thee that thou hast wasted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all thy wealth and hast lost thine hand on my account? I take

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee to witness against me and also Allah be my witness that I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will never part with thee, but will die under thy feet; and soon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou shalt see that my words are true. Then she sent for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kazi and witnesses and said to them, Write my contract of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marriage with this young man, and bear ye witness that I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: received the marriage settlement.[FN#551] When they had drawn up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the document she said, Be witness that all my monies which are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in this chest and all I have in slaves and handmaidens and other

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: property is given in free gift to this young man. So they took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: act of this statement enabling me to assume possession in right

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of marriage; and then withdrew, after receiving their fees.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon she took me by the hand and, leading me to a closet,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: opened a large chest and said to me, See what is herein; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looked and behold, it was full of kerchiefs. Quoth she, This is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the money I had from thee and every kerchief thou gavest me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: containing fifty dinars, I wrapped up and cast into this chest;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so now take thine own, for it returns to thee, and this day thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: art become of high estate. Fortune and Fate afflicted thee so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that thou didst lose thy right hand for my sake; and I can never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: requite thee; nay, although I gave my life 'twere but little and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I should still remain thy debtor. Then she added, Take charge

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of thy property.; so I transferred the contents of her chest to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my chest, and added my wealth to her wealth which I had given

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her, and my heart was eased and my sorrow ceased. I stood up and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kissed her and thanked her; and she said, Thou hast given thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand for love of me and how am I able to give thee an equivalent?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Allah, if I offered my life for thy love, it were indeed but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: little and would not do justice to thy claim upon me. Then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made over to me by deed all that she possessed in clothes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ornaments of gold and pearls, and goods and farms and chattels,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and lay not down to sleep that night, being sorely grieved for my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grief, till I told her the whole of what had befallen me. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: passed the night with her. But before we had lived together a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: month's time she fell sorely sick and illness increased upon her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by reason of her grief for the loss of my hand, and she endured

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but fifty days before she was numbered among the folk of futurity

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and heirs of immortality. So I laid her out and buried her body

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in mother earth and let make a pious perfection of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Koran[FN#552] for the health of her soul, and gave much money in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alms for her; after which I turned me from the grave and returned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the house. There I found that she had left much substance in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ready money and slaves, mansions, lands and domains, and among

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her store houses was a granary of sesame seed, whereof I sold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: part to thee; and I had neither time nor inclination to take

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: count with thee till I had sold the rest of the stock in store;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nor, indeed, even now have I made an end of receiving the price.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So I desire thou baulk me not in what I am about to say to thee:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: twice have I eaten of thy food and I wish to give thee as a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: present the monies for the sesame which are by thee. Such is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cause of the cutting off my right hand and my eating with my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: left. Indeed, said I, thou hast shown me the utmost kindness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and liberality. Then he asked me, Why shouldst thou not travel

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with me to my native country whither I am about to return with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Cairene and Alexandrian stuffs? Say me, wilt thou accompany me?;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I answered I will. So I agreed to go with him at the head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the month, and I sold all I had and bought other merchandise;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: then we set out and travelled, I and the young man, to this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: country of yours, where he sold his venture and bought other

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: investment of country stuffs and continued his journey to Egypt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But it was my lot to abide here, so that these things befell me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in my strangerhood which befell last night, and is not this tale,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O King of the age, more wondrous and marvellous than the story of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Hunchback? Not so, quoth the King, I cannot accept it:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there is no help for it but that you be hanged, every one of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: you.--And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day, and ceased saying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twenty-seventh Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King of China declared There is no help for it but that you be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hanged, the Reeve of the Sultan's Kitchen came forward and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If thou permit me I will tell thee a tale of what befell me just

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before I found this Gobbo, and, if it be more wondrous than his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: story, do thou grant us our lives. And when the King answered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yes he began to recount

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Reeve's Tale.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O King, that last night I was at a party where they made a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perfection of the Koran and got together doctors of law and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: religion skilled in recitation and intoning; and, when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: readers ended, the table was spread and amongst other things they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set before us was a marinated ragout[FN#553] flavoured with cumin

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seed. So we sat down, but one of our number held back and refused

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to touch it. We conjured him to eat of it but he swore he would

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not; and, when we again pressed him, he said, Be not instant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with me; sufficeth me that which hath already befallen me through

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eating it, and he began reciting:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shoulder thy tray and go straight to thy goal; * And, if suit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee this Kohl why,-use this Kohl![FN#554]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When he ended his verse we said to him, Allah upon thee, tell us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy reason for refusing to eat of the cumin ragout? `'If so it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be, he replied, and needs must I eat of it, I will not do so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: except I wash my hand forty times with soap, forty times with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: potash and forty times with galangale,[FN#555] the total being

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one hundred and twenty washings. Thereupon the hospitable host

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bade his slaves bring water and whatso he required; and the young

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man washed his hand as afore mentioned. Then he sat down, as if

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disgusted and frightened withal, and dipping his hand in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ragout, began eating and at the same time showing signs of anger.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And we wondered at him with extreme wonderment, for his hand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trembled and the morsel in it shook and we saw that his thumb had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: been cut off and he ate with his four fingers only. So we said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, Allah upon thee, what happened to thy thumb? Is thy hand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thus by the creation of God or hath some accident befallen it?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O my brothers, he answered, it is not only thus with this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thumb, but also with my other thumb and with both my great toes,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as you shall see. So saying he uncovered his left hand and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: feet, and we saw that the left hand was even as the right and in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like manner that each of his feet lacked its great toe. When we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw him after this fashion, our amazement waxed still greater and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: we said to him, We have hardly patience enough to await thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: history and to hear the manner of the cutting off of thy thumbs,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the reason of thy washing both hands one hundred and twenty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: times. Know then, said he, that my father was chief of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchants and the wealthiest of them all in Baghdad city during

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the reign of the Caliph Harun al Rashid; and he was much given to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wine drinking and listening to the lute and the other instruments

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of pleasaunce; so that when he died he left nothing. I buried him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and had perlections of the Koran made for him, and mourned for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him days and nights: then I opened his shop and found that he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: left in it few goods, while his debts were many. However I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: compounded with his creditors for time to settle their demands

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and betook myself to buying and selling, paying them something

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from week to week on account; and I gave not over doing this till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I had cleared off his obligations in full and began adding to my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: principal. One day, as I sat in my shop, suddenly and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unexpectedly there appeared before me a young lady, than whom I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
