text: never saw a fairer, wearing the richest raiment and ornaments and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: riding a she mule, with one negro slave walking before her and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another behind her. She drew rein at the head of the exchange

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bazaar and entered followed by an eunuch who said to her, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady come out and away without telling anyone, lest thou light a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fire which will burn us all up. Moreover he stood before her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: guarding her from view whilst she looked at the merchants' shops.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She found none open but mine; so she came up with the eunuch

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: behind her and sitting down in my shop saluted me; never heard I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: aught fairer than her speech or sweeter than her voice. Then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unveiled her face, and I saw that she was like the moon and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stole a glance at her whose sight caused me a thousand sighs, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my heart was captivated with love of her, and I kept looking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again and again upon her face repeating these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Say to the charmer in the dove hued veil, * Death would be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: welcome to abate thy bale!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Favour me with thy favours that I live: * See, I stretch forth my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palm to take thy vail!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When she heard my verse she answered me saying:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I've lost all patience by despite of you; * My heart knows

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nothing save love plight to you!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If aught I sight save charms so bright of you; * My parting end

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not in the sight of you!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I swear I'll ne'er forget the right of you; * And fain this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: breast would soar to height of you:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: You made me drain the love cup, and I lief * A love cup tender

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for delight of you:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Take this my form where'er you go, and when * You die, entomb

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me in the site of you:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Call on me in my grave, and hear my bones * Sigh their responses

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the shright of you:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And were I asked 'Of God what wouldst thou see?' * I answer,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'first His will then Thy decree!'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When she ended her verse she asked me, O youth, hast thou any

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fair stuffs by thee?; and I answered, O my lady, thy slave is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poor; but have patience till the merchants open their shops, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I will suit thee with what thou wilt. Then we sat talking, I and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she (and I was drowned in the sea of her love, dazed in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: desert[FN#556] of my passion for her), till the merchants opened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their shops; when I rose and fetched her all she sought to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tune of five thousand dirhams. She gave the stuff to the eunuch

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, going forth by the door of the Exchange, she mounted mule

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and went away, without telling me whence she came, and I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ashamed to speak of such trifle. When the merchants dunned me for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the price, I made myself answerable for five thousand dirhams and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went home, drunken with the love of her. They set supper before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and I ate a mouthful, thinking only of her beauty and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loveliness, and sought to sleep, but sleep came not to me. And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: such was my condition for a whole week, when the merchants

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: required their monies of me, but I persuaded them to have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: patience for another week, at the end of which time she again

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: appeared mounted on a she mule and attended by her eunuch and two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slaves. She saluted me and said, O my master, we have been long

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in bringing thee the price of the stuffs; but now fetch the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shroff and take thy monies. So I sent for the money changer and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the eunuch counted out the coin before him and made it over to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me. Then we sat talking, I and she, till the market opened, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she said to me, Get me this and that. So I got her from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchants whatso she wanted, and she took it and went away

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without saying a word to me about the price. As soon as she was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out of sight, I repented me of what I had done; for the worth of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the stuffs bought for her amounted to a thousand dinars, and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said in my soul, What manner of love is this? She hath brought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me five thousand dirhams, and hath taken goods for a thousand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinars.[FN#557] I feared lest I should be beggared through

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: having to pay the merchants their money, and I said, They know

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: none other but me; this lovely lady is naught but a cheat and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swindler, who hath diddled me with her beauty and grace; for she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw that I was a mere youth and laughed at me for not asking her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: address. I ceased not to be troubled by these doubts and fears,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as she was absent more than a month, till the merchants pestered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me for their money and were so hard upon me that I put up my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: property for sale and stood on the very brink of ruin. However,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as I was sitting in my shop one day, drowned in melancholy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: musings, she suddenly rode up and, dismounting at the bazaar

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gate, came straight towards me. When I saw her all my cares fell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from me and I forgot every trouble. She came close up to me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greeted me with her sweet voice and pleasant speech and presently

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, Fetch me the Shroff and weigh thy money.[FN#558] So she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gave me the price of what goods I had gotten for her and more,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and fell to talking freely with me, till I was like to die of joy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and delight. Presently she asked me, Hast thou a wife?; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered No, indeed: I have never known woman; and began to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shed tears. Quoth she Why weepest thou? Quoth I It is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nothing! Then giving the eunuch some of the gold pieces, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: begged him to be go between[FN#559] in the matter; but he laughed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, She is more in love with thee than thou with her: she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath no occasion for the stuffs she hath bought of thee and did

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all this only for the love of thee; so ask of her what thou wilt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she will deny thee nothing. When she saw me giving the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinars to the eunuch, she returned and sat down again; and I said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to her, Be charitable to thy slave and pardon him what he is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about to say. Then I told her what was in my mind and she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: assented and said to the eunuch, Thou shalt carry my message to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, adding to me, And do thou whatso the eunuch biddeth thee.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she got up and went away, and I paid the merchants their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: monies and they all profited; but as for me, regret at the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: breaking off of our intercourse was all my gain; and I slept not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the whole of that night. However, before many days passed her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eunuch came to me, and I entreated him honourably and asked him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after his mistress. Truly she is sick with love of thee, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied and I rejoined, Tell me who and what she is. Quoth he,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Lady Zubaydah, queen consort of Harun al-Rashid, brought her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up as a rearling[FN#560] and hath advanced her to be stewardess

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the Harim, and gave her the right of going in and out of her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: own sweet will. She spoke to her lady of thee and begged her to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marry her to thee; but she said, 'I will not do this, till I see

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the young man; and, if he be worthy of thee, I will marry thee to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him.' So now we look for the moment to smuggle thee into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Palace and if thou succeed in entering privily thou wilt win thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wish to wed her; but if the affair get wind, the Lady Zubaydah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will strike off thy head.[FN#561] What sayest thou to this? I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, I will go with thee and abide the risk whereof thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speakest. Then said he, As soon as it is night, go to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mosque built by the Lady Zubaydah on the Tigris and pray the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night prayers and sleep there. With love and gladness, cried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I. So at nightfall I repaired to the Mosque, where I prayed and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: passed the night. With earliest dawn, behold, came sundry eunuchs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in a skiff with a number of empty chests which they deposited in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Mosque; then all of them went their ways but one, and looking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: curiously at him, I saw he was our go between. Presently in came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the handmaiden, my mistress, walking straight up to us; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose to her and embraced her while she kissed me and shed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tears.[FN#562] We talked awhile; after which she made me get into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one of the chests which she locked upon me. Presently the other

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eunuchs came back with a quantity of packages and she fell to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stowing them in the chests, which she locked down, one by one,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till all were shut. When all was done the eunuchs embarked the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chests in the boat and made for the Lady Zubaydah's palace. With

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this, thought began to beset me and I said to myself, Verily thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lust and wantonness will be the death of thee; and the question

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is after all shalt thou win to thy wish or not? And I began to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weep, boxed up as I was in the box and suffering from cramp; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I prayed Allah that He deliver me from the dangerous strait I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in, whilst the boat gave not over going on till it reached the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Palace gate where they lifted out the chests and amongst them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that in which I was. Then they carried them in, passing through a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: troop of eunuchs, guardians of the Harim and of the ladies behind

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the curtain, till they came to the post of the Eunuch in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Chief[FN#563] who started up from his slumbers and shouted to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: damsel What is in those chests? They are full of wares for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Lady Zubaydah! Open them, one by one, that I may see what is in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them. And wherefore wouldst thou open them? Give me no words

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and exceed not in talk! These chests must and shall be opened.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So saying, he sprang to his feet, and the first which they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought to him to open was that wherein I was; and, when I felt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his hands upon it, my senses failed me and I bepissed myself in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my funk, the water running out of the box. Then said she to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Eunuch in Chief, O steward! thou wilt cause me to be killed and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thyself too, for thou hast damaged goods worth ten thousand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinars. This chest contains coloured dresses, and four gallon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flasks of Zemzem water;[FN#564] and now one of them hath got

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unstoppered and the water is running out over the clothes and it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will spoil their colours. The eunuch answered, Take up thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: boxes and get thee gone to the curse of God! So the slaves

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carried off all the chests, including mine; and hastened on with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them till suddenly I heard the voice of one saying, Alack, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alack! the Caliph! the Caliph ! When that cry struck mine ears I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: died in my skin and said a saying which never yet shamed the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sayer, There is no Majesty and there is no Might save in Allah,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Glorious, the Great! I and only I have brought this calamity

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon myself. Presently I heard the Caliph say to my mistress, A

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: plague on thee, what is in those boxes?; and she answered,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Dresses for the Lady Zubaydah;[FN#565] whereupon he, Open them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before me! When I heard this I died my death outright and said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to myself, By Allah, today is the very last of my days in this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: world: if I come safe out of this I am to marry her and no more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words, but detection stares me in the face and my head is as good

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as stricken off. Then I repeated the profession of Faith,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, There is no god but the God, and Mohammed is the Apostle

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of God!--And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: say her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twenty-eighth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the young

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchant continued as follows: Now when I testified, I bear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: witness that there is no god save the God, I heard my mistress

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the handmaid declare to the Caliph, These chests, O Commander of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Faithful, have been committed to my charge by the Lady

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Zubaydah, and she doth not wish their contents to be seen by any

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one. No matter! quoth the Caliph, needs must they be opened,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I will see what is in them; and he cried aloud to the eunuchs,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bring the chests here before me. At this I made sure of death

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (without benefit of a doubt) and swooned away. Then the eunuchs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought the chests up to him one after another and he fell to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: inspecting the contents, but he saw in them only otters and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stuffs and fine dresses; and they ceased not opening the chests

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he ceased not looking to see what was in them, finding only

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes and such matters, till none remained unopened but the box

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in which I was boxed. They put forth their hands to open it, but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my mistress the handmaid made haste and said to the Caliph, This

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one thou shalt see only in the presence of the Lady Zubaydah, for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that which is in it is her secret. When he heard this he gave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: orders to carry in the chests; so they took up that wherein I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and bore it with the rest into the Harim and set it down in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: midst of the saloon; and indeed my spittle was dried up for very

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fear.[FN#566] Then my mistress opened the box and took me out,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, Fear not: no harm shall betide thee now nor dread; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: broaden thy breast and strengthen thy heart and sit thee down

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till the Lady Zubaydah come, and surely thou shalt win thy wish

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of me. So I sat down and, after a while, in came ten hand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: maidens, virgins like moons, and ranged themselves in two rows,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: five facing five; and after them twenty other damsels, high

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bosomed virginity, surrounding the Lady Zubaydah who could hardly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: walk for the weight of her raiment and ornaments. As she drew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: near, the slave girls dispersed from around her, and I advanced

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and kissed the ground between her hands. She signed to me to sit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, when I sat down before her chair, she began questioning me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of my forbears and family and condition, to which I made such

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answers that pleased her, and she said to my mistress, Our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nurturing of thee, O damsel, hath not disappointed us. Then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to me, Know that this handmaiden is to us even as our own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: child and she is a trust committed to thee by Allah. I again

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kissed the ground before her, well pleased that I should marry my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mistress, and she bade me abide ten days in the palace. So I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abode there ten days, during which time I saw not my mistress nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: anybody save one of the concubines, who brought me the morning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and evening meals. After this the Lady Zubaydah took counsel with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Caliph on the marriage of her favourite handmaid, and he gave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leave and assigned to her a wedding portion of ten thousand gold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pieces. So the Lady Zubaydah sent for the Kazi and witnesses who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wrote our marriage contract, after which the women made ready

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sweetmeats and rich viands and distributed them among all the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Odahs[FN#567] of the Harim. Thus they did other ten days, at the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: end of which time my mistress went to the baths.[FN#568]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Meanwhile, they set before me a tray of food where on were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: various meats and among those dishes, which were enough to daze

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the wits, was a bowl of cumin ragout containing chickens breasts,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fricandoed[FN#569] and flavoured with sugar, pistachios, musk and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose water. Then, by Allah, fair sirs, I did not long hesitate;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but took my seat before the ragout and fell to and ate of it till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I could no more. After this I wiped my hands, but forgot to wash

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them; and sat till it grew dark, when the wax candles were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lighted and the singing women came in with their tambourines and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: proceeded to display the bride in various dresses and to carry

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her in procession from room to room all round the palace, getting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their palms crossed with gold. Then they brought her to me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disrobed her. When I found myself alone with her on the bed I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: embraced her, hardly believing in our union; but she smelt the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strong odours of the ragout upon my hands and forth with cried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out with an exceeding loud cry, at which the slave girls came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: running to her from all sides. I trembled with alarm, unknowing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what was the matter, and the girls asked her, What aileth thee,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O our sister? She answered them, Take this mad man away from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me: I had thought he was a man of sense! Quoth I to her, What

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: makes thee think me mad? Quoth she, Thou madman' what made thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eat of cumin ragout and forget to wash thy hand? By Allah, I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: requite thee for thy misconduct. Shall the like of thee come to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bed with the like of me with unclean hands?[FN#570] Then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took from her side a plaited scourge and came down with it on my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back and the place where I sit till her forearms were benumbed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I fainted away from the much beating; when she said to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: handmaids, Take him and carry him to the Chief of Police, that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he may strike off the hand wherewith he ate of the cumin ragout,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and which he did not wash. When I heard this I said, There is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no Majesty and there is no Might save in Allah! Wilt thou cut off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my hand, because I ate of a cumin ragout and did not wash? The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: handmaidens also interceded with her and kissed her hand saying,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O our sister, this man is a simpleton, punish him not for what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he hath done this nonce; but she answered, By Allah, there is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no help but that I dock him of somewhat, especially the offending

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: member. Then she went away and I saw no more of her for ten

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days, during which time she sent me meat and drink by a slave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: girl who told me that she had fallen sick from the smell of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cumin ragout. After that time she came to me and said, O black

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of face![FN#571] I will teach thee how to eat cumin ragout

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without washing thy hands! Then she cried out to the handmaids,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who pinioned me; and she took a sharp razor and cut off my thumbs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and great toes; even as you see, O fair assembly! Thereupon I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swooned away, and she sprinkled some powder of healing herbs upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the stumps and when the blood was stanched, I said, Never again

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will I eat of cumin ragout without washing my hands forty times

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with potash and forty times with galangale and forty times with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soap! And she took of me an oath and bound me by a covenant to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that effect. When, therefore, you brought me the cumin ragout my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: colour changed and I said to myself, It was this very dish that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: caused the cutting off of my thumbs and great toes; and, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: you forced me, I said, Needs must I fulfil the oath I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sworn. And what befell thee after this? asked those present;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he answered, When I swore to her, her anger was appeased and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I slept with her that night. We abode thus awhile till she said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to me one day, Verily the Palace of the Caliph is not a pleasant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: place for us to live in, and none ever entered it save thyself;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and thou only by grace of the Lady Zubaydah. Now she hath given

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me fifty thousand dinars, adding, Take this money and go out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and buy us a fair dwelling house. So I fared forth and bought a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fine and spacious mansion, whither she removed all the wealth she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: owned and what riches I had gained in stuffs and costly rarities.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Such is the cause of the cutting off of my thumbs and great toes.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: We ate (continued the Reeve), and were returning to our homes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when there befell me with the Hunchback that thou wottest of.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This then is my story, and peace be with thee! Quoth the King;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This story is on no wise more delectable than the story of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback; nay, it is even less so, and there is no help for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hanging of the whole of you. Then came forward the Jewish

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: physician and kissing the ground said, O King of the age, I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tell thee an history more wonderful than that of the Hunchback.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tell on, said the King of China; so he began the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tale of the Jewish Doctor.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Right marvellous was a matter which came to pass to me in my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth. I lived in Damascus of Syria studying my art and, one day,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as I was sitting at home behold, there came to me a Mameluke from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the household of the Sahib and said to me, Speak with my lord!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So I followed him to the Viceroy's house and, entering the great

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hall, saw at its head a couch of cedar plated with gold whereon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lay a sickly youth beautiful withal; fairer than he one could not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: see. I sat down by his head and prayed to Heaven for a cure; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he made me a sign with his eyes, so I said to him, O my lord!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: favour me with thy hand, and safety be with thee![FN#572] Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he put forth his left hand and I marvelled thereat and said, By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, strange that this handsome youth, the son of a great

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house, should so lack good manners. This can be nothing but pride

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and conceit! However I felt his pulse and wrote him a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prescription and continued to visit him for ten days, at the end

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of which time he recovered and went to the Hammam,[FN#573]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon the Viceroy gave me a handsome dress of honour and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: appointed me superintendent of the hospital which is in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Damascus.[FN#574] I accompanied him to the baths, the whole of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which they had kept private for his accommodation; and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: servants came in with him and took off his clothes within the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bath, and when he was stripped I saw that his right hand had been

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: newly cut off, and this was the cause of his weakliness. At this I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was amazed and grieved for him: then, looking at his body, I saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on it the scars of scourge stripes whereto he had applied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unguents. I was troubled at the sight and my concern appeared in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my face. The young man looked at me and, comprehending the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: matter, said, O Physician of the age, marvel not at my case; I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will tell thee my story as soon as we quit the baths. Then we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: washed and, returning to his house, ate somewhat of food and took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rest awhile; after which he asked me, What sayest thou to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: solacing thee by inspecting the supper hall?; and I answered So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: let it be. Thereupon he ordered the slaves to carry out the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carpets and cushions required and roast a lamb and bring us some

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fruit. They did his bidding and we ate together, he using the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: left hand for the purpose. After a while I said to him, Now tell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me thy tale. O Physician of the age, replied he, hear what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befell me. Know that I am of the sons of Mosul, where my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grandfather died leaving nine children of whom my father was the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eldest. All grew up and took to them wives, but none of them was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blessed with offspring except my father, to whom Providence

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: vouchsafed me. So I grew up amongst my uncles who rejoiced in me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with exceeding joy, till I came to man's estate. One day which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happened to be a Friday, I went to the Cathedral mosque of Mosul

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with my father and my uncles, and we prayed the congregational

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prayers, after which the folk went forth, except my father and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uncles, who sat talking of wondrous things in foreign parts and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the marvellous sights of strange cities. At last they mentioned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Egypt, and one of my uncles said, Travellers tell us that there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is not on earth's face aught fairer than Cairo and her Nile; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these words made me long to see Cairo. Quoth my father, Whoso

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath not seen Cairo hath not seen the world. Her dust is golden

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and her Nile a miracle holden; and her women are as Houris fair;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: puppets, beautiful pictures; her houses are palaces rare; her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: water is sweet and light[FN#575] and her mud a commodity and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: medicine beyond compare, even as said the poet in this his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: poetry:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Nile[FN#576] flood this day is the gain you own; * You alone

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in such gain and bounties wone:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Nile is my tear flood of severance, * And here none is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forlorn but I alone.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Moreover temperate is her air, and with fragrance blent, Which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surpasseth aloes wood in scent; and how should it be otherwise,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she being the Mother of the World? And Allah favour him who wrote

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: An I quit Cairo and her pleasaunces, * Where can I wend to find

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so gladsome ways?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shall I desert that site, whose grateful scents * Joy every soul

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and call for loudest praise?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Where every palace, as another Eden, * Carpets and cushions

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: richly wrought displays;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: A city wooing sight and sprite to glee, * Where Saint meets

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sinner and each 'joys his craze;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Where friend meets friend, by Providence united * In greeny

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: garden and in palmy maze:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: People of Cairo, and by Allah's doom * I fare, with you in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thoughts I wone always!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whisper not Cairo in the ear of Zephyr, * Lest for her like of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: garden scents he reave her,[FN#577]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And if your eyes saw her earth, and the adornment thereof with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bloom, and the purfling of it with all manner blossoms, and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: islands of the Nile and how much is therein of wide spread and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: goodly prospect, and if you bent your sight upon the Abyssinian

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Pond,[FN#578] your glance would not revert from the scene quit of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wonder; for nowhere would you behold the fellow of that lovely

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: view; and, indeed, the two arms of the Nile embrace most

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: luxuriant verdure,[FN#579] as the white of the eye encompasseth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: its black or like filigreed silver surrounding chrysolites. And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: divinely gifted was the poet who there anent said these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: couplets:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By th' Abyssinian Pond, O day divine!* In morning twilight and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in sunny shine:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The water prisoned in its verdurous walls, * Like sabre flashes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before shrinking eyne:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And in The Garden sat we while it drains * Slow draught, with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: purfled sides dyed finest fine:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The stream is rippled by the hands of clouds; * We too,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a-rippling, on our rugs recline,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Passing pure wine, and whoso leaves us there * Shall ne'er arise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from fall his woes design:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Draining long draughts from large and brimming bowls, *

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Administ'ring thirst's only medicine--wine.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And what is there to compare with the Rasad, the Observatory, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: its charms whereof every viewer as he approacheth saith, 'Verily

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this spot is specialised with all manner of excellence!' And if

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou speak of the Night of Nile full,[FN#580] give the rainbow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and distribute it![FN#581] And if thou behold The Garden at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eventide, with the cool shades sloping far and wide, a marvel

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou wouldst see and wouldst incline to Egypt in ecstasy. And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wert thou by Cairo's river side,[FN#582] when the sun is sinking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the stream dons mail coat and habergeon[FN#583] over its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other vestments, thou wouldst be quickened to new life by its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gentle zephyrs and by its all sufficient shade. So spake he and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the rest fell to describing Egypt and her Nile. As I heard their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: accounts, my thoughts dwelt upon the subject and when, after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: talking their fill, all arose and went their ways, I lay down to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sleep that night, but sleep came not because of my violent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: longing for Egypt; and neither meat pleased me nor drink. After a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: few days my uncles equipped themselves for a trade journey to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Egypt; and I wept before my father till he made ready for me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fitting merchandise, and he consented to my going with them,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying however, Let him not enter Cairo, but leave him to sell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his wares at Damascus. So I took leave of my father and we fared

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth from Mosul and gave not over travelling till we reached

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Aleppo[FN#584] where we halted certain days. Then we marched

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: onwards till we made Damascus and we found her a city as though

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she were a Paradise, abounding in trees and streams and birds and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fruits of all kinds. We alighted at one of the Khans, where my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: uncles tarried awhile selling and buying; and they bought and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sold also on my account, each dirham turning a profit of five on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prime cost, which pleased me mightily. After this they left me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alone and set their faces Egyptwards; whilst I abode at Damascus,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where I had hired from a jeweller, for two dinars a month, a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mansion[FN#585] whose beauties would beggar the tongue. Here I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: remained, eating and drinking and spending what monies I had in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand till, one day, as I was sitting at the door of my house be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hold, there came up a young lady clad in costliest raiment never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saw my eyes richer. I winked[FN#5886 at her and she stepped

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: inside without hesitation and stood within. I entered with her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and shut the door upon myself and her; whereupon she raised her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: face veil and threw off her mantilla, when I found her like a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pictured moon of rare and marvellous loveliness; and love of her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gat hold of my heart. So I rose and brought a tray of the most

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: delicate eatables and fruits and whatso befitted the occasion,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and we ate and played and after that we drank till the wine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turned our heads. Then I lay with her the sweetest of nights and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the morning I offered her ten gold pieces; when her face

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lowered and her eye brows wrinkled and shaking with wrath she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried, Fie upon thee, O my sweet companion! dost thou deem that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I covet thy money? Then she took out from the bosom of her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shift[FN#587] fifteen dinars and, laying them before me, said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Allah! unless thou take them I will never come back to thee.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So I accepted them and she said to me, O my beloved! expect me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again in three days' time, when I will be with thee between

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sunset and supper tide; and do thou prepare for us with these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinars the same entertainment as yesternight. So saying, she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took leave of me and went away and all my senses went with her.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: On the third day she came again, clad in stuff weft with gold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wire, and wearing raiment and ornaments finer than before. I had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prepared the place for her ere she arrived and the repast was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ready; so we ate and drank and lay together, as we had done, till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the morning, when she gave me other fifteen gold pieces and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: promised to come again after three days. Accordingly, I made

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ready for her and, at the appointed time, she presented herself

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more richly dressed than on the first and second occasions, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to me, O my lord, am I not beautiful? Yea, by Allah thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: art! answered I, and she went on, Wilt thou allow me to bring

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with me a young lady fairer than I, and younger in years, that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she may play with us and thou and she may laugh and make merry

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and rejoice her heart, for she hath been very sad this long time

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: past, and hath asked me to take her out and let her spend the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: night abroad with me? Yea, by Allah! I replied; and we drank

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till the wine turned our heads and slept till the morning, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she gave me other fifteen dinars, saying, Add something to thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: usual provision on account of the young lady who will come with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me. Then she went away, and on the fourth day I made ready the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house as usual, and soon after sunset behold, she came,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: accompanied by another damsel carefully wrapped in her mantilla.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They entered and sat down; and when I saw them I repeated these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: How dear is our day and how lucky our lot, * When the cynic's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: away with his tongue malign!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When love and delight and the swimming of head * Send

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cleverness trotting, the best boon of wine.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the full moon shines from the cloudy veil, * And the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: branchlet sways in her greens that shine:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the red rose mantles in freshest cheek, * And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Narcissus[FN#588] opeth his love sick eyne:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When pleasure with those I love is so sweet, * When friendship

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with those I love is complete!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I rejoiced to see them, and lighted the candles after receiving

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them with gladness and delight. They doffed their heavy outer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dresses and the new damsel uncovered her face when I saw that she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was like the moon at its full never beheld I aught more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beautiful. Then I rose and set meat and drink before them, and we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ate and drank; and I kept giving mouthfuls to the new comer,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: crowning her cup and drinking with her till the first damsel,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waxing inwardly jealous, asked me, By Allah, is she not more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: delicious than I?; whereto I answered, Ay, by the Lord! It is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my wish that thou lie with her this night; for I am thy mistress

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but she is our visitor. Upon my head be it, and my eyes. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she rose and spread the carpets for our bed[FN#589] and I took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the young lady and lay with her that night till morning, when I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: awoke and found myself wet, as I thought, with sweat. I sat up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and tried to arouse the damsel; but when I shook her by the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shoulders my hand became crimson with blood and her head rolled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: off the pillow. Thereupon my senses fled and I cried aloud,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, O All powerful Protector, grant me Thy protection! Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: finding her neck had been severed, I sprung up and the world

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waxed black before my eyes, and I looked for the lady, my former

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: love, but could not find her. So I knew that it was she who had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: murdered the damsel in her jealousy,[FN#590] and said, There is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no Majesty and there is no Might save in Allah, the Glorious, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Great! What is to be done now? I considered awhile then, doffing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my clothes, dug a hole in the middle of the court yard, wherein I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laid the murdered girl with her jewellery and golden ornaments;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, throwing back the earth on her, replaced the slabs of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marble[FN#591] pavement. After this I made the Ghusl or total

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ablution,[FN#592] and put on pure clothes; then, taking what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: money I had left, locked up the house and summoned courage and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went to its owner to whom I paid a year's rent, saying, I am

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about to join my uncles in Cairo. Presently I set out and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: journeying to Egypt, foregathered with my uncles who rejoiced in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, and I found that they had made an end of selling their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merchandise. They asked me, What is the cause of thy coming?;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I answered I longed for a sight of you; but did not let

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them know that I had any money with me. I abode with them a year,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: enjoying the pleasures of Cairo and her Nile,[FN#593] and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: squandering the rest of my money in feasting and carousing till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the time drew near for the departure of my uncles, when I fled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from them and hid myself. They made enquiries and sought for me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but hearing no tidings they said, He will have gone back to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Damascus. When they departed I came forth from my hiding place

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and abode in Cairo three years, until naught remained of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: money. Now every year I used to send the rent of the Damascus

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house to its owner, until at last I had nothing left but enough

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to pay him for one year's rent and my breast was straitened. So I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: travelled to Damascus and alighted at the house whose owner, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: jeweller, was glad to see me and I found everything locked up as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I had left it. I opened the closets and took out my clothes and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: necessaries and came upon, beneath the carpet bed whereon I had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lain that night with the girl who had been beheaded, a golden

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: necklace set with ten gems of passing beauty. I took it up and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cleansing it of the blood, sat gazing upon it and wept awhile.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I abode in the house two days and on the third I entered the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hammam and changed my clothes. I had no money by me now; so Satan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whispered temptation to me that the Decree of Destiny be carried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out. Next day I took the jewelled necklace to the bazaar and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: handed it to a broker who made me sit down in the shop of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: jeweller, my landlord, and bade me have patience till the market

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was full,[FN#594] when he carried off the ornament and proclaimed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it for sale, privily and without my knowledge. The necklet was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: priced as worth two thousand dinars, but the broker returned to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and said, This collar is of copper, a mere counterfeit after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the fashion of the Franks[FN#595] and a thousand dirhams have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: been bidden for it. Yes, I answered, I knew it to be copper,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as we had it made for a certain person that we might mock her:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: now my wife hath inherited it and we wish to sell it; so go and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: take over the thousand dirhams.--And Shahrazad perceived the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawn of day and ceased to say her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Twenty-ninth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beautiful youth said to the broker, Take over the thousand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dirhams; and when the broker heard this, he knew that the case

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was suspicious. So he carried the collar to the Syndic of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bazaar, and the Syndic took it to the Governor who was also

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prefect of police, and said to him falsely enough, This necklet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was stolen from my house, and we have found the thief in traders'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dress. So before I was aware of it the watch got round me and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: making me their prisoner, carried me before the Governor who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: questioned me of the collar. I told him the tale I had told to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the broker; but he laughed and said, These words are not true.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then, before I knew what was doing, the guard stripped off my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes and came down with palm rods upon my ribs, till for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: smart of the stick I confessed, It was I who stole it; saying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to myself, 'Tis better for thee to say, I stole it, than to let

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them know that its owner was murdered in thy house, for then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would they slay thee to avenge her. So they wrote down that I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had stolen it and they cut off my hand and scalded the stump in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: oil,[FN#596] when I swooned away for pain; but they gave me wine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to drink and I recovered and, taking up my hand, was going to my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fine house, when my landlord said to me, Inasmuch, O my son, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this hath befallen thee, thou must leave my house and look out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for another lodging for thee, since thou art convicted of theft.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou art a handsome youth, but who will pity thee after this? O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my master said I, bear with me but two days or three, till I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: find me another place. He answered, So be it. and went away

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and left me. I returned to the house where I sat weeping and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, How shall I go back to my own people with my hand lopped

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: off and they know not that I am innocent? Perchance even after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this Allah may order some matter for me. And I wept with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding weeping, grief beset me and I remained in sore trouble

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for two days; but on the third day my landlord came suddenly in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to me, and with him some of the guard and the Syndic of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bazaar, who had falsely charged me with stealing the necklet. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went up to them and asked, What is the matter? however, they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pinioned me with out further parley and threw a chain about my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neck, saying, The necklet which was with thee hath proved to be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the property of the Wazir of Damascus who is also her Viceroy;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and they added, It was missing from his house three years ago at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the same time as his younger daughter. When I heard these words,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my heart sank within me and I said to myself, Thy life is gone

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beyond a doubt! By Allah, needs must I tell the Chief my story;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, if he will, let him kill me, and if he please, let him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pardon me. So they carried me to the Wazir's house and made me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stand between his hands. When he saw me, he glanced at me out of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the corner of his eye and said to those present, Why did ye lop

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: off his hand? This man is unfortunate, and there is no fault in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him; indeed ye have wronged him in cutting off his hand. When I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard this, I took heart and, my soul presaging good, I said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, By Allah, O my lord, I am no thief; but they calumniated me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with a vile calumny, and they scourged me midmost the market,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bidding me confess till, for the pain of the rods, I lied against

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: myself and confessed the theft, albeit I am altogether innocent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of it. Fear not, quoth the Viceroy, no harm shall come to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. Then he ordered the Syndic of the bazaar to be imprisoned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said to him, Give this man the blood money for his hand;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, if thou delay I will hang thee and seize all thy property.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Moreover he called to his guards who took him and dragged him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: away, leaving me with the Chief. Then they loosed by his command

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the chain from my neck and unbound my arms; and he looked at me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, O my son, be true with me, and tell me how this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: necklace came to thee. And he repeated these verses:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Truth best befits thee, albeit truth * Shall bring thee to burn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the threatened fire.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Allah, O my lord, answered I, I will tell thee nothing but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the truth. Then I related to him all that had passed between me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the first lady, and how she had brought me the second and had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slain her out of jealousy, and I detailed for him the tale to its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: full. When he heard my story, he shook his head and struck his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: right hand upon the left,[FN#597] and putting his kerchief over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his face wept awhile and then repeated:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I see the woes of the world abound, * And worldings sick with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spleen and teen;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: There's One who the meeting of two shall part, * And who part not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are few and far between!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he turned to me and said, Know, O my son, that the elder

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: damsel who first came to thee was my daughter whom I used to keep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: closely guarded. When she grew up, I sent her to Cairo and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: married her to her cousin, my brother's son. After a while he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: died and she came back: but she had learnt wantonness and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ungraciousness from the people of Cairo;[FN#598] so she visited

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee four times and at last brought her younger sister. Now they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were sisters-german and much attached to each other; and, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that adventure happened to the elder, she disclosed her secret to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her sister who desired to go out with her. So she asked thy leave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and carried her to thee; after which she returned alone and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: finding her weeping, I questioned her of her sister, but she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, 'I know nothing of her.' However, she presently told her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mother privily of what had happened and how she had cut off her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sister's head and her mother told me. Then she ceased not to weep

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and say, 'By Allah! I shall cry for her till I die.' Nor did she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: give over mourning till her heart broke and she died; and things

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell out after that fashion. See then, O my son, what hath come

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to pass; and now I desire thee not to thwart me in what I am

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about to offer thee, and it is that I purpose to marry thee to my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youngest daughter; for she is a virgin and born of another

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mother;[FN#599] and I will take no dower of thee but, on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: contrary, will appoint thee an allowance, and thou shalt abide

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with me in my house in the stead of my son. So be it, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, and how could I hope for such good fortune? Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sent at once for the Kazi and witnesses, and let write my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marriage contract with his daughter and I went in to her.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Moreover, he got me from the Syndic of the bazaar a large sum of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: money and I became in high favour with him. During this year news

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came to me that my father was dead and the Wazir despatched a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: courier, with letters bearing the royal sign manual, to fetch me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the money which my father had left behind him, and now I am

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: living in all the solace of life. Such was the manner of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cutting off my right hand. I marvelled at his story (continued

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Jew), and I abode with him three days after which he gave me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: much wealth, and I set out and travelled Eastward till I reached

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this your city and the sojourn suited me right well; so I took up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my abode here and there befell me what thou knowest with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback. There upon the King of China shook his head[FN#600]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, This story of thine is not stranger and more wondrous

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and marvellous and delectable than the tale of the Hunchback; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so needs must I hang the whole number of you. However there yet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: remains the Tailor who is the head of all the offence; and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: added, O Tailor, if thou canst tell me any thing more wonderful

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: than the story of the Hunchback, I will pardon you all your

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: offences. Thereupon the man came forward and began to tell the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tale of the Tailor.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O King of the age, that most marvellous was that which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befell me but yesterday, before I foregathered with the Hunch

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back. It so chanced that in the early day I was at the marriage

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: feast of one of my companions, who had gotten together in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house some twenty of the handicraftsmen of this city, amongst

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them tailors and silk spinners and carpenters and others of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: same kidney. As soon as the sun had risen, they set food[FN#601]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before us that we might eat when behold, the master of the house

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered, and with him a foreign youth and a well favoured of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: people of Baghdad, wearing clothes as handsome as handsome could

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be; and he was of right comely presence save that he was lame of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one leg. He came and saluted us and we stood up to receive him;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but when he was about to sit down he espied amongst us a certain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man which was a Barber; whereupon he refused to be seated and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would have gone away. But we stopped him and our host also stayed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, making oath that he should not leave us and asked him, What

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is the reason of thy coming in and going out again at once?;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereto he answered, By Allah, O my lord, do not hinder me; for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the cause of my turning back is yon Barber of bad omen,[FN#602]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yon black o'face, yon ne'er do well! When the housemaster heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these words he marvelled with extreme marvel and said, How

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cometh this young man, who haileth from Baghdad, to be so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: troubled and perplexed about this Barber? Then we looked at the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stranger and said, Explain the cause of thine anger against the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Barber. O fair company, quoth the youth, there befell me a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strange adventure with this Barber in Baghdad (which is my native

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city); he was the cause of the breaking of my leg and of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lameness, and I have sworn never to sit in the same place with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, nor even tarry in any town where he happens to abide; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have bidden adieu to Baghdad and travelled far from it and came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to stay in this your city; yet I have hardly passed one night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before I meet him again. But not another day shall go by ere I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fare forth from here. Said we to him, Allah upon thee, tell us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the tale; and the youth replied (the Barber changing colour from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brown to yellow as he spoke): Know, O fair company, that my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father was one of the chief merchants of Baghdad, and Almighty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah had blessed him with no son but myself. When I grew up and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reached man's estate, my father was received into the mercy of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah (whose Name be exalted!) and left me money and eunuchs,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: servants and slaves; and I used to dress well and diet well. Now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah had made me a hater of women kind and one day, as I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: walking along a street in Baghdad, a party of females met me face

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to face in the footway; so I fled from them and, entering an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alley which was no thoroughfare, sat down upon a stone bench at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: its other end. I had not sat there long before the latticed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: window of one of the houses opposite was thrown open, and there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: appeared at it a young lady, as she were the full moon at its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fullest; never in my life saw I her like; and she began to water

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: some flowers on the window sill.[FN#603] She turned right and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: left and, seeing me watching her, shut the window and went away.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon fire was suddenly enkindled in my heart; my mind was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: possessed with her and my woman hate turned to woman love. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: continued sitting there, lost to the world, till sunset when lo!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Kazi of the city came riding by with his slaves before him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and his eunuchs behind him, and dismounting entered the house in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which the damsel had appeared. By this I knew that he was her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: father; so I went home sorrowful and cast myself upon my carpet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bed in grief. Then my handmaids flocked in and sat about me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unknowing what ailed me; but I addressed no speech to them, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they wept and wailed over me. Presently in came an old woman who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looked at me and saw with a glance what was the matter with me:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so she by my head spoke me fair, saying, O my son, tell me all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about it and I will be the means of thy union with her.[FN#604]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So I related to her what had happened and she answered, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son, this one is the daughter of the Kazi of Baghdad who keepeth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her in the closest seclusion; and the window where thou sawest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her is her floor, whilst her father occupies the large saloon in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the lower story. She is often there alone and I am wont to visit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at the house; so thou shalt not win to her save through me. Now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set thy wits to work and be of good cheer. With these words she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went away and I took heart at what she said and my people

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoiced that day, seeing me rise in the morning safe and sound.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By and by the old woman returned looking chopfallen,[FN#605] and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, O my son, do not ask me how I fared with her! When I told

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her that, she cried at me, 'If thou hold not thy peace, O hag of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ill omen, and leave not such talk, I will entreat thee as thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deservest and do thee die by the foulest of deaths.' But needs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: must I have at her a second time.[FN#606] When I heard this it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: added ailment to my ailment and the neighbours visited me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: judged that I was not long for this world; but after some days,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the old woman came to me and, putting her mouth close to my ear,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whispered, O my son; I claim from thee the gift of good news.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: With this my soul returned to me and I said, Whatever thou wilt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall be thine. Thereupon she began, Yesterday I went to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young lady who, seeing me broken in spirit and shedding tears

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from reddened eyes, asked me, 'O naunty[FN#607] mine, what ails

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee, that I see thy breast so straitened?'; and I answered her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weeping bitterly, 'O my lady, I am just come from the house of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth who loves thee and who is about to die for sake of thee!'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth she (and her heart was softened), 'And who is this youth of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom thou speakest?'; and quoth I, 'He is to me as a son and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fruit of my vitals. He saw thee, some days ago, at the window

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: watering thy flowers and espying thy face and wrists he fell in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: love at first sight. I let him know what happened to me the last

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: time I was with thee, whereupon his ailment increased, he took to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the pillow and he is naught now but a dead man, and no doubt what
