title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ever of it.' At this she turned pale and asked, 'All this for my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sake?'; and I answered, 'Ay, by Allah![FN#608] what wouldst thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have me do?' Said she, 'Go back to him and greet him for me and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tell him that I am twice more heartsick than he is. And on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Friday, before the hour of public prayer, bid him here to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house, and I will come down and open the door for him. Then I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will carry him up to my chamber and foregather with him for a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: while, and let him depart before my father return from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mosque.' When I heard the old woman's words, all my sickness

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: suddenly fell from me, my anguish ceased and my heart was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: comforted; I took off what clothes were on me and gave them to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her and, as she turned to go, she said, Keep a good heart! I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have not a jot of sorrow left. I replied. My household and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: intimates rejoiced in my recovery and I abode thus till Friday,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when behold, the old woman came in and asked me how I did, to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which I answered that I was well and in good case. Then I donned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my clothes and perfumed myself and sat down to await the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: congregation going in to prayers, that I might betake myself to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her. But the old woman said to me, Thou hast time and to spare:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so thou wouldst do well to go to the Hammam and have thy hair

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shaven off (especially after thy ailment), so as not to show

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: traces of sickness. This were the best way, answered I, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have just now bathed in hot water, but I will have my head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shaved. Then I said to my page, Go to the bazaar and bring me a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: barber, a discreet fellow and one not inclined to meddling or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: impertinent curiosity or likely to split my head with his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: excessive talk.[FN#609] The boy went out at once and brought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back with him this wretched old man, this Shaykh of ill omen.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When he came in he saluted me and I returned his salutation; then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth he, Of a truth I see thee thin of body; and quoth I, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have been ailing. He continued, Allah drive far away from thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy woe and thy sorrow and thy trouble and thy distress. Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grant thy prayer! said I. He pursued, All gladness to thee, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my master, for indeed recovery is come to thee. Dost thou wish to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be polled or to be blooded? Indeed it was a tradition of Ibn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Abbas[FN#610] (Allah accept of him!) that the Apostle said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'Whoso cutteth his hair on a Friday, the Lord shall avert from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him threescore and ten calamities;' and again is related of him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: also that he said, 'Cupping on a Friday keepeth from loss of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sight and a host of diseases.' Leave this talk, I cried;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: come, shave me my head at once for I can't stand it. So he rose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and put forth his hand in most leisurely way and took out a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kerchief and unfolded it, and lo! it contained an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: astrolabe[FN#611] with seven parallel plates mounted in silver.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he went to the middle of the court and raised head and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: instrument towards the sun's rays and looked for a long while.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When this was over, he came back and said to me, Know that there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have elapsed of this our day, which be Friday, and this Friday be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the tenth of the month Safar in the six hundred and fifty- third

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: year since the Hegira or Flight of the Apostle (on whom be the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bestest of blessings and peace!) and the seven thousand three

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hundred and twentieth year of the era of Alexander, eight degrees

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and six minutes. Furthermore the ascendant of this our day is,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: according to the exactest science of computation, the planet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mars; and it so happeneth that Mercury is in conjunction with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, denoting an auspicious moment for hair cutting; and this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: also maketh manifest to me that thou desires union with a certain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: person and that your intercourse will not be propitious. But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after this there occurreth a sign respecting a matter which will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befall thee and whereof I will not speak. O thou, cried I, by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, thou weariest me and scatterest my wits and thy forecast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is other than good; I sent for thee to poll my head and naught

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: else: so up and shave me and prolong not thy speech. By Allah,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied he, if thou but knew what is about to befall thee, thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wouldst do nothing this day, and I counsel thee to act as I tell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee by computation of the constellations. By Allah, said I,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: never did I see a barber who excelled in judicial astrology save

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thyself: but I think and I know that thou art most prodigal of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: frivolous talk. I sent for thee only to shave my head, but thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: comest and pesterest me with this sorry prattle. What more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wouldst thou have? replied he. Allah hath bounteously bestowed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on thee a Barber who is an astrologer, one learned in alchemy and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: white magic;[FN#612] syntax, grammar, and lexicology; the arts of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: logic, rhetoric and elocution; mathematics, arithmetic and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: algebra; astronomy, astromancy and geometry; theology, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Traditions of the Apostle and the Commentaries on the Koran.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Furthermore, I have read books galore and digested them and have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had experience of affairs and comprehended them. In short I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: learned the theorick and the practick of all the arts and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sciences; I know everything of them by rote and I am a past

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master in tota re scibili. Thy father loved me for my lack of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: officiousness, argal, to serve thee is a religious duty incumbent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on me. I am no busy body as thou seemest to suppose, and on this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: account I am known as The Silent Man, also, The Modest Man.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wherefore it behoveth thee to render thanks to Allah Almighty and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not cross me, for I am a true counsellor to thee and benevolently

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: minded towards thee. Would that I were in thy service a whole

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: year that thou mightest do me justice; and I would ask thee no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wage for all this. When I heard his flow of words, I said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, Doubtless thou wilt be my death this day!--And Shahrazad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perceived the dawn of day and ceased saying her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Thirtieth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the young

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man said to the Barber, Thou certainly will be the death of me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this very day! O master mine, replied he, I am he, The Silent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Man hight, by reason of the fewness of my words, to distinguish

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me from my six brothers. For the eldest is called Al-Bakbúk, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prattler; the second Al-Haddár, the babbler; the third Al-Fakík,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the gabbler; the fourth, his name is Al-Kuz al-aswáni, the long

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: necked Gugglet, from his eternal chattering; the fifth is Al-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nashshár, the tattler and tale teller; the sixth Shakáshik, or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: many clamours; and the seventh is famous as Al-Sámit, The Silent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Man, and this is my noble self! Whilst he redoubled his talk, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thought my gall bladder would have burst; so I said to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: servant, Give him a quarter dinar and dismiss him and let him go

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from me in the name of God who made him. I won't have my head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shaved to day. What words be these, O my lord? cried he. By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah! I will accept no hire of thee till I have served thee and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have ministered to thy wants; and I care not if I never take

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: money of thee. If thou know not my quality, I know thine; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: owe thy father, an honest man, on whom Allah Almighty have mercy!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: many a kindness, for he was a liberal soul and a generous. By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, he sent for me one day, as it were this blessed day, and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went in to him and found a party of his intimates about him.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth he to me, 'Let me blood;' so I pulled out my astrolabe and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: taking the sun's altitude for him, I ascertained that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ascendant was inauspicious and the hour unfavourable for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brooding. I told him of this, and he did according to my bidding

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and awaited a better opportunity. So I made these lines in honour

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of him:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I went to my patron some blood to let him, * But found that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: moment was far from good:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So I sat and I talked of all strangenesses, * And with jests and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: jokes his good will I wooed:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: They pleased him and cried he, 'O man of wit, * Thou hast proved

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee perfect in merry mood!'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Quoth I, 'O thou Lord of men, save thou * Lend me art and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wisdom I'm fou and wood

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: In thee gather grace, boon, bounty, suavity, * And I guerdon the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: world with lore, science and gravity.'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thy father was delighted and cried out to the servant, 'Give him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an hundred and three gold pieces with a robe of honour!' The man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: obeyed his orders, and I awaited an auspicious moment, when I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blooded him; and he did not baulk me; nay he thanked me and I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: also thanked and praised by all present. When the blood-letting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was over I had no power to keep silence and asked him, 'By Allah,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O my lord, what made thee say to the servant, Give him an hundred

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and three dinars?'; and he answered, 'One dinar was for the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: astrological observation, another for thy pleasant conversation,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the third for the phlebotomisation, and the remaining hundred and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the dress were for thy verses in my commendation.' May Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: show small mercy to my father, exclaimed I, for knowing the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like of thee. He laughed and ejaculated, There is no god but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the God and Mohammed is the Apostle of God! Glory to Him that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: changeth and is changed not! I took thee for a man of sense, but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I see thou babblest and dotest for illness. Allah hath said in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Blessed Book,[FN#613] 'Paradise is prepared for the goodly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who bridle their anger and forgive men.' and so forth; and in any

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: case thou art excused. Yet I cannot conceive the cause of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hurry and flurry; and thou must know that thy father and thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grandfather did nothing without consulting me, and indeed it hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: been said truly enough, 'Let the adviser be prized'; and, 'There

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is no vice in advice'; and it is also said in certain saws,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'Whoso hath no counsellor elder than he, will never himself an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: elder be';[FN#614] and the poet says:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whatever needful thing thou undertake, * Consult th' experienced

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and contraire him not!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And indeed thou shalt never find a man better versed in affairs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: than I, and I am here standing on my feet to serve thee. I am not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: vexed with thee: why shouldest thou be vexed with me? But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whatever happen I will bear patiently with thee in memory of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: much kindness thy father shewed me. By Allah, cried I, O thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with tongue long as the tail of a jackass, thou persistest in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pestering me with thy prate and thou becomest more longsome in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy long speeches, when all I want of thee is to shave my head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and wend thy way! Then he lathered my head saying, I perceive

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou art vexed with me, but I will not take it ill of thee, for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy wit is weak and thou art but a laddy: it was only yesterday I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: used to take thee on my shoulder[FN#615] and carry thee to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: school.' O my brother, said I, for Allah's sake do what I want

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and go thy gait! And I rent my garments.[FN#616] When he saw me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: do this he took the razor and fell to sharpening it and gave not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over stropping it until my senses were well nigh leaving me. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he came up to me and shaved part of my head; then he held his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand and then he said, O my lord, haste is Satan's gait whilst

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: patience is of Allah the Compassionate. But thou, O my master, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ken thou knowest not my rank; for verily this hand alighteth upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the heads of Kings and Emirs and Wazirs, and sages and doctors

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: learned in the law, and the poet said of one like me:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: All crafts are like necklaces strung on a string, * But this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Barber's the union pear of the band:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: High over all craftsmen he ranketh, and why? * The heads of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kings are under his hand![FN#617]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then said I, Do leave off talking about what concerneth thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not: indeed thou hast straitened my breast and distracted my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mind. Quoth he, Meseems thou art a hasty man; and quoth I,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Yes ! yes! yes! and he, I rede thee practice restraint of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: self, for haste is Satan's pelf which bequeatheth only repentance

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and ban and bane, and He (upon whom be blessings and peace!) hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, 'The best of works is that wherein deliberation lurks;' but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I, by Allah! have some doubt about thine affair; and so I should

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like thee to let me know what it is thou art in such haste to do,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for I fear me it is other than good. Then he continued, It

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wanteth three hours yet to prayer time; but I do not wish to be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in doubt upon this matter; nay, I must know the moment exactly,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for truly, 'A guess shot in times of doubt, oft brings harm

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about;' especially in the like of me, a superior person whose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: merits are famous amongst mankind at large; and it doth not befit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me to talk at random, as do the common sort of astrologers. So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, he threw down the razor and taking up the astrolabe, went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth under the sun and stood there a long time; after which he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned and counting on his fingers said to me, There remain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: still to prayer time three full hours and complete, neither more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nor yet less, according to the most learned astronomicals and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wisest makers of almanacks. Allah upon thee, cried I, hold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy tongue with me, for thou breakest my liver in pieces. So he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took the razor and, after sharpening it as before and shaving

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other two hairs of my head, he again held his hand and said, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: am concerned about thy hastiness and indeed thou wouldst do well

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to let me into the cause of it; 't were the better for thee, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou knowest that neither thy father nor thy grandfather ever did

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a single thing save by my advice. When I saw that there was no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: escape from him I said to myself, The time for prayer draws near

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and I wish to go to her before the folk come out of the mosque.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: If I am delayed much longer, I know not how to come at her. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said I aloud, Be quick and stint this talk and impertinence, for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I have to go to a party at the house of some of my intimates.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When he heard me speak of the party, he said, This thy day is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blessed day for me! In very sooth it was but yesterday I invited

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a company of my friends and I have forgotten to provide anything

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for them to eat. This very moment I was thinking of it: Alas, how

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I shall be disgraced in their eyes! Be not distressed about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this matter, answered I; have I not told thee that I am bidden

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to an entertainment this day? So every thing in my house, eatable

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and drinkable, shall be thine, if thou wilt only get through thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: work and make haste to shave my head. He replied, Allah requite

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee with good! Specify to me what is in thy house for my guests

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that I may be ware of it. Quoth I, Five dishes of meat and ten

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chickens with reddened breasts[FN#618] and a roasted lamb. Set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them before me, quoth he that I may see them. So I told my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: people to buy, borrow or steal them and bring them in anywise,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And had all this set before him. When he saw it he cried, The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wine is wanting, and I replied, I have a flagon or two of good

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: old grape- juice in the house, and he said, Have it brought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out! So I sent for it and he exclaimed, Allah bless thee for a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: generous disposition! But there are still the essences and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perfumes. So I bade them set before him a box containing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nadd,[FN#619] the best of compound perfumes, together with fine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lign-aloes, ambergris and musk unmixed, the whole worth fifty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinars. Now the time waxed strait and my heart straitened with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it; so I said to him, Take it all and finish shaving my head by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the life of Mohammed (whom Allah bless and keep!). By Allah,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said he, I will not take it till I see all that is in it. So I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bade the page open the box and the Barber laid down the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: astrolabe, leaving the greater part of my head unpolled; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sitting on the ground, turned over the scents and incense and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: aloes wood and essences till I was well nigh distraught. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took the razor and coming up to me shaved off some few hairs and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repeated these lines:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The boy like his father shall surely show, * As the tree from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: its parent root shall grow.[FN#620]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then said he, By Allah, O my son, I know not whether to thank

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee or thy father; for my entertainment this day is all due to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy bounty and beneficence; and, although none of my company be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: worthy of it, yet I have a set of honourable men, to wit Zantut

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bath-keeper and Sali'a the corn-chandler; and Silat the bean-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seller; and Akrashah the greengrocer; and Humayd the scavenger;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and Sa'id the camel-man; and Suwayd the porter; and Abu Makarish

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the bathman;[FN#621] and Kasim the watchman; and Karim the groom.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: There is not among the whole of them a bore or a bully in his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cups; nor a meddler nor a miser of his money, and each and every

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath some dance which he danceth and some of his own couplets

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which he caroleth; and the best of them is that, like thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: servant, thy slave here, they know not what much talking is nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what forwardness means. The bath keeper sings to the tom-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tom[FN#622] a song which enchants; and he stands up and dances

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and chants,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'I am going, O mammy, to fill up my pot.'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: As for the corn-chandler he brings more skill to it than any; he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dances and sings,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'O Keener,[FN#623] 0 sweetheart, thou fallest not short'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he leaves no one's vitals sound for laughing at him. But the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: scavenger sings so that the birds stop to listen to him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dances and sings,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'News my wife wots is not locked in a box!'[FN#624]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And he hath privilege, for 'tis a shrewd rogue[FN#625] and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: witty; and speaking of his excellence I am wont to say,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: My life for the scavenger! right well I love him, * Like a waving

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bough he is sweet to my sight:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fate joined us one night, when to him quoth I * (The while I grew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: weak and love gained more might)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'Thy love burns my heart!' 'And no wonder,' quoth he * 'When the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drawer of dung turns a stoker wight.'[FN#626]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And indeed each is perfect in whatso can charm the wit with joy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and jollity; adding presently, But hearing is not seeing; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: indeed if thou make up thy mind to join us and put off going to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy friends, 'twill be better for us and for thee. The traces of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: illness are yet upon thee and haply thou art going among folk who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be mighty talkers, men who commune together of what concerneth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them not; or there may be amongst them some forward fellow who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will split thy head, and thou half thy size from sickness. This

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall be for some other day, answered I, and laughed with heart

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: angered: finish thy work and go, in Allah Almighty's guard, to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy friends, for they will be expecting thy coming. O my lord,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied he, I seek only to introduce thee to these fellows of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: infinite mirth, the sons of men of worth, amongst whom there is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neither procacity nor dicacity nor loquacity; for never, since I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grew to years of discretion, could I endure to consort with one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who asketh questions concerning what concerneth him not, nor have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I ever frequented any save those who are, like myself, men of few

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words. In sooth if thou were to company with them or even to see

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them once, thou wouldst forsake all thy intimates. Allah fulfil

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy joyance with them, said I, needs must I come amongst them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: some day or other. But he said, Would it were this very day,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for I had set my heart upon thy making one of us; yet if thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: must go to thy friends to day, I will take these good things,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wherewith thou hast honoured and favoured me, to my guests and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leave them to eat and drink and not wait for me; whilst I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: return to thee in haste and accompany thee to thy little party;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for there is no ceremony between me and my intimates to prevent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my leaving them. Fear not, I will soon be back with thee and wend

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with thee whithersoever thou wendest. There is no Majesty and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there is no Might save in Allah, the Glorious, the Great! I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shouted, Go thou to thy friends and make merry with them; and do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: let me go to mine and be with them this day, for they expect me.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But the Barber cried, I will not let thee go alone; and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied, The truth is none can enter where I am going save

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: myself. He rejoined, I suspect that to day thou art for an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: assignation with some woman, else thou hadst taken me with thee;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yet am I the right man to take, one who could aid thee to the end

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou wishest. But I fear me thou art running after strange women

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and thou wilt lose thy life; for in this our city of Baghdad one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cannot do any thing in this line, especially on a day like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Friday: our Governor is an angry man and a mighty sharp blade.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shame on thee, thou wicked, bad, old man! cried I, Be off!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what words are these thou givest me? O cold of wit,[FN#627]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried he, thou sayest to me what is not true and thou hidest thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mind from me, but I know the whole business for certain and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seek only to help thee this day with my best endeavour. I was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fearful lest my people or my neighbours should hear the Barber's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: talk, so I kept silence for a long time whilst he finished

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shaving my head; by which time the hour of prayer was come and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Khutbah, or sermon, was about to follow. When he had done, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to him, Go to thy friends with their meat and drink, and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will await thy return. Then we will fare together. In this way I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hoped to pour oil on troubled waters and to trick the accursed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: loon, so haply I might get quit of him; but he said, Thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cozening me and thou wouldst go alone to thy appointment and cast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thyself into jeopardy, whence there will be no escape for thee.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now by Allah! and again by Allah! do not go till I return, that I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: may accompany thee and watch the issue of thine affair. So be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it, I replied, do not be long absent. Then he took all the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: meat and drink I had given him and the rest of it and went out of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my house; but the accursed carle gave it in charge of a porter to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carry to his home but hid himself in one of the alleys. As for me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I rose on the instant, for the Muezzins had already called the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Salam of Friday, the salute to the Apostle;[FN#628] and I dressed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in haste and went out alone and, hurrying to the street, took my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stand by the house wherein I had seen the young lady. I found the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: old woman on guard at the door awaiting me, and went up with her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the upper story, the damsel's apartment. Hardly had I reached

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it when behold, the master of the house returned from prayers and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entering the great saloon, closed the door. I looked down from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the window and saw this Barber (Allah's curse upon him!) sitting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over against the door and said, How did this devil find me out?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: At this very moment, as Allah had decreed it for rending my veil

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of secrecy, it so happened that a handmaid of the house master

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: committed some offence for which he beat her. She shrieked out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and his slave ran in to intercede for her, whereupon the Kazi

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beat him to boot, and he also roared out. The damned Barber

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fancied that it was I who was being beaten; so he also fell to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shouting and tore his garments and scattered dust on his head and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kept on shrieking and crying Help ! Help ! So the people came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: round about him and he went on yelling, My master is being

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: murdered in the Kazi's house! Then he ran clamouring to my place

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the folk after him, and told my people and servants and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slaves; and, before I knew what was doing, up they came tearing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their clothes and letting loose their hair[FN#629] and shouting,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Alas, our master!; and this Barber leading the rout with his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes rent and in sorriest plight; and he also shouting like a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: madman and saying, Alas for our murdered master! And they all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made an assault upon the house in which I was. The Kazi, hearing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the yells and the uproar at his door, said to one of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: servants, See what is the matter; and the man went forth and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned and said, O my master, at the gate there are more than

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ten thousand souls what with men and women, and all crying out,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'Alas for our murdered master!'; and they keep pointing to our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house. When the Kazi heard this, the matter seemed serious and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he waxed wroth; so he rose and opening the door saw a great crowd

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of people; whereat he was astounded and said, O folk! what is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there to do? O accursed! O dog! O hog! my servants replied;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tis thou who hast killed our master! Quoth he, O good folk,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and what hath your master done to me that I should kill him?--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and ceased saying her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Thirty-first Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the Kazi

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to the servants, What hath your master done to me that I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: should kill him? This is my house and it is open to you all.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then quoth the Barber, Thou didst beat him and I heard him cry

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out; and quoth the Kazi, But what was he doing that I should

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beat him, and what brought him in to my house; and whence came he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and whither went he? Be not a wicked, perverse old man! cried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Barber, for I know the whole story; and the long and short

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of it is that thy daughter is in love with him and he loves her;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and when thou knewest that he had entered the house, thou badest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy servants beat him and they did so: by Allah, none shall judge

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: between us and thee but the Caliph; or else do thou bring out our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master that his folk may take him, before they go in and save him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perforce from thy house, and thou be put to shame. Then said the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kazi (and his tongue was bridled and his mouth was stopped by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: confusion before the people), An thou say sooth, do thou come in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and fetch him out. Whereupon the Barber pushed forward and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: entered the house. When I saw this I looked about for a means of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: escape and flight, but saw no hiding place except a great chest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the upper chamber where I was. So I got into it and pulled the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lid down upon myself and held my breath. The Barber was hardly in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the room before he began to look about for me, then turned him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: right and left and came straight to the place where I was, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stepped up to the chest and, lifting it on his head, made off as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fast as he could. At this, my reason forsook me, for I knew that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he would not let me be; so I took courage and opening the chest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: threw myself to the ground. My leg was broken in the fall, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the door being open I saw a great concourse of people looking in.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now I carried in my sleeve much gold and some silver, which I had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: provided for an ill day like this and the like of such occasion;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so I kept scattering it amongst the folk to divert their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: attention from me and, whilst they were busy scrambling for it, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set off, hopping as fast as I could, through the by streets of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Baghdad, shifting and turning right and left. But whithersoever I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went this damned Barber would go in after me, crying aloud, They

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would have bereft me of my master! They would have slain him who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was a benefactor to me and my family and my friends! Praised be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah who made me prevail against them and delivered my lord from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their hands! Then to me, Where wilt thou go now? Thou wouldst

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: persist in following thine own evil devices, till thou broughtest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thyself to this ill pass; and, had not Allah vouchsafed me to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee, ne'er hadst thou escaped this strait into which thou hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fallen, for they would have cast thee into a calamity whence thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: never couldest have won free. But I will not call thee to account

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for thine ignorance, as thou art so little of wit and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: inconsequential and addicted to hastiness! Said I to him, Doth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not what thou hast brought upon me suffice thee, but thou must

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: run after me and talk me such talk in the bazaar streets? And I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: well nigh gave up the ghost for excess of rage against him. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I took refuge in the shop of a weaver amiddlemost of the market

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and sought protection of the owner who drove the Barber away;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, sitting in the back room,[FN#630] I said to myself, If I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: return home I shall never be able to get rid of this curse of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Barber, who will be with me night and day; and I cannot endure

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the sight of him even for a breathing space. So I sent out at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: once for witnesses and made a will, dividing the greater part of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my property among my people, and appointed a guardian over them,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to whom I committed the charge of great and small, directing him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to sell my houses and domains. Then I set out on my travels that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I might be free of this pimp;[FN#631] and I came to settle in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: your town where I have lived some time. When you invited me and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came hither, the first thing I saw was this accursed pander

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seated in the place of honour. How then can my heart be glad and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my stay be pleasant in company with this fellow who brought all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this upon me, and who was the cause of the breaking of my leg and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of my exile from home and native land. And the youth refused to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sit down and went away. When we heard his story (continued the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tailor) we were amazed beyond measure and amused and said to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Barber, By Allah, is it true what this young man saith of thee?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: By Allah, replied he, I dealt thus by him of my courtesy and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sound sense and generosity. Had it not been for me he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perished and none but I was the cause of his escape. Well it was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for him that he suffered in his leg and not in his life! Had I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: been a man of many words, a meddler, a busy body, I had not acted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thus kindly by him; but now I will tell you a tale which befell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, that you may be well assured I am a man sparing of speech in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom is no forwardness and a very different person from those six

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Brothers of mine; and this it is.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Barber's Tale of Himself.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I was living in Baghdad during the times of Al-Mustansir

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bi'llah,[FN#632] Son of Al-Mustazi bi'llah the then Caliph, a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prince who loved the poor and needy and companied with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: learned and pious. One day it happened to him that he was wroth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with ten persons, highwaymen who robbed on the Caliph's highway,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he ordered the Prefect of Baghdad to bring them into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presence on the anniversary of the Great Festival.[FN#633] So the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Prefect sallied out and, making them His prisoners, embarked with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them in a boat. I caught sight of them as they were embarking and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to myself, These are surely assembled for a marriage feast;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: methinks they are spending their day in that boat eating and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drinking, and none shall be companion of their cups but I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: myself. So I rose, O fair assembly; and, of the excess of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: courtesy and the gravity of my understanding, I embarked with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: them and entered into conversation with them. They rowed across

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the opposite bank, where they landed and there came up the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: watch and guardians of the peace with chains, which they put

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: round the robbers' necks. They chained me among the rest of them;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, O people, is it not a proof of my courtesy and spareness of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speech, that I held my peace and did not please to speak? Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they took us away in bilbos and next morning carried us all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before Al- Mustansir bi'llah, Commander of the Faithful, who bade

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: smite the necks of the ten robbers. So the Sworder came forward

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after they were seated on the leather of blood;[FN#634] then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drawing his blade, struck off one head after another until he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: smitten the neck of the tenth; and I alone remained. The Caliph

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looked at me and asked the Heads man, saying, What ails thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that thou hast struck off only nine heads?; and he answered,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah forbid that I should behead only nine, when thou biddest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me behead ten! Quoth the Caliph, Meseems thou hast smitten the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: necks of only nine, and this man before thee is the tenth. By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy beneficence! replied the Headsman, I have beheaded ten.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Count them! cried the Caliph and whenas they counted heads, lo!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there were ten. The Caliph looked at me and said, What made thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: keep silence at a time like this and how camest thou to company

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with these men of blood? Tell me the cause of all this, for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: albeit thou art a very old man, assuredly thy wits are weak. Now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when I heard these words from the Caliph I sprang to my feet and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied, Know, O Prince of the Faithful, that I am the Silent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shaykh and am thus called to distinguish me from my six brothers.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I am a man of immense learning whilst, as for the gravity of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: understanding, the wiliness of my wits and the spareness of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speech, there is no end of them; and my calling is that of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: barber. I went out early on yesterday morning and saw these men

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: making for a skiff; and, fancying they were bound for a marriage

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: feast, I joined them and mixed with them. After a while up came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the watch and guardians of the peace, who put chains round their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: necks and round mine with the rest; but, in the excess of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: courtesy, I held my peace and spake not a word; nor was this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other but generosity on my part. They brought us into thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: presence, and thou gavest an order to smite the necks of the ten;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yet did I not make myself known to thee and remained silent

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before the Sworder, purely of my great generosity and courtesy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which led me to share with them in their death. But all my life

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: long have I dealt thus nobly with mankind, and they requite me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the foulest and evillest requital! When the Caliph heard my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words and knew that I was a man of exceeding generosity and of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: very few words, one in whom is no forwardness (as this youth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would have it whom I rescued from mortal risk and who hath so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: scurvily repaid me), he laughed with excessive laughter till he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell upon his back. Then said he to me, O Silent Man, do thy six

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brothers favour thee in wisdom and knowledge and spareness of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speech? I replied, Never were they like me! Thou puttest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: reproach upon me, O Commander of the Faithful, and it becomes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee not to even my brothers with me; for, of the abundance of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their speech and their deficiency of courtesy and gravity, each

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one of them hath gotten some maim or other. One is a monocular,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another palsied, a third stone blind, a fourth cropped of ears

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and nose and a fifth shorn of both lips, while the sixth is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hunchback and a cripple. And conceive not, O Commander of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Faithful, that I am prodigal of speech; but I must perforce

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: explain to thee that I am a man of greater worth and fewer words

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: than any of them. From each one of my brothers hangs a tale of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: how he came by his bodily defect and these I will relate to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. So the Caliph gave ear to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Barber's Tale of his First Brother.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know then, O Commander of the Faithful, that my first brother, Al

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bakbuk, the Prattler, is a Hunchback who took to tailoring in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Baghdad, and he used to sew in a shop hired from a man of much

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wealth, who dwelt over the shop,[FN#635] and there was also a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flour-mill in the basement. One day as my brother, the Hunchback,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was sitting in his shop a tailoring, he chanced to raise his head

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and saw a lady like the rising full moon at a balconied window of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his landlord's house, engaged in looking out at the passers

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: by.[FN#636] When my brother beheld her, his heart was taken with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: love of her and he passed his whole day gazing at her and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neglected his tailoring till eventide. Next morning he opened his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shop and sat him down to sew; but, as often as he stitched a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stitch, he looked to the window and saw her as before; and his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: passion and infatuation for her increased. On the third day as he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was sitting in his usual place gazing on her, she caught sight of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and, perceiving that he had been captivated with love of her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laughed in his face[FN#637] and he smiled back at her. Then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disappeared and presently sent her slave girl to him with a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bundle containing a piece of red cowered silk. The handmaid

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: accosted him and said, My lady salameth to thee and desireth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee, of thy skill and good will, to fashion for her a shift of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this piece and to sew it handsomely with thy best sewing. He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied, Hearkening and obedience; and shaped for her a chemise

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and finished sewing it the same day. When the morning morrowed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the girl came back and said to him, My lady salameth to thee and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asks how thou hast passed yesternight; for she hath not tasted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sleep by reason of her heart being taken up with thee. Then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laid before him a piece of yellow satin and said, My lady biddeth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee cut her two pair of petticoat trousers out of this piece and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sew them this very day. Hearkening and obedience!' replied he,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greet her for me with many greetings and say to her, Thy slave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is obedient to thine order; so command him as thou wilt. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: applied himself to cutting out and worked hard at sewing the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trousers; and after an hour the lady appeared at the lattice and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saluted him by signs, now casting down her eyes, then smiling in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his face, and he began to assure himself that he would soon make

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a conquest. She did not let him stir till he had finished the two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pair of trousers, when she with drew and sent the handmaid to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whom he delivered them; and she took them and went her ways. When

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it was night, he threw himself on his carpet bed, and lay tossing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about from side to side till morning, when he rose and sat down

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in his place. Presently the damsel came to him and said, My

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master calleth for thee. Hearing these words he feared with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding fear; but the slave girl, seeing his affright, said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, No evil is meant to thee: naught but good awaiteth thee. My

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady would have thee make acquaintance with my lord. So my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother the tailor, rejoicing with great joy, went with her; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when he came into the presence of his landlord, the lady's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: husband, he kissed the ground before him, and the master of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house returned his greeting and gave him a great piece of linen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, Shape me shirts out of this stuff and sew them well;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and my brother answered, To hear is to obey. Thereupon he fell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to work at once, snipping, shaping and sewing till he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: finished twenty shirts by supper time, without stopping to taste

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: food. The house master asked him, How much the wage for this?;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he answered, Twenty dirhams. So the gentleman cried out to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the slave girl, Bring me twenty dirhams, and my brother spake

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not a word; but the lady signed, Take nothing from him;'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon my brother said, By Allah I will take naught from thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand. And he carried off his tailor's gear and returned to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shop, although he was destitute even to a red cent.[FN#638] Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he applied himself to do their work; eating, in his zeal and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: diligence, but a bit of bread and drinking only a little water

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for three days. At the end of this time came the handmaid and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to him, What hast thou done? Quoth he, They are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: finished, and carried the shirts to the lady's husband, who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would have paid him his hire: but he said, I will take nothing,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for fear of her and, returning to his shop, passed the night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without sleep because of his hunger. Now the dame had informed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her husband how the case stood (my brother knowing naught of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this); and the two had agreed to make him tailor for nothing, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: better to mock and laugh at him. Next morning he went to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shop, and, as he sat there, the handmaid came to him and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Speak with my master. So he accompanied her to the husband who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to him, I wish thee to cut out for me five long sleeved

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: robes.[FN#639] So he cut them out[FN#640] and took the stuff and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went away. Then he sewed them and carried them to the gentleman,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who praised his sewing and offered him a purse of silver. He put

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out his hand to take it, but the lady signed to him from behind

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her husband not to do so, and he replied, O my lord, there is no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hurry, we have time enough for this. Then he went forth from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house meaner and meeker than a donkey, for verily five things

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were gathered together in him viz.: love, beggary, hunger,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nakedness and hard labour. Nevertheless he heartened himself with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the hope of gaining the lady's favours. When he had made an end

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of all their jobs, they played him another trick and married him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to their slave girl; but, on the night when he thought to go in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to her, they said to him, Lie this night in the mill; and to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: morrow all will go well. My brother concluded that there was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: some good cause for this and nighted alone in the mill. Now the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: husband had set on the miller to make the tailor turn the mill:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so when night was half spent the man came in to him and began to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: say, This bull of ours hath be come useless and standeth still

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: instead of going round: he will not turn the mill this night, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yet we have great store of corn to be ground. However, I'll yoke

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him perforce and make him finish grinding it before morning, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the folk are impatient for their flour. So he filled the hoppers

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with grain and, going up to my brother with a rope in his hand,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tied it round his neck and said to him, Gee up! Round with the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mill! thou, O bull, wouldst do nothing but grub and stale and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dung! Then he took a whip and laid it on the shoulders and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: calves of my brother, who began to howl and bellow; but none came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to help him; and he was forced to grind the wheat till hard upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawn, when the house master came in and, seeing my brother still

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tethered to the yoke and the man flogging him, went away. At day

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: break the miller returned home and left him still yoked and half

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dead; and soon after in came the slave girl who unbound him, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to him, I and my lady are right sorry for what hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: happened and we have borne thy grief with thee. But he had no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tongue wherewith to answer her from excess of beating and mill

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turning. Then he retired to his lodging and behold, the clerk who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had drawn up the marriage deed came to him[FN#641] and saluted

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, saying, Allah give thee long life! May thy espousal be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blessed! This face telleth of pleasant doings and dalliance and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kissing and clipping from dusk to dawn. Allah grant the liar no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: peace, O thou thousandfold cuckold!, my brother replied, by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah, I did nothing but turn the mill in the place of the bull

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all night till morning! Tell me thy tale, quoth he; and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother recounted what had befallen him and he said, Thy star

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: agrees not with her star; but an thou wilt I can alter the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: contract for thee, adding, 'Ware lest another cheat be not in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: store for thee. And my brother answered him, See if thou have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not another contrivance. Then the clerk left him and he sat in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his shop, looking for some one to bring him a job whereby he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: might earn his day's bread. Presently the handmaid came to him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, Speak with my lady. Begone, O my good girl, replied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he, there shall be no more dealings between me and thy lady.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The handmaid returned to her mistress and told her what my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother had said and presently she put her head out of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: window, weeping and saying, Why, O my beloved, are there to be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: no more dealings 'twixt me and thee? But he made her no answer.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then she wept and conjured him, swearing that all which had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befallen him in the mill was not sanctioned by her and that she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was innocent of the whole matter. When he looked upon her beauty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and loveliness and heard the sweetness of her speech, the sorrow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which had possessed him passed from his heart; he accepted her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: excuse and he rejoiced in her sight. So he saluted her and talked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with her and sat tailoring awhile, after which the handmaid came

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him and said, My mistress greeteth thee and informeth thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that her husband purposeth to lie abroad this night in the house

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of some intimate friends of his; so, when he is gone, do thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: come to us and spend the night with my lady in delightsomest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: joyance till the morning. Now her husband had asked her, How

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shall we manage to turn him away from thee?; and she answered,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Leave me to play him another trick and make him a laughing stock

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for all the town. But my brother knew naught of the malice of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: women. As soon as it was dusk, the slave girl came to him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carried him to the house, and when the lady saw him she said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, By Allah, O my lord, I have been longing exceedingly for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. By Allah, cried he, kiss me quick before thou give me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: aught else.[FN#642] Hardly had he spoken, when the lady's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: husband came in from the next room[FN#643] and seized him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saying, By Allah, I will not let thee go, till I deliver thee to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the chief of the town watch. My brother humbled himself to him;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but he would not listen to him and carried him before the Prefect

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who gave him an hundred lashes with a whip and, mounting him on a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: camel, promenaded him round about the city, whilst the guards

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: proclaimed aloud, This is his reward who violateth the Harims of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: honourable men! Moreover, he fell off the camel and broke his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leg and so became lame. Then the Prefect banished him from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: city; and he went forth unknowing whither he should wend; but I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard of him and fearing for him went out after him and brought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him back secretly to the city and restored him to health and took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him into my house where he still liveth. The Caliph laughed at my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: story and said, Thou hast done well, O Samit, O Silent Man, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spare of speech!; and he bade me take a present and go away. But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I said, I will accept naught of thee except I tell thee what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befell all my other brothers; and do not think me a man of many

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: words. So the Caliph gave ear to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Barber's Tale of his Second Brother.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Know, O Commander of the Faithful, that my second brother's name

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was Al-Haddar, that is the Babbler, and he was the paralytic. Now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it happened to him one day, as he was going about his business,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that an old woman accosted him and said, Stop a little, my good

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man, that I may tell thee of somewhat which, if it be to thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: liking, thou shalt do for me and I will pray Allah to give thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: good of it! My brother stopped and she went on, I will put thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the way of a certain thing, so thou not be prodigal of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: speech. On with thy talk, quoth he; and she, What sayest thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to handsome quarters and a fair garden with flowing waters,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flowers blooming, and fruit growing, and old wine going and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pretty young face whose owner thou mayest embrace from dark till

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dawn? If thou do whatso I bid thee thou shalt see something

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greatly to thy advantage. And is all this in the world? asked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my brother; and she answered, Yes, and it shall be thine, so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou be reasonable and leave idle curiosity and many words, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: do my bidding. I will indeed, O my lady, said he, how is it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou hast preferred me in this matter before all men and what is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it that so much pleaseth thee in me? Quoth she, Did I not bid

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee be spare of speech? Hold thy peace and follow me. Know, that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the young lady, to whom I shall carry thee, loveth to have her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: own way and hateth being thwarted and all who gainsay; so, if

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou humour her, thou shalt come to thy desire of her. And my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother said, I will not cross her in anything. Then she went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on and my brother followed her, an hungering after what she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: described to him till they entered a fine large house, handsome

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and choicely furnished, full of eunuchs and servants and showing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: signs of prosperity from top to bottom. And she was carrying him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the upper story when the people of the house said to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: What dost thou here? But the old woman answered them, Hold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: your peace and trouble him not: he is a workman and we have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: occasion for him. Then she brought him into a fine great

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pavilion, with a garden in its midst, never eyes saw a fairer;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and made him sit upon a handsome couch. He had not sat long, be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fore he heard a loud noise and in came a troop of slave girls

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surrounding a lady like the moon on the night of its fullest.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When he saw her, he rose up and made an obeisance to her,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon she welcomed him and bade him be seated. So he sat down

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she said to him, Allah advance thee to honour! Is all well

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with thee? O my lady, he answered, all with me is right

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: well. Then she bade bring in food, and they set before her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: delicate viands; so she sat down to eat, making a show of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: affection to my brother and jesting with him, though all the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: while she could not refrain from laughing; but as often as he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looked at her, she signed towards her handmaidens as though she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were laughing at them. My brother (the ass!) understood nothing;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but, in the excess of his ridiculous passion, he fancied that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady was in love with him and that she would soon grant him his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: desire. When they had done eating, they set on the wine and there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came in ten maidens like moons, with lutes ready strung in their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hands, and fell to singing with full voices, sweet and sad,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon delight gat hold upon him and he took the cup from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady's hands and drank it standing. Then she drank a cup of wine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and my brother (still standing) said to her Health, and bowed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to her. She handed him another cup and he drank it off, when she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slapped him hard on the nape of his neck.[FN#644] Upon this my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother would have gone out of the house in anger; but the old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woman followed him and winked to him to return. So he came back

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the lady bade him sit and he sat down without a word. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
