text: she again slapped him on the nape of his neck; and the second

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slapping did not suffice her, she must needs make all her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: handmaidens also slap and cuff him, while he kept saying to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: old woman, I never saw aught nicer than this. She on her side

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ceased not exclaiming, Enough, enough, I conjure thee, O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mistress!; but the women slapped him till he well nigh swooned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: away. Presently my brother rose and went out to obey a call of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nature, but the old woman overtook him, and said, Be patient a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: little and thou shalt win to thy wish. How much longer have I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to wait, my brother replied, this slapping hath made me feel

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: faint. As soon as she is warm with wine, answered she, thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shalt have thy desire. So he returned to his place and sat down,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where upon all the handmaidens stood up and the lady bade them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: perfume him with pastiles and besprinkle his face with rose-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: water. Then said she to him, Allah advance thee to honour! Thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hast entered my house and hast borne with my conditions, for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whoso thwarteth me I turn him away, and whoso is patient hath his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: desire. O mistress mine, said he, I am thy slave and in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hollow of thine hand! Know, then, continued she, that Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath made me passionately fond of frolic; and whoso falleth in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with my humour cometh by whatso he wisheth. Then she ordered her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: maidens to sing with loud voices till the whole company was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: delighted; after which she said to one of them, Take thy lord,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and do what is needful for him and bring him back to me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forthright. So the damsel took my brother (and he not knowing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what she would do with him); but the old woman overtook him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, Be patient; there remaineth but little to do. At this his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: face brightened and he stood up before the lady while the old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woman kept saying, Be patient; thou wilt now at once win to thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wish!; till he said, Tell me what she would have the maiden do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with me? Nothing but good, replied she, as I am thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sacrifice! She wisheth only to dye thy eyebrows and pluck out thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mustachios. Quoth he, As for the dyeing of my eye brows, that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will come off with washing,[FN#645] but for the plucking out of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my mustachios, that indeed is a somewhat painful process. Be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cautious how thou cross her, cried the old woman; for she hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set her heart on thee. So my brother patiently suffered her to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dye his eyebrows and pluck out his mustachios, after which the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: maiden returned to her mistress and told her. Quoth she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Remaineth now only one other thing to be done; thou must shave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his beard and make him a smooth o' face.[FN#646] So the maiden

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went back and told him what her mistress had bidden her do; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my brother (the blockhead!) said to her, How shall I do what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will disgrace me before the folk? But the old woman said, She

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would do on this wise only that thou mayst be as a beardless

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: youth and that no hair be left on thy face to scratch and prick

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her delicate cheeks; for indeed she is passionately in love with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. So be patient and thou shalt attain thine object. My

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother was patient and did her bidding and let shave off his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beard and, when he was brought back to the lady, lo! he appeared

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dyed red as to his eyebrows, plucked of both mustachios, shorn of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his beard, rouged on both cheeks. At first she was affrighted at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him; then she made mockery of him and, laughing till she fell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon her back, said, O my lord, thou hast indeed won my heart by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy good nature! Then she conjured him, by her life, to stand up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and dance, and he arose, and capered about, and there was not a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cushion in the house but she threw it at his head, and in like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: manner did all her women who also kept pelting him with oranges

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and lemons and citrons till he fell down senseless from the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cuffing on the nape of the neck, the pillowing and the fruit

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pelting. Now thou hast attained thy wish, said the old woman

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when he came round; there are no more blows in store for thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and there remaineth but one little thing to do. It is her wont,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when she is in her cups, to let no one have her until she put off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her dress and trousers and remain stark naked.[FN#647] Then she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will bid thee doff thy clothes and run; and she will run before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee as if she were flying from thee; and do thou follow her from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: place to place till thy prickle stands at fullest point, when she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will yield to thee;[FN#648] adding, Strip off thy clothes at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: once. So he rose, well nigh lost in ecstasy and, doffing his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: raiment, showed himself mother naked.--And Shahrazad perceived

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the dawn of day and ceased to say her permitted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Thirty-second Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that when the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: old woman said to the Barber's second brother, Doff thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes, he rose, well nigh lost in ecstasy; and, stripping off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his raiment, showed himself mother naked. Whereupon the lady

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stripped also and said to my brother, If thou want anything run

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after me till thou catch me. Then she set out at a run and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ran after her while she rushed into room after room and rushed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out of room after room, my brother scampering after her in a rage

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of desire like a veritable madman, with yard standing terribly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tall. After much of this kind she dashed into a darkened place,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he dashed after her; but suddenly he trod upon a yielding

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spot, which gave way under his weight; and, before he was aware

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where he was, he found himself in the midst of a crowded market,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: part of the bazaar of the leather sellers who were crying the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prices of skins and hides and buying and selling. When they saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him in his plight, naked, with standing yard, shorn of beard and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mustachios, with eyebrows dyed red, and cheeks ruddied with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rouge, they shouted and clapped their hands at him, and set to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flogging him with skins upon his bare body till a swoon came over

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him. Then they threw him on the back of an ass and carried him to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Chief of Police. Quoth the Chief, What is this? Quoth they,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: This fellow fell suddenly upon us out of the Wazir's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house[FN#649] in this state. So the Prefect gave him an hundred

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lashes and then banished him from Baghdad. However I went out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after him and brought him back secretly into the city and made

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him a daily allowance for his living: although, were it not for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my generous humour, I could not have put up with the like of him.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the Caliph gave ear to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Barber's Tale of his Third Brother.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: My third brother's name was Al-Fakík, the Gabbler, who was blind.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: One day Fate and Fortune drove him to a fine large house, and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knocked at the door, desiring speech of its owner that he might

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beg somewhat of him. Quoth the master of the house, Who is at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the door? But my brother spake not a word and presently he heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him repeat with a loud voice, Who is this? Still he made no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answer and immediately heard the master walk to the door and open

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it and say, What dost thou want? My brother answered Something

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for Allah Almighty's sake.[FN#650] Art thou blind? asked the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man, and my brother answered Yes. Quoth the other, Stretch me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out thy hand. So my brother put out his hand thinking that he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: would give him something; but he took it and, drawing him into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the house, carried him up from stair to stair till they reached

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the terrace on the house top, my brother thinking the while that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he would surely give him something of food or money. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asked my brother, What dost thou want, O blind man? and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered, Something for the Almighty's sake. Allah open for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee some other door! O thou! why not say so when I was below

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stairs? O cadger, why not answer me when I first called to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee? And what meanest thou to do for me now? There is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nothing in the house to give thee. Then take me down the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stair. The path is before thee. So my brother rose and made

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his way downstairs, till he came within twenty steps of the door,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when his foot slipped and he rolled to the bottom and broke his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: head. Then he went out, unknowing whither to turn, and presently

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell in with two other blind men, companions of his, who said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, What didst thou gain to day? He told them what had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befallen him and added, O my brothers, I wish to take some of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the money in my hands and provide myself with it. Now the master

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the house had followed him and was listening to what they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said; but neither my brother nor his comrades knew of this. So my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother went to his lodging and sat down to await his companions,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the house owner entered after him without being perceived.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When the other blind men arrived, my brother said to them, Bolt

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the door and search the house lest any stranger have followed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us. The man, hearing this, caught hold of a cord that hung from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the ceiling and clung to it, whilst they went round about the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house and searched but found no one. So they came back, and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sitting beside my brother, brought out their money which they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: counted and lo! it was twelve thousand dirhams. Each took what he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wanted and they buried the rest in a corner of the room. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they set on food and sat down, to eat. Presently my brother,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hearing a strange pair of jaws munching by his side,[FN#651] said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to his friends, There is a stranger amongst us; and, putting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth his hand, caught hold of that of the house master.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thereupon all fell on him and beat him;[FN#652] and when tired of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: belabouring him they shouted, O ye Moslems! a thief is come in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to us, seeking to take our money! A crowd gathered around them,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whereupon the intruder hung on to them; and complained with them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as they complained, and, shutting his eyes like them, so that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: none might doubt his blindness, cried out, O Moslems, I take

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: refuge with Allah and the Governor, for I have a matter to make

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: known to him! Suddenly up came the watch and, laying hands on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the whole lot (my brother being amongst them), drove them[FN#653]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the Governor's who set them before him and asked, What news

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with you? Quoth the intruder, Look and find out for thyself,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not a word shall be wrung from us save by torture, so begin by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beating me and after me beat this man our leader.[FN#654] And he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pointed to my brother. So they threw the man at full length and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gave him four hundred sticks on his backside. The beating pained

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, whereupon he opened one eye and, as they redoubled their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blows, he opened the other eye. When the Governor saw this he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to him, What have we here, O accursed?; whereto he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied, Give me the seal-ring of pardon! We four have shammed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: blind, and we impose upon people that we may enter houses and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: look upon the unveiled faces of the women and contrive for their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: corruption. In this way we have gotten great gain and our store

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: amounts to twelve thousand dirhams. Said I to my company, 'Give

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me my share, three thousand;' but they rose and beat me and took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: away my money, and I seek refuge with Allah and with thee; better

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou have my share than they. So, if thou wouldst know the truth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of my words, beat one and every of the others more than thou hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beaten me, and he will surely open his eyes. The Governor gave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: orders for the question to begin with my brother, and they bound

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him to the whipping post,[FN#655] and the Governor said, O scum

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the earth, do ye abuse the gracious gifts of Allah and make as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: if ye were blind! Allah! Allah! cried my brother, by Allah,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there is none among us who can see. Then they beat him till he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: swooned away and the Governor cried, Leave him till he come to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and then beat him again. After this he caused each of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: companions to receive more than three hundred sticks, whilst the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sham Abraham kept saying to them Open your eyes or you will be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beaten afresh. At last the man said to the Governor, Dispatch

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: some one with me to bring thee the money; for these fellows will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not open their eyes, lest they incur disgrace before the folk.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So the Governor sent to fetch the money and gave the man his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pretended share, three thousand dirhams; and, keeping the rest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for himself, banished the three blind men from the city. But I, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Commander of the Faithful, went out and overtaking my brother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: questioned him of his case; whereupon he told me of what I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: told thee; so I brought him secretly into the city, and appointed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him (in the strictest privacy) an allowance for meat and drink!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Caliph laughed at my story and said, Give him a gift and let

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him go; but I said, By Allah! I will take naught till I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made known to the Commander of the Faithful what came to pass

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the rest of my brothers; for truly I am a man of few words

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and spare of speech. Then the Caliph gave ear to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Barber's Tale of his Fourth Brother.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now as for my fourth brother, O Commander of the Faithful, Al-Kuz

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-aswáni, or the long necked Gugglet hight, from his brimming

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over with words, the same who was blind of one eye, he became a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: butcher in Baghdad and he sold flesh and fattened rams; and great

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: men and rich bought their meat of him, so that he amassed much

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wealth and got him cattle and houses. He fared thus a long while,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till one day, as he was sitting in his shop, there came up an old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man and long o' the beard, who laid down some silver and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Give me meat for this. He gave him his money s worth of flesh

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the oldster went his ways. My brother examined the Shaykh's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: silver, and, seeing that the dirhams were white and bright, he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set them in a place apart. The greybeard continued to return to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the shop regularly for five months, and my brother ceased not to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lay up all the coin he received from him in its own box. At last

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he thought to take out the money to buy sheep; so he opened the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: box and found in it nothing, save bits of white paper cut round

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to look like coin;[FN#656] so he buffeted his face and cried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: aloud till the folk gathered about him, whereupon he told them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his tale which made them marvel exceedingly. Then he rose as was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his wont, and slaughtering a ram hung it up inside his shop;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after which he cut off some of the flesh, and hanging it outside

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kept saying to himself, O Allah, would the ill omened old fellow

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but come! And an hour had not passed before the Shaykh came with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his silver in hand; where upon my brother rose and caught hold of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him calling out, Come aid me, O Moslems, and learn my story with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this villain! When the old man heard this, he quietly said to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him, Which will be the better for thee, to let go of me or to be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: disgraced by me amidst the folk? In what wilt thou disgrace

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me? In that thou sellest man's flesh for mutton! Thou liest,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou accursed! Nay, he is the accursed who hath a man hanging

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: up by way of meat in his shop. If the matter be as thou sayest, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: give thee lawful leave to take my money and my life. Then the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: old man cried out aloud, Ho, ye people! if you would prove the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: truth of my words, enter this man's shop. The folk rushed in and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found that the ram was become a dead man[FN#657] hung up for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sale. So they set upon my brother crying out, O Infidel! O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: villain!; and his best friends fell to cuffing and kicking him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and kept saying, Dost thou make us eat flesh of the sons of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Adam? Furthermore, the old man struck him on the eye and put it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out. Then they carried the carcass, with the throat cut, before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Chief of the city watch, to whom the old man said, O Emir,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this fellow butchers men and sells their flesh for mutton and we

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have brought him to thee; so arise and execute the judgments of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Allah (to whom be honour and glory!). My brother would have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: defended himself, but the Chief refused to hear him and sentenced

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him to receive five hundred sticks and to forfeit the whole of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his property. And, indeed, had it not been for that same property

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which he expended in bribes, they would have surely slain him.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then the Chief banished him from Baghdad; and my brother fared

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth at a venture, till he came to a great town, where he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thought it best to set up as a cobbler; so he opened a shop and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sat there doing what he could for his livelihood. One day, as he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went forth on his business, he heard the distant tramp of horses

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, asking the cause, was told that the King was going out to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hunt and course; so my brother stopped to look at the fine suite.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: It so fortuned that the King's eye met my brother's; whereupon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the King hung down his head and said, I seek refuge with Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from the evil of this day!;[FN#658] and turned the reins of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: steed and returned home with all his retinue. Then he gave orders

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to his guards, who seized my brother and beat him with a beating

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: so painful that he was well nigh dead; and my brother knew not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what could be the cause of his maltreatment, after which he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned to his place in sorriest plight. Soon afterwards he went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to one of the King's household and related what had happened to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him; and the man laughed till he fell upon his back and cried, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother mine, know that the King cannot bear to look at a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: monocular, especially if he be blind of the right eye, in which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: case he doth not let him go without killing him. When my brother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard this, he resolved to fly from that city; so he went forth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: from it to another wherein none knew him and there he abode a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: long while. One day, being full of sorrowful thought for what had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: befallen him, he sallied out to solace himself; and, as he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: walking along, he heard the distant tramp of horses behind him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said, The judgement of Allah is upon me! and looked about

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for a hiding place but found none. At last he saw a closed door

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which he pushed hard: it yielded. and he entered a long gallery

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in which he took refuge, but hardly had he done so, when two men

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: set upon him crying out, Allah be thanked for having delivered

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee into our hands, O enemy of God! These three nights thou hast

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: robbed us of our rest and sleep, and verily thou hast made us

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: taste of the death cup. My brother asked, O folk, what ails

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: you?; and they answered, Thou givest us the change and goest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: about to disgrace us and plannest some plot to cut the throat of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the house master! Is it not enough that thou hast brought him to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beggary, thou and thy fellows? But now give us up the knife

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wherewith thou threatenest us every night. Then they searched

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and found in his waist belt the knife used for his shoe

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leather; and he said, O people, have the fear of Allah before

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: your eyes and maltreat me not, for know that my story is a right

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: strange! And what is thy story? said they: so he told them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what had befallen him, hoping they would let him go; however they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: paid no heed to what he said and, instead of showing some regard,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beat him grievously and tore off his clothes: then, finding on

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his sides the scars of beating with rods, they said, O accursed!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: these marks are the manifest signs of thy guilt! They carried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him before the Governor, whilst he said to himself, I am now

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: punished for my sins and none can deliver me save Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Almighty! The Governor addressing my brother asked him, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: villain, what led thee to enter their house with intention to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: murther?; and my brother answered, I conjure thee by Allah, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Emir, hear my words and be not hasty in condemning me! But the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Governor cried, Shall we listen to the words of a robber who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hath beggared these people, and who beareth on his back the scar

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of his stripes? adding, They surely had not done this to thee,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: save for some great crime. So he sentenced him to receive an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hundred cuts with the scourge, after which they set him on a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: camel and paraded him about the city, proclaiming, This is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: requital and only too little to requite him who breaketh into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: people's houses. Then they thrust him out of the city, and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother wandered at random, till I heard what had befallen him;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, going in search of him, questioned him of his case; so he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: acquainted me with his story and all his mischances, and I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carried him secretly to the city where I made him an allowance

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for his meat and drink. Then the Caliph gave ear to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Barber's Tale of his Fifth Brother.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: My fifth brother, Al-Nashshár,[FN#659] the Babbler, the same who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was cropped of both ears, O Commander of the Faithful, was an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asker wont to beg of folk by night and live on their alms by day.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Now when our father, who was an old man well stricken in years

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sickened and died, he left us seven hundred dirhams whereof each

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: son took his hundred; but, as my fifth brother received his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: portion, he was perplexed and knew not what to do with it. While

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in this uncertainty he bethought him to lay it out on glass ware

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of all sorts and turn an honest penny on its price. So he bought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an hundred dirhams worth of verroterie and, putting it into a big

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tray, sat down to sell it on a bench at the foot of a wall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: against which he leant back. As he sat with the tray before him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he fell to musing and said to himself, Know, O my good Self,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that the head of my wealth, my principal invested in this glass

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ware, is an hundred dirhams. I will assuredly sell it for two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hundred with which I will forthright buy other glass and make by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it four hundred; nor will I cease to sell and buy on this wise,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till I have gotten four thousand and soon find myself the master

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of much money. With these coins I will buy merchandise and jewels

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and ottars[FN#660] and gain great profit on them; till, Allah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: willing, I will make my capital an hundred thousand dirhams. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I will purchase a fine house with white slaves and eunuchs and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: horses; and I will eat and drink and disport myself; nor will I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: leave a singing man or a singing woman in the city, but I will

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: summon them to my palace and make them perform before me. All

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this he counted over in his mind, while the tray of glass ware,:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: worth an hundred dirhams, stood on the bench before him, and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after looking at it, he continued, And when, Inshallah! my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: capital shall have become one hundred thousand[FN#661] dinars, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will send out marriage brokeresses to require for me in wedlock

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the daughters of Kings and Wazirs; and I will demand to wife the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eldest daughter of the Prime Minister; for it hath reached me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that she is perfect in beauty and prime in loveliness and rare in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: accomplishments. I will give a marriage settlement of one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thousand dinars; and, if her father consent, well: but if not I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will take her by force from under his very nose. When she is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: safely homed in my house, I will buy ten little eunuchs[FN#662]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and for myself a robe of the robes of Kings and Sultans; and get

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me a saddle of gold and a bridle set thick with gems of price.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then I will mount with the Mamelukes preceding me and surrounding

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me, and I will make the round of the city whilst the folk salute

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and bless me; after which I will repair to the Wazir (he that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is father of the girl) with armed white slaves before and behind

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me and on my right and on my left. When he sees me, the Wazir

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stands up, and seating me in his own place sits down much below

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me; for that I am to be his son in law. Now I have with me two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eunuchs carrying purses, each containing a thousand dinars; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of these I deliver to him the thousand, his daughter's marriage

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: settlement, and make him a free gift of the other thousand, that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he may have reason to know my generosity and liberality and my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greatness of spirit and the littleness of the world in my eyes.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And for ten words he addresses to me I answer him two. Then back

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I go to my house, and if one come to me on the bride's part, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: make him a present of money and throw on him a dress of honour;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but if he bring me a gift, I give it back to him and refuse to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: accept it,[FN#663] that they may learn what a proud spirit is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mine which never condescends to derogate. Thus I establish my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rank and status. When this is done I appoint her wedding night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and adorn my house showily! gloriously! And as the time for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: parading the bride is come, I don my finest attire and sit down

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on a mattress of gold brocade, propping up my elbow with a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pillow, and turning neither to the right nor to the left; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: looking only straight in front for the haughtiness of my mind and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the gravity of my understanding. And there before me stands my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife in her raiment and ornaments, lovely as the full moon; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I, in my loftiness and dread lordliness,[FN#664] will not glance

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at her till those present say to me, 'O our lord and our master,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy wife, thy handmaid, standeth before thee; vouchsafe her one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: look, for standing wearieth her.' Then they kiss the ground

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before me many times; whereupon I raise my eyes and cast at her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one single glance and turn my face earthwards again. Then they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bear her off to the bride chamber,[FN#665] and I arise and change

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my clothes for a far finer suit; and, when they bring in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bride a second time, I deign not to throw her a look till they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have begged me many times; after which I glance at her out of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: corner of one eye, and then bend down my head. I continue acting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after this fashion till the parading and displaying are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: completed[FN#666]--And Shahrazad perceived the dawn of day and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ceased saying her per misted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When It was the Thirty-third Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Barber's fifth brother proceeded: - Then I bend down my head and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: continue acting after this fashion till her parading and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: displaying are completed. Thereupon I order one of my eunuchs to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bring me a bag of five hundred dinars which I give as largesse to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the tire women present and bid them one and all lead me to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bride chamber. When they leave me alone with her I neither look

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at her nor speak to her, but lie[FN#667] by her side with my face

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the wall showing my contempt, that each and every may again

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: remark how high and haughty I am. Presently her mother comes in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to me, and kissing[FN#668] my head and hand, says to me, 'O my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lord, look upon thine handmaid who longs for thy favour; so heal

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her broken spirit!' I give her no answer; and when she sees this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she rises and busses my feet many times and says, 'O my lord, in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: very sooth my daughter is a beautiful maid, who hath never known

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: man; and if thou show her this backwardness and aversion, her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart will break; so do thou incline to her and speak to her and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soothe her mind and spirit.' Then she rises and fetches a cup of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wine; and says to her daughter, 'Take it and hand it to thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lord.' But as e approaches me I leave her standing between my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hands and sit, propping my elbow on a round cushion purfled with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gold thread, leaning lazily back, and without looking at her in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the majesty of my spirit, so that she may deem me indeed a Sultan

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and a mighty man. Then she says to me, 'O my lord, Allah upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee, do not refuse to take the cup from the hand of thine hand

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: maid, for verily I am thy bondswoman.' But I do not speak to her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and she presses me, saying, 'There is no help but that thou drink

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it;' and she puts it to my lips. Then I shake my fist in her face

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and kick her with my foot thus. So he let out with his toe an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knocked over the tray of glass ware which fell to the ground and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: falling from the bench, all that was on it was broken to bits. 'O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: foulest of pimps,[FN#669] this comes from the pride of my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: spirit' cried my brother; and then, O Commander of the Faithful,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he buffeted his face and rent his garments and kept on weeping

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and beating himself. The folk who were flocking to their Friday

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: prayers saw him; and some of them looked at him and pitied him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilst others paid no heed to him, and in this way my bother lost

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: both capital and profit. He remained weeping a long while, and at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: last up came a beautiful lady, the scent of musk exhaling from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her, who was going to Friday prayers riding a mule with a gold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saddle and followed by several eunuchs. When she saw the broken

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: glass and my brother weeping, her kind heart was moved to pity

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for him, and she asked what ailed him and was told that he had a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tray full of glass ware by the sale of which he hoped to gain his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: living, but it was broken, and (said they), there befell him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what thou seest. Thereupon she called up one of her eunuchs and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said to him, Give what thou hast with thee to this poor fellow!.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And he gave my brother a purse in which he found five hundred

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinars; and when it touched his hand he was well nigh dying for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: excess of joy and he offered up blessings for her. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned to his abode a substantial man; and, as he sat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: considering, some one rapped at the door. So he rose and opened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and saw an old woman whom he had never seen. O my son, said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she, know that prayer tide is near and I have not yet made my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Wuzu-ablution;[FN#670] so kindly allow me the use of thy lodging

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the purpose. My brother answered, To hear is to comply;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and going in bade her follow him. So she entered and he brought

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her an ewer wherewith to wash, and sat down like to fly with joy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: because of the dinars which he had tied up in his belt for a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: purse. When the old woman had made an end of her ablution, she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came up to where he sat, and prayed a two bow prayer; after which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: she blessed my brother with a godly benediction, and he while

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thanking her put his hand to the dinars and gave her two, saying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to himself These are my voluntaries.[FN#671] When she saw the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gold she cried, Praise be to Allah! why dost thou look on one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who loveth thee as if she were a beggar? Take back thy money: I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have no need of it; or, if thou want it not, return it to her who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gave it thee when thy glass ware was broken. Moreover, if thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wish to be united with her, I can manage the matter, for she is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my mistress. O my mother, asked my brother, by what manner of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: means can I get at her?; and she answered, O my son! she hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: an inclination for thee, but she is the wife of a wealthy man; so

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: take the whole of thy money with thee and follow me, that I may

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: guide thee to thy desire: and when thou art in her company spare

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: neither persuasion nor fair words, but bring them all to bear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon her; so shalt thou enjoy her beauty and wealth to thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heart's content. My brother took all his gold and rose and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: followed the old woman, hardly believing in his luck. She ceased

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not faring on, and my brother following her, till they came to a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tall gate at which she knocked and a Roumi slave-girl[FN#672]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came out and opened to them. Then the old woman led my brother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: into a great sitting room spread with wondrous fine carpets and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hung with curtains, where he sat down with his gold before him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and his turband on his knee.[FN#673] He had scarcely taken seat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before there came to him a young lady (never eye saw fairer) clad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in garments of the most sumptuous; whereupon my brother rose to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his feet, and she smiled in his face and welcomed him, signing to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him to be seated. Then she bade shut the door and, when it was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shut, she turned to my brother, and taking his hand conducted him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to a private chamber furnished with various kinds of brocades and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gold cloths. Here he sat down and she sat by his side and toyed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with him awhile; after which she rose and saying, Stir not from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy seat till I come back to thee; disappeared. Meanwhile as he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was on this wise, lo! there came in to him a black slave big of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: body and bulk and holding a drawn sword in hand, who said to him,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Woe to thee! Who brought thee hither and what dost thou want

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: here? My brother could not return him a reply, being tongue tied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for terror; so the blackamoor seized him and stripped him of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes and bashed him with the flat of his sword blade till he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fell to the ground, swooning from excess of belabouring. The ill

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: omened nigger fancied that there was an end of him and my brother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard him cry, Where is the salt wench?[FN#674] Where upon in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came a handmaid holding in hand a large tray of salt, and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave kept rubbing it into my brother's wounds;[FN#675] but he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: did not stir fearing lest the slave might find out that he was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: not dead and kill him outright. Then the salt girl went away, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the slave cried Where is the souterrain[FN#676] guardianess?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hereupon in came the old woman and dragged my brother by his feet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to a souterrain and threw him down upon a heap of dead bodies. In

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this place he lay two full days, but Allah made the salt the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: means of preserving his life by staunching the blood and staying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: its flow Presently, feeling himself able to move, Al-Nashshar

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rose and opened the trap door in fear and trembling and crept out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: into the open; and Allah protected him, so that he went on in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: darkness and hid himself in the vestibule till dawn, when he saw

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the accursed beldam sally forth in quest of other quarry. He

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: followed in her wake without her knowing it, and made for his own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lodging where he dressed his wounds and medicined himself till he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was whole. Meanwhile he used to watch the old woman, tracking her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: at all times and seasons, and saw her accost one man after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another and carry them to the house. However he uttered not a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: word; but, as soon as he waxed hale and hearty, he took a piece

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of stuff and made it into a bag which he filled with broken glass

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and bound about his middle. He also disguised himself as a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Persian that none might know him, and hid a sword under his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: clothes of foreign cut. Then he went out and presently, falling

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in with the old woman, said to her, speaking Arabic with a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Persian accent, Venerable lady,[FN#677] I am a stranger arrived

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but this day here where I know no one. Hast thou a pair of scales

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wherein I may weigh eleven hundred dinars? I will give thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: somewhat of them for thy pains. I have a son, a money changer,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who keepeth all kinds of scales, she answered, so come with me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him before he goeth out and he will weigh thy gold. My

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother answered Lead the way! She led him to the house and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young lady herself came out and opened it, whereupon the old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: woman smiled in her face and said, I bring thee fat meat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: today.[FN#678] Then the damsel took my brother by the hand, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: led him to the same chamber as before; where she sat with him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: awhile then rose and went forth saying, Stir not from thy seat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till I come back to thee. Presently in came the accursed slave

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the drawn sword and cried to my brother, Up and be damned

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to thee. So he rose, and as the slave walked on before him he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drew the sword from under his clothes and smote him with it,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: making head fly from body. Then he dragged the corpse by the feet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to the souterrain and called out, Where is the salt wench? Up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came the girl carrying the tray of salt and, seeing my brother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sword in hand, turned to fly; but he followed her and struck off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: her head. Then he called out, Where is the souterrain

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: guardianess? , and in came the old woman to whom he said, Dost

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: know me again, ill omened hag? No my lord, she replied, and he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: said, I am the owner of the five hundred gold pieces, whose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house thou enteredst to make the ablution and to pray, and whom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou didst snare hither and betray. Fear Allah and spare me,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cried she; but he regarded her not and struck her with the sword

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till he had cut her in four. Then he went to look for the young

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady; and when she saw him her reason fled and she cried out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: piteously Aman![FN#679] Mercy! So he spared her and asked,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: What made thee consort with this blackamoor?, and she answered,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I was slave to a certain merchant, and the old woman used to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: visit me till I took a liking to her. One day she said to me, 'We

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have a marriage festival at our house the like of which was never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seen and I wish thee to enjoy the sight.' 'To hear is to obey,'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered I, and rising arrayed myself in my finest raiment and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ornaments, and took with me a purse containing an hundred gold

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pieces. Then she brought me hither and hardly had I entered the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house when the black seized on me, and I have remained in this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: case three whole years through the perfidy of the accursed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beldam. Then my brother asked her, Is there anything of his in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the house?; whereto she answered, Great store of wealth, and if

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou art able to carry it away, do so and Allah give thee good of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it My brother went with her and she opened to him sundry chests

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wherein were money bags, at which he was astounded; then she said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to him, Go now and leave me here, and fetch men to remove the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: money., He went out and hired ten men, but when he returned he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found the door wide open, the damsel gone and nothing left but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: some small matter of coin and the household stuffs.[FN#680] By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this he knew that the girl had overreached him; so he opened the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: store rooms and seized what was in them, together with the rest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the money, leaving nothing in the house. He passed the night

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rejoicing, but when morning dawned he found at the door some

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: twenty troopers who laid hands on him saying, The Governor wants

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee! My brother implored them hard to let him return to his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house; and even offered them a large sum of money; but they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: refused and, binding him fast with cords, carried him off. On the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: way they met a friend of my brother who clung to his skirt and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: implored his protection, begging him to stand by him and help to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deliver him out of their hands. The man stopped, and asked them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what was the matter, and they answered, The Governor hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ordered us to bring this fellow before him and, look ye, we are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: doing so. My brother's friend urged them to release him, and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: offered them five hundred dinars to let him go, saying, When ye

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: return to the Governor tell him that you were unable to find

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him. But they would not listen to his words and took my brother,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dragging him along on his face, and set him before the Governor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who asked him, Whence gottest thou these stuffs and monies?;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he answered, I pray for mercy! So the Governor gave him the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kerchief of mercy;[FN#681] and he told him all that had befallen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him from first to last with the old woman and the flight of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: damsel; ending with, Whatso I have taken, take of it what thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wilt, so thou leave me sufficient to support life.[FN#682] But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Governor took the whole of the stuffs and all the money for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: himself; and, fearing lest the affair come to the Sultan's ears,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he summoned my brother and said, Depart from this city, else I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: will hang thee. Hearing and obedience quoth my brother and set

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: out for another town. On the way thieves fell foul of him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: stripped and beat him and docked his ears; but I heard tidings of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his misfortunes and went out after him taking him clothes; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brought him secretly into the city where I assigned to him an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: allowance for meat and drink. And presently the Caliph gave ear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The Barber's Tale of his Sixth Brother.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: My sixth brother, O Commander of the Faithful, Shakashik,[FN#683]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: or Many clamours, the shorn of both lips, was once rich and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: became poor, so one day he went out to beg somewhat to keep life

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in him. As he was on the road he suddenly caught sight of a large

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and handsome mansion, with a detached building wide and lofty at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the entrance, where sat sundry eunuchs bidding and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forbidding.[FN#684] My brother enquired of one of those idling

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: there and he replied The palace belongs to a scion of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Barmaki house; so he stepped up to the door keepers and asked an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alms of them Enter, said they, by the great gate and thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shalt get what thou seekest from the Wazir our master.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Accordingly he went in and, passing through the outer entrance,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: walked on a while and presently came to a mansion of the utmost

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: beauty and elegance, paved with marble, hung with curtains and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: having in the midst of it a flower garden whose like he had never

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seen.[FN#685] My brother stood awhile as one bewildered not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: knowing whither to turn his steps; then, seeing the farther end

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the sitting chamber tenanted, he walked up to it and there

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: found a man of handsome presence and comely beard. When this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: personage saw my brother he stood up to him and welcomed him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: asked him of his case; whereto he replied that he was in want and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: needed charity. Hearing these words the grandee showed great

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: concern and, putting his hand to his fine robe, rent it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exclaiming, What! am I in a City, and thou here an hungered? I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have not patience to bear such disgrace! Then he promised him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all manner of good cheer and said, There is no help but that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou stay with me and eat of my salt.[FN#686] O my lord,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: answered my brother, I can wait no longer; for I am indeed dying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of hunger. So he cried, Ho boy! bring basin and ewer; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: turning to my brother, said, O my guest come forward and wash

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy hands. My brother rose to do so but he saw neither ewer nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: basin; yet his host kept washing his hands with invisible soap in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: imperceptible water and cried, Bring the table! But my brother

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again saw nothing. Then said the host, Honour me by eating of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this meat and be not ashamed. And he kept moving his hand to and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fro as if he ate and saying to my brother, I wonder to see thee

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eating thus sparely: do not stint thyself for I am sure thou art

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: famished. So my brother began to make as though he were eating

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whilst his host kept saying to him, Fall to, and note especially

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the excellence of this bread and its whiteness! But still my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother saw nothing. Then said he to himself, This man is fond

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of poking fun at people; and replied, O my lord, in all my days

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I never knew aught more winsome than its whiteness or sweeter

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: than its savour. The Barmecide said, This bread was baked by a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand maid of mine whom I bought for five hundred dinars. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: called out, Ho boy, bring in the meat pudding[FN#687] for our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: first dish, and let there be plenty of fat in it; and, turning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to my brother said, O my guest, Allah upon thee, hast ever seen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: anything better than this meat pudding? Now by my life, eat and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be not abashed. Presently he cried out again, Ho boy, serve up

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the marinated stew[FN#688] with the fatted sand grouse in it;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he said to my brother, Up and eat, O my guest, for truly

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thou art hungry and needest food. So my brother began wagging

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his jaws and made as if champing and chewing,[FN#689] whilst the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: host continued calling for one dish after another and yet

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: produced nothing save orders to eat. Presently he cried out, Ho

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: boy, bring us the chickens stuffed with pistachio nuts; and said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to my brother, By thy life, O my guest, I have fattened these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chickens upon pistachios; eat, for thou hast never eaten their

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like. O my lord, replied my brother, they are indeed first

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rate. Then the host began motioning with his hand as though he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were giving my brother a mouthful; and ceased not to enumerate

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and expatiate upon the various dishes to the hungry man whose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hunger waxt still more violent, so that his soul lusted after a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bit of bread, even a barley scone.[FN#690] Quoth the Barmecide,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Didst thou ever taste anything more delicious than the seasoning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of these dishes?; and quoth my brother, Never, O my lord! Eat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heartily and be not ashamed, said the host, and the guest, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have eaten my fill of meat; So the entertainer cried, Take away

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and bring in the sweets; and turning to my brother said, Eat of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this almond conserve for it is prime and of these honey fritters;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: take this one, by my life, the syrup runs out of it. May I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: never be bereaved of thee, O my lord, replied the hungry one and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: began to ask him about the abundance of musk in the fritters.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Such is my custom, he answered: they put me a dinar weight of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: musk in every honey fritter and half that quantity of ambergris.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: All this time my brother kept wagging head and jaws till the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master cried, Enough of this. Bring us the dessert! Then said

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he to him,' Eat of these almonds and walnuts and raisins; and of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this and that (naming divers kinds of dried fruits), and be not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: abashed. But my brother replied, O my lord, indeed I am full: I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: can eat no more. O my guest, repeated the host, if thou have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a mind to these good things eat: Allah! Allah![FN#691] do not

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: remain hungry; but my brother rejoined, O my lord, he who hath

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eaten of all these dishes how can he be hungry? Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: considered and said to himself, I will do that shall make him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: repent of these pranks. Presently the entertainer called out

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bring me the wine; and, moving his hands in the air, as though

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they had set it before them, he gave my brother a cup and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Take this cup and, if it please thee, let me know. O my lord,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he replied, it is notable good as to nose but I am wont to drink

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wine some twenty years old. Knock then at this door,[FN#692]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quoth the host for thou canst not drink of aught better. By

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy kindness, said my brother, motioning with his hand as though

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he were drinking. Health and joy to thee, exclaimed the house

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: master and feigned to fill a cup and drink it off; then he handed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: another to my brother who quaffed it and made as if he were

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drunken. Presently he took the host unawares; and, raising his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: arm till the white of his armpit appeared, dealt him such a cuff

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on the nape of his neck that the palace echoed to it. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: came down upon him with a second cuff and the entertainer cried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: aloud What is this, O thou scum of the earth? O my lord,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied my brother, thou hast shown much kindness to thy slave,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and admitted him into thine abode and given him to eat of thy

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: victual; then thou madest him drink of thine old wine till he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: became drunken and boisterous; but thou art too noble not to bear

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with his ignorance and pardon his offence. When the Barmaki

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: heard my brother's words he laughed his loudest and said, Long

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have I been wont to make mock of men and play the madcap among my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: intimates, but never yet have I come across a single one who had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the patience and the wit to enter into all my humours save

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thyself: so I forgive thee, and thou shalt be my boon companion

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in very sooth and never leave me. Then he ordered the servants

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to lay the table in earnest and they set on all the dishes of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which he had spoken in sport; and he and my brother ate till they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were satisfied; after which they removed to the drinking chamber,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where they found damsels like moons who sang all manner songs and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: played on all manner instruments. There they remained drinking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: till their wine got the better of them and the host treated my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother like a familiar friend, so that he became as it were his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother, and bestowed on him a robe of honour and loved him with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: exceeding love. Next morning the two fell again to feasting and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: carousing, and ceased not to lead this life for a term of twenty

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: years; at the end of which the Barmecide died and the Sultan took

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: possession of all his wealth and squeezed my brother of his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: savings, till he was left a pauper without a penny to handle. So

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he quitted the city and fled forth following his face;[FN#693]

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but, when he was half way between two towns, the wild Arabs fell

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: on him and bound him and carried him to their camp, where his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: captor proceeded to torture him, saying, Buy thy life of me with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thy money, else I will slay thee! My brother began to weep and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: replied, By Allah, I have nothing, neither gold nor silver; but

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I am thy prisoner; so do with me what thou wilt. Then the Badawi

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: drew a knife, broad bladed and so sharp grinded that if plunged

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: into a camel's throat it would sever it clean across from one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: jugular to the other,[FN#694] and cut off my brother's lips and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waxed more instant in requiring money. Now this Badawi had a fair

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife who in her husband's absence used to make advances to my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brother and offer him her favours, but he held off from her. One

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day she began to tempt him as usual and he played with her and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made her sit on his lap, when behold, in came the Badawi who,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: seeing this, cried out, Woe to thee, O accursed villain,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wouldest thou debauch my wife for me? Then he took out a knife

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and cut off my brother's yard, after which he bound him on the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: back of a camel and, carrying him to a mountain, left him there.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: He was at last found by some who recognised him and gave him meat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and drink and acquainted me with his condition; whereupon I went

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forth to him and brought him back to Baghdad where I made him an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: allowance sufficient to live on. This, then, O Commander of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Faithful, is the history of my six brothers, and I feared to go

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: away without relating it all to thee and leave thee in the error

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of judging me to be like them. And now thou knowest that I have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: six brothers upon my hands and, being more upright than they, I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: support the whole family. When the Caliph heard my story and all

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I told him concerning my brothers, he laughed and said, Thou

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sayest sooth, O Silent Man! thou art indeed spare of speech nor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is there aught of forwardness in thee; but now go forth out of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this city and settle in some other. And he banished me under

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
