text: edict. I left Baghdad and travelled in foreign parts till I heard

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of his death and the accession of another to the Caliphate. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I returned to Baghdad where I found all my brothers dead and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chanced upon this young man, to whom I rendered the kindliest

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: service, for without me he had surely been killed. Indeed he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slanders me and accuses me of a fault which is not in my nature;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and what he reports concerning impudence and meddling and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: forwardness is idle and false; for verily on his account I left

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Baghdad and travelled about full many a country till I came to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this city and met him here in your company. And was not this, O

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: worthy assemblage, of the generosity of my nature?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The End of the Tailor's Tale.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then quoth the Tailor to the King of China: When we heard the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Barber's tale and saw the excess of his loquacity and the way in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which he had wronged this young man, we laid hands on him and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: shut him up, after which we sat down in peace, and ate and drank

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and enjoyed the good things of the marriage feast till the time

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the call to mid afternoon prayer, when I left the party and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: returned home. My wife received me with sour looks and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Thou goest a pleasuring among thy friends and thou leavest me to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sit sorrowing here alone. So now, unless thou take me abroad and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: let me have some amusement for the rest of the day, I will cut

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the rope[FN#695] and it will be the cause of my separation from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: thee. So I took her out and we amused ourselves till supper

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: time, when we returned home and fell in with this Hunchback who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was brimful of drink and trolling out these rhymes:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Clear's the wine, the cup's fine;   * Like to like they combine:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: It is wine and not cup!              * 'Tis a cup and not wine!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So I invited him to sup with us and went out to buy fried fish;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: after which we sat down to eat; and presently my wife took a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: piece of bread and a fid of fish and stuffed them into his mouth

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and he choked; and, though I slapped him long and hard between

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the shoulders, he died. Then I carried him off and contrived to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: throw him into the house of this leach, the Jew; and the leach

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: contrived to throw him into the house of the Reeve; and the Reeve

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: contrived to throw him on the way of the Nazarene broker. This,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: then, is my adventure which befell me but yesterday. Is not it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more wondrous than the story of the Hunchback? When the King of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: China heard the Tailor's tale he shook his head for pleasure;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and, showing great surprise, said, This that passed between the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: young man and the busy-body of a Barber is indeed more pleasant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and wonderful than the story of my lying knave of a Hunchback.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then he bade one of his Chamberlains go with the Tailor and bring

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Barber out of jail, saying, I wish to hear the talk of this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Silent Man and it shall be the cause of your deliverance one and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: all: then we will bury the Hunchback, for that he is dead since

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: yesterday, and set up a tomb over him.--And Shahrazad perceived

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the dawn of day and ceased to say her per misted say.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When it was the Thirty-fourth Night,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: She said, It hath reached me, O auspicious King, that the King of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: China bade, Bring me the Barber who shall be the cause of your

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: deliverance; then we will bury this Hunchback, for that he is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dead since yesterday and set up a tomb over him. So the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Chamberlain and the Tailor went to the jail and, releasing the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Barber, presently returned with him to the King. The Sultan of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: China looked at him and considered him carefully and lo and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: behold! he was an ancient man, past his ninetieth year; swart of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: face, white of beard, and hoar of eyebrows; lop eared and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: proboscis-nosed,[FN#696] with a vacant, silly and conceited

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: expression of countenance. The King laughed at this figure o' fun

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and said to him, O Silent Man, I desire thee to tell me somewhat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of thy history. Quoth the Barber, O King of the age, allow me

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: first to ask thee what is the tale of this Nazarene and this Jew

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and this Moslem and this Hunchback (the corpse) I see among you?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And prithee what may be the object of this assemblage? Quoth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King of China, And why dost thou ask? I ask, he replied, in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: order that the King's majesty may know that I am no forward

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fellow or busy body or impertinent meddler; and that I am

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: innocent of their calumnious charges of overmuch talk; for I am

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he whose name is the Silent Man, and indeed peculiarly happy is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my sobriquet, as saith the poet:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: When a nickname or little name men design, * Know that nature

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with name shall full oft combine.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Then said the King, Explain to the Barber the case of this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback and what befell him at supper time; also repeat to him

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the stories told by the Nazarene, the Jew, the Reeve, and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Tailor; and of no avail to me is a twice told tale. They did his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: bidding, and the Barber shook his head and said, By Allah, this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is a marvel of marvels! Now uncover me the corpse of yonder

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback. They undid the winding sheet and he sat down and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: taking the Hunchback's head in his lap, looked at his face and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: laughed and guffaw'd[FN#697] till he fell upon his back and said,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: There is wonder in every death,[FN#698] but the death of this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback is worthy to be written and recorded in letters of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: liquid gold! The bystanders were astounded at his words and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: King marvelled and said to him, What ails thee, O Silent Man?

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Explain to us thy words ! O King of the age, said the Barber,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I swear by thy beneficence that there is still life in this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Gobbo Golightly! Thereupon he pulled out of his waist belt a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: barber's budget, whence he took a pot of ointment and anointed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: therewith the neck of the Hunchback and its arteries. Then he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: took a pair of iron tweezers and, inserting them into the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Hunchback's throat, drew out the fid of fish with its bone; and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: when it came to sight, behold, it was soaked in blood. Thereupon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Hunchback sneezed a hearty sneeze and jumped up as if nothing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: had happened and passing his hand over his face said, I testify

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that there is no god, but the God, and I testify that Mohammed is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Apostle of God. At this sight all present wondered; the King

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of China laughed till he fainted and in like manner did the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: others. Then said the Sultan, By Allah, of a truth this is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: most marvellous thing I ever saw! O Moslems, O soldiers all, did

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: you ever in the lives of you see a man die and be quickened

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: again? Verily had not Allah vouchsafed to him this Barber, he had

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: been a dead man! Quoth they, By Allah, 'tis a marvel of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: marvels. Then the King of China bade record this tale, so they

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: recorded it and placed it in the royal muniment-rooms; after

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which he bestowed costly robes of honour upon the Jew, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Nazarene and the Reeve, and bade them depart in all esteem. Then

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: he gave the Tailor a sumptuous dress and appointed him his own

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tailor, with suitable pay and allowances; and made peace between

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: him and the Hunchback, to whom also he presented a splendid and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: expensive suit with a suitable stipend. He did as generously with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Barber, giving him a gift and a dress of honour; moreover he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: settled on him a handsome solde and created him Barber

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surgeon[FN#699] of state and made him one of his cup companions.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: So they ceased not to live the most pleasurable life and the most

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: delectable, till there came to them the Destroyer of all delights

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the Sunderer of all societies, the Depopulator of palaces and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Garnerer for graves. Yet, O most auspicious King! (continued

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shahrazad) this tale is by no means more wonderful than that of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the two Wazirs and Anís al-Jalís. Quoth her sister Dunyazad, And

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: what may that be?, whereupon she began to relate the following

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: tale of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: End of Vol. 1.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Arabian Nights, Volume 1

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Footnotes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: confusion in geographical matters.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#3] Shahryár not Shahriyar (Persian) = City-friend. The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Breslau to Shahrbán or Defender of the City, like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Marz-ban=Warden of the Marshes. Shah Zamán (Persian)=King of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Age: Galland prefers Shah Zenan, or King of women, and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bull edit. changes it to Shah Rummán, Pomegranate King. Al-Ajam

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mlechchhas to Hindus, Tajiks to Turks, etc., etc.), and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: especially Persia; Ajami (a man of Ajam) being an equivalent of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Gr. {Greek Letters}. See Vol.. ii., p. 1.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#4] Galland writes Vizier, a wretched frenchification of a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: mincing Turkish mispronunciation; Torrens, Wuzeer (Anglo-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Indian and Gilchristian); Lane, Wezeer; (Egyptian or rather

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: popularly supposed to be wizr (burden) and the meaning

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Minister; Wazir al-Wuzará being Premier. In the Koran (chaps.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: xx., 30) Moses says, Give me a Wazir of my family, Harun (Aaron)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: my brother. Sale, followed by the excellent version of the Rev.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: J. M. Rodwell, translates a Counsellor, and explains by One

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: who has the chief administration of affairs under a prince. But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: both learned Koranists learnt their Orientalism in London, and,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like such students generally, fail only upon the easiest points,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: familiar to all old dwellers in the East.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#5] This three-days term (rest-day, drest-day and departure

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: day) seems to be an instinct-made rule in hospitality. Among

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Moslems it is a Sunnat or practice of the Prophet.)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#6] i.e., I am sick at heart.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#7] Debauched women prefer negroes on account of the size of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: their parts. I measured one man in Somali-land who, when

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: quiescent, numbered nearly six inches. This is a characteristic

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the negro race and of African animals; e.g. the horse; whereas

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the pure Arab, man and beast, is below the average of Europe; one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the best proofs by the by, that the Egyptian is not an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Asiatic, but a negro partially white-washed. Moreover, these

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: imposing parts do not increase proportionally during erection;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: consequently, the deed of kind takes a much longer time and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: adds greatly to the woman's enjoyment. In my time no honest Hindi

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Moslem would take his women-folk to Zanzibar on account of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: huge attractions and enormous temptations there and thereby

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: offered to them. Upon the subject of Imsák = retention of semen

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and prolongation of pleasure, I shall find it necessary to say

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: more.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#8] The very same words were lately spoken in England proving

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the eternal truth of The Nights which the ignorant call

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: downright lies.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#9] The Arab's Tue la!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#10] Arab. Sayd wa kanas: the former usually applied to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fishing; hence Sayda (Sidon) = fish-town. But noble Arabs (except

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Caliph Al-Amin) do not fish; so here it means simply sport,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chasing, coursing, birding (oiseler), and so forth.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#11] In the Mac. Edit. the negro is called Mas'úd; here he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: utters a kind of war-cry and plays upon the name, Sa'ád, Sa'íd,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sa'úd, and Mas'ud, all being derived from one root, Sa'ad =

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: auspiciousness, prosperity.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#12] The Arab. singular (whence the French génie), fem.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jinniyah; the Div and Rakshah of old Guebre-land and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Rakshasa, or Yaksha, of Hinduism. It would be interesting to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: trace the evident connection, by no means accidental, of Jinn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with the Genius who came to the Romans through the Asiatic

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Etruscans, and whose name I cannot derive from gignomai or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: genitus. He was unknown to the Greeks, who had the Daimon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: {Greek Letters}, a family which separated, like the Jinn and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Genius, into two categories, the good (Agatho-dæmons) and the bad

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (Kako-dæmons). We know nothing concerning the status of the Jinn

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: amongst the pre-Moslemitic or pagan Arabs: the Moslems made him a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: supernatural anthropoid being, created of subtile fire (Koran

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chapts. xv. 27; lv. 14), not of earth like man, propagating his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: kind, ruled by mighty kings, the last being Ján bin Ján,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: missionarised by Prophets and subject to death and Judgment. From

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the same root are Junún = madness (i.e., possession or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: obsession by the Jinn) and Majnún=a madman. According to R.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jeremiah bin Eliazar in Psalm xii. 5, Adam was excommunicated for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one hundred and thirty years, during which he begat children in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his own image (Gen. v. 3) and these were Mazikeen or Shedeem-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Jinns. Further details anent the Jinn will presently occur.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#13] Arab. Amsár (cities): in Bull Edit. Amtár (rains), as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in Mac. Edit. So Mr. Payne (I., 5) translates: And when she

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: flashes forth the lightning of her glance, She maketh eyes to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: rain, like showers, with many a tear. I would render it, She

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#45] Originally in Al-Islam the concubine (Surriyat, etc.) was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a captive taken in war and the Koran says nothing about buying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slave-girls. But if the captives were true believers the Moslem

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was ordered to marry not to keep them. In modern days concubinage

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: has become an extensive subject. Practically the disadvantage is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that the slave-girls, knowing themselves to be the master's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: property, consider him bound to sleep with them; which is by no

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: means the mistress's view. Some wives, however, when old and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: childless, insist, after the fashion of Sarah, upon the husband

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: taking a young concubine and treating her like a daughter--which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is rare. The Nights abound in tales of concubines, but these are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chiefly owned by the Caliphs and high officials who did much as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: they pleased. The only redeeming point in the system is that it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: obviated the necessity of prostitution which is, perhaps, the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: greatest evil known to modern society.

text: (idiotcy, congenital deafness, etc.) observed in mixed races like

text: the English and the Anglo-American. When a Badawi speaks of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: daughter of my uncle he means wife; and the former is the dearer

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: title, as a wife can be divorced, but blood is thicker than

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: water.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#118] Arab. Kahbah; the coarsest possible term. Hence the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: unhappy Cave of Don Roderick the Goth, which simply means The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whore.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#119] The Arab Banj and Hindú Bhang (which I use as most

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: familiar) both derive from the old Coptic Nibanj meaning a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: preparation of hemp (Cannabis sativa seu Indica); and here it is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: easy to recognise the Homeric Nepenthe. Al- Kazwini explains

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the term by garden hemp (Kinnab bostáni or Sháhdánaj). On the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: other hand not a few apply the word to the henbane (hyoscyamus

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: niger) so much used in mediæval Europe. The Kámús evidently means

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: henbane distinguishing it from Hashish al haráfísh = rascals'

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grass, i.e. the herb Pantagruelion. The Alfáz Adwiya (French

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: translation) explains Tabannuj by Endormir quelqu'un en lui

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: faisant avaler de la jusquiame. In modern parlance Tabannuj is =

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: our anæsthetic administered before an operation, a deadener of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pain like myrrh and a number of other drugs. For this purpose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hemp is always used (at least I never heard of henbane); and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: various preparations of the drug are sold at an especial bazar in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Cairo. See the powder of marvellous virtue in Boccaccio, iii.,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 8; and iv., 10. Of these intoxicants, properly so termed, I shall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have something to say in a future page.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The use of Bhang doubtless dates from the dawn of civilisation,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whose earliest social pleasures would be inebriants. Herodotus

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (iv. c. 75) shows the Scythians burning the seeds (leaves and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: capsules) in worship and becoming drunken with the fumes, as do

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the S. African Bushmen of the present day. This would be the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: earliest form of smoking: it is still doubtful whether the pipe

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was used or not. Galen also mentions intoxication by hemp.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Amongst Moslems, the Persians adopted the drink as an ecstatic,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and about our thirteenth century Egypt, which began the practice,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: introduced a number of preparations to be noticed in the course

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of The Nights.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#120] The rubbish heaps which outlie Eastern cities, some

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (near Cairo) are over a hundred feet high.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#121] Arab. Kurrat al-aye; coolness of eyes as opposed to a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hot eye (sakhin) one red with tears. The term is true and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: picturesque so I translate it literally. All coolness is pleasant

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to dwellers in burning lands: thus in Al-Hariri Abu Z yd says of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bassorah, I found there whatever could fill the eye with

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: coolness. And a cool booty (or prize) is one which has been

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: secured without plunging into the flames of war, or imply a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: pleasant prize.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#122] Popularly rendered Caucasus (see Night cdxcvi): it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: corresponds so far with the Hindu Udaya that the sun rises

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: behind it; and the false dawn is caused by a hole or gap. It is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: also the Persian Alborz, the Indian Meru (Sumeru), the Greek

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Olympus and the Rhiphæan Range (Veliki Camenypoys) or great

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: starry girdle of the world, etc.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#123] Arab. Mizr or Mizar; vulg. Búzah; hence the medical

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Lat. Buza, the Russian Buza (millet beer), our booze, the O.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Dutch buyzen and the German busen. This is the old

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of negro and negroid Africa, the beer of Osiris, of which dried

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: remains have been found in jars amongst Egyptian tombs. In

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Equatorial Africa it known as Pombe; on the Upper Nile Merissa

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: or Mirisi and amongst the Kafirs (Caffers) Tshuala, Oala or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Boyala: I have also heard of Buswain Central Africa which may

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be the origin of Buzah. In the West it became      , (Romaic

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: ), Xythum and cerevisia or cervisia, the humor ex hordeo,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: long before the days of King Gambrinus. Central Africans drink it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in immense quantities: in Unyamwezi the standing bedsteads,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: covered with bark-slabs, are all made sloping so as to drain off

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the liquor. A chief lives wholly on beef and Pombe which is thick

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: as gruel below. Hops are unknown: the grain, mostly Holcus, is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: made to germinate, then pounded, boiled and left to ferment. In

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Egypt the drink is affected chiefly by Berbers, Nubians and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slaves from the Upper Nile, but it is a superior article and more

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like that of Europe than the Pombe. I have given an account of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the manufacture in The Lake Regions of Central Africa, vol. ii.,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: p. 286. There are other preparations, Umm-bulbul (mother nightie

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gale), Dinzáyah and Súbiyah, for which I must refer to the Shaykh

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: El-Tounsy.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#124] There is a terrible truth in this satire, which reminds

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: us of the noble dame who preferred to her handsome husband the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: palefrenier laid, ord et infâme of Queen Margaret of Navarre

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (Heptameron No. xx.). We have all known women who sacrificed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: everything despite themselves, as it were, for the most worthless

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of men. The world stares and scoffs and blames and understands

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nothing. There is for every woman one man and one only in whose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slavery she is ready to sweep the floor. Fate is mostly opposed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to her meeting him but, when she does, adieu husband and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: children, honour and religion, life and soul. Moreover Nature

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (human) commands the union of contrasts, such as fair and foul,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dark and light, tall and short; otherwise mankind would be like

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the canines, a race of extremes, dwarf as toy-terriers, giants

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: like mastiffs, bald as Chinese remedy dogs, or hairy as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Newfoundlands. The famous Wilkes said only a half truth when he

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: backed himself, with an hour s start, against the handsomest man

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in England; his uncommon and remarkable ugliness (he was, as the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Italians say, un bel brutto) was the highest recommendation in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the eyes of very beautiful women.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#125] Every Moslem burial-ground has a place of the kind where

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: honourable women may sit and weep unseen by the multitude. These

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: visits are enjoined by the Apostle:--Frequent the cemetery,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: 'twill make you think of futurity! Also:--Whoever visiteth the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: graves of his parents (or one of them) every Friday, he shall be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: written a pious son, even though he might have been in the world,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before that, a disobedient. (Pilgrimage, ii., 71.) The buildings

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: resemble our European mortuary chapels. Said, Pasha of Egypt,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: was kind enough to erect one on the island off Suez, for the use

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of English ladies who would like shelter whilst weeping and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wailing for their dead. But I never heard that any of the ladles

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: went there.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#126] Arab. Ajal=the period of life, the appointed time of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: death: the word is of constant recurrence and is also applied to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sudden death. See Lane's Dictionary, s.v.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#127] The dying Badawi to his tribe (and lover) appears to

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: me highly pathetic. The wild people love to be buried upon hill

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: slopes whence they can look down upon the camp; and they still

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: call out the names of kinsmen and friends as they pass by the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: grave-yards. A similar piece occurs in Wetzstein (p. 27,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Reisebericht ueber Hauran, etc.):--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: O bear with you my bones where the camel bears his load

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And bury me before you, if buried I must be;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And let me not be burled 'neath the burden of the vine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: But high upon the hill whence your sight I ever see!

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: As you pass along my grave cry aloud and name your names

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The crying of your names shall revive the bones of me:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I have fasted through my life with my friends, and in my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: death, I will feast when we meet, on that day of joy and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: glee.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#128] The Akásirah (plur. of Kasrá=Chosroës) is here a title

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of the four great dynasties of Persian Kings. 1. The Peshdadian

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: or Assyrian race, proto-historics for whom dates fail, 2. The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Káyánián (Medes and Persians) who ended with the Alexandrian

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: invasion in B. C. 331. 3. The Ashkánián (Parthenians or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Arsacides) who ruled till A. D. 202; and 4. The Sassanides which

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have already been mentioned. But strictly speaking Kisri and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Kasra are titles applied only to the latter dynasty and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: especially to the great King Anushirwan. They must not be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: confounded with Khusrau (P. N. Cyrus, Ahasuerus? Chosroës?),

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and yet the three seem to have combined in Cæsar, Kaysar and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Czar. For details especially connected with Zoroaster see vol. I,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: p. 380 of the Dabistan or School of Manners, translated by David

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Shea and Anthony Troyer, Paris, 1843. The book is most valuable,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but the proper names are so carelessly and incorrectly printed

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that the student is led into perpetual error.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#129] The words are the very lowest and coarsest; but the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: scene is true to Arab life.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#130] Arab.Hayhát: the word, written in a variety of ways is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: onomatopoetic, like our heigh-ho! it sometimes means far from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#131] Lane (i., 134) finds a date for the book in this

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: passage. The Soldan of Egypt, Mohammed ibn Kala'ún, in the early

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eighth century (Hijrah = our fourteenth), issued a sumptuary law

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: compelling Christians and Jews to wear indigo-blue and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: saffron-yellow turbans, the white being reserved for Moslems. But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the custom was much older and Mandeville (chaps. ix.) describes

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it in A. D. 1322 when it had become the rule. And it still

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: endures; although abolished in the cities it is the rule for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Christians, at least in the country parts of Egypt and Syria. I

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: may here remark that such detached passages as these are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: absolutely useless for chronology: they may be simply the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: additions of editors or mere copyists.

text: [FN#132] The ancient Mustaphá = the Chosen (prophet, i. e.

text: And hence, probably, Molière's Mamamouchi; and the modern

text: Hence our muslin.

text: [FN#139] This is Mr. Thackeray's nose-bag. I translate by

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and the muscles. The later Caliphs blinded their victims by passing

text: and scourges, for such purpose. Here the East and the West differ

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which nations are policed.

text: [FN#198] Incest is now abominable everywhere except amongst the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: peoples, as the Egyptians (Isis and Osiris), Assyrians and ancient

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Persians. Physiologically they are injurious only when the parents

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: have constitutional defects: if both are sound, the issue, as

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: amongst the so-called lower animals  is viable and healthy.

text: [FN#199] Dwellers in the Northern Temperates can hardly imagine

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#200] Arab.  'Urban, now always used of the wild people, whom

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the French have taught us to call les Bedouins; Badw being a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: waste or desert, and Badawi (fem. Badawíyah, plur. Badáwi and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bidwán), a man of the waste. Europeans have also learnt to miscall

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Egyptians Arabs: the difference is as great as between an

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Englishman and a Spaniard. Arabs proper divide their race into

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sundry successive families. The Arab al-Arabá (or al- Aribah, or

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: al-Urubíyat) are the autochthones, prehistoric, proto-historic and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: extinct tribes; for instance, a few of the Adites who being at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Meccah escaped the destruction of their wicked nation, but mingled

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with other classes. The Arab al-Muta'arribah, (Arabised Arabs)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are the first advenæ represented by such noble strains as the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Koraysh (Koreish), some still surviving. The Arab al-Musta'aribah

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (insititious, naturalized or instituted Arabs, men who claim to be

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Arabs) are Arabs like the Sinaites, the Egyptians and the Maroccans

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: descended by intermarriage with other races. Hence our

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Mosarabians and the Marrabais of Rabelais (not, a word

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: compounded of Maurus and Arabs). Some genealogists, however, make

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Muta'arribah descendants of Kahtan (possibly the Joktan of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Genesis x., a comparatively modern document, B.C. 700?); and the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Musta'aribah those descended from Adnán the origin of Arab

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: genealogy. And, lastly, are the Arab al-Musta'ajimah, barbarised

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Arabs, like the present population of Meccah and Al-Medinah.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Besides these there are other tribes whose origin is still unknown,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: such as the Mahrah tribes of Hazramaut, the Akhdám (=serviles) of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Oman (Maskat); and the Ebná of Al-Yaman: Ibn Ishak supposes the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: latter to be descended from the Persian soldiers of Anushirwan who

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: expelled the Abyssinian invader from Southern Arabia.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (Pilgrimage, m., 31, etc.)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: three stones before washing. Moslems and Hindus (who prefer water

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: without ablution; and the people of India call European draught-

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: houses, by way of opprobrium, Kághaz-khánah = paper closets.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Most old Anglo-Indians, however, learn to use water.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

text: A single Talbiyah is a Shart or positive condition: and its

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#643] The panel-dodge is fatally common throughout the East,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: where a man found in the house of another is helpless.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#644] This was the beginning of horseplay which often ends in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a bastinado.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#645] Hair-dyes, in the East, are all of vegetable matter,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: henna, indigo-leaves, galls, etc.: our mineral dyes are, happily

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for them, unknown. Herklots will supply a host of recipes The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Egyptian mixture which I quoted in Pilgrimage (ii., 274) is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sulphate of iron and ammoniure of iron one part and gall nuts two

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: parts, infused in eight parts of distilled water. It is innocuous

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but very poor as a dye.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#646] Arab. Amrad, etymologically beardless and handsome,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: but often used in a bad sense, to denote an effeminate, a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: catamite.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#647] The Hindus prefer having the cardinal points as her

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: sole garment. Vêtu de climat, says Madame de Stael. In Paris

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: nude statues are draped in cerulean blue. Rabelais (iv.,29)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: robes King Shrovetide in grey and gold of a comical cut, nothing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: before, nothing behind, with sleeves of the same.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#648] This scene used to be enacted a few years ago in Paris

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: for the benefit of concealed spectators, a young American being

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the victim. It was put down when one of the lookers-on lost his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: eye by a pen-knife thrust into the crevice.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#649] Meaning that the trick had been played by the Wazir's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wife or daughter. I could mention sundry names at Cairo whose

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: charming owners have done worse things than this unseemly frolic.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#650] Arab. Shayyun li'lláhi, a beggar's formula = per amor

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: di Dio.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#651] Noting how sharp-eared the blind become.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#652] The blind in Egypt are notorious for insolence and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: violence, fanaticism and rapacity. Not a few foreigners have

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: suffered from them (Pilgrimage i., 148). In former times many

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were blinded in infancy by their mothers, and others blinded

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: themselves to escape conscription or honest hard work. They could

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: always obtain food, especially as Mu'ezzins and were preferred

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: because they could not take advantage of the minaret by spying

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: into their neighbours' households. The Egyptian race is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: chronically weak-eyed, the effect of the damp hot climate of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: valley, where ophthalmia prevailed even during the pre-Pharaohnic

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: days. The great Sesostris died stone-blind and his successor lost

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: his sight for ten years (Pilgrimage ii., 176). That the Fellahs

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: are now congenitally weak-eyed, may be seen by comparing them

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: with negroes imported from Central Africa. Ophthalmia rages,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: especially during the damp season, in the lower Nile-valley; and

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the best cure for it is a fortnight's trip to the Desert where,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: despite glare, sand and wind, the eye readily recovers tone.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#653] i.e., with kicks and cuffs and blows, as is the custom.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (Pilgrimage i., 174.)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#654] Arab. Káid (whence Alcayde) a word still much used in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: North Western Africa.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#655] Arab. Sullam = lit. a ladder; a frame-work of sticks,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: used by way of our triangles or whipping-posts.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#656] This is one of the feats of Al-Símiyá = white magic;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fascinating the eyes. In Europe it has lately taken the name of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Electro-biology.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#657] again by means of the Símiyá or power of fascination

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: possessed by the old scoundrel.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#658] A formula for averting Al-Ayn, the evil eye. It is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: always unlucky to meet a one-eyed man, especially the first thing

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in the morning and when setting out on any errand. The idea is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that the fascinated one will suffer from some action of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: physical eye. Monoculars also are held to be rogues: so the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Sanskrit saying Few one-eyed men be honest men.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#659] Al-Nashshár from Nashr = sawing: so the fiddler in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Italian is called the village-saw (Sega del villaggio). He is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Alnaschar of the Englished Galland and Richardson. The tale

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is very old. It appears as the Brahman and the Pot of Rice in the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Panchatantra; and Professor Benfey believes (as usual with him)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: that this, with many others, derives from a Buddhist source. But

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: I would distinctly derive it from Æsop's market-woman who kicked

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: over her eggs, whence the Lat. prov. Ante victoriam canere

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: triumphum = to sell the skin before you have caught the bear. In

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Kalilah and Dimnah and its numerous offspring it is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Ascetic with his Jar of oil and honey; in Rabelais (i., 33)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Echephron's shoemaker spills his milk, and so La Perette in La

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Fontaine. See M. Max Muller's Chips, (vol. iii., appendix) The

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: curious reader will compare my version with that which appears at

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the end of Richardson's Arabic Grammar (Edit. Of 1811): he had a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: better, or rather a fuller MS. (p. 199) than any yet printed.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#660] Arab. Atr = any perfume, especially oil of roses;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: whence our word Otter,' through the Turkish corruption.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#661] The texts give dirhams (100,000 = 5,000 dinars) for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: dinars, a clerical error as the sequel shows.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#662] Young slaves, says Richardson, losing colour.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#663] Nothing more calculated to give affront than such a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: refusal. Richardson (p. 204) who, however, doubts his own version

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (p. 208), here translates, and I will not give liberty to my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: soul (spouse) but in her apartments. The Arabic, or rather

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Cairene, is, wa lá akhalli rúhi I will not let myself go, i.e.,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: be my everyday self, etc.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#664] Whilst she is in astonishment and terror.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (Richardson.)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#665] Chamber of robes, Richardson, whose text has Nám for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Manám.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#666] Till I compleat her distress, Richardson, whose text

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is corrupt.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#667] Sleep by her side, R. the word Name bearing both

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: senses.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#668] Will take my hand, R. takabbal being also ambiguous.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#669] Arab. Mu'arras one who brings about 'Ars, marriages,

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: etc. So the Germ. = Kupplerinn a Coupleress. It is one of the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: many synonyms for a pimp, and a word in general use (Pilgrimage

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: i., 276).The most insulting term, like Dayyús, insinuates that

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the man panders for his own wife.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#670] Of hands and face, etc. See Night cccclxiv.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#671] Arab. Sadakah (sincerity), voluntary or superogatory

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: alms, opposed to Zakát (purification), legal alms which are

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: indispensable. Prayer carries us half way to Allah, fasting

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: brings us to the door of His palace and alms deeds (Sadakah)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: cause us to enter. For Zakát no especial rate is fixed, but it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: should not be less than one-fortieth of property or two and a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: half per cent. Thus Al-lslam is, as far as I know, the only faith

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which makes a poor-rate (Zakát) obligatory and which has invented

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: a property-tax, as opposed the unjust and unfair income-tax upon

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which England prides herself.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#672] A Greek girl.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#673] This was making himself very easy; and the idea is the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: gold in the pouch caused him to be so bold. Lane's explanation

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (in loco) is all wrong. The pride engendered by sudden possession

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of money is a lieu commun amongst Eastern story tellers; even in

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the beast-fables the mouse which has stolen a few gold pieces

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: becomes confident and stout-hearted.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#674] Arab. al-Málihah also means the beautiful (fem.) from

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Milh=salt, splendour, etc., the Mac edit. has Mumallihah = a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: salt-vessel.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#675] i.e., to see if he felt the smart.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#676] Arab. Sardábeh (Persian)=an underground room used for

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: coolness in the hot season. It is unknown in Cairo but every

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: house in Baghdad, in fact throughout the Mesopotamian cities, has

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: one. It is on the principle of the underground cellar without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: which wine will not keep: Lane (i., 406) calls it a vault.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#677] In the orig. O old woman! which is insulting.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#678] So the Italians say a quail to skin.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#679] Amen is the word used for quarter on the battle-field;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and there are Joe Millers about our soldiers in India mistaking

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: it for a man or (Scottice) a mon.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#680] Illustrating the Persian saying Allah himself cannot

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: help a fool.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#681] Any article taken from the person and given to a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: criminal is a promise of pardon, of course on the implied

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: condition of plenary confession and of becoming King's

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: evidence.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#682] A naïve proposal to share the plunder.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#683] In popular literature Schacabac., And from this tale

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: comes our saying A Barmecide's Feast, i.e., an illusion.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#684] The Castrato at the door is still (I have said) the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fashion of Cairo and he acts Suisse with a witness.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#685] As usual in the East, the mansion was a hollow square

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: surrounding what in Spain is called Patio: the outer entrance was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: far from the inner, showing the extent of the grounds.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#686] Nahnu málihín = we are on terms of salt, said and say

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Arabs. But the traveller must not trust in these days to the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: once sacred tie; there are tribes which will give bread with one

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: hand and stab with the other. The Eastern use of salt is a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: curious contrast with that of Westerns, who made it an invidious

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and inhospitable distinction, e.g., to sit above the salt-cellar

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and below the salt. Amongst the ancients, however, he took bread

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: and salt means he swore, the food being eaten when an oath was

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: taken. Hence the Bride cake of salt, water and flour.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#687] Arab. Harísah, the meat-pudding before explained.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#688] Arab. Sikbáj, before explained; it is held to be a

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lordly dish, invented by Khusraw Parwiz. Fatted duck says the

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Bresl. Edit. ii., 308, with more reason.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#689] I was reproved in Southern Abyssinia for eating without

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: this champing, Thou feedest like a beggar who muncheth silently

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in his corner; and presently found that it was a sign of good

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: breeding to eat as noisily as possible.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#690] Barley in Arabia is, like our oats, food for horses: it

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fattens at the same time that it cools them. Had this been known

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: to our cavalry when we first occupied Egypt in 1883-4 our losses

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: in horse-flesh would have been far less; but official ignorance

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: persisted in feeding the cattle upon heating oats and the riders

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: upon beef, which is indigestible, instead of mutton, which is

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: wholesome.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#691] i.e. I conjure thee by God.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#692] i.e. This is the very thing for thee.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#693] i.e., at random.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#694] This is the way of slaughtering the camel, whose throat

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: is never cut on account of the thickness of the muscles. Égorger

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: un chameau is a mistake often made in French books.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#695] i.e. I will break bounds.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#696] The Arabs have a saying corresponding with the dictum of

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: the Salernitan school:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Noscitur a labiis quantum sit virginis antrum:

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Noscitur a naso quanta sit haste viro;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: (A maiden's mouth shows what's the make of her chose;

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And man's mentule one knows by the length of his nose.)

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Whereto I would add:--

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: And the eyebrows disclose how the lower wig grows.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: The observations are purely empirical but, as far as my

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: experience extends, correct.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#697] Arab. Kahkahah, a very low proceeding.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#698] Or for every death there is a cause; but the older

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: Arabs had a saying corresponding with Deus non fecit mortem.

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: [FN#699] The King's barber is usually a man of rank for the best

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: of reasons, that he holds his Sovereign's life between his

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: fingers. One of these noble Figaros in India married an English

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: lady who was, they say, unpleasantly surprised to find out what

title: THOUSAND NIGHTS AND A NIGHT
text: were her husband's official duties.
